Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but quite poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jenni H
Reviews.Content: I'll start with some positives about the Westin. It is in a great location, has very comfortable beds and a good bath / shower. Check in was quick and easy and the staff member was very friendly. We did an express check out which was also hassle free. However...parking is ridiculously expensive at $56 per night. We stayed in a club room with access to the club lounge. The lounge is fairly drab and uninspiring although the service for evening drinks and canapÃ©s was excellent and staff friendly. Compared to other executive clubs we have been to the canapÃ©s on offer at the Westin were not as good. A few negatives about our room. The bathroom has a big glass window looking out over the room. While it is OK during the day ( you can drop the blind), at night if someone needs to use the bathroom the lights wake you up. Our room still had rubbish near the kettle from the last guests. Finally the most disappointing aspect of our stay. Unfortunately I left my cleansers in the shower ( expensive products) and I phoned the hotel as soon as I realized I had left them. I was told that if housekeeping found them they would be logged and the staff member said he would call back. I did not hear from them and when I called back was told nothing was found. I definitely left them in the shower so I can only guess they were either thrown out or pocketed by housekeeping. Although they apologized they weren't really interested. Such a shame that a beautiful hotel is so greatly let down by poor service. We will not choose to stay at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “CENTRE OF THE CITY”
Reviews.Author: akmacca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Sydney on business for two nights. I was impressed with the Central location as it was close to everything Sydney offers. I had asked for a room in the Heritage wing but was told that none were available. The check in was quick but impersonal. A bank of fast lifts awaited to take me to my room on the 16th floor. The room was above average size and contained a few ammentities you wouldn't find in a lesser quality hotel. Even though I was on the 16th floor I had no view at all, my room looked out on office building and the scene was bleak. The queen bed was very comfortable and was well-stocked with comfortable pillows. A large flat screen TV filled the wall at the end of the bed. This is by far the largest TV I have ever encountered in a hotel room. The standout feature was the bathroom which was oversized. A large bathtub filled one side of the bathroom whilst the other side was taken up by a shower stall and separate toilet. The bathroom ametities were of a high quality as were the bathtowels. The room was fine, my biggest gripe and a continuing one with staying in large cities was the cost of ancillaries. Parking was expensive as was internet. The room service fare was broad but the cost inhibitive especially with a $8 room delivery charge. Overall a excellent hotel with fine ameities, problem is that you will pay for the pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Beds and staff heavenly, but who is really special?”
Reviews.Author: MissJaneAustralia
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great hotel. This was my second stay in a deluxe Tower room. Beds and full length bar heavenly. Service was friendly and very genuine.The pool involved somthing of a quest- akin to Alices adventures down a rabbit hole -to locate the pool it involved going through a series of doors, steps, lifts and passageways, acrooss yoga rooms etc. After so much effort one was expecting something more than a dark, basic indoor pool. If you don't need a pool the hotel is ftirst rate and has access to a very well equipped gym for those who like that sort of thing. Breakfast was in a light filled atrium, again with a most helpful and attentive waiting staff. One minor note on our booking I mentioned it was our silver wedding anniversary. I wasn't expecting chocolates or flowers but a brief acknowlgment would have been nice as this personal touch is what has drawn me to this hotel (the staff all have a note on their nane badges what their personal passion is.) This lack of making your stay a personal one may make me choose another Sydney hotel in July.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay, Truly Setting the Bar Very High for Sydney Area Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th or 5th time staying at the Westin, Sydney; and, like past visits, I was extremely pleased with all aspects of my visit. For me, the high points are as follows: 1. After having been in transit to SYD for nearly 25 hours, the flight I usually take always arrives early in the morning (6:30). As with every other time I have stayed at this Westin, I was warmly welcomed and a temporary room was made available to me to settle, rest and shower until my particular room type was vacated, cleaned and available for me to formally check-in. 2. Even though the Westin is part of the Starwood Group of Hotels, which is part of a large, global corporation and the hotel is geared more towards business travelers (my opinion), I cannot emphasize enough how cozy/homey and sincere the staff was and has been with regard to attitude, attentiveness, professionalism and anticipation of my individual needs. 3. Location, location, location! I've stayed at most of the major hotels in Sydney and the Westin has the best location in the CBD. The hotel's proximity to all the major tourist attractions, SYD-based corporations, great shopping and wonderful restaurants is second-to-none (in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tasha l
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault it. We stayed in the Heritage room which was huge and had 2 very comfortable double beds, perfect for us and the kids. I love the tall ceiling. It's located on the other side of the hotel so it was very quiet and peaceful. The concierge was friendly and helpful. The location is fantastic, so near to the shops and most other attractions. We also enjoyed the small swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... Pretty good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kym Y
Reviews.Content: Was impressed with the Westin. Great location and some great service (a few attitude from concierge, but other staff were great) Easy access to all the sights as city shopping and business.

Reviews.Title: “Best location and super 5 star comfy”
Reviews.Author: FiveStarTraveller4
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney on business and always choose to stay at Westin properties. This time once again it did not disappoint. The hotel was fantastic and perfect sanctuary to return to after a tiring day full of meetings. We slept like babies in our heavenly bed! The buffet Breakfast was amazing. It consisted of smoothies, fresh squeezed juices, normal juices, omelettes made on request, bacon, sausages, poached and scrambled eggs, green beans and baked beans, fresh salmon, cold meats, cheeses, deserts and much more. The best buffet breakfast I have ever had! When booking it is worthwhile to include breakfast. We booked direct and it was only an extra $20 to include breakfast for two.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoldenRainbowBear
Reviews.Content: At a discount rate for a late booking, this is the best value hotel I have stayed in Australia. Not that that means a lot per se, where star inflation is rampant! At full price, it is what you would expect . . . and not get, often, unfortunately; except for the king bed: undoubtedly the best hotel bed I have slept in anywhere in the world! High praise indeed! Service was good, efficient and friendly enough . . though a little 'Sydney' - ie, impersonal. Clean physically and energetically [ie, no gouls from previous occupants & activities] Location is good for connection with the harbour and the features of CBD, Hyde Park, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Posh Hotel in A Great Location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Saw Lin A
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel in early March and the rates were very good. Our booking was done directly through the hotel. Our overnight flight arrived early at 8 am and prior to our arrival we called the hotel to request for early check in if available. Hotel check in time was 3 pm. When we arrived, the receptionist was very friendly and informed us that our room was ready and available. Check in was very efficient which took less than 5 minutes - just sign the form after we confirmed our details and hotel took our credit card. We were given a room on the 13th floor - it only looked out to the other office blocks :( , but the room was very comfortable and beautiful (with a see through glass bathroom), which I guess made up for the lack of view. There is a health club (gym) which we used during our stay....some advice if you wish to use the health club...avoid the peak hours 5-7 pm as office workers nearby use the gym after work. The hotel is in a good location, next to Sunrise Channel 7 studio not far from the main shopping precinct Myers and David Jones, and Circular Quay/ Opera House. There is a post office right in the same building which you can buy bus tickets. Tip - there is also a free bus 555 that does a circuit around the city. Look out at the bus stop signs as they indicate if 555 stops there. We had dinner at Mosaic - food was excellent and presentation was good too. The hotel has a lounge that is very popular with the business community in the evening. We had a few drinks and it was very relaxing. Check out was so easy. We received a note in an envelope and we were asked to sign the form if we were agreeable with the charges listed. Just put in the security cards and drop off in a box or give to reception as you leave. No queue unlike some hotels that we had stayed in the past. We were very happy with our 1 week stay at the hotel overall - no complains. Would definitely return to Westin hotel in our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service in excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve_james62
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel from recommendations and reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Check in was friendly and efficient, which was great after over 30 hours of travelling. Room not the biggest but perfectly comfortable for my wife and I. There was a bottle on ice and lovely chocolate dessert waiting for us in our room ( I had told them we were celebrating our wedding anniversary in earlier email ) Bathroom was well equipped but didn't find the glass doors to our taste, very noisy to open and close. The bed however was a different matter, so big and super comfy! Stayed room only and wanted to sample different cafes and restaurants but did have room service a couple of times. Found the food of superb quality and presentation. We were able to use the free wifi in hotel lobby rather than pay the usual exuberant rates you find in hotels. We found all staff were friendly, helpful and polite. The location of the hotel is ideal, just a short walk to Circular Quay and close to many attractions. We would definitely return to the Westin and have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Bumble8r
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel feels like home! We stay here several times each year and have never had a complaint! The elegant rooms are spacious, clean and the heavenly beds are exactly that! Located in central Sydney's Pitts street is a a short stroll or can ride to most shops and restaurants. The service is excellent staff are only too happy to help with everything (they even helped to orchestrate my now husbands proposal) Just be sure to ask for a room that is neither next to the service lift nor to far away (some rooms can be a good 5 min walk away) I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location !!”
Reviews.Author: chai77
Reviews.Content: Location : smack bang middle of city, just short 200 meter walk to shopping mall. you can also walk to chinatown area in 20 minutes and about 15 minutes walk to circular quay where you have the sydney opera house and sydney harbour bridge. there is a huge grocery shopping centre ( Coles ) located at junction of george and king street junction - where you can buy stuff to take back to the hotel. free city loop bus located on George Street outside hotel heading towards the harbour - runs between 09:30am and 03:30pm - you got to cross the road and catch the bus number 555. good idea to catch it on the first day and do the loop the get your bearings - takes you to chinatown as well. Hotel : we had the twin bed room on level 7, large room with glass wall separating bathroom and bedroom. feels new with modern facilities. yes the swimming pool is located in the adjoining health club and a bit of a walk within the building to get there. took us a while to find the pool.no free wifi within hotel but there is apple main store at junction of george and king street - opposite coles and there is macdonalds there too. if breakfast is not included in package - i would skip it. too expensive ( i think $40 ) to be worth it

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service and great location!”
Reviews.Author: Geospud
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here a night for business. This is a great hotel, truly deserving of 4.5 or 5 star status. At $195 this was great value. Must have had something to do with the Easter break. Anyway, the rooms are sweet. Nice large flat screen TV. The bathroom was a real highlight as well. Stylishly designed! You could sit in the deep bath, watching TV through a glass wall. And sound wasn't an issue as there were extra speakers in the bathroom. And they even had CNN and CNBC..which is rare to find at Aussie hotels! Location wise, close to Darling Harbour and many other sights. I don't think it gets much better than this. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Akamu
Reviews.Content: Styed for three days/2 nights... was completely not what I expected. Reception was slow and unfriendly - had to wait an hour for my room to be ready - stayed in a Grand Club room, which is not worth it in a value/quality context. Club Lounge is completely uninspiring, with a lack of ambiance and friendly, attentive service reps. My room was filthly and had hair all over the bath, toilet and showers, including on my bed... cleaniliness was definitely an issue. Amenities are poor and run down. I don't know what all the fuss and positive reviews are on this site, but felt completely cheated and misguided by the reviews below. Will never stay there again and had a very poor first impression of Sydney from this hotel. Shame... what a waste of a perfectly good location. Would prefer ShangriLa or Four Seasons to this anyday...

Reviews.Title: “Location, contemporary, staff warm when they know you”
Reviews.Author: MangoRacin
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Westin are either in the Tower (modern contemporary style) or heritage (elegant, restored in the GPO). I prefer the modern tower rooms which have a great shower (including rain shower) and bath. The Westin bed always gives a good nights rest. As a platinum guest I have access to their pleasant executive lounge which serves a wholesome breakfast, light snacks during the day and evening cocktails. Room internet is wifi and fixed ethernet. I've stayed many times at the Westin and have found that now I'm a regular guest my experience i improving every time. More staff are welcomimg me by name which is a nice personal touch. Although there's still a grumpy gentleman on the concierge desk that doesn't seem to enjoy his role as much as he should.... The gym is very good as well. Pool, weights and good cardio equipment. In summary, great location, comfortable rooms but expensive (high room rates, parking is super expensive).

Reviews.Title: “The Parson's Egg - Good in Parts !”
Reviews.Author: jarathome
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for 6 nights in March and enjoyed our holiday in Sydney very much. Mixed feelings about our stay at The Westin: The room was on the small side but adequate as we don't spend much time in there. We loved the beds, very comfortable with a good supply of pillows. We loved the lifts, fast and prompt. We loved the free wi-fi in the lobby downstairs and wished it could be extended to the rooms. We loved the rain shower in the bathroom although the diverter is quite difficult to operate. We hated the room decor, stainless steel and glass, sharp corners everywhere, not to our taste. Glass panels with glass doors in the bathroom, can't be closed quietly, the bathroom counter is too small for use and the washbasin is designed to splash water all over the counter if the taps are turned on too strongly. A couple of outstanding negative points: The electric kettle in the room is dangerous, it has a small steam outlet exactly where ones thumb goes when lifting the kettle with a normal grip. After being burned twice I learned to pick up the kettle with an abnormal grip. The other point concerns complimentary water: two free but small bottles of drinking water are provided but are hidden away from view in the closet. But on the bathroom counter in prominent view where other hotels leave their complimentary drinking water, there are two inviting bottles of water with an invitation to "stay hydrated". Unfortunately, the $7 charge for each bottle is printed very feintly in tiny letters, seen too late ! Water for purchase should be located more obviously in the minibar, this comes across as an underhand marketing trick. Talking of underhand, a charge of $1.50 as a donation to Unicef appears apparently automatically on the room bill. When questioned, the cashier informed us that there should be a note in the room inviting us to donate, no such note of course. No-one would begrudge a small donation to Unicef I am sure but does it have to be done in such an underhand way ?

Reviews.Title: “POOR VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: AUSSIETRAVELADVISER
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with the assessment of Westin Hotel Sydney shown on TripAdviser. That said, what is right and what is wrong with the Westin? On the positive side the hotel is centrally located and is very convenient for persons doing business or going shopping in the CBD. In these cases, location may well outweigh the negatives and a stay of only one or two nights may be acceptable in a room which is not up to standard. Also on the positive side is the service provided by the concierge, Ron. He is as good as any I have experienced anywhere in the world. On the negative side, we found that the hotel was unsuitable for a couple spending 5 nights on a holiday in Sydney. So what's wrong? First is the size and standard of the rooms. Be aware that rooms are not all of the same size. Despite being a SPG member and having booked an executive room, we were allocated a tiny room which would not pass muster in a 3 star hotel. Next is the spartan decoration of the rooms - the top 31st floor at least is in need of urgent refurbishment. Compared to other 5 star executive hotels, both in Sydney and worldwide, the room standard is not up to scratch. We requested a move to another room but were told that this could not be accommodated for another two nights. Why not when other guests were arriving and being allocated larger rooms? I can only presume that the hotel plays hard ball on its frequent stayer policy and they get first preference - farewell Westin your policy has lost you two regular visitors to Sydney. Next is the limited refreshment serviced provided in the club lounge. The limited choice of canapÃ©s and other refreshments is a disgrace for this standard of hotel. the dÃ©cor is also in need of refurbishment and there is a safety hazard with an unmarked small step adjacent to a number of tables located near the widows. Finally, don't be taken in by suggestions that the upper rooms have views. The so called views are of offices and buildings. If you want the views that Sydney is famous for then stay at the recently renovated Shangri La, or the Intercontinental, or Mirvac's Quay Grand Suites. Our other disappointment was to find that we were trapped for five nights with a non refundable room rate. Perhaps that is why we were allocated a small room in the first place. If we had the flexibility we would have moved after the first night. In summary - if you are staying in Sydney on holidays then, for a similar price for an executive room you will be better served at the Intercontinental or the Shangri La hotels. Beware of paying a room rate at the Westin which locks you in to this hotel which is need of refurbishment."

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and quite efficient business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Springstreet77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in March with 2 adults and 2 children for a short break in Sydney. Checkin was very friendly and we were given access to our room immediately despite it only being 12pm. Room was spacious and clean. Loved the view on to the clock and huge showerhead in the bathroom. Beds were very comfortable. Dissapointments were the pool and housekeeping. The pool was located in the public health club and smelt a bit sweaty to me. It was a very very long walk through walkways, lifts and stairs. We only tried it once. Despite housekeeping meeting us in our room initially and seeing that we were a party of 4, only 1 small container of shampoo/conditioner/shower gel was left for us. This of course, was used very quickly and we had to keep calling asking for more the entire trip (3 calls about this to housekeeping.) I also had to request milk on a number of occasions. It would've shown some initiative to leave a few more of these things for us to save the extra phone calls. Overall, we enjoyed the hotel but I prefer Circular Quay as a location for a holiday. Would stay again if on business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: methewifeandtwokids
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend in the city with our two children. The location is in the heart of the city, in the historic GPO building. The buffet breakfast was the best I have had, and I've stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world. We stayed in a tower room on level 17 and had views of the clock tower and Martin Place. The room and bathroom facilities were top class and very modern. I would recommend to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, interesting architecture, great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Sydney and I wanted a hotel good for buisness but also good for sightseeing and general leisure. Being a 'follower' of Starwood and Westin I went for the Westin Sydney. I was not dissapointed. I got a superb suite with beautiful views and good amenities: 2 flat screens, dvd, i-home and all other electronic comforts. The bed, as usual with Westin properties, real good. The bathroom was excellent incluidng a bath tub with fantastic views of the city. Room service was good quality but even for Sydney it was a bit on the pricey side. The executive lounge on the 28th floor is small but a great place to meet and have breakfast or drinks in the evening, while enjoying great Sydney views. You can also reserve the small conference room there for a a meeting. My only criticism was trying to get a taxi at the door. The Staff was unusually unresponsive and some taxis would not take you unless you were going to the airport... Not sure why the Westin allows this in their premises. After 20 m inutes i had to get back into the hotel and enlist the concierge's help who took care of it swiftly. All in all a great 5* hotel in the center of Sydney. Highly recommended! Don Travel

Reviews.Title: “Great 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: joe_rodrigo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin in early March 2012 for two days. We arrived from the Sydney airport to the hotel. We were greeted by the one of the concierge and bags were taken off us. He was very friendly and courteous. Our checking time was 3 PM and but we arrived at the hotel just after 11 AM. Our rooms were ready and we had very little waiting time. The rooms were very comfortable, tastefully decorated and very welcoming. Service was outstanding. We also experienced great service in the bar downstairs. The whole hotel was very well maintained. They also had a fantastic gym for the guests as well. Overall we rated this hotel as an outstanding five star establishment. We will go back there again and would recommend as a great hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, but no atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Peter_Cain
Reviews.Content: I stayed twice in mid March 2012, on a business trip. Access might seem difficult through the one way system if you are not using a cab, but it is centrally located and I took advantage of that for a couple of long walks to see the sights of Sydney. The room was spaciously awesome, the bed as comfortable as any, the bathroom, towels and linens clean - absolutely no problems there. First rate. The buffet breakfast was very good - not the best I ever had (Grand Hyatt, Jakarta, for that), but, like everything in Oz (even if it is at the Westin) it isn't cheap. A$42.00 is waaaay too much! It left me cold (both times) because there was no atmosphere. Even the staff are, for the most part, as cold as the sandblasted stone in the atrium. Coldly efficient, yes. Yes, I would stay there again, it is a comfortable place to stay if you can get a decent rate, but I sure as hell wouldn't be going there if I was looking for any warmth or atmosphere, so not likely my choice for a vacation stop. Final word - not only is there a 1.5% surcharge for using a credit card, but if you are like me and tend to trust them to get your bill right, you may not notice the automatic donation to a Unicef charity that they snatch from you on the way out. It is only a buck and a half, but nevertheless a tad on the cheeky side.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but the pool was terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Tara M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney for five nights while we toured the city and loved the location. We could easily walk to Circular Quay, shopping, restaurants, pubs and Darling Harbour. It is a very large hotel and while the staff were all polite, I wouldn't consider the service to be as personal we received in other hotels. (It seemed that no one remembered us from day to day). We stayed on the top floor and the view was of office buildings, definitely not spectacular. We enjoyed the club lounge - it was a nice perk. There was free wifi, happy hour, and snacks. While everything about the hotel was "pretty good", there was one thing that was terrible - the pool! It was an adventure to get there - down one elevator, up another, over a pedway, through multiple rooms (including laundry and a workout room!) When we finally got there, we learned that it was a lap pool rather than a leisure pool and there wasn't a hot tub or whirlpool. In my opinion, the hotel was more expensive than the service and amenities warranted, but it could largely be attributed to the location and Australian economy in general.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ai882
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here back in October 2011. I had usually stayed at the Sheraton on the Park, however due to it being booked out, I took tried the Westin. The rooms are amazing and very well appointed. The bathrooms are large and luxurious, especially the Bathtub. Personally, i prefer the decor of the Sheraton on the Park as its a bit more Regal, however the Westin tries to be more modern and chic, and does it very well. As has been my experience with Starwood hotels in the past, service was excellent and I was also upgraded to a superior room with late checkout till 4. The valet parking was handy and the breakfast was very nice. One negative is the health club. My fiancÃ© wanted to do a workout early Saturday morning but was advised the gym only opened at 9.00 am and was already closed Friday evening. Overall, this is an amazing hotel and you will not be disappointed with it. My boss appears to prefer the Westin over the Sheraton, so I guess my business trips will be at the Westin, and weekend trips will be at the Sheraton...Going there for business again on Thursday ;D

Reviews.Title: “Great City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steveoreilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in March 2012 and were very happy. Good sized standard room - Great king size bed and great pillows, stylish bathroom. There was a Bose clock radio/cd player bedside - but had no I Pod connectivity (so unless you travel with a bunch of CD's it is a very overpriced clock) Very good service from front desk and porters. Nice bar at Lobby level and really good upmarket food court down escalator from lobby - we had 2 lunch's at the Sushi train style Japanese (great food with first class fresh sushi and nice wine by the glass) and two other places there looked great - a wood fored pizza place that served gourmet pizzas & a cheese and wine bar. If you need to be in the city this is a great location and a very good hotel that is reasonably priced. The only downside we experienced was the very crappy in house WiFi

Reviews.Title: “Really great for business travel”
Reviews.Author: MYKNN
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a top hotel in Sydney, and probably the best choice for the business traveler who would like to be as close as possible to Martin Place. This IS Martin Place! It does not have the harbor views of the hotels around Circular Quay, of course (and even those hotels are close to some business locations too) so there is a bit of that trade-off. It might not be the best place then for a first-time Sydney visitor. The rooms are well furnished, with clean, modern, nice lines. Lighting is good for those who would like to do some work in the room. I had better time working on the desk here than at the Sheraton on the Park (see my review to compare). The rooms are also very quiet, and I thought it wasn't the case since my room was in front of the big clock tower that rings every hour and every fifteen minutes (although only during the better part of the day, and never late at night). I got used to it after a few hours and thought it made my stay a bit more unique. The hotel is of course built around the old post office building, and they have built a grand property that gives due respect to the heritage building. The lobby does not feel cramped even though it is buzzing with activity all day long. Service at the lobby bar is good although they forgot to serve my drinks together with my food. The Intermezzo restaurant close to the lobby (not owned by the hotel) and those at the floor below are some of the best in the city (but you are spoilt for choice in the city anyway). Other good things: The gym is very good, and has everything you need, although it can get crowded a times Taxis are always available outside the lobby, and no long waits for transport Close to the shopping area Bottomline: Very good for business and will not say no to staying here next time. For the first time Sydney visitor, a stay around the circular quay might be slightly better though.

Reviews.Title: “Would be happy to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: JohnStockholm
Reviews.Content: We moved here after having stayed 2 nights at a different hotel near Kings Cross with a similar class/rating but that hotel was not clean and had leaking smelly bathrooms in both rooms that we stayed in (we changed rooms after the first night) - so coming to the Westin after that experience was a great relief. The hotel is well located - smack in the center of the CBD has a pleasant lobby and the staff is reasonably friendly. The bed was big and comfy and the view (we had a very high floor) was good. Everything worked and was well maintained - and compared with the Sheraton where we stayed for new year's, which is just around the corner and also in the Starwood group - the Westin seemed so much better. The only "complaints" I may have would be that the gym was so far away (but made up for being well equipped) and that the in room internet charge was exorbitant (and free wifi in the lobby - didnÂ¨t quite make up for this). Would be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Appalling Spa - Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Vinylstatistics
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business and would consider it as an excellent alternative to the Sheraton but i'm afraid it doesn't quite match up. Some of this comes down to taste: Westin is modern and chic, the Sheraton is more oppulent; both are very well appointed. The Westin check-in experience is good although I would echo earlier review comments about the 'cold reception'. Furthermore the hotel entrance gets cluttered and it isn't readily clear wether you are entering the hotel or an office block. The open plan layout in the lobby is done very well although it reminds me too much of a shopping mall, more Westfield than Waldorf if you know what I mean. The rooms are fabulous! Very comfortable bed, incredibly well done bathrooms and a superb eye for detail. I flinched when i read the price tags associated with the room service menu, but this is not a bed and breakfast. The most disappointing aspect of the hotel is the spa and fitness facility. This appears to be contracted out to the gym in the same block and subsequently to get to the pool you need to leave the rooms, cross a bridge over the 'Westfield', walk past other hotel rooms (the ones that get disturbed by the gym), find a lift, go to the 4th floor, go up a short flight of stairs into the gym, walk through the gym, up another flight of stairs, cross a gym floor, walk through a laundry room, past another exercise room, up another flight of stairs and find you left your goggles in your room. Simply unnaceptable for a hotel in this category. If exercise is your idea of hell, you will love the Westin; otherwise stick with the Sheraton if you want your SPG points.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you're prepared to pay the price”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights to begin our vacation in Australia. After arriving in the morning following a very long overseas flight, we had to wait until the afternoon for a room. I can understand that if the hotel was full, but doubt it was. Regardless, the attitude from the check in staff was cold and not in keeping with a 5* luxury hotel. Which it is indeed. The lobby is truly magnificent. The hotel is conveniently situated. The staff otherwise very professional and helpful. Our room was clean, well designed and very comfortable. We would have preferred a view of the harbor, but were not on a high enough floor, so ask ahead. You need to be prepared for the cost of visiting Sydney, rated as the world's 3rd most expensive business city. Coffee is 8$; add an additional 8$ for room delivery! The coffee is quite awful American style on top of that. The gym is quite busy and the machines heavily used. It is a club open to members not staying at the hotel. Water can be had, of course but for purchase. Parking overnight? We paid 56$! Inquired at a public lot nearby- it was 80$ per night!! I pay less that twice that per month at work. Breakfast? Prepare to pay over 40$. Or,do what we did- walk down Pitt St to the Blue Water Restaurant. Better coffee, and breakfast dishes are about 14$. Overall, I enjoyed our stay at the Westin in Sydney. Just remember to bring the water from your room to the gym. And remember what BMW stands for- bring money in your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “I've changed my preferred Sydney hotel to the Westin”
Reviews.Author: DadTravelOrganiser
Reviews.Content: Yes, Iâ€™ve changed my mind. I used to say that the Sheraton the Park was my choice of hotel in Sydney. Now it is the Westin. It really is a fantastic hotel, world class. There are so many things to like about it that you are unlikely, even the worst room, to have a bad time. * Quiet rooms. Is the location good? It depends. If you are interested in a view, with the exception of the city views that come from the higher floors, there really isnâ€™t one. There are many hotels with great views including the Sheraton on the Park (those rooms facing the park), the Four Points (those rooms facing Darling Harbour), the Marriott on Circular Quay (all the high ones, and those looking towards the Opera House), and also the The location benefits for the Westin are the mid-city location. Being on Martin Place, it is not far from anywhere, including the shops, the Hyde Park, Circular Quay, public transport (Wynyard or Martin Place stations), Darling Harbour. It is also pretty quiet. It has plenty of local areas that are good to go for a walk or run in the morning too. What is the room like? If you book or are lucky enough to get a heritage room these are absolutely tremendous. They are very large, some enormous. I actually prefer these from all of the standard tower rooms that I have stayed in, though none of these are bad! They are well appointed and reasonably fresh, with very nice bathrooms. All rooms are sizeable and easily useable, with nice desks, chairs, TV, places for luggage etc. I love the showers in particular â€“ the rain fall shower heads are fantastic. But are the beds comfortable? The Westin Heavenly beds are quite good. They are all the same in the Westin brand, so you know what you are going to get. What was the food like? The food, whilst expensive, is absolutely top notch. I regularly stay with an included breakfast rate and the quality of what is on offer exceeds anything I have had at a hotel. The staff are very attentive, and it is a really pleasant place to dine with a large selection of papers on offer. I have also had room service. The quality again was very high, but it is very pricey. There are plenty of restaurants in a short distance walk that the concierge can point you to. Was it quiet? Yes. Having stayed quite a few times Iâ€™ve found the hotel to be free of most noise â€“ it takes some effort for the neighbouring rooms to create intrusive noise. Anything special? There are some special things about the hotel: * The heritage facade and elements of the General Post Office are really nice. It is interesting to see and explore, particularly in the heritage area (which is also where the gym is located). * The staff are really good. I am offered water and towel on return from my morning walks, and nothing is too much trouble. * The right newspaper is delivered to your room, when you ask. * The photos in the heritage corridors of the post office history are really interesting, and worth a wander.

Reviews.Title: “2 Sides”
Reviews.Author: MLORD13
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Sydney 2 times in March 2012 and both were acceptable. The hotel is well appointed and the staff courteous. However if I can give you a tip, make sure you ask for a room in the old side of the hotel as the rooms on that side are much bigger where as the new side they are boxy but ok. PS the beds are magnificent.

Reviews.Title: “An elegant classic.”
Reviews.Author: ChadRogers
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located by city hall int he centre of Sydney. A marvellous building part of a historic complex. Sushi spot in the basement is convenient, food and drink at the lobby bar is top drawer. I have stayed here for both business an pleasure band loved it both times. Front desk staff helped make arrangements for some very tricky travel and the room looked down on the tower of city hall. I love this hotel - it is my Sydney favourite.

Reviews.Title: “Massive Room , delightful service”
Reviews.Author: boxter23
Reviews.Content: Complimentry Upgrade to Heritage suite on arrival was most impressive. Enormous room, very comfy bed and sizable bathroom. Breakfast buffet had great variety and staff always pleasant. Travelled solo so will definatley be back with partner.

Reviews.Title: “Class and style. Always a pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: MapleInfusedAussie
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a delight. Staff are a cut above most other places. The breakfast buffet is extensive. Beds are comfy. Great bathroom. No free wireless Internet and an outdated tv are my only criticisms. In this day and age, complimentary wireless internet should be a given in a hotel of this calibre.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: WaterLily13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Sydney for one night in an executive club room (2903) in the tower, overlooking the city with glimpses of the harbour. Booking on line with the hotel was seamless as was the check-in and express check-out (received the account the night before with instructions to leave the key in the check-out box in the foyer). The foyer doesn't have the usual look and feel of a luxury hotel as the space was also used for casual business meetings and thoroughfare for locals. It felt more like a subdued shopping mall. However this did not detract from the overall benefits of the location and as others have mentioned it is a business hotel. The room was spacious with very a comfortable bed, linen and pillows, although the room did lack the wow factor for the price paid. It was ultra quiet being on the 29th floor, so that was a bonus. The bathroom was also spacious and clean with separate bath and shower. Loved the rain shower, but it also had the standard shower head facility for those who are in need of a strong shot of water on their shoulders and back. Enjoyed a relaxing and simple breakfast of scrambled eggs and coffee in the club lounge on the 28th floor. Other breakfast options included mushrooms, baked beans, bacon, assortment of pastries, fruit, cheese and bread. The lounge was small and but worth the extra money to have access to the private space where the staff were friendly, efficient and responsive to maintaining the cleanliness of the lounge and attending to guest's requests. The location was perfect, very central and in walking distance to the Art Gallery of New South Wales, Circular Quay, Opera House, the Rocks, shopping mall and train/bus station or a very cheap taxi fare under $10 to these locations if your feet were tired. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Always better than expected”
Reviews.Author: FamilyonHolidays_11
Reviews.Content: Love the Westin Sydney! Highlights are the beautiful rooms, the great staff, and the heritage building ambience. Definitely our favourite pick for Sydney. The two double-bed rooms are spacious and sleep all of us comfortably. There is a little nightclub noise floating up the street on Saturday nights. Being thrifty, we park at one of the cheaper Wilson car parks rather than pay for valet parking...

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel. Westin level of service.”
Reviews.Author: kowkowzeiss
Reviews.Content: Stayed no less than 10 times over the past few years. 90% business. And it IS a business hotel. Try to get a tower room. Bed very comfortable, good linen. Excellent rain shower. Blows you away. Bathroom design nice. Service ok. Not warm, but corporate. Check in and out efficient but often overwhelmed by guests. Concierge unchanged for a few years, reasonable pulling power but still can't get top tier restaurant at the drop of a hat. Another one of those annoying hotel charging a million dollars for wireless internet. For business, location, I'd go for it. Not a special hotel. Always passable but never surprises. (some rooms are just plain run down, always request exchange - there are better ones!) Try Four Seasons or Shangri-la if you want service.

Reviews.Title: “Old meets new, but that's ok”
Reviews.Author: Toppee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a mix of old buildings and new buildings which can make it a little annoying sometimes if your in the old federation building. But the rooms are fantastic and the position is perfect if your going to be staying in the city. Service is great here too and downstairs there are a couple of bars and restaurants which are all of differing quality - so if you want a quick pizza you can do that or if you want one of the best steaks in Sydney you can do that too. The rooms are expensive though and if I was travelling for business and not going to spend a lot of time in my room I'd probably go somewhere a little less expensive. I think the Hilton just down the road is even less expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Ok - 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Madeleine C
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm old-fashioned and out of touch, but when I spend over $200 a night on a 5-star hotel in Sydney, I expect it to be at least a 4.5 star experience. Upon check-in, I felt slightly judged by the receptionist. It was a really hot day and I'd traveled from Canberra - so I wasn't looking my best - and I got the vibe from him that perhaps I wasn't the clientele they were after. Looking around and over to the restaurant, it was a pretty snooty affair. The room was pretty small. Phone and wifi reception was virtually non-existent. The bed was comfy. The view overlooked the interior of the hotel, which was different. It's got a great bathroom - the bath was wonderful, the rain shower was good, and the toiletries lovely. The room service was ridiculously expensive, as was the mini-bar. So expensive that I decided not to have a room service breakfast (something I really enjoy as a treat), as I didn't want to give Westin any more of my money. So, it was ok but I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect from Westin, but avoid Heritage rooms 134,136, 138 and 140”
Reviews.Author: travelerMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Got a great price for a room while on business trip, and was upgraded to a Heritage room. The room is in the refurbished section (old GPO building) and is one of four that faces George St, and I assume are similar in characteristics. If you want to wake up on your own terms, avoid these rooms as I was woken by traffic noise at about 5.30 am even though the windows are double-glazed. It didn't fazed me too much as I'd an early start. Don't get me wrong, the rooms have wonderful high ceilings, are the size of a one-bed apartment, and beautifully appointed Westin-style with Heavenly bed, and the location, staff and amenities are top-notch. There are other Heritage rooms that are in-facing or face onto Martin Place that should be quieter, or go for the Tower rooms which are in the new block.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: buddensabroad
Reviews.Content: Well! What a fabulous hotel! Really helpful, friendly staff, beautiful rooms, stunning breakfast, right in the middle of Sydney, and excellent value for money. Couldn't recommend it more highly. I'll definitely go back there, or look for others within the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: bagwan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the night of March 3rd, 2012 and were more than satisfied with the hotel. We had asked for an early check-in and while we had to attend at the desk in person before the hotel could commit to that, we did in fact get into our room by 11am. We had a room on the Preferred Guest floor and the room was really spacious, bright and immaculate. Another one of those heavenly Westin beds - how great are they!! Beautiful bathroom, great closet storage and complimentary bottles of water which are rare today. We enjoyed dessert and coffees late on Sat night in the bar and service and food were excellent. A really quiet, more-than-comfortable stay and we hope to visit the hotel again on our next trip to Sydney from Victoria, B.C. Canada. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at Westin Sydney for one night as we were heading to the Opera House for a show and it was within walking distance. We booked through Starwood website, on a prepaid rate inc breakfast. First thing I noticed when I walked into Westin was it smelt nice. Strange, I know, but it did. Check in was quick and efficient. Lobby was spacious and very light and airy. Room had a good layout, nice sized bathroom (bigger than I was expecting!) and an amazing bed. Very comfortable. We had a view facing the city and the big clock, which went off every fifteen minutes or so, which we were concerned about for during the night, however it either didn't go off at night or we didn't notice it. Breakfast was as good as a buffet breakfast at a hotel can be, nice selection. Not a large restaurant though, and the layout wasn't very good. Check out was quick, my bill said the wrong address and they were quick to rectify that. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and top spot!”
Reviews.Author: LouMelbourne11
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is one of those classy hotels that, I think is mainly for business travelers, but is also wonderful for tourists. The rooms are very spacious and a very generous bathroom, with bath, sep shower and toilet. The finishes are understated and modern. The location is wonderful and a quick walk to malls, restaurants and sights. The service is professional and impeccable. Comfy bed. Great bar. One of my Sydney faves.

Reviews.Title: “Historical, iconic, and well worth a visit.”
Reviews.Author: Shannon S
Reviews.Content: The Westin is currently my favourite hotel in the Sydney CBD. My partner and I have stayed here on 4 occasions in the past 3 years, and every time has been excellent. The rooms are modern and spacious, the location is very central to most of the attractions in Sydney, and depending upon the position they can have a great view of the clock tower nearby, or of the iconic central courtyard. The staff are very attentive and helpful and the buffet breakfast is one of the best in the Sydney CBD. Of particular interest is the sandstone architecture throughout the hotel, as the building is one of the oldest original buildings in Sydney. Great for a romantic weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Lhaz
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate from hotel.com and decided to splurge for two nights on the Westin. We were allowed to check in just before noon which helped a lot after a 14 hr flight! The moment we entered our room on the 28th floor, we were very impressed. The large marble and glass bathroom was a luxury spa which was separated from the bedroom by a glass wall. Enclosed within the glass wall was an automated blind that went up and and down for privacy. The room was immaculate, spotless, and very quiet which allowed us to sleep like babies. The bed was super comfortable and encased in luxury sheets. There were two complimentary bottles of drinking water which were re-stocked every day. Our rate included breakfast buffet at AUD $38 for two per day. Breakfast was served on the first floor restaurant which was just magnificent and breathtaking with its domed glass roof. There was a vast array of fresh, delicious breakfast selection which made it very difficult to eat just enough - we wanted to taste everything! The muesli and fresh baked bread were to die for. We have traveled quite a bit and stayed only at hotels and B&B's highly recommended by TripAdvisor. I can honestly say that Westin's breakfast is so worth what we paid for. The location is very central. We took the train from Sydney airport which took 15 minutes before walking about three blocks to the hotel. The hotel is located on the corner of Martin Place and Pitt Street. We walked everywhere - to Darling Harbor, Chinatown, Paddy's Market, Botanic Gardens, Opera House, and Circular Quay. There are hundreds and hundreds of stores, malls, and shopping center surrounding this hotel. I read a review suggesting going down the basement food courts at any of the shopping malls near this hotel. We weren't disappointed! There were all kinds of international dishes, bakeries, coffee shops, juice stands, ice cream parlors at reasonable prices. The downside is every restaurant and store close before 6:00pm on weekdays, and even earlier on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: busymother_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney in a tower room which was located on the 6th floor. It was a mystery deal on "wotif.com" so I was a little hesitant in what type of room we would get. I need not have worried! Although it was probably their basic standard room, the room was clean with a comfortable king size bed (& comfy pillows), mini bar, TV/DVD, and a spacious bathroom with separate shower and bath. We overlooked the inside of the GPO building. It was quiet and comfortable. I thought the clock would chime on the hour during the night - if it did I didn't hear it. Check-in was quick and we used the express check out the next day. We used the valet carparking (expensive but we had no choice, it was for convenience sake as well) and that was fine, although it took them about 10-15 minutes to retrieve the car the next day. The location was excellent and the service at the lobby bar was good. I would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Michael076
Reviews.Content: I got a room for the low $200s off the internet and for the price the experience was outstanding. Room very well appointed, clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel is in the very centre of Sydney, next to the old GPO. Only gripe was when I went looking for the Hotel Services compendium - usually a folder on the room's desk or in one of the drawers. Not finding it, I called the hotel operator who told me that it was electronic, on the TV. This turned into quite a hassle. To find out a detail which might take a few page flips from a folder, on the TV one had to navigate through various menu choices (guessing some of the time), and often getting it wrong as the delay between choice and response was pretty slow. May sound a small thing, but by the third time I gave up and simply called the operator for information. A place like the Westin shouldn't construct these type of hassles. Would have been a 5 rating without this. No wi-fi in the room, only hardwire internet for $20/24 hours. Not the most expensive I've seen, but another small irritant. All the ancillary services (ie meals, drinks) in the Westin are quite expensive, as one might expect. Plan to eat and drink out; there are lots of options very close. But for the price, this was an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mix of character and modernity in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ozjug
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "heritage" section that user to house the Sydney central post office. This section of the hotel has retained some old world charm while spotlessly clean and with modern bathrooms and furnishings. The location is very central in Sydney city and makes a good base from which to explore, and a quiet haven to return to. The main location downside is the Westin doesn't have harbour views, which is a shame in a beautiful city like this, but it's close enough to walk to the harbour and certainly cheaper than some hotels with front row harbour views. On a weekend morning, there is very little open nearby, so finding breakfast away from the hotel is a challenge. That said, the hotel breakfast is very good so it's only a question of price. Staff were efficient and polite, though not particularly friendly. There's good restaurants nearby such as Postales tapas bar, that we have since returned to just for the food.

Reviews.Title: “high points but low ones as well....”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler_1037
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a suite --- lovely views. The first suite had a dirty bathroom which I noticed immediately; toothpaste on the vanity, some gunk on the sink faucet, smeared and water spotted mirror and hair in the bath tub. I called to report the findings and someone was sent up right away but instead of coming with cleaning supplies to remedy the issues, she came to investigate. She then left and returned with the cleaning supplies.The in and out and the fact we could not freshen up in our bathroom for thirty minutes was mildly irritating. After the cleaning person broke the shower sprayer and called maintenance to repair it, I insisted we be moved to another room. The wifi was not available in the rooms (500.00/ night?? - puhleese) so we had to trek up to the 28th floor where we experience an incredibly slow connection. We did not have better luck in the "business center" on the 6th floor -- a windowless room not much bigger than a small walk in closet. The last gripe is when I requested no maid service for the duration of our stay. They told me that they would oblige the no service but that an agent would have to come by daily to inspect the room -- they said for "security and well being" -- what??!! When I pressed them on this I was patched to the manager who just reiterated the mantra "security and well being" with no explanation. When I pay over 500.00/night at a hotel of this caliber I expect some privacy. Let me say we were two Americans traveling with a ten year old child. Security? Really? AMERICANS TRAVELING WITH A CHILD IN SYDNEY. Other than these annoyances, the views were lovely, the beds Westin comfortable, and the service in the Club lounge quite nice. The staff we encountered were friendly and accommodating and the location of the hotel was good although I would have liked to be closer to Circular Quay. All in all, I wouldn't stay here again -- the cleanliness of the room might have been a one off but the wifi was unacceptably slow and the security and well being policy was a complete invasion of my privacy and ironically, my well being.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, few minus points”
Reviews.Author: sashmanash
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Wotif and (from previous reviews) were slightly concerned that service would be somewhat lacking. We were quite happy with check in staff, however it was a bit annoying having to wait for the concierge to leave our bags while we shopped and waited for our room to be ready - the wait was probably ten minutes. Anyway, once we got to our room we were happy with the quality of the room. We had no view except over the inner part of the hotel, but I'm guessing the more expensive rooms have a nicer view. Had a look a the room service menu which was ridiculously priced (even for room service), so decided to eat out. Checkout was easy and staff helpful in organising a taxi. Overall, a good deal if you get a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to stay again.”
Reviews.Author: BellaOlive
Reviews.Content: I am afraid my review of hotels in Sydney will have to come to an end as I have found what I was looking for at the price I want to pay. $229 bought me a night of sheer comfort. I stayed in my room for as long as possible, lazed around in the huge bath while classical music was piped through the speakers in the blond marble bathroom, had a long hot shower in the beautiful rain showerhead shower area, lazed around in my robe on the king sized bed with the soft fine linen and the ample supply of feather pillows, got take out from one of the many food outlets and watched a movie. How fantastic is that! This place is central, close to everything important in Sydney. Shopping, restaurants, the harbour, the ferries, the buses, the trains...... The gym is well equipped and is shared with local membership so there are classes as well. The pool is perched above everything, like an attic pool. Its small but okay if you are desperate to get some laps in. It only has two lanes so best to get there early or late. If you can get this room cheaper than what I did it will be the bargin of the century. The staff are extremely efficient and professional. This place restored me after a hectic week of travel. I felt like I was enclosed in a comfy world revolving around me. I bought my ticket on Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Could Stay Forever”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Used some points (SPG) and cash ($80) for a Deluxe Tower room then paid $120 per night (2) to upgrade to an Executive Club room. Room 3002. A great view, a big room. What more is required? Enjoyed Canapes and drinks in the evenings and a very tasty well provisioned breakfast in the morning. This was a birthday splurge. MUST do it again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Aussie333Lithgow
Reviews.Content: My husband myself and our two children recently stayed here. It was wonderful. So central to everything, right in Martin Place, a stroll from Channel Seven building in Martin Place where the kids got on television in the morning with Koshy and Nat on Sunrise, that made their day. Walk to Circular Quay. Walk everywhere or get on the free green bus doing the City circuit from Circular Quay to Central all day. The hotel was just lovely, although staff were friendly it was a bit impersonal downstairs at reception but the rooms were beautiful. We overlooked the clock tower in Martin Place on 22nd floor and had three glimpses through the buildings on different angles of the harbour. Just gorgeous. The room was spotless, loved the marble spacious bathroom with separate toilet, shower and bath, white terry bathrobes for your use, luxurious beds. Just lovely. Only downer, if you want to park your car you can pay $56 per day extra for valet parking or the Hotel concierge can stamp your ticket from 123 Pitt Street Wilson carpark and you will only pay $25 per day. Only problem was the Concierge did not explain which carpark properly and when you are "country bumpkins" like us the city is overwhelming and we knew we were very near the hotel and saw a Wilson carpark sign and went in but it was Bond Street (off Pitt Street) carpark and when we went to pay the next day it was $138. Quite a let down when leaving on such a wonderful two days in Sydney. So make sure you are in the right carpark. Overall a wonderful, luxurious Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Confession: this is my favorite hotel in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: Melb2day
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend for my birthday. We had breakfast and parking included and I can honestly say they do the best breakfast buffet I have been to. Rooms were large, modern and clean. The signature bed was amazing (and I'm 6 months pregnant - so when I say it was comfortable you really should believe me). The rain shower was lush and the staff put us in a nice quiet room away from the lift. Restaurants nearby and a party at a trendy bar on George st meant we didn't use our car all weekend. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “5 star”
Reviews.Author: ast1963
Reviews.Content: Arrrived early from a flight from Singapore, however we were in the room by 10am. Lovely room on 19th floor, very spacious and modern, dreamy bed, lovely bathroom with individual shower, wc, nice big bath and window looking into the room. Tried to look for the swimming pool but gave up after going to the old part of the building up and down corridors and stairs through the fitness centre... in the end I couldn't be bothered. I did however manage to find the business centre for free use of 3 computers/printers and free wifi though found the room very hot. in the end used my laptop in the reception area where there is also free wifi. Didn't bother with breakfast as there are so many place to have breakfast for allot less. Took one of the black limos parked in the hotel back to the airport for almost the same price as a taxi - 50au$. We left some bags in the hotel when we left to fly to New Zealand as we were returning for our final few days before flying back to the UK. They appeared in our room again moments after we were given the room around 10am. This time our room was on the 15th floor and was a bit more spacious. This is a great hotel in a great location, all the designer stores LV, Tiffany, Chanel minutes walk away as was the Westfield shopping Centre where Prada, Gucci etc have their stores. The Opera House is about 10 minutes walk with Darlington harbour about 20 mins walk. We ate at Kingsleigh Steak house (King St) and Nicks Seafood restaurant (Darlington harbour) both recommended on Tripadvisor, not cheap around 150au$ for 2 buth then everything is so expensive now in Sydney. We had breakfast at the Lumiere Cafe in paddington area which was amazing - their smoked salmon eggs benedict diving - about 17au$. Take a 20 min boat to Manly beach for a lovely day out. Bondi beach is a bit dissappointing but I suppose you have to go there to say you have seen it. Its been 10 years since I was last in Sydney, and I could not get over how much the city has improved shopping wise, though it is SO expensive with the exchange rate as it is now. We brought back some Manuka honey which I found much cheaper in Holland and Barrett in the UK!!! On our last night we went to the cinema nearly 40au$ for 2 tickets. Go to the Andrew(Boy)Charleton pool http://www.abcpool.org/ for a nice relaxing day sunbathing and swimming for 5au$ though take your towels. it is about 10 mins walk from the hotel through the botanical gardens where you must go to see all the sleeping bats in the rainforest section.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: brannri
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our recent vacation to Sydney and would highly recommend. The rooms are modern, good size, and my room had a decent view (although only partial through the skyline) of the harbor. The executive lounge is great (for breakfast & drinks before dinner), the gym is actually a health club that is connected to the hotel, and the hotel is close to public transportation if you want to go to Bondi beach (bus stop is a block away) or Circular Quay (10 minute walk), which is the main transportation hub to catch ferries to several locations, such as the Zoo or Manly Beach. Overall, very impressed with the hotel and would stay at again if visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, Modern Sydney Stop”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at the Westin in Sydney. The feel of the hotel is clean, modern and efficient â€“ with enough style to feel special. My room was spacious with a nice bath â€“ I strongly prefer separate showers, which this room had. One small issue was no in-room wifi, but there is a wired internet connection in each room and wireless in the lounge and lobby. Much of my free time was spent in the executive lounge (complementary to SPG Platinum) where I enjoyed a modest but satisfying breakfast. Bacon and eggs, not just cold items. Very good fruit and baked goods too. The lounge staff offered incredible and personal service â€“ it was the highlight of my stay. If you are heading to Sydney, Iâ€™d strongly recommend. The location is as central as you can find â€“ there is nothing in central Sydney that cannot be reached on foot. Itâ€™s a great starting point for walking and easy to find if you get turned around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bronwyn P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin and were very impressed with the decor and fantastic service provided. It was really close to the State Theatre and plenty of top class restaurants. The room was modern and very classy. I love the layout and features of the bathroom. I would recommend staying here if money is not a problem. It was expensive buying drinks. If you need to stay in Sydney CBD then the Westin should be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely short weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: DRlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, even the run of house room's were very spacious. Nice attractive modern decor, lovely spacious bathrooms with full sized bath and dual shower & separate toilets. King bed with soft sheets all add up to make the Westin rooms in Sydney worth a mention. Nice to come back to the hotel late after a wedding and be able to sit in the lobby and still order coffee or drinks and light meals. So many hotels close up early and the Westin does not, so thank you for these small but important gestures to your guests. Two faults however, the heavenly bed with all the comforters were no where to be seen in my particular room (have stayed at Westin's in the past so I know what their beds should feel like and this one was large, but not pillow topped like others have been). I was disappointed in that, our bed was rather firm. Secondly, waiting for breakfast when there were empty tables was disappointing. The hostess with the complimentary danishes kept walking past me over and over offering to other guests and not me for some reason and I was famished. I thought that was just tormenting me. When a Hotel knows they are at capacity and they know how many guests have booked a bed and breakfast package they should be able to anticipate how many staff should be allocated to serving breakfast / clearing tables etc.. and also perhaps ask guests to indicate a time for b'fast arrival. Having hordes of hotel guests turn up at 9am all expecting a table is unrealistic when at capacity. Outside guests were seated before us (which ticked me off a little). Anyway, it's a beautiful hotel in a great location and we enjoyed our sweet albeit short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and elegant”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins66
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a most enjoyable weekend in Sydney, staying at the Westin. From the moment you walk into the huge lobby, you are made to feel welcome by the friendly, courteous and knowledgeable staff members. Our room was spotlessly clean, spacious and well appointed. The Heavenly bed fell well short of feeling heavenly, but once this was pointed out, staff were there in minutes to put a mattress topper on the bed. A request for different bed pillows was handled with the same speed. We dined at Mosaic - the hotel restaurant - for 1 breakfast, 1 lunch and 1 dinner. All three meals were an absolute delight, beautiful fresh, top quality ingredients prepared well. I do not very often sing the praises of hotel dining , but this was a wonderful exception. A great central location for exploring Sydney. Well done Westin, we will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but your privacy will be invaded (at Noon ?)”
Reviews.Author: Trips56
Reviews.Content: Central Location makes for great access to the Bridge, the Opera House and a host of sights & shopping locations in the area. The City sightseeing bus is available a short walk away (past the ANZAC Memorial on Martin Place), which made it really convenient for us. The Lobby has interesting artworks, which also serve to ease the pain of waiting. The Bar looked very inviting but duty (and the wife) beckoned :-( Car parking charges of 56 AUD per day represent a convenience, but we declined as we opted to explore the area on foot /cab /city sightseeing bus. The Hotel has 2 wings and we had rooms at the 7th (?) floor in the modern wing. However, as this looked onto a perspex sheet covering the central courtyard between the 2 wings, we did not have much of a view. Check in & Check out was efficient, staff was helpful and gave us rooms despite our reaching the Hotel around 1230 Hrs. At the price we paid, we thought our stay was super value. Rooms were comfortable with all mod-cons; the welcome message displayed on the LCD TV which read " (Name)...welcome to your home in Sydney" was a nifty touch. The Bathroom, was clean, and spacious, but more on that later. Gym is in the Heritage wing and is well equipped although it was effectively closed for Christmas/ Boxing day. Gripes: The bathroom blind did not adequately cover the glass for complete privacy, and this caused signifficant discomfort. More seriously, despite leaving the 'Do not Disturb' sign on (as we were running late for an event, and didn't have time to pack our stuff away in the safe etc), Hotel staff entered the room in our absence to clean it. When we asked the front desk, we were blithely brushed off with "Oh that's hotel policy...we always enter a room at 2 (or was it 12 ?) even if the DND sign is on" !! Haven't heard such brazen faced bull$@*! in any hotel anywhere. One can understand the Hotel's right to open a room if a guest hasn't been seen for a couple of days, but this was coming it rather high. This event, and the facile explanation marred what was otherwise quite an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: AandKCanberra
Reviews.Content: Booked a secret hotel for a reasonable price and were very happy with The Westin. Had a tower room with a beautiful bathroom and comfy bed. The buffet breakfast was really good. Ten minute walk to the Rocks. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: RonWamberal
Reviews.Content: Been here many times and am always happy - right in the heart of the city and just minutes from the Mall, restaurants, shopping and a short walk to the ferry terminal The hotel like most Westins is very stylish and contemporary and very well designed. Within the hotel, my choice of rooms depends on both mood and what my stay revolves around. The Tower perhaps is more modern and better if you intend to spend time in the Club Lounge - just a few seconds in the lift and you can relax in the Lounge with a wonderful view of most of Sydney. If though you prefer a sense of history and want to spend any time in the swimming pool, it is probably easier to choose a room in the historical wing. These rooms are a little larger with a high ceiling but even better, makes the trip to the pool a little easier. Anyone who has ever been to the swimming pool will know what I mean - there are times when I think it would have been easier to trek Mount Everest.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Sydney is Superb !!!”
Reviews.Author: Kilgore_Trout_88
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney for three nights and loved every minute. From the time we arrived, all the hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. Ron the Concierge was absolutely fabulous and helped us secure dinner and tour reservations all of which were spot on. The hotel interior was beautiful and spotless. Our room was beautiful - natural wood and glass for a nice open feel - and very quite - we loved it. The hotel is located within walking distance of the harbor, quays, SOH, botanical garden, and also near CBD shopping. We would definitely stay here if we return to Sydney. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love it. Top location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheCleaner
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to stay here a few times and the hotel is just beautiful. It has a nice atmosphere, the rooms have a decent size and they have a proper gym. Like with any hotel in Australia, give the food a miss. It is just stupidly overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless, elegant and stylish”
Reviews.Author: beadmaker_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Westin for 4 nights in Oct 2011. The location is fantastic, centre of the city, valet parking was easy and check-in was quite quick. The hotel staff are unobtrusive, but always on hand to assist if needed. We needed some things from our car on a few occasions and they were delivered to the room in minutes. We stayed in the heritage part of the hotel and had a room facing inward to the large covered courtyard. The room was large, with a separate lobby area with the bathroom off to one side and a small walk-in robe on the other. The bath was fantastically oversize and there was a large walk-in rain shower. Toiletries were high end. The main room was large with 3 Georgian style large arched windows. The bed was heavenly. The old stairway in this hotel was a location in the movie The Matrix, and makes a great photo location. This hotel is in walking distance from may of Sydney's attractions - the Rocks, the Opera House, Art Gallery, Circular Quay and the CBD shopping district. I searched around for prices before booking through the hotel's own site - it had the cheapest rates. A couple of tips, the restaurants under the hotel are overpriced (we ate at two, maybe the others are better?). Internet connection in your room costs extra which is a bit strange for a classy hotel, however we picked up the free wi-fi from the Lobby from our inward facing room .

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, amazing, brilliant~”
Reviews.Author: tabras
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney exceeds all expectations and reputations. The room was immaculate with an amazing view over the mall below. The amenities were perfect and the service was outstanding. The business centre was quiet and easy to use, although the computers were a little old - but free printing is good. The gym was huge and well equipped. The Westin is everything you can imagine and more - well worth the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - disappointing pool/spa facilities”
Reviews.Author: Li_Li
Reviews.Content: Our stay was just an overnight stay, in a Tower Superior Room with King bed (which is the lowest standard room). However, it was lovely - spacious and light, clean and comfy. The bathroom was very nice and the bathroom amenities were great. The bed was very comfortable and luxurious. It was nice to have a iPod dock. The only fault in the room was there was some noise through the night - sort of like metal clanging, but duller. It was hard to pinpoint where it came from and it was irregular. When we stay overnight at a luxury hotel, we like to spend an afternoon by the pool and spa to relax. So the Westin was very disappointing in this regard. The pool, as previous reviews have pointed out, is quite a walk away from the Tower rooms and it's in a gym. It's like going through a rabbit warren to get there. And it is a very small pool, in an enclosed area with zero atmosphere. There is no spa bath, but there is a steam room in the change room, where the atmosphere is not really conducive to relaxation. I suppose they don't claim to be a 'spa' but a health club. The hotel location is excellent if you want to explore the city. The service and food at Mosaic restaurant, where we went for dinner, was very good. There are lots of restaurants at the basement level, which we would have tried if we stayed longer! Breakfast at Mosaic was good too - nice selection and eggs made to order. Check-in service was courteous enough and we didn't really deal with any other staff apart from that as we did the express check-out, which was very easy and convenient. We probably wouldn't go back because of the lack of pool/spa facilities, but I would definitely recommend the hotel if that doesn't bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BaltNj
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, more geared towards business travel. Easy train from airport.

Reviews.Title: “Still good after 10 years”
Reviews.Author: Matt196
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here basically since the place opened and it's never disappointed. Good location on Martin Place and in the middle of everything, very comfortable rooms of a decent size and the beds are great. Staff are good and generally helpful and the Club lounge is comfortable and well stocked with a board room up there if you want to use it. The bar has a nice buzz about it without being packed and the restaurant delivers solid food at a reasonable price. There are better locations with views of the bridge and harbour and so if that's what you are looking for then the Shangri-la and Four Seasons and definitely the Park Hyatt are better choices but expect the price to go up. For business it's hard to beat the value for money and convenience the Westin offers and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend away”
Reviews.Author: Lola2590
