Reviews.Content: The Westin is an amazing hotel in an amazing location. The staff are very friendly and approachable. Even though the hotel it self does not have a day spa. There is an endota spa in the same building - you just have to look. Our room was clean and absolutley no problems. Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel. Would reccommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Mystery deal - great stay”
Reviews.Author: wraith
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a great location if you want to shop at the new Westfield Mall and the QVB, the rooms are very large and spacious, however parking is horrendous, its $59 per night, next time i'll park down the road a little bit at one of the Wilson parking stations for less than half of that. We had breckie and it was lovely, nice amenities in the room, and we were on the 8th floor and it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Do you read the "terrible" reviews first? Skip it, the hotel is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: german2
Reviews.Content: I was sceptical due to the reviews here when I booked the Westin. But the Westin truely is a great hotel. Rooms are modern and very spacious (I stayed in room 1311, a nice corner room with windows on 2 sides at the end of the hallway, which made it really quiet) and very nicely decorated. The location is perfect if you want to explore the city. The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. I stayed there when I came to Sydney, and checked a few other hotels while I was in the city. But for the last days of my trip I booked the Westin again. I think there is no better place to stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Vickiillawong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the week-end. Check in was quick, and friendly. Our room looked over the atrium to the clock tower, very nice. The room was spotless, with a modern spacious bathroom and dressing area. The staff were all very friendly . I would definitley reccomend The Westin. The beds and pillows were an absolute dream to sleep on. Close to everything and only an easy 10 minute stroll to Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Gives the hotel chain a good name”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's an international hotel chain. However it's one of the best examples of a Westin hotel I've come across. I like the clean, white, spacious feeling design of the place. There are older styled and more modern rooms available, both very nice. Service is efficient if a little stuffy. I love the Heavenly beds - very comfortable. It deserves it's place among the top hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The 'heavenly bed' is no longer so heavenly....”
Reviews.Author: Gilmore68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sydney Westin a number of times and have always loved this hotel until now.... On my last trip I hopped into my 'heavenly bed' only to abruptly discover that the silky smooth cotton sheets had been replaced with scratchy polyester blend sheets. Not kidding, it was like sleeping on a scratchy canvas sack! Â To make matters worse the doona cover is no longer soft cotton but 100% polyester and the doona filling is lumpy polyester rather than a more comfortable feather and down. I spoke to the duty manager the next day to request that my bed be made up with cotton sheets and I was told that all Westin hotels now have polyester blend linen on their beds. Alas, the heavenly bed is no longer so heavenly.... Â  If you don't mind an abundance of polyester on your bed and scratchy sheets I can recommend the Westin however if like me, you appreciate sleeping in the comfort of quality linen, the Westin is not your best option.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TOCSOG
Reviews.Content: Rooms, are nice. Very clean hotel. Staff is very friendly and helpful. It will be a little out of date soon, but for now it works. I would suggest a makeover, due to the price point.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sydney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jskiba55
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one Saturday night in a Deluxe Tower Room. The lobby is beautiful and the location is superb. It is about a 30second walk to the Pitt St Mall and Westfield. We also ate at the Spanish restaurant downstairs in the GPO building which was great. The room was beautiful and very spacious for a city room. While it didn't have a wow factor, the furniture was nice. I absolutely loved the rain shower and bed. The bed is amazing. The view was fairly good, in particular, the clock tower. We had waffles for breakfast which were decent. The staff were decent and professional although not friendly. Overall it was a great stay. Very comfortable with an amazing bed. I have stayed at many of the 5star Sydney hotels and this is probably my second favourite behind the Shangri-la (only beats it because of the harbour view). This room has the bed though (even beats the Sofitel). Really great location especially if you love shopping. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel with some quirks”
Reviews.Author: Simon T
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a really nice hotel in a great location. Lobby is spacious and check in was fast and service was generally excellent. The room I stayed in was also fantastic - spacious, good facilities, LCD TV. The only quirks i think - no Wifi in the room and the bathroom feels that it was designed by someone who has not tried using it. For one, there are absolutely no hooks in toliet! Which makes it difficult to hang your towels, clothes or anything. Despite being such a modern hotel, they used the old fashioned plastic shower curtains which means the whole toilet floor typically gets wet. A glassed up shower area would help. Otherwise, nice hotel to be in!

Reviews.Title: “Well located good value”
Reviews.Author: skipAussieontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for the first time and was pleased, get a room on 15 floor or above and take the breakfast option , it is good value, and the team at breakfast were most accomodating.. The room was quiet with lots of natural light, Gym etc was good . Like most Aussie hotels the internet was outrageous at $24.95 per day and parking is a joke at $56 per day

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: daelc80
Reviews.Content: My partner and I come up to Sydney for a long weekend and where so suprised about our stay at the Westin it ticked all the boxes and exceeded our expectations

Reviews.Title: “My first 5 star - well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: GigiNine
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I have stayed at a 5 star hotel (due to a fabulous Wotif deal) and it was well worth it. I don't know how I will adjust back to my normal budget travel! I stayed in a Heritage room overlooking Martin Place. What can I say - huge room, the most comfortable bed ever (seriously, it was like sleeping on a cloud), a rainforest shower, deep bath with lots of hot water, bose sound system, digital tv, walk in wardrobe... I didn't want to leave the room ! It is exactly as shown on the website and very clean as wel; as comfortable. The location is perfect for Sydney - a block from the mall (huge new Westfield, Myer etc). a downhill walk to Circular Quay etc, and for budget-at-heart travellers like me, a Coles just around the corner. As an ex-Sydney resident I loved staying in what was the old GPO building - and particularly enjoyed the book in the room explaining about the history and renovation. Had I more time I would have spent some time in the public areas, as they looked very inviting (such a huge space) On the negative side, surely hotels of this standard would have free wi-fi? And why is the cable aimed mostly at men - come on, are 4 sports channels really necessary! Yes they did have W but I really would have loved the lifestyle or movie channels. Yes, Westin, I will be back !

Reviews.Title: “The Bed is SOOO COMFY”
Reviews.Author: Anita S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with one of my good friends and payed an extra $40 p/n for an upgrade Tower Twin Room. View wasn't THE best.. but it was a very modern design, and definitely felt clean. The BED is the best, one of the most comfyiest beds I have slept in.. almost want to steal it and take it home with me! Staff were lovely, always had a smile, even the housekeepers! Location was only a minute or two walk from Pitt Street mall and 5-10 minutes from the Harbour!

Reviews.Title: “perfect as expected”
Reviews.Author: hoteldiary
Reviews.Content: The hotelroom did fully come up to our expectations: very well cleaned, modern as showed on the website, best beds I have ever sleept in a hotel with wonderful pillows, friendly staff which did make our short notice changes possible and as well ignore our casual appereance, late check-out, huge bathroom. It's a typical business hotel and has therefore as well a bit a cold atmosphere, the bars are ridiculous expensive. The staff had a taxi ready and the luggage already packed the moment I left the hotel, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “True 5 Star in design, service, location - met Business traveler and Family travelling expectations!”
Reviews.Author: drea2000 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is five star - design, service and location. Despite its large size and volume of rooms - the service is excellent and what I expect from a five star hotel. Pros Design - room from soup to nuts - they cut no corners here Atrium Breakfast - could have stayed all day! Service - prompt and anticipate your needs Spa bath tub - fabulous! Location Cons $56 daily parking - boo

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, exellent location”
Reviews.Author: expialidocious
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight for our wedding anniversary and was extremely pleased with the serviced we received. The hotel is located in the middle of the city, close to the retail shops and restaurants. Public transport is within easy access and so are the tourist spots. Suggestion for future customer service improvement and guests satisfaction: Increase staff at checkin counter to reduce guest waiting time... The bathrooms are excellent and it would be nice to provide additional toiletries like bath oil or bath bubbles.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and rooms”
Reviews.Author: edamame
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December and found the hotel to be in a great central location. Rooms were spacious and clean. Staff were courteous, efficient and very helpful. My only small criticism is that the bar closes quite early, reflecting the fact that this part of town is not the nightlife central of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location... highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: anita70
Reviews.Content: The Westin was a perfect choice! We stayed for three nights, and due to lack of availability we had to book the Four Points for the rest of our stay in Sydney. We could compare the two, and for a new stay in January we booked again the Westin. My husband is SPG Platinum and we felt pampered and welcomed, they did give us an upgrade. The location is perfect, the staff was friendly and helpful. They have a superb Executive Lounge with great staff and high quality products. We had breakfast there each morning and chilled out when we returned tired to the hotel. They even gave us presents for our two daughters! We'd definitely stay here should we ever be back in Sydney. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Always good, all the time, every time.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa N
Reviews.Content: My family & I have frequented the Westin Sydney for many years now, mainly because it is such a wonderful hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, the amenities are great, the food is great and the rooms are absolutely the best. The beds are extremely comfortable and the position is perfect - right in the middle of the city, walking distance to everything! Not to mention there are some great restaurants downstairs, as well as a food court which is so convenient. On my last stay I left some shoes there, and after a bit of a cafuffle, they sent them back to me, where I live. No case of lost items here, they were very helpful in getting them back to me and as always I remain impressed with them. I definitely recommend their buffet breakfast - it is great and very tasty! While it can be a little on the expensive side sometimes, it is worth every penny. When my friends ask where to stay in Sydney, I always recommend the Westin. It is 100% all the time. This is one hotel that has earned its 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: looseheadSydney
Reviews.Content: Arriving for a work conference I was pleasantly surprised to find my room ready to go upon arrival at 11.30, on an upper floor in the tower, my room had 2 glimpses of the harbour, and was well appointed, and kept without showing to much wear and tear which can sometimes ruin an otherwise great room.

Reviews.Title: “A Stunning Hotel in Great Location Matched by Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: danieltjames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Hotel as part of a month long holiday, touring Australia and this was right up there as one of the best places we stayed. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel welcome and although the hotel may be a popular destination for business travellers, as holiday makers, we were made to feel as though we were as important as anybody else. The hotel is modern and stylish in it's appearance yet it is housed within an old building with lots of period features. Our room was large, with lots of very nice special touches. The large TV was home to various local, regional and international channels along with an informative guest channel too. There was free wifi in the lobby which although taken for granted in many places, was a refreshing change in Australia. The spacious bathroom had lots of toiletries and a huge bath that filled in the blink of an eye. At the Westin, they call their beds "heavenly" - and having stayed there for two nights, we now know why. We had late night room service one evening which was incredible. The food quality was excellent, the portions were huge and service was speedy and friendly - and it was also comparatively great value. In a nutshell, the Westin should be the hotel of choice in this great city. The location is perfect, the staff warm and friendly, welcoming and helpful and the hotel offers great value for money. We'd definitely stay here should we ever be back in Sydney. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RaySF84
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with very comfortable beds and great service. Only Ethernet in rooms. WiFi in business center and lobby. Pricey hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best!”
Reviews.Author: danielglick
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel! The Westin made us feel right at home after a 23 hour flight from Montreal. Timothy Cannon was really sweet to us and made sure our xmas was one to remember. great location and service all around. d

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, spacious rooms, standard Westin”
Reviews.Author: skewedeye
Reviews.Content: The Westin in Sydney is fantastically located within walking distance to a lot of the tourist action. We were traveling with two young children and were very grateful for the spacious rooms. It would've been nice to have queen sized beds, but the doubles were adequate. The one annoying aspect was having to pay for an Internet connection and it is limited to one device being connected. I would highly recommend taking along a travel router so that multiple people can access the Internet. Overall, would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - 5 Start Quality”
Reviews.Author: SimonandSarah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight in a Superior Tower Room. The hotel was brilliant, very professional and great quality. This is defiantly a 5 start hotel unlike others in Sydney which have a 5 star rating but have poor service and terrible rooms (The Shangri-La, Amora & Raddison fall into this category). We were surprised by the size of the room, for comparison it is bigger than the standard room at the Hilton. The bathroom was exceptional, large space with a great bath that you can lay in and still watch the tv. There is also a large separate shower with a rain shower head. We had a king bed which was very very comfortable, next to the bed is a Bose radio system and on the wall is a 37inch Plasma TV with in-room movies etc. We had the buffet breakfast which was excellent. There is a huge range, we didn't experience any queues or waiting times, plus is always nice when a 'proper' coffee is at hand. Overall I would highly recommend staying here, great service, quality furnishing, very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Quality, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: whitefox1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend away with our 7 month old baby in a corner suite. The room itself was nicely sized and clean (only thing to note being stained lounge furniture which we would not have expected in one of these rooms in this hotel). We had access to the executive lounge, which had excellent views and professional, attentive staff. As we were unable to access the lounge with our baby between certain hours, the staff offered to bring drinks and canapÃ©s to our room. The hotel is conveniently located near CBD shopping and a short walk to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and even The Star casino. The porters were not so helpful with our wait for a prebooked taxi with a baby capsule, and we waited over 1/2 hour before we approached them (to find out where our taxi was) only to be advised one had not yet been dispatched (we ended up walking to our destination with the pram!). Whilst the wait was beyond the porters control, we were waiting right next to them and they could have told us! Overall we had a very lovely stay and the negatives we mention were minor.

Reviews.Title: “Great for kids!”
Reviews.Author: BraveTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night only. Terrific kids pack, two good size double beds in the room and great amenities close by. Would defnitely stay here again with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: WaterBaby_UK
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the Westin. The staff were helpful. I'd forgotten my phone charger and they sent one up in 5 minutes. The room was beautiful, clean and large. The beds were really comfortable, and my friend and I slept really well. The harbour is a short (15 mins) walk and you are a stone's throw from the shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Stiza82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the first one in mine and my wife's trip throughout Australia. We stayed here for the 2012 new year's celebrations. The hotel was clean and more importantly, so were the rooms. The staff was friendly and professional. Very helpful to us when we had questions about where to go and what to see. The SPG club lounge was also great. Quite full Â each day due to the holiday weekend. What was great was that when it was too full, they would send you down to the restaurant downstairs which had a much better selection of food.Â  This hotel would get a five star overall rating from us and if we could rate it a 4.5 we would. However, our only complaint was the lack of wifi in the rooms themselves. Wifi was restricted to the lobby or the club lounge - which was so inconvenient. Anytime we needed the Internet, we had to go all the way downstairs. When you're tired, sometimes you just want to get ready for bed and curl up with your iPad with wifi - not have to trudge out of the room each time you need to check email or Skype. I don't know if this is true or not, but a staff member told us that the hotel does indeed have wifi capabilities within the room themselves - but that they turned it off for the holiday weekend due to capacity issues with all the travelers. Again, I don't know if this is true or not. But if it is, I would think that was a Â very poor decision for the hotel to make just to save a little cash on bandwidth. Other than the wifi issues, this hotel is pretty close to the circular quay, the rocks, and other tourist spots to see. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we ever came back to Sydney.Â

Reviews.Title: “Nice birthday”
Reviews.Author: Jen Z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night on 15th december after my husband booked the room on Wotif as a birthday surprise. Stayed in room 705, superior tower room. Overall, I was very pleased with the standard of the room and it's cleanliness, with the only criticism I have being a bit of mildew in shower grouting and a 'sour' smelling shower curtain. Fairly picky but I do like a spotless bathroom and I do believe this should be a given at any 5*. This was the only fault I could find with the room though and I loved the soft bed with fresh white linen and soft fluffy white bath towels. The best thing about this room was the absolute quiet, no traffic noise! This was due to the room opening onto the covered central atrium and the quiet is a trade off with the lack of any view however, having stayed in much noisier rooms at other hotels in the CBD, I'll take a peaceful night's sleep over views any time! We had a night cap in the hotel bar and as you would expect, quite expensive but very pleasant and relaxing service (so pleasant I recall the young Asian man that served us drinks was named Jason and he was absolutely delightful despite it being near the end of a long shift and he was a credit to his employer, thankyou) Breakfast was fairly average in variety but acceptable (excellent poached eggs though) and service was pleasant. All in all, a pleasant stay, good room, very good, pleasant service from all staff (at a busy time of year) and I would definitely rate this hotel much higher than others we've stayed at in CBD including Marriot and Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in the city - beds not so heavenly!”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: The westin is well positioned in the centre of Sydney very close to shopping and short walk to major restaurant precincts at King St Wharf and the Rocks and not far to go for a walk through the magnificent Botanical Gardens. Parking is $56 overnight which is very steep. The concierge was helpful when questioned about other options directing us to Wilsons at Angel Place just a short walk away on Pitt St. You can't have multiple entry/ exits but the overnight was $15 (stayed a Sunday night) for 24 hours. The hotel was really clean and well appointed. The room had a stunning bathroom but the " heavenly bed" was far from comfortable with the floor providing a more restful location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a fabulous city!”
Reviews.Author: balzer4
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Westin is luxury all the way! On a recent 3 night stay we opted for the basic room rate. What a fabulous surprise when we walked into our room and found a magnificent room with luxury amenities. The bathroom was fabulous. Separate room for toilet and shower. The tub was huge with a button to lower a privacy screen. Westin beds are so comfortable. The linens are the best. Nice size desk to work at. The room has everything to make your stay luxurious. The location of the hotel is wonderful. So close to dining, shopping, transportation. The staff couldn't be nicer, friendlier, or more helpful. We didn't eat at the hotel because Sydney has so many wonderful restaurants to dine at. We did have a after dinner drink at the lounge. Pricey, but so is every 5 star hotel in every great city.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located 5-star hotel with amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: OL1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights under a Wotif Secret Stays deal and, like most of my secret stay experiences, it has been a great experience. The interior of the hotel is beautifully decorated from the modern foyer and lobby to the wonderful balcony that connects the elevator to the rooms from which gives you a beautiful view above and below your floors The room that I stayed in was amazing -perhaps one of the largest and most spacious that I have ever stayed in during my visits to various hotels around the globe. It was modern, warm, welcoming, beautifully furnished and had every possible luxury and amenity you could think of -I could and did stay in it for hours and enjoyed the ambience and the comfort that it provided. The bathroom was absolutely stunning and took my breath away -truly one of the largest and most spacious I have ever encountered with enclosed and cordoned off seperate spaces for both the shower and the toilet (something I have never seen in a hotel before) and there was also a bath as well. I cannot recommend the room highly enough The hotel is very centrally located with a plethora of shops literally at your fingertips and a Coles supermarket nearby which is also very helpful. The lobby bar is great and serves a wonderful high tea and, on my final night here when I had to meet a friend in the bar just as it was closing, they generously gave us drinks even though they were shutting down. Service was professional and courteous to a fault with staff going well above and beyond what was required of them to meet my needs and provide me with a wonderful experience. The concierge was especially helpful and knowledgeable with a depth of information that he was able to give me almost immediately nearby shops and restaurants My only complaint was the exorbitant rate this hotel charges for Internet usage. I realize that most Australian hotels,unlike most of their American and some of their European counterparts, insist on charging for Internet usage from their rooms but $24.00 per night is way too expensive even given that. Nevertheless this fact thankfully didn't detract from my stay here for anything other than the first night and certainly the one disadvantage did not cancel out the huge benefits and the great pleasure and privilege of staying here. I would definitely stay here again for the wonderful rooms -and hope to do so in the future- and the exceptional service and would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaMI
Reviews.Content: We have nothing but good things to say about this Westin. The staff was consistently helpful & courteous, and our room was beautifully decorated and maintained. The hotel is close to shopping, and the hop-on hop-off bus also stops nearby. Circular quay was only a 10 minute walk. We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Bella Bella Bella”
Reviews.Author: jballjbest
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a WESTIN property,an we were impressed.from walking in on the 31st dec an leaving on the 5th Jan,could not fault anything.staff were lovely we will return.thanks WESTIN

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel. Great location. Nice executive lounge.”
Reviews.Author: CdnUkPlat
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights over NYE... was upgraded to Superior Tower room. Overall decent stay. Upgraded room had a nice view, but wasn't very spectacular - a tad dull and small'ish. Room is modern and has all the usual stuff. The executive lounge (I'm SPG Plat.) was nice, very good service, and a tasty breakfast. Gym is big (a Fitness First) and has lots of equipment. No Wifi... but can hardly complain. Staff very friendly and helpful - used the concierge several times and each time proved useful. Would stay again... but get a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellerlaw80
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to report on my stay here as whilst you expect a fair bit from a 5 star hotel, this stay did exceed my expectations. Celebrated a special ocassion and was greeted well when we arrived. We were upgraded to a Tower Deluxe Corner Room which had an excellent view of George Street and the clock tower. Room was impeccable. It isn't often these days when I get even mildly excited about a hotel room but this was really nice. Bathroom has a nice design with good bath, and separate toilet and shower for privacy. Overall room was massive. Everything about our stay was comfortable. The location of this hotel to the malls, shopping, bars and our restaurant reservation make this hotel top of my list of places to stay in for a weekend treat soon. Highly commendable staff, particularly the girl who checked us in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing. Worth every penny.”
Reviews.Author: Santhi7
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been better: Location- minutes walking distance from the quay, opera house, darling harbour, markets, and much more! Service- while a huge hotel, amazing personalized service! Free business center and wireless in lobby! Staff- so helpful with excursions and directions. Dining- cibevenienr choices of dining right below lobby. Room- stunning, modern, spacious- could live in the bathroom alone!

Reviews.Title: “`w”
Reviews.Author: Burcher
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay here with our 13 month old son for a couple of nights post Christmas and to break up our trip returning home. We had a wonderful stay. The hotel is very well appointed, the room was large and the bathroom contained a separate shower and toilet. There was plently of room for the porta cot. We were literally 1 minute walk to Pitt St mall and an easy 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Concierge (Peter ) was very helpful and made our arrival very personal. We asked for a few items to be delivered to our room and they were done so without hesitation and quickly. Also, the bed is not called "Heavenly" for nothing - sensational! We have stayed in a few different hotels in the city and we will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected better by far else were”
Reviews.Author: richardpeace
Reviews.Content: Let me start by the positives the westin is clean and commands a central location in the CBD.... I would not recommend it at all to family and friends as there is far better with better views and service in the city.The big fault having stayed here for 14 nights and my first trip to Sydney is the service and communication.The hotel lacks personality and warmth .For a 5 star hotel no introductions were given on check in we were still discovering a few days into the stay were things were.most of the facilities were not offered by the hotel pool fitness center ,restaurants were operated by third parties so the hotel claims no responsibility,the hotel only offers a turn down service on request.whenever we requested anything we had to follow up several times before our request was met. The hotel got our rate incorrect and it took several days to amend so when going for breakfast was asked to sign as the system says it wasn't included,although the food was good again service was slow and far too less staff we waited 10 mins to be seated and then no coffee offered. When we asked to speak to the manager we had to ask several times....again.when we met with him he spoke at us and talked down trying to justify and interrupting before I had finished my sentence.He also stood as we seated.Again not at all the device delivery I expect from a 5 star westin. , .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel In Heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Stacey S
Reviews.Content: Westin Sydney Hotel Review The Westin Sydney is a magnificent hotel located in the heart of the city. The exquisite architecture and warm interiors are mixed with modern and luxurious amenities. The hotel is built upon the landmark Sydney General Post Office constructed in 1886. In 1996, the building was sold, and refurbished, and turned into shops, offices and the Westin Hotel. The Lobby & Check-in : The lobby is grand and welcomes travelers from all over the world with traditional and comfortable furnishings. I was greeted as soon as I arrived by the bellman and felt very welcome. He took my bags and showed me to the Starwood Preferred Guest Check-in line. The check-in process was simple and quick. I had two reservations â€“ one paid and one reward reservation â€“ and the hotel combined them for me and ensured I could stay in the same room the entire stay. Upon checking in, I was told about the Executive Lounge, free internet access (due to Platinum Status) and Westin Workout options. The Room: Wow! What else can I say? I was upgraded to an executive room with a king bed and it was spectacular (Iâ€™m not sure the pictures do it justice!) The room was modern and bright and made me feel at home. From my room, I could see the clock tower, which is beautiful, and had a great view of the city. The room had a king sized bed, desk and gigantic bathroom. The bathroom had a large soaking tub and separate shower. The wall separating the bathroom and bedroom was glass and had an electric curtain that could be raised and lowered as needed. I absolutely could have moved in and felt right at home. The room had wired internet connection â€“ no wireless in the rooms. The room was very clean and housekeeping came by in the evening for turn-down service refreshing the towels and bottled water. Executive Lounge: The lounge was very nice, but very crowded. There was free wireless internet in the lounge and therefore there were always people (including me) on their phones and iPads and other devices. The appetizers were platted and served by the staff - so you were stuck with what they gave you. The appetizers were pretty, but not to my liking. There was cheese and veggies available for self-service. All drinks were complimentary and also served by the staff (alcoholic and non-alcoholic). While the staff was very friendly and very accommodating, it was a little odd to have to ask for a bottle of water or apple juice every time I wanted one. The hotel: A block from Sydneyâ€™s central shopping district (Pitt Street Mall and ueen Victoria Building), close to all major attractions and with easy access to public transportation the hotel is in the perfect location for visitors (business and holiday alike). The hotelâ€™s restaurant is overpriced and service is poor. I arrived on Christmas Day, and there werenâ€™t many dining options. I had a Caesar Salad with Grilled Chicken and a coke and with taxes my bill came to $48. The salad was good, but expensive (I should note that the coke was $6.) Under the hotel are a variety of restaurants and shops â€“ however none of them were open during my stay since it was Christmas Day, Boxing Day and then everything was closed the day after Boxing Day because it fell on a weekend. I found myself walking down the street to the Pitt Street Mall and enjoying the restaurants and Westfield Food Court for most meals. Overview: I loved the Westin and will stay there any chance I get. The hotel and the staff are amazing! You can see more photos on my website: http://www.verygoodpoints.com/2011/12/westin-sydney-hotel-review.html

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Charm of Heritage meets modernism...very well done!”
Reviews.Author: Champagne4everyone
Reviews.Content: This hotel is oozing with style, charm and elegance and it is done well. We were upgraded to a heritage room which we had requested (on availability) and we were delighted with the Heritage Room's luxury feel yet honest heritage features such a huge thick true black out drapes, subtle lighting and very high ceilings. This room category has the signature luxury Westin bathrooms with rain shower and deep bath, fluffy white robes and Westin amenities. The room overlooked Martin Place and is located in the old GPO side of the hotel. Windows are double glazed so room is extremely peaceful and has comfortable sitting furniture to look out the window and see the world go by. The service at this hotel is second to none, extremely high level service as one expects with Starwood Westin properties and the facilities are good. The only downfall for this property is the gym/pool facilities, the pool is in the attic of the original building and is managed by Good Life Health centre, it has a very cold and isolated feel to it and it is a nightmare to get to, you have to walk through group fitness areas etc to get to it. The gym facilities are very good though and the showers have male/female specific steam rooms in shower areas, great showers and all the facilities required. Hotel is very close to everything in the city so the location is 10/10. Definitely returning to this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Kayt83
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, staff very helpful, fantastic location for both business and leisure travel. Having stayed at most of the comparable standard hotels in Sydney in the last few years, I think the Westin is a stand out and I will definitely stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay with a spectacular room”
Reviews.Author: lucygertrudis
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything; perfect location, lovely room and friendly, quick service. For the price I don't believe it would be possible to find a comparable hotel. Everything was within walking distance; the harbor was less than a ten minute walk and all the best shopping was just outside the door. We reserved a twin room on the Starwood Preferred Level and when we arrived they already had our additional rollaway bed waiting, since there were three of us. The room was incredibly spacious and the rollaway was by far the comfiest extra bed I have ever slept on, not to mention the other main beds which were also amazing. The bathroom was huge and well divided so that more then one person could use it at once, an important consideration when travelling with family. There were huge floor to ceiling windows opening up to a gorgeous city view. The ONLY complaint that we had was the internet situation. Internet in the rooms was grossly overpriced and although they provided "free wi-fi" in the lobby, it is incredibly slow. Nonetheless the overall experience was wonderful and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: crumycat
Reviews.Content: I have visited many Westin Hotels around the world, and the Westin Sydney really shows off the Westin Brand well. From the moment you walk through the door and smell the White Tea signature scent, you know you are home. The hotel is immaculate from start to finish. The hotel is well cared for and very clean. The staff at the Westin were very pleasant and helpful at all times. We stayed in an Executive Club Superior room on Level 28 which provided us with access to the Executive Club Lounge. Now you may read that many people complaining about the Lounge, but I found nothing wrong with it. Yes, you canâ€™t serve yourself Alcohol, but the staff are on hand to keep the drinks flowing. The food selection was excellent, but if you compare this to the Sheraton Sydney, then you will notice there is generally no hot food. Iâ€™ve also been to Executive Club Lounges where drinks are not complimentary, so I feel that this lounge does really well. You have to remember, they are not serving dinner, they are serving a pre-dinner snack! Breakfast in the Executive Lounge is well presented and is very tasty. Our room was well presented, quiet and clean. The bathroom was a delight with a huge Westin Heavenly tub and a rainwater shower. The heavenly Westin bed could have been a little software, but Iâ€™m not complaining. The room size was larger than most hotels I have stayed in. The Westin Sydney is central to Pitt Street Mall (main shopping district in Sydney) and near many bars and clubs. It is also a short 10-15 min walk from Darling Harbour, The Rocks and the Quay. I donâ€™t think you can really get more central than the Westin Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Book By It's Cover!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy V
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Shame our first impressions were not so positive. So close to Christmas we took an overnight trip to Sydney to attend a business meeting and to see our daughter. Sadly, if we had taken my car (Merc) we may have had a better reception but we travelled in my husband's newly detailed and 2010 plated Toyota Hilux. We were met by a Westin attendant who straight-away asked if we had a booking under 'Wot-If' (we are Starwood members) Then as my husband collected gifts from the rear of the vehicle the attendant commented that the newly purchased and still boxed floor fan wasn't necessary as the Westin rooms were all airconditioned! He was serious! Now, really, is that an appropriate manner to receive clients. Upon reporting our concerns at reception they were dismissed! Sorry Westin, your hotel staff and facilities are world-class; even with the busyness of Christmas, clients should all be greeted equally and with respect, there is no place for sarcasm! Sandy

Reviews.Title: “Westin 3rd time around”
Reviews.Author: scb222
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the westin, but i was less impressed than the previous other two times i stayed here. check in was easy enough and i was even greeted as a returning client. however, the guy at checkin didnt give me the room i had requested and so i had to trudge down to reception and have my room changed. this was very disappointing as i was here for a romantic stay with my partner. also the key card for the lift and room hadnt been scanned properly and didnt work, so 2 visits later to reception and finally we got our room. not a good start to our stay. the rest of our time went well and i do really recommend the westin for its location and quality of rooms. the glass feature bathrooms are my fave in all the world. i hope next time, as a prefferred starwood and westin guest i am treated a bit better by checkin.

Reviews.Title: “We would like to live here please....”
Reviews.Author: Azgators
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. The renovation they did from the original post office that the building was (and still is in a small corner) originally is amazing. Best lobby I've seen in a very long time. We used our starwood points to book the room, and as Platinum members were given the Starwood floor, but really pissed with the view they gave us. We got to spy on an office building about 10 feet away. Upon calling down to the lobby you get the run around that you always do, the "sorry, we only have rooms with worse views available". One of these days we will figure out what day and time to arrive to get an all around good room. But we don't let little things like that bother us too much, I didn't go to Sydney to sit in my hotel room and watch it rain, much more fun to be outside choking on all the Aussies smoking along the sidewalks as I enjoy the rain. The room is one of the coolest I've ever stayed at. Look at the many pics people have submitted to see what you get to enjoy. Good products for your body. Nice size safe. Nice size refridgerator for your use. Plenty of closet space for clothes. You get the Westin Heavensomethingorother bed which is very nice. Mulitple choices of pillows No in room wifi for free is correct. We had to go down to the lobby and hang out for a bit with our Ipad if we wanted to check our email or find a good place to eat. The hidden spot is the biz center so no one seems to use. Free computers, free printing. Don't bother asking the concierge on how to get around town via public transportation. They look at you as if you've sprouted three heads, the audacity of someone using some of the best public transportation in the world, something that is non-existant in the US. Note to all, its easy to get around, don't waste your money on taxis. Also, the concierge does have good suggestions for food if you want to spend around A$50 a person, less then that and they are clueless. Just use tripadvisor or urbanspoon for ideas. Location is not the best, but is near to public transportation. We walked several times to Circular Quay and it wasn't bad. Then found there are free buses that go that way, oops. Hotel is actually in the middle of the CBD so is easy to get to anything. We wouldn't hesitate to return, we also stayed at the IC during the visit and it doesn't compare at all to the Westin ...

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: smokyharry
Reviews.Content: From the first friendly face helping with our bags and parking our cvar, the service was first class. Room was clen, quiet and well appointed. As the tv said on entering our room, "our home in Sydney' was right. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Starwood experience”
Reviews.Author: heart_to_heart66
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we wanted a Starwood experience. We booked via the starwood webpage, booked a flexible full rate, just to ensure the experience we wanted. But sadly this was not to be. We were a late Friday night check in, the check in experience was cold, at no point was our Starwood membership recognize. We were stuck in a room on the 3rd floor where the full length windows looked out on to a big grey cement box. When I went down stairs, I was made to wait a very long time, only to be told that there were no other rooms. They did reduce the room rate and gave us breakfast. But still this was not the experience I had booked in here for. In the morning I checked what else was available in sydney only to find out that there were other room at the hotel, so when I called, I got the same lie that there were no other room. When I called them on the lie i was told that they could upgrade us if I was prepared to pay an additional $40 dollars per night, which was still $30 less then what I had actually booked the room for and was prepared to pay!! So I was really been ripped off given the room they had placed us in by $70 per night according to all the calculations. They did move us, finally to a Starwood floor, and to a room with a view. But a disappointment and hassle for a weekend away. If you want a special experience and a warm hotel and lovely rooms, don't stay here, choose the Four Seasons or the Observatory hotel, they are much much better value.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive building, immaculate refurbishment.”
Reviews.Author: ralphm
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel is integrated in the former Sydney Post Office, with some rooms in the old building and some in a high rise tower with views of Darling Harbour in the upper floors. We had a large corner suite towards the old clock tower in the new part of the hotel. The room was impressive and included a living room, a large bedroom with fantastic views upon the city, a walk in wardrobe and a bathroom of a decent size for two adults and a child. We only had three days left to stay in Sydney, because of the good location of the hotel in the financial district within walking distance of many tourist attractions and public transport you can easily spend more time there. The only thing we did not like in the hotel had been the business lounge, children were not allowed to enter after 6 p.m.. This was very inconvenient, though some items were taken to our room by the waiters. The additional price for the lounge was not worth the money, food presentations were poor. The pool is in the old building as a part of a fitness center with a long way to go from the rooms in the tower. It has a good size for swimming but the surroundings look very tired, there are no lounge chairs and the atmosphere is not suitable to spend some time there after leaving the water. When we came back to the hotel to get our luggage for our afternoon flight they needed for about three quarters of an hour to find it. But we arrived at the airport just in time. We can recommend the Westin Sydney, it is a fantastic hotel, but bookings of the business lounge when you are travelling with children are nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: No In-Room WiFi”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Although it is now December 2011, and at this price and this self-rating, there is no in-room wifi. There is wired internet in room (for a fee!) and wifi in the lobby (pwd "internet") and business centre only. Not good enough nowadays sorry Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Mykosher
Reviews.Content: Usually Westin group buy hotels in good location, upgrade the lobby and double room price. Trip advisors reviews convince me to go...and it was a good choice. This Westin is not only Westin its also Australian friendly experience. Great room, rates affordable and good location It should get 1st position on Trip Adv soon Dont be scare by some monkeys around sometimes, its usual in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “wedding bliss!! - Executive Suite”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our wedding and chose the Executive suite. The executive suite is massive and luxuriously fitted out with beautiful sweeping views of the city from its bedroom, bathrooms and lounge rooms. The beds are luxuriously soft and comfortable, ample cupboards to store clothes ..with an absolutely stunning bathroom luxuriously fitted out as one would expect from a 5 star hotel. Having said that.. service is probably not what i would expect from a 5 star hotel and probably needs more work. the breakfast in the executive club suites isnt that great.. and the rooms can is a bit pricey so one would definitely expect more. having said that... the hotel is exceptional and definitely highly recommended if one is looking for a luxury stay!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced but good”
Reviews.Author: WildcatNZ
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is very good, but the price is too high compared to other hotels. The internet cost $25 minimum for 24 hours - a rip off

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and 'unhomely'”
Reviews.Author: Aswad8
Reviews.Content: We booked at this hotel for more than 2 months ago.you would think they'd give you a decent room,but ours was overlooking a huge aircond,in between buildings and overseeing an office!we can actually see them eye to eye!we cant open the blinds unless you want to 'amuse' those people from the building across from you.i think if you want a decent view room,you just cant go through a middle party such as wotif etc,you'd have to book directly with westin.otherwise,they'd treat you as an underrated customer,im telling you!even then,they stuffer up the booking by only giving free breakfast for one person instead of two.yes,you would think planning for many months before would give you some worry free,but this may not happen to everyone,so just keep that in mind.Please bear in mind,this hotel is humongous and there are other businesses in the same building so it doesnt really have the comfort feeling,i would say more like PRETENTIOUS customers with class.it seems that almost everyone has got branded clothings and all and we really felt out of place.its better if you go to just a hotel building like sheraton to get the closeness and warmth feeling.

Reviews.Title: “My first 5 star experience”
Reviews.Author: MurrumbaJo
Reviews.Content: Yes it was lovely, but I did expect a bit more from one of the top 5 in Sydney. The room (we were on the 30th floor) was a little on the small side......comfortable seating for 2 would have been much better.....if there were not buildings in the way the view would have been amazing.....but there definitely were glimpses of the harbour which were great. The bathroom was outstanding with a rainfall shower ......another first for me .....was beautiful. The breakfast was everything that you could ask for and a bit more. The position was excellent for walking to all the major sights......all in all, no major faults.....probably just my expectations for the $400 + per night.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Experience”
Reviews.Author: jomac701
Reviews.Content: We recently spent three glorious nights at the Westin Hotel in Sydney. Views for ever, an immaculately clean spacious suite and, best of all, their Heavenly beds..........to die for! By staying in an executive suite, we had free access to the executive dining area, with free breakfast and evening canapes and drinks. This overall, meant the cost was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: ModernNomad001
Reviews.Content: It is no surprised this hotel has been rated one of the best in the world. I have stayed here numerous times and for a variety of reasons (business, when I was dating my wife as a couple and now with our three young children). This is the best hotel to use as a base for exploring Sydney. You are an easy walk from either Darling Harbor or the Rocks / Circular Quay (main ferry terminal / major train stop), and of course you are in the heart of the city for business. A few tips: - There is a dining area downstairs in the Post Office building with a variety of ranging from quick food to fine dining; there is even a great wine / cheese room - yum and romantic! There are neat things to see down there (old bank vault, 'caves' and a neat archeological area) - Just down the block is a Cole's supermarket at King and George - can stock up on food and has a nice wine section (get the Nobel One desert wine and thank me later) And a few more tips for traveling with little ones: - The lobby is great at 3am when the kids are still on US time and you want to let your wife sleep - lots of fun things to see and play on without disturbing (many) people - The dining area downstairs in is just so-so for little kids at lunch, but they do enjoy seeing all the neat things. I believe at night kids are not allowed at all. What I have done is ordered take away from the pizza place (very nice pizza) and then either run the kids to the grocery store to pick up a few things or just let them have fun going up and down the escalators - See the tip above about the grocery store. You can pack light on diapers, etc... and stock up there once you arrive at reasonable rates - We used points for the last stay and for an extra 2,500 per night you can get a bigger room which is worth it - For things to do in Sydney make sure you hit the aquarium, Darling Harbor is so-so but worth a bit of time, the Opera House tour is a lot of fun, ride a ferry (Bondi makes a fun day with a playground, the beaches to see, lots of neat places to eat), and the zoo is a must see. There are tons of good parks for letting little ones have a run around and a picnic, ones to try are Wynyard Park (a few blocks from the hotel, lots of places to buy take away including Subway); the Royal Botanical Gardens are huge, have great views of the harbor, great plants, a nice cafe and of course the BATS which kids love; and Hyde Park is gorgeous with the Archibald Fountain, neat birds and lovely views of St Mary's.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - still very good but....”
Reviews.Author: shearn
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Westin in Sydney following a 2 week stay in late 2008. Booked again due to the excellent service and value for money at the time. Did it live up to such high expectations again? (Bearing in mind we preferred the Westin to the Park Hyatt which we stayed at in 2007). Overall - nearly, but not quite there. Our initial room was not up to standard (the mattress smelt of stale urine - not pleasant at all for a 5 star hotel) which was very disappointing but to be fair on the staff - and this is where they excel - Carly Stone took on our concerns and upgraded us to a Deluxe Tower room for no extra charge. She also arranged for chocolates and fruit to be delivered to the room which was a nice touch. Our new room was on the 18th floor and was much better overall and in line with our stay three years ago. However, similar to some other reviews, we did feel that there was a lack of experienced staff overall and the concierge desk was nowhere near as helpful as last time. Also the cost of breakfast and dinner was ridiculously high although part of this is down to the weakness of the english pound compared to our last visit. We ended up at nearby Vivo (cafe) every morning for breakfast which was excellent. Overall, would we stay again when we are next in Sydney? Probably not but the Westin is still a good but not great hotel in my opinion. Our visit was definitely saved by Carly who was excellent resulting in a personalised letter of apology to our room from the Front Office Manager. She was the only one who showed genuine interest in us from day one. Keep an eye on future reviews for improvement especially in the cleaning department.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern, good location, very busy, $25 internet charge”
Reviews.Author: obrij1
Reviews.Content: The room was very good, the bed fantastic, it was quiet, but the lobby was exceedingly busy all the time. The main gripe is why I have to pay $25 for internet in a $500 per night room. Something is not right with that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: rojaan1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights before flying OS. We were on the 29th Floor with a view of the clock and harbour. The room was quiet, the bed excellent so we slept well. Breakfast in the ex lounge was included. We had a car and the only complaint was it was very slow to get the car up with valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chenille W
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip. This hotel is really nice. In the CBD. Great location. Close to a bus stop that you can hop on the city bus for free and tour the city. Went to both Bondi and Bonte Beach from here and was great. Breakfast buffett was around $40.00 per person; good selection including smoothies. Multiple places to eat and drink in the basement or you can take back to the room. Some around $15.00 for tapas. Front desk staff was very friendly and hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gattaca616
Reviews.Content: Things started off badly when on arrival my husband was asked by the porter if he (my husband, not the porter) wanted to take our (3) suitcases up the room. Huh? Then things really went downhill. We were given a suite which had vomit stains on the carpet and was directly above the A/C plant, which meant it was really quite noisy (and it was an unattractive view too)! While we could of possibly managed this for 1 night we were staying for 3, and had pointedly paid the exorbitant price to stay in a suite to be comfortable, not stressed! When we asked if it was possible to move, we were basically given the runabout by two very young and haughty staff members (one being the duty manager), with the end result of being moved 1 floor up (so the problem effectively remained), offered EARPLUGS and the added inconvenience of possibly moving rooms the next day. Unbelievable. It seemed the staff just could not fathom how when you arrive at your destination you just want to unpack and relax, not haggle about rooms, moving or earplugs! (We didn't move rooms again.) The most disappointing part though was that although we pointed out we had been coming to the hotel for the past 10 years, we were not treated as valued customers, at all. (Note, we were already staying in a suite so an upgrade was not the point or an option.) Yes, the beds are comfy, but the hotel is starting to look tired, and sadly staff seem perfectly happy to offer minimal service, and the management absolutely none. It is really more like a 3.5 star hotel now at 5 star prices. Stay if you are prepared to pay and put up with this lack of service or interest. We are not and won't be going back, particularly not when there are now so many other fantastic options in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ruffled by Raphael”
Reviews.Author: jimmhk
Reviews.Content: The WEstin is generally a good hotel with excellent business amenities and spacious rooms which display only the first signs of tiredness. It is priced ok for the v strong market and has an excellent CBS location. Breakfast is good and was included. Two gripes however. One major. A door man called Raphael really hacked all four of us off by accepting a bribe from another person,behind us in the queue , to get a taxi while it was raining heavily during our stay. we got a formulaic answer to our complaint from a gentleman called Taejon ,which doesn't help matters. Other complaint is the gym is off property and is exceptionally beaten up and poor quality. Car to the airport was xcellent nd otherwise the concierge and other staff top notch.

Reviews.Title: “I love the beds!”
Reviews.Author: Fossettes
Reviews.Content: We have stayed several times at the Westin Sydney and keep returning for several reasons; We like the location being a short walk to Circular Quay or shopping, The rooms are large and light filled. We love having a view of the clock (although once he had an alleyway view, which wasn't great, but it wasn't awful either.) The front desk staff are always welcoming and helpful - upon check in my husband mentioned something to me about it being my birthday and the staff member must have overheard. That night when we arrived back from the theatre, there was a beautiful birthday dessert and a personalized letter waiting for us! I was shocked (and thrilled - it was yummy!) The beds are so comfortable I want one for home! The only thing I don't particularly like about the rooms are the glass walls of the bathroom, but I love the rain shower head, so it's a tradeoff!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service, Inner City Sydney at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Simon H
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is perfectly located - you can walk to almost everything. The hotel itself has everything you need from bars, restaurants to a gym and indoor pool. The service is exceptional 24 hours a day and the rooms comfort factor is superb. I have stayed at the Westin Sydney three times now and would recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel with the lot.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient city location”
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Female
Reviews.Content: I didn't experience much of this hotel spending only about 10 hours in it, but what I saw, I liked. Front desk were very helpful in changing my allocated room to somehing quieter when I mentioned on check-in my need for a quiet room. The Tower room on level 5 was well-appointed and the glass-walled bathroom was especially fun. The only negative was that there wasn't a power point in easy proximity of the bed, so I couldn't charge my phone while I lay in bed talking. Great value at $200 through wotif.com

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location wrapped up together”
Reviews.Author: Robin M
Reviews.Content: This wonderfully located hotel is extremely comfortable and has a certain chic presence about it; Ideal for the shopper and even better if you want to hide within it's walls. The only negative is the pool which does not meet the standard of the rest of he facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent service and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: HMCinSG
Reviews.Content: This isn't the place to stay for a view. But compared to some of the more expensive harbourside locations, you still get a great location and great rooms. What's good? The rooms are a good size and bathrooms excellent. Food is of a high standard and there are also several great restaurants in the same complex. The beds are the publicised 'Heavenly' and live up to reputation. Great gym. What's not hot? The work desks and chairs are average and do not suit anyone that needs to spend much time working. The bar has great service but the atmosphere of a train station.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: brookdj1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel and was pleasantly surprised at being upgrade to the exec. Floor. The room was spacious and had a wonderful view of downtown from the 28th floor. Beds were great as always. The only minor concern was the service in the Executive lounge. Service was spotty if non existent at times. Other than that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Property”
Reviews.Author: goodnamesaretaken
Reviews.Content: Property seems to be two buildings with an enormous sky light connecting the two. Numerous restaurants and bars and open space on the ground floor. This is really a beautiful Westin. When you leave the elevator and cross over the sky bridge to the other building, you get a sense how big the hotel is and see how they kept intact the historical details of the former buildings. The room had tray ceilings, shower with a rain shower head, and the standard comfortable bed. Given that the hotel caters to the business travelor, I was surprised that the room did not come with wi-fi. I had to go down to the Business Center to log in. Expect an expensive martini.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel , need of wifi”
Reviews.Author: travelbeee
Reviews.Content: Always stayed here for biz. Good hotel. Have all the basics, perhaps time to think about a renovation and at least add wifi offering to guest bedroom! Very comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in the heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: Katrina E
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for one night in November - we were in Sydney for my sister's wedding. We had stayed 2 nights at the Four Points by Sheraton, and decided to treat ourselves at the Westin. After our 2 honeymoon stay at the Westin Fiji, we thought we might have enough points for an upgrade, so we asked upon check-in â€” not enough points, but were upgraded anyway to the Deluxe Tower Room. Our room 1402 was absolutely beautiful! Spotless, spacious and relaxing. Perfect for unwinding in the midst of the city. We had dinner at Cinta Ria in Westfields - so close! Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Clean and well maintained Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattrx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2010 for a weekend and the hotel was in a great location in the CBD, only a short walk away from the train station and easy to find. The room itself was slightly dated but was clean and very well maintained. Part of the hotel is in a heritage building with beautiful features, we were tempted to due high tea here due to the atmosphere. The lobby is grand and the room was spacious with a modern bathroom and TV. As an SPG platinum guest there which provided us with access to the lounge which included breakfast and evening snacks and wine as an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms and views!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in August 2011 and really liked this hotel. The location is superb- walking distance to everything you could wnt such as the Opera house, Darling harbour, the Aquarium, etc as well as many other shops and restaurants. We stayed in a Deluxe Tower room which are the newer rooms. We had rooms on the 16th and 18th floors which offered spectacular views across the city and even some harbour views. The staff were extremely helpful when my boryfriend left his suit there and kept it for us until we returned a week later. The bedrroms were great with comfortable beds and fantastic modern bathrooms with rainfall showers and a huge bath. We didnt have breakfast or any meals there as we were often out and about with friends and there are so many cafes int he area we didnt feel it was necessary. As for the other facilities we used the gym twice, which was excellent as was the pool. Overall if we come back to Sydney we will be staying at the Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location and good food.”
Reviews.Author: Alex_Bell
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at a special rate via a well known hotel site for our first few days in Australia. Really glad we did, the room was spotless, fantastically comfortable bed, quiet and exceptional choice for breakfast. Topped off with a great central location, this place was hard to fault. Only caveate would be the value score would have been less if we had payed full price.

Reviews.Title: “Location is very good”
Reviews.Author: gillg
Reviews.Content: Room 1201, king bed, very comfortable, spacious and a full window view of the clock tower which I quirkily enjoyed. Our initial assigned room was 402- very claustrophobic space which i think is due to the fact that it is within the auditorium structure, it is probably the same size as spacious 1201 but I was very, very glad to get the move. Best points Location, location, location- easy walk to the shopping strip, easy walk to Circular Quay and the Botanical Gardens, etc. Nice tea and coffee. Nice bathroom products. Pleasant staff. Negatives The price of internet- outrageous at $25/day, this fact has been commented on time and time again yet the charge persists- I don't get it. The in house pricing in the room/room service/lobby lounge- it is all really exorbitant. I dont get that either. Overall, a good stay, we enjoyed the hotel whilst there for a 2 night stay. Would I go back? Not necessarily. The room rate would have to be very inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCTSRacing
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous hotel, couldn't fault it - a very enjoyable stay. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to other.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here when in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: janethomas
Reviews.Content: We have just been back from a long weekend stay at the Westin Sydney. We love everything about the hotel. The room was of a very good size. Bed was large and comfortable. Lovely ambience in the lobby. The hotel is situated right in the city, within walking distance to shops and food. Will definitely stay here again when next in Sydney. I was secretly wishing that our Qantas flight got cancelled so we could stay another night :) (Yes we were in Sydney the weekend Qantas grounded all their planes)

Reviews.Title: “Blowout Expensive.. It's Sydney not Monte Carlo!”
Reviews.Author: Sash8849
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a grand 5 star experience, I suggest you shop elsewhere. I chose the Westin because I am a member of the Starwood group. Being 5 Star, I didn't have any delusions about price. However this Sydney based hotel hikes up prices. I thought I was in London. A 5 Star hotel that charges what this hotel does, the service should be backed up by uncompromising superiority. I left the hotel feeling ripped off. There was no pulse at check in. Not even a welcome for a Starwood member. Here's you key. See you later. I had one small bag that took 20 minutes to get to my room. I had to call concierge to speed things up. If your thinking of room service, watch out for the whopping add ons that could blowout your dinner budget. For example. Caeser Salad with prawns $40 plus $8 delivery fee. ( I think it was $18 for 3 prawns. $6 each ) Just note when ordering room service, any small changes to the menu should be clarified with the operator to avoid any shocks when you come to paying the bill. Internet $25 for 24 hrs. A hotel without heart. Dissapointing

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with perfect blending”
Reviews.Author: Vandender
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westin Sydney end of October 2011, was very surprised with beautiful blending in from the hotel into next doors old building with clock tower. Looks very nice and very cozy. The rooms are very spacious with good views over central Sydney. Everything can be visited within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Service is very nice but not overdone. Try the executive floors, visit of the lounge is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tc1707
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel at a great location. Staff had a bad day I guess. Should not happen at a 5-star place. Don't understand that there is no Wifi in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jasonz92
Reviews.Content: Must say this was one of the best SPG hotels we have ever stayed at (the other being the Westin Melbourne). Very friendly, polite, and helpful staff even with all of our questions as it was our first time in Sydney. No attitude or impatience like in the US. Not only that, the room was spectacular. Very well designed and spacious and the bed... soooo comfy especially after a 14 hour fligt. We had a great veiw of the clock tower. Location was great as well, 10 minute walk to China town, 15 minute walk to Darling Harbour, 10 minute walk to Circular Quay.... can sa enough great things. Internet was decent as well- not super fast or anything, but fast enough to get some work done

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: TreyZ
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent (monthly) Sydney traveller and will typically stay at either the Sheraton on the Park or the Westin; and whilst the Westin is supposed to be a top-tier 5 star hotel, I find it quite bland and unexciting. The usual check in experience is good however on occasion I need to press them for an upgrade when it should be automatic (SPG Gold member). The hotel lobby is part of the Sydney GPO and there is an office building attached so the lobby is generally quite lively and bustling with activity however its not too relaxing if you want to go down to the lounge for a quiet meeting or drink. The tower rooms are well appointed, bright and clean, they overlook the GPO clock tower with views of the Sydney CBD skyline, nice however it feels clinical rather than comfortable. The bathrooms are very spacious with large bath tubs and excellent 'rain forest' shower heads. The breakfast buffet is superb with a good selection of quality food. Hotel guests get access to the No 1 Martin Place health club which is very well equipped however it is a public gym and not exclusive to hotel guests so it can get very busy with local office workers in the evening. Housekeeping staff need to go back to maid-school, they ring the doorbell and knock on the door incessantly even when the 'DO NOT DISTURB' sign is on, and then when they do make the room they do not even collect all of the rubbish. Very convenient location with good facilities but the hotel doesn't have any real character to it.

Reviews.Title: “was impressive once upon a time..”
Reviews.Author: cchen0204
Reviews.Content: I remember my first trip to sydney, the bridge, the harbour, the impeccable Westin. It seemed so grand back then, and the amenities and service impossible to beat. Fast forward to 2011, the exterior of the building is as beautiful as I remember, and the room condition is surprisingly good for a hotel with some age, however, the service was absolutely a disaster. I was surprised when the concierge proudly displayed their clefs d'or badges, during my 4 night stay at westin, in no way did they provide any sort of helpful, sound advice to warrant those badges. Not only were they unhelpful, they were downright rude. I was disappointed, expected much more from this property

Reviews.Title: “Well run business hotel with good rooms”
Reviews.Author: APWLondon
Reviews.Content: Well located and well run, central sydney hotel with great rooms, nothing amazing but none the less well appointed, good bed, excellent bathroom - all one needs

Reviews.Title: “Great location, large comfy rooms and beds!”
Reviews.Author: davidevil
Reviews.Content: If you like central, then the Westin is a great choice. The rooms are huge, beds super comfortable and the staff are really friendly and helpfull. The hotel has no great views, but is a short walk down to the harbour. The rain shower is fantastic and the rooms are really quiet. The hotel lacks a bit of character and the modern and old do not jell well.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a city break”
Reviews.Author: timisiytangco
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I had stayed at a Westin, recommended by friends with whom I was traveling. I'm so glad I chose to stay here. It's in the center of the city, so most attractions and restaurants are walking distance or a short cab ride away. The "Heavenly Bed" was indeed, as heavenly as promised. The concierge was extremely knowledgeable and we ended up trusting his judgement more than our Luxe Guide and Time Out Sydney! Two (minor) reasons I didn't give this 5 stars: AU$7 bottles of water (really?) and a crowded lobby where luggage was constantly strewn across the lobby. But I definitely look forward to my next Westin stay.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Sydney-Trust me”
Reviews.Author: KennyLauer
Reviews.Content: First, let's say, I am not the easiest guest to please. I travel a lot and have certain expectations. This property is the Best westin I have stayed at so far--and I have stayed at a lot of them. Here is why: 1) The staff is amazing friendly and attentive. I called Service Express at least 10 times, and they always pick up on the 2nd ring or less--they must have a big staff responding to customer needs. Big star in my book. 2) The rooms are exceptional. I am in the tower (I think), but the bathrooms are big and well done (lots of glass), the desks are workable, and the beds comfortable. 3) The workout facility is--bar none--the best I have ever scene. It is a full scale facility with well maintained equipment and everything you could expect. They must have had at least 30 pieces of cardio equipment. 4) The food is well prepared and very good..and delivered as ordered. 5) The property itself is beautiful and the location is amazing. You can easily get to any of the attractions by walking as well as access to amazing shopping and open areas. 6) If you have club lounge access--it is well stocked and the food is excellent--and the folks that work there are extremely nice and helpful. The only thing I would like for them to do is have wireless internet access in the rooms. It is wired and the speed is decent, but for US travelers who hope to have wireless for their iphones and ipads (because the roaming charges are outrageous), it is very unfortunate. Overall though a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: My partner and I decided to stay at the Westin for 1 week in mid-September, as we have had such great experiences in the past. This stay was no different. From check-in to check-out, the only problem we had was with the dvd player, which was fixed w/in 30 minutes after I had notified a rep. Again, I am pleased to report that even while checking-in before the normal hour, I was accommodated We stayed in a well-appointed Executive Club King on the lounge floor/SPG floor. Our room, just as with every other time, was spacious, and all of our needs and requests were met throughout our stay. One of the things I appreciate about the Westin Sydney is that the rooms which we've stayed have 2 rooms together tucked inside there own separate foyer, thus providing an additional feeling of privacy. Also, I have never heard passersby in the hallway, as I do in many other hotels. The room's color scheme and tone adds to a feeling of calm and relaxation. Some people don't like the setup of the bathrooms; I like them. And, if you want more privacy, there is the automatic black-out shade for the window between the tub and room area. The choice in shower heads is nice, especially the rain feature. And I find the scent of the white tea aloe to be soothing as well. This was my first time using the lounge. In comparison to other hotel lounges, it is on par. Light breakfast options are served in the morning, access is provided throughout the day (w free wifi and non-alcoholic beverages), and canapes and drinks are served from 6-8P daily. I was quite pleased with the level of professionalism and friendliness all hotel staff had treated us, again making us feel at home away from home. To date, I have stayed at most of Sydney's finest hotels, and I prefer the Westin over all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch”
Reviews.Author: Lisaj67
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while my husband was attending a conference. We had great room with club lounge access. The hotel is very central and it's easy to walk to all the main attractions from the hotel. I had a massage which I considered very good value for money. The service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and breakfast”
Reviews.Author: nicw68
