Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend in Sydney with our children. We had interconnecting rooms. The rooms were large and clean. the bed comfortable, lots of space for clothing and great bathroom and good shower pressure. The buffet breakfast in the morning was beautiful and I loved the location being so close to Westfield, David Jones and Myers. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, good location”
Reviews.Author: marikirby
Reviews.Content: Great location. We were a little dissapointed in the room selection as it was not nearly as nice as the ones pictured by members on TA. Room was very clean and the room service was really good. TIP: If you want a room with a view, stay at the Four Seasons. We spent 2 nigths at the Westin and 3 nights at the Four Seasons. At the Four Seasons we had complimentary breakfast, Four Seasons service, and a room with a view of the Opera House and Bridge for less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, exactly what you expect from Westin”
Reviews.Author: ScottH09
Reviews.Content: Westin Sydney is your traditional nice, clean and comfortable Westin. Exactly what you would expect from the brand. The location is good (about 10 minutes walk from Circular Quay) but not great as some hotels are closer. Hotel gives you access to a nice gym and staff was very friendly. If you are coming to Sydney to see the traditional tourist spots, don't mind a short walk and don't care about being on the water or having a view of the water, this is an excellent option as it is a bit cheaper than the waterfront spots but the hotel is just as nice. Hotel is also a short (less than 5 minute) walk from the train to the airport. Traffic to and from the airport is bad if you are in a cab so the train is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “My true love for me”
Reviews.Author: lol89955
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Sydney for the Kids Choice Awards Friday, Saturday and Sunday 2011 it was outstanding the lobby is very spacious very first class the bar and lounge has outstanding staff as well as you are greeted and farewelled with a smile. The rooms are excellent when you check in the bellman shows you all the facilities in your room and how they work. The buffet breakfast is outstanding I reccomend it in your hotel rate. In the buffet the chefs and waitresses treat you to a lovely smile and are very helpful and kind. The food is just amazing even at the bar you can get a delicious 5 star dessert we got coconut icecream mango and choc mousse and hard pink sugar. Our room was directly across from the G.P.O Clock tower. (you don't hear the noise that often) This was absoloutely a 5 star stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: BeagleBrisbane
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, great service, central location - I would highly recommend the Westin in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Location and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: SavannahLady2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business. It's centrally located and absolutely first rate. If you can, gain access to the executive lounge. Wonderful views and the breakfast is great. I really can't say enough about this hotel. The only small criticism is that - and I couldn't believe this - the rooms didn't actually have wireless connectivity, which is a bit of a pain when you are on business.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: CanberraCaro
Reviews.Content: Decided on the Westin as a last minute quick getaway. Everything was fantastic! Check-in was smooth, quick and efficient. Wandered up to the room - it was great. Tower King room, fantastic view of the clock tower right outside the window. Bed was amazingly comfortable. Loved the bathroom, with a big 'window' wall, which was great for us, but definitely not for everyone. Concierge was very helpful in explaining parking to us, and suggested the most amazing restaurant for dinner. Absolutely loved it! Room service was quick. Breakfast was good, love the wide range of food available. Only minor quip - a bottle of water in the fridge had already been opened when we checked in. Not fussed, as we weren't planning on drinking water, we just made sure to tell reception before check out. Great location, right in the middle of Sydney, with easy access to everything, and only a short walk away from anything, really. Overall, loved the stay. Got late check-out free of charge, and complimentary Starwood membership. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “designed for relaxation and location”
Reviews.Author: marg1516
Reviews.Content: Arrival welcoming and efficient. Room spacious,comfy, easy to unwind and provides generously..beautiful bathroom. Position very central to shops and sightseeing Concierge helpful. Would definitely return. Many tempting treats in room?

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you ask for a quiet room”
Reviews.Author: teresa L
Reviews.Content: I recently had two nights in a Heritage room that faced onto George Street. Although the room was impeccably presented, the traffic noise was so audible throughout the night that it was hard to get to sleep. My feedback from management on the noise situation was that "many of our guests prefer these rooms that are close to the sights and sounds of the bustling city". If noise is an issue then you should ask for a quiet room! My profile has now been annotated to this effect should I book a room at the Westin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Service &View”
Reviews.Author: travelingaussies
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights before leaving to go to Thailand and it was 5 star. Great service,views,location and many more... This is the place to stay while in Sydney...

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: grimrater
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Hotels in Circular Quay and I thought I'd miss being close to the harbour and Opera House. To be honest the Westin was such a pleasure to stay in that I didn't think about it. From the Hotel's main entrance if you turn left you're in Theatre land and designer heaven. Turn right and you're metres from the Pitt St Shopping Mall and Westfield. The choice of restaurants nearby (in fact in the building) would satisfy even the fussiest of diners. The Westin is a very busy Hotel, at peak times the check in line can be quite long. Nonetheless it's all handled efficiently. We have the advantage of being SPG members and had a fast check in. The staff have the ability to be friendly and professional without being 'gushy'. Congratulations must go to the Management team. Definately my new 'home' in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, even for a family!”
Reviews.Author: Littlemisslady9
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family , including my 6 yo sister in this hotel and I have to say it was probably the best hotel I have ever been to in Australia. My family and I always stay in the best hotels , and we have to many very grand hotels in Europe, but this hotel was still outstanding. The service was great, they were not in your face but they were there when you needed them. The breakfast buffet was very good, appreciated the gluten free range for my sister who is gluten intolerant. The room was big and the bathroom was clean and fresh. Highly recommend this hotel to both families and for business. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the centre of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: Luxury hotel within walking distance to anywhere in the city. Everything from the fantastic rain shower to the bed you don't want to leave to the pure silence in the room. Even the bath how you can open the screen from the bathroom to the bedroom is just an added luxury this hotel has in order to exceed expectations. If you want to guarantee luxurious accommodation, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: EnjoylifeQueensland
Reviews.Content: Great hotel location which is a comfortable walk from great restaurants, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, The Rocks, the shops and the theatres. Staff are friendly and efficient and the business centre is excellent for printing boarding passes and checking emails if you don't have an i phone. Rooms are a good size and bathrooms luxurious.The historic architecture add charm to the whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Favorite Hotel in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: 42GLENLOCH
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning hotel and my top favorite in Sydney. They've kept the magnificent old Post Office facade and clock tower on the outside, but the inside is pure modern lux! Lots of Scandinavian blonde wood, miles of glass and marble and a little art deco. Beautiful art glass and 'to die for' bathrooms, soft lighting - and that's all before you sink into their blissful beds! The linen is superb. The staff are warm and friendly as well as efficient and the concierge has a way of getting the best tables at the best restaurants around town, within hours! Buffet breakfast is great, as are the restaurants downstairs. Sydney's a great town - but the Westin just puts the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “What every hotel should be like!”
Reviews.Author: Kayne87
Reviews.Content: If you get the chance stay at the Westin, Sydney. A wonderful hotel that cleverly mixes new with the old. Built at No 1 Martin Place in the old Sydney GPO building, the Westin has transformed the historic site, whilst keeping true to her original uses. For those who prefer the more subtle, homely hotels why not choose to stay in the heritage rooms, built in the historic part of the GPO building, or if your like me, book one of the Tower rooms/suits. These rooms, with wall to ceiling windows and bathrooms that have beautiful city views, or overlook the famous Martin Place will simply amaze those people looking to see, stay and play in Sydney. Yes there are the hotels that line the beautiful harbour with views of the Opera House and our iconic Harbour Bridge (if your traveling def do the bridge climb, either as the sun is rising or at sunset, there is nothing quite like it). But you will never find a hotel with beds like the Westin, and I know what the weary traveller is in desperate need of. After walking around all day, and exploring all night you need a great nights sleep. Simply... heavenly. You are located in the centre of Sydney, with beautiful restaurants down stairs, and if you are into shopping we have Burberry, Armani, Louis Vuitton, and for the girls Tiffanys and Cartier only footsteps away (plus we have our newly refurbished Westfield shopping centre filled with every amazing clothes shop you could imagine, anyway go just to see the design of the place, it looks fantastic), why not see a show at the state theatre or Capitol theatre, visit some of the best restaurants in Aus- Bilson's, Tetsuya's, Est., Marque or why not head over to Surry Hills, the melting pot of Sydney's very best food and wine bars, think SOHO in NY or a little San Francisco. While at Surry Hills, pop over to Oxford St and enjoy the night life, or dance the night away in Kings Cross (for those who like to party hard). When I choose to stay in the city, I choose the Westin, the service is tops, the views a great, the bathrooms are beautiful and the beds just amazing. It is what all hotels should be like. It puts a smile on my face each time I go to Sydney. I have stayed in many hotels and this has to be one of my top 3. So no matter where you choose to stay, promise me one thing... You'll have a great time in Sydney. Eat. Sleep. Play.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business hotel in prime Sydney CBD location”
Reviews.Author: Jaimeandjohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin the night we moved in to our new house, rather than dealing with unpacked boxes. This is a fantastically located hotel, so should be on the radar for any traveller to Sydney. We suggest that this is hotel more appealing to the top end business traveller (probably rivaled by the Four Seasons near the Rocks or the Intercontinental closer to Circular Quay) than a hotel suitable to the romantic getaway (the Observatory Hotel win that prize without comparison). Some observations: * the room layout is great with the bath located in the centre of the room (not the Mandirin Oriental in HK, but that sets the standard) * service is as good as any hotel * beds are typically Westin , the best mattress and sheets * buffet breakfast was superb * room accessories (shampoos, vanity sets) were underwhelming, no toothbrushes or razor sets, which you would typically expect for a room for in excess of $300 a night. We recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Bronwyn B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stay at this hotel quite regularly as we both work in the CBD.I love the layout of the rooms at this hotel.The rooms are large and the bathrooms are huge.It is always clean and the staff are super friendly and professional.The reception area is quite grand and the valet service is efficient and friendly.Love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Best 5 Star Accommodation in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: rninstyle
Reviews.Content: Meeting friends from Brisbane for a culinary tour of Sydney we all agreed that we would stay at the Westin after reading the reviews from tripadvisor. We were not disappointed. The hotels location has to be the most central to the shopping district of Pitt Street and built within an historic monument well known in Sydney's Martin Place. Leaving the taxi, our bags were taken by the friendly concierge staff at the properties entrance and we were directed to reception for checkin. As it was just after 9am in the morning we were expecting to leave our bags so we could explore Sydney while our room became available, we were all quite surprised when we were told our room was ready, we were also directed to where the hotel facilities were such as the gym, business centre and restaurants. After telling the man at reception our plans over the long weekend he provided us with maps and "best route" ideas to get to our destinations - excellent customer service. Our room itself was on the 23rd floor a Starwood Preferred Guest floor (we aren't actually members of that group) and was located facing the clock tower of Martin Place. Don't be concerned about this, though the clock tower chimes every 15 minutes we hardly noticed it. The room was spacious and luxerious, lots of complementary items and bottled water, we especially liked the rain shower like fitting in the bathroom and the "heavenly bed". Upon our ventures out to explore Sydney we were always greeted with smiles and offers of umbrellas to brave Sydney's rainy weather, the business centre though small and tucked away was hardely habitated and free printing was handy when wanting to print our boarding passes to fly home. Even as Sydney explodes with people on a Saturday night we remained comfortable and safe in the area we were in and a chance meeting with Pat Rafter and Bernard Tomic while in the elevator perhaps confirmed to us that this property must be good. We understand a hotel such as this is mostly geared to business people and the like, but we thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights here at the Westin, and have agreed to stay again on our next visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel with only minor niggles”
Reviews.Author: newkstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Hotel in Sydney for the weekend of 17/18 September 2011. This was my first stay at the Westin, although I have been to Sydney many times. This was a bit of a treat as I normally stay at more moderately price hotels. I paid $355 per night for a deluxe tower room through the hotel website. This was the cheapest available price and it was pre-paid. The entry to this hotel is very low key. I realised I had walked past it many times without even knowing it was there. The taxi drop off area is woefully small and crowded. My taxi couldn't get in and I got dropped off int he street and walked in. No problem but if you had a lot of luggage or it was raining, I guess you would just be stuck in the queue for a while. Actual check-in for me was very quick and pleasant but the reception desks are quite small and there were sizeable queues at other times. My room was on the 23rd floor. The room itself was very pleasant. Larger than standard, with great bathroom (see through from the bath, though with blinds), and very large windows. While the view was nothing special, I loved the light. A couple of niggles. the first was the appalling size of the wardrobe. It was the smallest I have encountered in a hotel. See the photo. What full height hanging space there was was taken up by the iron and ironing board. I just fitted in a suit. If there were two of you staying for a little longer, you would be stuck. There is no excuse as there was a wasted space next to the wardrobe that could be used to double the size. The work desk was also badly set up. Maybe I am odd, but I like to watch telly while working and that was impossible. I had to manhandle the desk into a more convenient spot. Also there were only two, quite cheap and uncomfortable chairs. There was plenty of room for something better but the only comfortable place to sit was the bed. The bed was great as other have commented. the final problem with the room was no wireless Internet at all. Broadband was available but @ $24 for 24 hours (should always be free!) and it was slow. There was supposed to be wireless broadband in the public areas but I could never connect. These are relatively minor niggles but could be easily fixed and should be. The room was serviced efficiently and quickly. All the staff were efficient and pleasant. The public areas and the rooms are nicely decorated and the hotel is very centrally located. I did use room service and the food was very pleasant, though very expensive - $80-$90 for three courses. The only other problem was that way too much food was provided. A smoked salmon starter must have had at least 500g of smoked salmon. An unusual complaint to get too much, but I certainly couldn't eat it all. Overall, a very nice hotel for a splurge but really too expensive to use regularly for business or private visits.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: mlmgl
Reviews.Content: A bit disappointed. I booked a Heritage Superior room and have to say I found the room lacking in space, with a small window and not much of a view. The pool area was VERY dissapointing. I would expect more from a 5 star hotel. I walked to the pool at 7.30am for a nice morning spa only to be told that it doesn't open until 8.00am. At 8am, I walked around the gym for 5 minutes trying to look for the pool., I finally found the pool (run by GoodLife gym - not by the Westin). Very average with no spa! My stay was ok but there are a lot of other great 5 star hotels in Sydney with much better facilites. Great location though for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cameron h
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. On perfect location.very helpful staff.excellent.service.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: katyjoyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy the Westin Hotels and the Sydney Westin is certainly in a great position for those that want to take advantage of the new and wonderful Westfield - Pitt St shopping complex. A good business Hotel as well. The beds are indeed Heavenly but something i felt was missing on this trip in the rooms. No tissues, no herbal teas, not the usual extras, maybe a few cost cutting issues happening! The pool is tiny and a rabbit warren of a walk to get to it. The gym was very good. We did take a taxi to a delightful restaurant called China Doll at the Finger Wharf for dinner and would highly recommend it. Breakfast in the Hotel is ok but there is plenty to choose from close by if its not part of your package. Overall an enjoyable stay and yes we would return, mostly for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Boroondara
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I enjoyed a weekend stay in Sydney and couldn't fault the hotel other then the reception staff who were a little unwelcoming, the rooms are lovely, fitted out well, great heavenly beds, location is perfect and would stay again when we visit Sydney next

Reviews.Title: “Dependably good but the Westin formula could do with a lift in the service department”
Reviews.Author: Justbobhrh
Reviews.Content: It is a good hotel - no doubt about it - great location, nicely fitted out - great "heavenly" beds etc; but I just find that this Westin lacks that "something more" that you get from some other Westin's around the world. I continue to stay here whenever in Sydney and maybe that is my point - I keep coming back but there is never really any acknowledgement of my continued patronage over and above the 500 points Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) benefit on arrival. The hotel is in such am amazing location, in the old GPO (Post Office) building - it could be a truly great experience, it just lacks something that it is hard to put a finger on.

Reviews.Title: “nice weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: MR_S1_11
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin for a weekend trip to Sydney. Took the train from the airport and had no difficulty getting to the hotel with public transport. Arrived mid Friday night and the bar was very busy, and this in turn made the lobby very noisy. Check in was quiet and was very efficient, so we were quickly in our room and the noise could not be heard from here. We stayed in the historic part of the hotel and to a very small degree it showed, however it was very nice and comfortable with all the amenities you would expect. My one complaint is more about Sydney. There is not that much to do in the CBD itself, which makes the location questionable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Philip R
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Fantastic position right in the middle of the city. Stones throw to anything the shopper/partier/tourist may want. The service was very personal and outstanding. The pricing was as you would expect for a top quality property in such a location but still very reasonable, I thought. The beds are excellent and the bathrooms are also very good. I will definately be staying next time I am in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You to Ron & Janice”
Reviews.Author: Whwhib
Reviews.Content: The hotel experience was great, but was made even better by the service offered by Ron on the Concierge Desk and Janice from Secure Parking who sorted out my parking problems quickly and efficiently. I would like to personally thank them both. btw, Stay here, service, rooms and the restaurants are all top class and its right in the middle of the city just a 2 min walk from the main Westfield shopping experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: reichen10
Reviews.Content: Location could not be beat - in the heart of the city but only a few blocks walk to the Harbour and The Rocks. Very clean, very stylish, very chic, and very very comfortable. Rooms were quiet, beds excellent, and everything nice and clean. Never once saw a maid but the room was always done when I got back from my tours. Staff very helpful with all of my questions and never seemed bothered. Wonderful breakfast buffet, great workout gym, and restaurants everywhere. Loved the public spaces. Free internet was a big plus. Highly recommend this hotel to the pickiest traveler. I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rammenon
Reviews.Content: For folks used to a few basics - the Westin does not disappoint. Quick check in, good rooms, though a trifle impersonal. Wireless works right the first time and the breakfast in the morning is excellent. Rooms are modern enough to have a good night's sleep. A modern business hotel with no fuss and delivers on what you need for a stay between business meetings: Clean and comfortable with quick service. Not recommended for family vacation or ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Strong Westin brand in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: samstevens1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks like it was recently renovated. Very business driven, although we stayed as a family, and it worked for us as well. Location is in the heart of the CBD, 10 minute walking distance to everything. Rooms are very clean, and well maintained. And of course, the Westin heavenly beds make the rooms very comfortable. This is a really good Westin property. Btw, I agree with a poster below--weird not having wi-fi in the room, and 25.00 (Aus) for broadband connected internet is a little outdated and costly. Tip: there is free wi-fi in the lobby of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel in the heart of CBD and shopping are”
Reviews.Author: Eeklin
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the Westin sydney and was very happy to be upgraded to the Deluxe room. Our room 2502 was facing the clock tower and we were given 'morning calls' everyday. Pros : - New room with modern furniture and fittings - Property well kept and maintained - In the heart of CBD and shopping area. Lots to shop and eat nearby - Free wifi in the lobby area Cons : - Unwanted 'morning call' from the clock tower - Expensive parking. AUD56 for 24 hours, but car parked by concierge - No room slippers provided (not a common thing in australia ?) Paid AUD220 for this room under the SPG special deal. Think it is definitely more worth it to stay at Westin Sydney than Swissotel Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great SPG property. Staff are awesome”
Reviews.Author: spdolan
Reviews.Content: Pick of the bunch in Sydney. Room service food is 5 star, staff are spot on, perfect location. Only downer is the broadband and wifi. Broadband is slow, WIFI non-exisent in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not special”
Reviews.Author: walvisch
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in a heritage room. This hotel is ideally located slap bang in the middle of Sydney CBD. And its surrounds and public areas are imposing and grand, if somewhat impersonal. The room, was big and spacious with very high ceilings. It felt somewhat sparse and not luxurious. The tv was too small for a room of that size. Our bed was great as usual. The noise from Martin Place was intrusive and the very average busker under our window at 8 am not enjoyable. Service was below average, restaurant reservations that were promised by concierge simply weren't made, with no follow up.The gym and business centre were tucked away and below standard. Having stayed at two Westin properties in the last three months it feels to me that the Westin brand is losing its touch and feels a bit sloganistic. No real hospitable people on staff, but plenty of cards & booklets with pretty pictures and snappy typeset slogans trying to conjure up feelings, moods, wishes and desires that simply aren't met by the hotel, rooms or it's staff. Not good enough for a five star property

Reviews.Title: “excellent and professional”
Reviews.Author: teamadelaide
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice. 2 years ago and on this occasion. Excellent hotel. Well maintained, good size rooms, friendly and accommodating staff. Also, good variety of restaurants on site. Gym is well equipped, but closes at 6pm (a bit too early in my opinion). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: corky_c
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 10 nights in May with my husband. The hotel is nice, in a great location. Service is very good compared to other hotels in Sydney and Melbourne. We didn't have breakfast there but I've previously eaten at the hotel's restaurant Mosaic and the lobby bar - both very good. The Spa at the hotel is also great, as is the Gym.

Reviews.Title: “consistently wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kitty555
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin several times now during conferences. I am always impressed by the excellent service and beautifully clean, well maintained rooms. This is my favourite hotel in Sydney. The breakfasts are delicous with a fabulous range of choices. It trumps the Sheraton on the Park.

Reviews.Title: “When they say Heavenly Beds - Believe them!" What bliss”
Reviews.Author: mytimenow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Westin for 3 nights and loved it - got a good deal thru Zuji and was worth every penny. The rooms are fabulous - the bathrooms even better and the beds are just fabulous. Very quiet rooms, huge bath tubs, most excellent rain showers and great pillows - what more does anyone want when they travel. The location is right in the CBD - shops surround you, a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay or 15 minute walk in the other direction to Chinatown. We walked from Surry Hills back into the city which was an easy 25 minute walk. If you don't want to splurge on the breakfast - coffee shops and cafes are everywhere just outside the hotel. Stayed here once before years ago and always vowed to return - and now I have but not for the last time!!

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Jonni78
Reviews.Content: The staff are amazing, my stay has been well worthwhile. I love the valet parking, they bring your car up upon request. The only thing I have to compain about is the toilet smells, I don't think they cleaned it properly. I really should have let them know at the start and I'm sure they would have sent a cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “My Fav Hotel!! Counting Down the Days Till My Next Visit!!”
Reviews.Author: AussieSteve88
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice with my partner (once on our two year anniversary) and can safely say this is my favourite hotel. Service is amazing and the hotel looks wonderful!!!!!! I love the atrium and the overall style of the hotel. I've stayed in both a heritage room and a tower room. I think I like the heritage room best, but the tower room did have a glass wall between the bathroom and the rest of the room, meaning that you can watch tv and lounge back in the bath while having a glass of champas!! There are even speakers in the bathroom, making listening to the tv easy. Both rooms are nice and roomy, quite big in my opinion. On both occasions, I had a great sleep, the bed was heavenly. My partner and I also got a surprise on our anniversary, as the hotel sent up a complementary desert and bottle of wine when they found out we were spending our anniversary with them. We also paid for the club access, which included drinks, pre dinner canapÃ©s and breakfast, all of which were amazing!!! Location wise, the hotel is close to The Rocks and Pitt Street Mall, which are the main attracts for my partner and I; it is also a short walk to Town Hall. The only downside is that it can be expensive, the first time we went, we got a cheap mystery deal, but the second time was a bit expensive, but you definitely get what you pay for, which is elegance, superior service and five-star treatment. Overall, a fantastic hotel, two fantastic stays, both leaving me counting down the days till my next visit!!!!

Reviews.Title: “â€œJoint stay reviewâ€� Stayed 22-24 Oct 2010 AND 5-7 Aug 2011”
Reviews.Author: NQTropics
Reviews.Content: WESTIN SYDNEY. PITT ST. Stayed 22-24 Oct 2010 AND 5-7 Aug 2011 Reception: Great both times Concierge great, easy check in with details correct. Check out the same. Interior is fabulous. Old world meets new. And the combination works. Clock Tower above the clear ceiling looks wonderful. Modern tower building has all the bells and whistles you could want without being too fussy. Relaxed feel about it all. Hotel facilities: THE BAR on ground with various seating areas and restaurants sliding off the sides of the building. Itâ€™s quite different. We used the bar etc., on ground, and its fine. Bear in mind, this is very high end and the prices reflect the same. Gym, business centre and yes, Executive club on top. Rooms: We stayed in a Superior room using points for both stays. We were in town for special events away from the hotel, so time spent in house was to relax and sleep! Decided not to pay extra for an upgrade to an executive room. We had 26th floor both times which was fine. DÃ©cor was fine, see pic. Large king bed area with wide screen TV. Bose side radio. Side high back chairs, desk with lamp. Bed was to die for literallyâ€¦hard to leave it in the mornings. Pillows wonderful. Bathroom was clean marble/frosted green glass, nice walk in shower, large soaking tub all behind glass with electric roman blind to hide away. Bath products fine. Robes in the hanging closet. Fair sized hang space with the usual things. Safe included. Mini bar/fridge etc, offerings, all very expensive. Do yourself a favour and avoid it! Try the Quality Cellars beside the Menzies. They have all tastes in wine from $15 to $200 plus. Coffee plunger. Hot water jug and sachet coffee/tea as well. Food: In-house not bad for the price. We did indulge and it was great, especially when the last night laziness creeps in! Depending on the reason for your stay, this Hotel is a good one. Location is central, and as a guide a AU 7.50 cab ride gets you to most other central areas including Circular Quay. Hotel access drop off can be a drama, but the HC drivers we use and taxis know about it Overall, a great place. They do have a LOT of conventions here, so the main foyer areas can be noisy on weekends. Retreat to the deep tub after a long afternoon. Safe Travels R & G

Reviews.Title: “The only bad thing is having to check out..”
Reviews.Author: cabsavie
Reviews.Content: Just love this place, spend a lot of time staying here and always look forward to it. The rooms are great, the staff extremely helpful and professional and those beds are something else.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location among swish retail and not far from anything”
Reviews.Author: DiboTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a safe luxury option in Sydney. It is at One Martin Place at the cosmopolitan CBD heart of Sydney. During the weekday you are surrounded by the busy and glamorous suits and high heels of corporate Australia. On Saturday there is a buzz around the glamorous high end shops surrounding the hotel. On Sunday, well it really all feels a bit dead as the CBD empties and its hard to even find a coffee until later in the day. Try and get a room looking over the old GPO clock tower. Our room was above the tower and gave a great view over the clock, towers and glimpses of Sydney Harbour and the North Shore in the distance. The lobby of the Westin Sydney shares an atrium with retail and eatery areas. The lobby has always felt to me like a bit of a thoroughfare, but a very grand one at that. Desk staff are Westin professional and of a world class standard. The lifts whisk you up into the tower of beautifully decorated muted colours and blonde wood highlights which are a recognized signature of Westin these days. The rooms are comfortable, but not as big of some of the Westin rooms. I believe there are larger rooms in the lower sections of the Hotel. Large windows reveal the great view, a glass wall into the bathroom lets the great vista in. The bed is heavenly and comfortable as always and the room palette of brown and blonde is very pleasing with a fresh and contemporary feel. The silver fixtures glow and make for a light filled room. The bathroom is spacious and the rain head shower is great. The hotel is in affiliation with the corporate gym next door which fills a couple of floors of an old building. The gym is cramped and the pool is too small to exercise in and located at the wrong end of a rabbit warren of corridors. The exercise facilities really are a weak point of this hotel. The service really is â€œExpressâ€� and nothing is a problem for the well mannered yet slick staff. I have eaten at the hotel restaurant before and was pleased. The barmen also mix a mean cocktail. For something more indulgent, seek out the GPO Cheese and Wine shop and choose a bottle and wedge of cheese from the hand picked range and nip up to the room for a movie in bed with wine and cheese â€“ luxury ! So the Westin is very Sydney, for business, shopping and a bit of indulgent pleasure. Just forget exercising for a while.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good CBD Position”
Reviews.Author: Burro12
Reviews.Content: With well appointed rooms, that have lovely bathrooms , this hotel is clean and modern and right in the heart of the city. Foyer is a little busy and noisy as people use it as a walk through between Pitt & George Streets. The lower level has some nice rather informal restaurants and bars which is handy. Five star with a five star price.

Reviews.Title: “Great position”
Reviews.Author: crop1959
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night the restaurant was great value for money and the meal was great The rooms were great heaps of room.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but great rooms and location”
Reviews.Author: masaccio
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin certainly is superb and we got there in around 20 minutes from the airport on a Friday evening (cost was $45 with tolls). Our room was very comfortable with great facilities and a superb bathroom in particular. My only grumble is that for our $240 I expected breakfast, but no luck there and a full breakfast for two in the room is a bonkers $60.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: S L
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone - I stayed here on business, but with my family in toe, and experienced faultless service. What I liked: Rooms: The rooms were well appointed, modern and clean. It had an updated feel to it which I liked Executive Lounge: Service at the lounge was second to none. The staff there recognised our favourite drinks, and always served with a smile - even 5 minutes before closing time. It is always good to be greeted as if you are an old friend, and they certainly treated you like one! Concierge: The concierge was very helpful and made good restaurant and food recommendations. Overall, friendly and engaging service. Loved it and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and immaculately clean”
Reviews.Author: SBCope
Reviews.Content: We based our choice for our vaction on Tripadvisor's ratings and we were more than pleased. From check-in to check-out, it was seam-less. Being an SPG member, got us a room on the 24th floor, with breath-taking views. The bathroom was really well designed and incredibly clean. We had flight cancellations during our stay and we used the business center with free Wi-fi, fax, copying machines and printers, which was such a help. The location is a bonus, with easy access to the local shops, restaurants and sights. It was 15min walk to Circular Quay. We also enjoyed the brunches at "Vivo", located near the rear exit.

Reviews.Title: “One to miss...”
Reviews.Author: M J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating our 21st wedding anniversary and thought a night in a suite at a five star hotel was in order. I booked directly with the Westin over phone and explained in detail what it was that we were looking for. We were shocked when we entered our suite, as it was in fact just a room, a nice one, but so not what I had booked and pre paid for. After around 45 minutes of debate we left in total disgust. Despite the fact we paid the going rate for the suite, the hotel staff insisted we'd booked and paid for a room and if we wanted to upgrade we were told we could pay another $100. These people showed a total disregard for the mantra 'the customer is always right', their attitude was appalling. I didn't receive a confirmation email and that seemed to be my fault as well. There was no apology, no "there must have been a mix up", nothing, even though they knew it was our anniversary they treated us like an annoyance . Five star, I don't think so. If you want to have that on your letterhead, take the time to train your staff. We have since received a full refund and an apology but that's all just little too late.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless each and every time”
Reviews.Author: LukeandMarie
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney, nestled on Pitt Street and facing Martin Place is one of those establishments xthat has managed to combine 5 star luxury and amenities with boutique service and hospitality. I have stayed at this Westin about adozen times this year and each time the service is seemless, starting from the personalised check in service in one of the 3 or 4 'pod like' concierge desks, which are a fantastic idea that doesn't make one feel they have just arrived at a post office counter or a McDonald's servery. The rooms are ample and well appointed with glass dividers between bedroom and bathroom with blinds that can be either drawn for privacy or left open for added light and space. Room service (to which I have somewhat of an addiction to) is for once of the same quality as a restaurant, and given the prices (not just here but in any hotel) so it should be. the menu is vast and caters for different cuisines, appetites and choices - and it is fast and always courteous. Location for either business or pleasure is unbeatable as the Westin is essentially in thecentre of Sydney next to martin Place with its lovelt cenotaph and a short walk from all attractions or offices. it would be remiss not to mention the italian restaurant called Intermezzo which is located inside the vast lobby of the Hotel and which in my opinion is one of the top 3 or 4 italian restaurants in Sydney (the others being Lucio's in Paddington; Beppi's in east Sydney ; Bambini in Elizabeth street and last but certainly not least, Macchiavelli in Clarence Street) . Overall, a faultless hotel with faultless service and a brillinat restaurant across the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: berny590
Reviews.Content: The Westin actually was built connecting architecturally to the old Sydney Post Office from the early 1900's, with a beautiful glass ceiling atrium. Quite an amazing job of preservation and modern use. My room was interesting as the bathroom had glass separating it from the bedroom area making the room more spacious looking. Everything was in pristine shape and the service excellent. The gym on the old post office side was the largest and most equipped I have even seen in a hotel. Only issue I had was the food pricing in the hotel was double what could be found in outside restaurants making it prohibitive to eat inside. Luckily my price included full breakfast which was delicious each day. Hotels are pricey in Sydney but I was quite pleased here.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: marduk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights - staff attentive, efficient and friendly. Concierge went out of his way to help. Rooms clean, spacious and recently renovated. Bathroom had plenty of space and an excellent shower. Big, properly equipped gym with heated indoor pool and access to fitness classes. My one gripe is the outrageous daily fee for in-room internet access when it is free practically everywhere else in the hotel. Hotel location is CBD which is great for business and an easy 15 minute walk to Circular Quay if you want to hop on a ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless design and execution”
Reviews.Author: benchickens
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for a mixture of work and leisure trip. Great location for both - walking distance to both the financial and shopping districts. Walking in, we were greeted by a grand, glass-covered atrium, the signature Westin 'white tea' scent, and friendly efficeint service. The Tower room we stayed in was spotless, roomy and well designed with a large glass window separating bathroom and bedroom to create the illusion of even more space (an electric blind can be lowered to divide the two spaces for privacy). The beds were of the usual Westin 'Heavenly Bed' standard - plush, comfortable, I haven't had a better sleep in another hotel. Only minor criticism would be that although there is free wi-fi in the lobby, there is no wi-fi in the rooms, only wired internet - considering this is a 5-star hotel, very strange indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly the best city hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Mog25
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this fantastic hotel (bit pricey but we took advantage of a Trailfinders' deal - pay for three nights, get one free). The location was brilliant - midway between the Harbour/Opera House and Darling Harbour. Both of these destinations were an easy walk but the area around the hotel itself contained many cafes (for breakfast) and Victorian arcades. The hotel building is the old post office which has been refurbished to the very highest standards. Our room was superb (ultra modern) and the views from our room in the tower were awesome. Service was prompt and friendly and what small amount of food we ate in the hotel was good. Would stay again like a flash!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the luxury”
Reviews.Author: lnd_beale
Reviews.Content: Having found a Best Rate guarantee that was honoured by Starwood we (my husband and I) found ourselvelves staying in an Executive Suite at the Westin Hotel. THe suite consisted of a entrance with extra toilet and a spacious lounge and in the main room we had a large room with en suite bathroom. We had Club facilities whare we enjoyed breakfast and evening drinks. One complaint could be that the food in the Club was not varied much - I think that there could be improvement there but other than that we enjoyed professional, courteous service everywhere and would thoroughly recommend staying in a suite if the budget can stretch to it or if one finds a good deal on a web site that Starwood Best rate guarantees (with a 10 percent discount)

Reviews.Title: “Tops for comfort and service”
Reviews.Author: kayelle006
Reviews.Content: We included breakfast in our rate, and this was very good value. We had one room service meal which was generous and well presented, but it took some time and a reminder before they collected our tray. In general the service was prompt ,friendly, and just what was needed. Our room was just opposite the post office clock which became our friend and chimed melodiously during the day. We didn't hear it at night after the curtains were drawn. There was an array of restaurants and bars in the basement which we used because the weather was awful, but the restaurants were good and not too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: Bnorv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful - we stay here anytime we need to stay in the CBD. The rooms are spotless and the service is amazing. I am a member so there is an express line for check in and check out is as easy as putting your key in the drop box - What could be easier. Perfect location, close to everything and if you just want to relax, go downstairs into the GPO food hall and you have a variest of luxury foods to choose from. Its like a food court but the foods is deluxe :) Will deffinately return, we wont stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Probably You Best Choice If You Don't Require a Harbour View”
Reviews.Author: Lord_of_Canterbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on business/pleasure. Used Starwood points but I know the rates exceeded USD 300 per night during the time of my stay. Excellent central location. Extremely busy hotel near a lot of shopping (at least Mon - Fri). Very bright and modern - impressive ground floor/lobby area. My standard room was large, modern, and clean. Great bathroom and the bed was comfortable. The gym was decent, but certainly not great as described by others. The buffet breakfast exceeded my high expectations given the cost. Pricing in the lobby bar was super aggressive - home of the USD 12.50 Corona beer. Stayed at the Four Seasons during my two previous trips to Sydney - the Westin is a better choice if you don't need a harbour view. You can walk to the harbour area from the Westin (10 minutes). I will return and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very slick and in a great central position”
Reviews.Author: ozandy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very functional for both the travelling business person or a couple staying in Sydney for a few nights. Very central position on Pitt Street, close to the main shopping area along with being close to the underground rail and monorail, which I used for a great meal down at Darling Harbour. Reception, Concierge etc all very "no fuss" and efficient which kept everything streamlined. Used the lomo service to the airport on the Concierge's suggestion and it was very good and very reasonably priced. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMermaid027
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent for business, food and shopping. The hotel itself is gorgeous as it was once the Sydney Post Office during the late 1900s. Upon taking over and renovating it, The Westin has done a good job in retaining and preserving much of the historical values - with many old photos of when it was a functioning post office, mounted on the walls. I stayed in the Heritage wing, where the room was extremely large though felt quite cosy, and had a nice walk-in wardrobe so that my luggage and shoes were tucked away. The only downside I would say about this hotel is that while there is broadband connection, there's no available WiFi in the rooms. This makes using the iPhone, as a traveler, quite expensive if you don't have a laptop. However, the hotel does offer free 24-hr WiFi in the lobby, so you can go down there to use it. Overall, a lovely hotel where I would stay again. The website : http://www.wotif.com/ offers some good rates. I stayed for 4 nights, and only paid for 3 - which was a huge saving of A$300.

Reviews.Title: “True five star in sydney”
Reviews.Author: vietnambound
Reviews.Content: By chance I had the opportunity to stay twice at the weston in the past month, once in a tower deluxe and then in a heritage superior room. The tower room was smallish but beautifully appointed, but avoid this option if you hate the bath overlooking the bedroom - though thankfully there are opaque glass separate toilet and shower. We were on a high floor and i liked the city buildings view with the GPO clock tower below us. Visitors to sydney might prefer harbor views and if you have the money and can wait for the refurbishment to be done stay at the park hyatt it's the finest hotel in sydney (and Australia for that matter) The second time at the westin I stayed in a heritage room and these are the rooms I'd favor. I'm sure the deluxe rooms are even nicer, but the superior room has a lot of space, high ceilings, well appointed bathrooms good separate walk in wardrobe big comfortable bed. The decor is a little cold but thats my only complaint about this room. (oh and if I could open a window that would be even better. The breakfast is good but horrendously expensive unless you get a deal with the room. Make sure you sign up for starwood preferred and take advantage of the 4pm checkout. I saw complaints about getting to the gym and it is a bit out of the way, but follow the signs enjoy the walk and admire the old photos of the historic GPO on the way. The gym itself is well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Antonio8069
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay @ the Westin as it was the o.nly Starwood property in the centre with 2 double beds. What a pleasant surprise to discover its also one of the best hotels in the city! Some highlights: - the health club and pool on the 6th floor are modern and very well equipped; - the business centre on the 3rd floor is fully equipped c/w complimentary Internet; - the business lounge on the 28th floor is one of the best I have ever visited; - our room on the 31st floor had an incredible washroom incl. a tub with a view! I cannot say enough postive about this property!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jaql33
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great, very comfortable and clean. Hotel is located close to shops but not centrally located for the nightlife if that's what you're after. Nonetheless, you can still easily catch a taxi to any other surrounding locations.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklysuz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Sydney 3 times over the past 6 months, and always stay there now when travelling to Sydney. It has the best location in the city - when shopping in the number one thing on your list. Even when the hotel has been very busy they always treat you very well and take care of all your needs. Car valet, and luggage brought to your room proptly. The rooms are wonderful, nice and clean. The rooms on the heritage side are bigger if you want some more space and they have a better view also. The GPO is below the hotel which has some amazing restaurants and shops. I will come back here time and time again when in Sydney, love this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: tim2007
Reviews.Content: Admittedly my rating is coloured by the fact that we got upgraded to an Executive Suite after booking on the basic fare, but can only pass comment on my experience. Hotel is very elegant and the suite was superb with wonderful size bathroom and walk in robes. We were very impressed. Is beautifully placed too and the up market food court below (don't think this forms part of hotel) allows cheaper dining alternatives to the restaurant. Overall a great experience and I would gladly stay again

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Oktaria
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for exploring the city, the suite was spacious and quite nice, and what I liked most was their white tea aloe product range. It smells fantastic. Except the fact that we waited nearly half an hour for our luggage to be delivered to our room, it seemed that they lacked of staff on those days we were staying there, I'd return to this hotel. It's a bit pricey but everything's expensive in Australia in the moment anyway

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property but Poorly Managed”
Reviews.Author: flick2614
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of a business trip for one night. The property itself is great but the staff was absolutely horrible. We ate at the restaurant as soon as we arrived. When the bill came we presented our SPG card, to which we were informed that a different menu applied to SPG members. A look at the special menu revealed prices increased equal to our discount amount! Before retiring for the evening, we scheduled an airport shuttle for the next morning to catch our 9 am international flight. After the shuttle failed to arrive at the specified time, the concierge called the shuttle company and revealed that we had never actually been scheduled on a shuttle that morning. Within the less than 24 hour period we stayed at this hotel there were numerous other annoying interactions with the staff, too many to list here.

Reviews.Title: “Faultless stay”
Reviews.Author: pigletthepug
Reviews.Content: We are a family of father, mother, and 2 young boys. Stayed at the Westin for 2nights. Booked through hotels.com for $430 total for 2 nights. We stayed in Tower Deluxe Twin room (2 double beds) #1005. Checked in early, and the room was available. The room was huge!!!! I was genuinely surprised since we were in the middle of Sydney. Not a great view, but we didn't care since the room was very comfortable. It was a simple room, but everything was spot on clean and faultless. Called for extra pillows and ice cubes....delivered within 10 minutes each time. For a big box hotel, I thought this was pretty commendable. Location wise, it's a short walk to everywhere. But it is in the middle of the city. So, depending on what you are after, this may or may not suit your needs. Have never stayed at a Westin before, but had a very positive experience here that we might in the future. With the price we paid, we thought it was very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant combination of old and new”
Reviews.Author: SB488
Reviews.Content: Although we live in Sydney, we stayed overnight at the Westin because we attended a function in their ballroom that night (Testra NSW Business Awards). We decided it was easier to go upstairs after the function - allowing us to eat and drink as much as we liked - rather than catching the train home. It was also an opportunity to spoil ourselves. The hotel is in a modern building behind the old GPO (Sydney's main post office) which is a sandstone structure dating back over 100 years. In the redevelopment, they retained the facade of the old building and created some interesting spaces around the hotel entrance foyer. When we were checking in, they upgraded us to a very nice room on level 25 overlooking the GPO. On this floor, there was a sign near the lifts saying "Starwood Preferred Guests Floor" and so I guess they upgraded us because we are SPG members. From our room, we could see the GPO clock tower with the Australian flag on top . We also had a good view of the buildings down George Street and Pitt Street leading down to the Harbour. The bathroom area uses glass screens. The screens for the toilet and shower are opaque but the window between the bedroom and bathroom is clear. Our porter told us that this is so you can lie back in the bath and watch the TV in the bedroom. If you need privacy, you simply lower the blind. There was a broadband cable internet connection in the room (for a fee). I didn't need to use it because I didn't bring my laptop with me. They offerred free WiFi in the hotel foyer area but not in the rooms. Nowadays a lot of hotels also have free WiFi in the guest rooms because most people have iPhones (or similar). Breakfast was on level 1 (just above the hotel foyer). The restaurant overlooks a large open space between the new building and the internal walls of the old GPO structure. Although it has the feeling of a large atrium open to the sky, there is a glass roof to keep the weather out. It's a charming location to have breakfast. The buffet breakfast had a very good range of options to choose from. The hotel is as central to Sydney as you could possibly get - right on Martin Place near the Cenotaph. It is within easy walking distance of shops, theatres, department stores, Circular Quay and the Rocks. We drove our car into the city on the Friday afternoon and drove home on the Saturday morning. It was a good feeling to be able to drive up to the front door of the hotel and leave the keys with the porter to park the car in their carpark under the hotel. We enjoyed our night at the Westin. It is everything that you expect a five-star international-standard hotel to be. We were suitably spoilt.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational”
Reviews.Author: AndyChiara
Reviews.Content: My partner and I are slowly working our way through the Sydney 5 star hotel experience: to date, the Westin has blowed the competition out of the water. Our Heritage room (#123) was stunning with gloriously high ceilings (unusual for a Sydney hotel!) and views over Martin Place. In fact, the entire hotel is gorgeous, with a particularly lovely light filled glass atrium leading through the restaurant to the heritage wing. As a Sydney sider, it is difficult for me to comment on how convenient the location would be to a tourist, but it is nicely located close to transport and the Harbour: you're pretty much in the thick of the central business district. My only gripe is that checking in came with a short wait and Sunday morning breakfast felt a little like an office cafeteria, and also came with a wait (almost 10 minutes). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AustralianKiwi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband on our first ever holiday away minus our kids in 17 years. Booked a deluxe room on high floor for 5 nights. Place is pricey, but worth it. Have no complaints whatsoever. Great location, sort of in the middle of the city so within walking distance to darling harbour/circular quay. Got the buffet breakfast each day which was absolutely yummy and great range of foods to choose from. Loved the bathrooms! Order room service a couple of nights. Bit pricey again, but very delicious. If you are a couple looking for somewhere special to stay, I would recommend trying the Westin. Room was great, staff were excellent, daily servicing of rooms were on par too. Would recommend as a nice treat away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: DDFA
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for a combination of work and pleasure (weekend in Sydney) using a fantastic Wotif deal making it very good value. The room - which was their standard room was spacious and the bathroom, excellent - meeting the luxury standrds expected of this class of hotel. Others have already commended the comfort of the beds and we found thesame. The breakfasts were so good - and the staff really delightful and keen to provide good service. Finally, at check out - I must say that the desk clerk was fantastically calming when I discovered I didn't have my wallet/cards etc. and helped immediately to gain access back to our room to check if I had left it there before assisting contacting card companies etc. Thankfully it was still in our room so all was well but his very professional approach asisted in making a small "crisis" disappear! This really is a first class hotel experience - one of the best we've ever had. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good”
Reviews.Author: Travellinghack
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively expensive hotel but its location, high quality rooms and especially its instant service mean its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and great beds”
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle43
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 2 nights in an executive room. The staff in the executive club lounge are a credit to the hotel. Service was attentive without hovering and drinks were always refreshed promptly. Rooms are a good size and beds are exceptionally comfortable hence known as 'heavenly beds'. Location is also great for shopping - not far to lug all those shopping bags!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for exploring Sydney”
Reviews.Author: BrassyVet
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an executive suite for five nights. Pros: The location is great; close to Circular Quay (10 min walk) and Darling Harbour (10 min walk), with the new Westfield Sydney and almost any store you could want less than 5 min from the front door. The hotel is also situated on top of quite a few different restaurants (sushi, spanish, steak, greek, etc), the two of which we tried were very good. The suite was very spacious with a bedroom, lounge, bathroom and walk in robe. The bed was extremely comfortable and the bath incredibly deep. The service provided by every single member of staff we met was fantastic. From check in, to an emergency laundry requirement, to getting a beer in the bar at midnight (the two incidents unrelated), nothing was a problem. The service request phone, where you just push one button regardless of your needs, is a great idea. The executive club had a great view of the city and provided good service both at breakfast and later when we returned for complementary canapes and drinks each night. My wife used the Endota day spa one day and felt it was the best spa she's ever had. Cons: The pool is almost impossible to find without taking a GPS. It is situated within the health club next to the hotel who, we felt, were not happy with the concept of hotel guests using their equipment. The coffee in the executive club is machine made, not barista made and, consequently, doesn't give you that wake up zing in the mornings. Overall, we felt the Westin really delivered what we were looking for: a great hotel that we could use as a base for exploring Sydney. It's not cheap, but nothing in Sydney is at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all up, room spacious, 5 star”
Reviews.Author: theresaherd
Reviews.Content: Only negative is that the parking was very dear and they tried to up sell us saying we could get a room sooner. Actually our room was ready and fanastic. Such a good location and a great city. Loved staying here and would do it again in a heart beat

Reviews.Title: “First Class hotel with First Class service”
Reviews.Author: Chezza_King
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last Friday night after a special night out for my birthday. I was a little worried after reading some negative reviews, but we were very impressed. From the moment we arrived, we were treated like valued guests. On checking in, we were offered a late checkout without even asking for it. The staff were efforlessly polite and friendly. Every staff member took the time to chat to us, and enquire if we were enjoying our stay. Although we had booked the cheapest room through Wotif, it far exceeded our expectations. It was large, clean and bright.The bathroom was wonderful, and the bed was soooooo comfortable, I didn't want to get up the next morning. Can't think of a single negative comment to make. First class hotel with first class service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelersofOZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate a birthday. From the moment you arrive you are treated with excellent service. Rooms are great with special views over the city. Bar area relaxing and enjoyable. Breakfast is amazing with many temptations and delights. We enjoyed our visit, the people, first class service and great location make it a special hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATION!”
Reviews.Author: Zetster
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The hotel is central to everything, and the bus station is just across the street - you can take a bus to Bondi Beach. It's also walking distance to Circular Quay. The staff were helpful and recommended a good Japanese restaurant near the Rocks. The room were spacious, and love the heavenly bed. Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Inner City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PNPathman
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in this lovely modern hotel for almost a week. It is well appointed and the staff and service were great. The only small negative was the old GPO clock that chimes every 15 minutes until 9.00pm, which makes it hard to sleep if you are hitting the pit early. The attached private gym was great and free to guests. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wake up at the Westin...............To a thumping earthquake at 7.45 am on a sunday morning.”
Reviews.Author: casstef
Reviews.Content: Our room directly under the running machines of the gym, harried staff and overpriced average food ruined an otherwise lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunfun18
Reviews.Content: We are preferred starwood guests. We had booked two rooms months in advance and had asked for adjoining or rooms close by, yet they were only able to give us rooms on the same floor, but not close by. The rooms were very nice, the only drawback being that the wall between the bathroom and bedroom is a large window. If someone turns on the light to go to the bathroom during the night, the other person can be disturbed. There is a curtain, but it is not sufficient. The rooms were otherwise very clean, well appointed and quiet. No outside noise or hallway noise. The breakfast, which was included in our rate, was phenomenal. It was served beginning a very early time, even on Sunday, which was very helpful. They had every type of fruit I could think of and more. The only real negative was that because it was a holiday weekend, the fitness center hours were very limited. I am used to the Westin gyms being available to hotel guests on a 24/7 basis with the room key. This gym must belong to a third party and the Westin guests only have rights to use it. There is a sign in the room to bring your own towels to the gym so they don't charge you for a towel. This was very disappointing to us because we left the hotel before the opening of the gym and returned after the closing. I don't remember exactly, but it seemed like it was only open between 9 am and 5 pm or possibly even fewer hours. Very limited for a hotel even on a holiday weekend. The front desk is a bit formal, but provided us assistance with directions and other recommendations. The lobby is very nice. The location of the hotel is very good. A short walk to the Harbor Bridge, Circular Quay and also to Darling Harbor. It is located within a few blocks of the Sydney Observatory. It is a very practical hotel. However, we had only views of the backs of adjoining buildings and the hotel is very contemporary, so not a lot of character. If returning, I might opt to stay closer to Circular Quay and try to get a room with a water view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: TheWinger
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a few nights on points and really enjoyed my time here. We arrived at the hotel at about 830 am and was granted an early checkin, the room we had on the SPG floor faced the clock tower and was very large, clean and bright, the bathroom was especially large. Every staff member we met was very friendly and helpfull. Location was excellent for exploring the city, and a quick walk to Circular Quay. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: ChipsUk
Reviews.Content: Have stayed many times in the Four Seasons for business, but was visiting Sydney with my wife and thought we would try the Westin based on Trip Advisor reviews. Rooms are absolutely fine, and bigger than at the FS, but staff at the Westin just don't get it in terms of customer service. Very unlikely to return therefore based on this experience.

Reviews.Title: “starting to lose sparkle”
Reviews.Author: further40
Reviews.Content: This has always been the best business hotel in Sydney - great location and the best rooms, although it is not really a weekend or night life location but it is in walking distance to everything. I hadn't stayed there for a while and noticed that the decor - carpet, tiling etc could do with a very thorough clean or be replaced. The fit out, which is at least 5 years old has stood the test of time and still looks modern and stylish and is sound proof, very spacious and comfortable with all modern equipment. It is, however, a bit worn. Unfortunately the bed was uncomortable and should be replaced. I do not recall the beds being uncomfortable there in the past, so I assume that they have just reached the end of their life span. The service is very good. As others have said, there are no views to mention but the adaptation from the old GPO is impressive. Still my favourite Sydney hotel - if they would just fix the beds!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Australia, was very happy I chose this as my hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marketmiami1
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel about 9am after a grueling 23 hours of flying from Miami. At check in my room was not yet available, so I took advantage of the free wifi in the lobby and made a little walk around the neighborhood. At 11am when I returned the front desk notified me that a room is now available and I can check in. I had an executive club room with wonderful views of the clock tower in the neighboring plaza. Everything in the room was perfect from the shower (Heavenly) to the linens. After a day out seeing the sights I returned to my room to find some chocolate covered strawberries and chilled Champagne. The executive club was a great plus and the evening hor's d'ouvres were great along with the complimentary cocktails. When I return to Sydney I will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional room and location”
Reviews.Author: CaraDave
Reviews.Content: When we booked our $208 room, I expected something reasonably modern, in a good location and a smallish room and small bathroom. I was stunned with the massive, sound proof, ultra modern room right on Pitt street mall. Unbelievable value. Negatives were v expensive room service with food which was clearly not fresh or value for money. That said, the servings were generous, and food and service was excellent and arrived in a timely manner. Our car also took around 20 min to get out if valet parking, however, car was well cared for: I had left money and credit card in the vehicle both which were still there and visible when I picked it up. There was occasionally a funny running water sound ( usually in the morning) which was off-putting. But I am really nit picking here. A sophisticated crowd, seamless service, ultra modern room and service make the westin the best luxury value in Sydney city.

Reviews.Title: “Not convenient for Circular Quay sites, but more than makes up for it!”
Reviews.Author: traveller2007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin as I am a Starwood Preferred Guest and find it a consistently reliable brand. I was not disappointed.I had previosly stayed elsewhere and had been disappointed at the quality of service for the price (Sydney is pricey for us Brits at the moment!). The Westin was worth the money though. Everything from check in to check out was smooth. I didnt like my initial room and changed not once but twice - all of this was taken care of without any complaints or excuses, just very professional and courteous service (I forget the name of the particular receptionist but made a note of her excellent service on a feedback card). This is all the more notable as I was staying over ANZAC Day weekend - the hotel is right on Martin Place and it was busy all the time. The staff were not stressed or overwhelmed by this which was admirable. The rooms are lovely - amazing bathrooms and spacious. I only wish the views were a bit better but I think thats to be expected in the centre of the city. The way the Post Office has been incorporated into the modern building is beautiful. The facilities are also good - 24 hr computer room and coffee in the room. A few minor points which werent great: the swimming pool - really hard to find and such a disappointment when I finally got to it! the musty smell in the older part of the hotel/business centre the restaurant on the mid level only seemed to have a fixed menu. There is a cafe as well but nothing really appealed to me. But there are tons of places just steps away outside and also downstairs - these were just closed as it was the weekend/easter and ANZAC Day. better signs needed for crossing to the old part of the hotel, eg business centre/gym. but these are minor . This may not be as convenient for sites eg The Rocks, Opera House, ferry, but the hotel more than makes up for it, esp if you get any online or SPG deals.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JamNewZealand
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 5 nights. We were impressed with the service and the rooms. We stayed in a tower deluxe room which was very spacious with a really comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was a good size with a separate toilet and shower. We had breakfast included and there was a huge selection of items on the buffet. The location was great-right in the heart of the CBD. The concierge was great with recommending good places for dinner. In fact we went to Est.(which is above the Establishment bar in George Street). A lovely restaurant with great food and service. I booked a massage and a pedicure though the spa and they were both excellent. Lots of shopping right at the door, and within walking distance to the Rocks and Circular Quay. Below the hotel are some bars and a selection of eating places-for example a sushi train and a pizza place.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay @ Westin & MUCH, MUCH Better!”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: Still on holiday to celebrate my 30th, I made my way to Sydney....this has been my 5th time in the city, & second stay at this hotel. My first experience in 2009 was not too good. This time, the Westin really came around and stepped up to the plate. I'm a Starwood Gold Preferred Member, and it always means a lot to me when my loyalty is valued and recognized -- which they did. Since I arrived early, my room was not ready and I had expressed how tired I was and would just prefer a room ASAP to sleep. I was assigned a room at the end of the hallway on the 8th floor (not a Starwood Preferred floor), which was the best they could do at that point. However, it was next to the elevator motor room, which was quite noisy. I requested a change in rooms the next day, and was placed on in room 2215. This was definitely an upgrade -- spacious, a Preferred floor, etc...I was MUCH happier. The staff was friendly, responsive and efficient. Also, I am very thankful to housekeeping for making an exception by providing my room with a full service rather than turn-down at 8PM; it was very considerate of them. Prior to arrival, I had requested a nice bouquet of flowers (protea), which was delivered in beautiful fashion. Also, I had scheduled the 2-hr men's indulgence spa package, and there was a little confusion there. No one had informed me that it would take place in my room. The massage therapist was late; and, although very nice (and talkative), I prefer to relax in quiet when I have a massage. I asked how long this person had been licensed and was told 2 years. I think, for the Westin, a massage therapist with more experience (and based on a price of $310AUD), is necessary. I also found it uncomfortable when she had requested I fill out her review in front of her. Because of that, I was not honest when I filled out that form. So, I hope management will look into that. Since I was having such a great time with my special someone (btw, the bathtubs are GREAT for a romantic interlude with your partner), I extended my stay and reserved a tower deluxe room. The hotel upgraded me & I remained in the same room, but was offered a comparable room with a different view. I decided to stay put, so I didn't have to pack, etc. For this trip, I intentionally chose the Westin, as it's centrally located. I've also stayed at the Four Seasons & Intercontinental, but those are nestled in Circular Quay, and I wanted to be close to -- rather, IN -- the CBD. At the Westin you have quick and easy access to all the best shops, museums, the gardens, etc. There are a number of great restaurants in the basement level (I'm most partial to "Prime"...if you like steak, but they have many other types of food, too) The decor in the lobby is chic, yet comfy and brilliantly complimented with brightly-colored flower arrangements. The rooms are, on the whole, spacious, also comfy and understated. I love the partitioned bathrooms with the opaque, aqua-colored glass doors to the bathroom, shower stall and bathroom closet. Many hotels have lotions and shampoos that smell very feminine, but the White Tea Aloe, in my opinion, is appealing to both men and women.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Westin”
Reviews.Author: CityVistors
Reviews.Content: I found a discounted deal on Westin web site which required rate to be paid on application. This rate enabled our stay in a luxury room at an affordable price. Rooms were very clean with luxury fittings and so well equipped. Showers were magnificent, bedding and pillows super comfortable. Staff extremely attentive and very personalized. Location was fantastic -within walking distance of train stations, Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and The Rocks. Would definitely recommend Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive Parking charges and dont ask why!!”
Reviews.Author: StevenG45
Reviews.Content: If you want a pleasureable stay at this hotel dont take your car or more importantly dont mention parking charges to any of the staff.
