I was gobsmaked at the parking charges and simply asked the front desk why the parking charges were so high......it must be a sore point as the young girl tried to blame every other company except the westin ( Macquarie Bank copped most of the blame ) and when i mention i was not staying at the Macquarie Hotel she asked me would i like to cancel my booking!!!! It just got worse from then on..... Anyway i have sratched off The Westin from my list of Sydney Hotels.....Oh and dont ask for a slightly late check out, another blame game will begin... steve@qpt.com.au

Reviews.Title: “Great room with great service!”
Reviews.Author: jen131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 2 nights and loved it. The room was a nice size for the 3 of us and had a nice view. It was clean and quiet. The one downside was the glass bathroom, which if someone got up very early to shower etc, it would light up the entire room. There was a blind that pulled down on the glass wall, but didn't black it out. The service was excellent and they allowed us to do a late check out with no fees. Very nice, considering our flight wasn't until 9pm. The rain shower was superb! Very relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “what you would expect from a westin”
Reviews.Author: tripfi
Reviews.Content: stayed on starwood preferred guest points so felt even better as a freebie. great location just off martin place (entrance on Pitt St). Good room service, spectacular bathroom, great breakfast, heavenly bed - what you would expect from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “How could they do it?”
Reviews.Author: jhnelsen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Sydney at least 20 times. I have SPG Platinum status and have generally enjoyed the Westin in Sydney over the last 4 years. As a result of my last stay, they have lost me forever as a customer. Here's what happened. Several days before my planned check-out, I spoke with the front desk about extending my stay for another 4 days. At that time, I was told that I could do so for the same rate all but one day on which the hotel was booked full. I was fine with that, since I was actually planning to be somewhere else that night and was only keeping the room, so I didn't have to pack and check out. Well, on the day I was originally supposed to check out, the housekeeping staff told me she was surprised that I had extended my stay, since their records showed me leaving. I called the front desk right away. After some time, they called back and confirmed I could stay the current night and that they would look into the other nights (thought this was just a formality). Finally, they called me back to tell me that I could indeed stay those nights, but that the room rate went up by $500/night. They also seemed to doubt my story about reserving the a few days earlier, stating "we have no record that it occurred." This is outrageous! I am of course not accepting such a move and wonâ€™t stay there again. And I have Platinum status with Westin, so imagine what happens to you if you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Heritage rooms are nice but the hallways have a smell problem”
Reviews.Author: gcsyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the Heritage rooms overlooking Martin Place, nice large rooms with double height ceilings, separate robe and large bathroom with rain shower. The only problem we had was an incredible stench in the hallway that made you nearly passout as you tried to unlock the door everytime. Once in the room it was OK though. The hotel appeared aware of the problem with a deodoriser spotted in the hallway as we were checking out. No-one should have been put in these rooms with the hallway in this condition as it ruined the hotel experience on arrival and depature from the room everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, historic charm, close to EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: nooneelsehasthisname
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 4 nights over the Easter break. This hotel is faultless. We had a view of the historic clock tower and enjoyed reading the history of the hotel and listening to the clock chiming - thougtfully the chiming is "turned off" after about 9.00pm. The room was spacious and fautlessly clean, king size bed, coffee bags and earl greay tea provided. We arose at 4.00am to attend the poignant ANZAC day Dawn Ceremony which was conducted at the Cenetaph right outside the hotel. We stood on the internal hotel stair case for the best and driest view in town. We were able to walk to a show at the Opera House and for a ferry to Manly from Circular Quay, walked to the Harbour bridge and walked across - the flat way, no need to walk over the top. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back.”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin 3 more times since my inital review last year and I have to say that they are consistently excellent. This is not a cheap hotel by any stretch of the imagination, but I still keep coming back. I have read several reviews about rude/snobbish staff, but to be honest I have never encountered this despite always showing up after an overnight flight looking rather bedraggled in a t shirt and jeans. Yes this hotel is indeed filled with smarty dressed business types, however this is not a tourist class hotel so I don't see a issue. Some people think that the lobby is a little cold and sterile, but I have to say that is why I like it. I like the clean lines and the big cavernous uncluttered space. The rooms are quiet, very large and the bathroom are beautiful. It is a quiet hotel all round and this is important to me. I still think that wifi should come standard in all 5 star hotel rooms for free, but this is a rare thing, and unfortunately Westin charges $24.50/day (that's why the 4/5 for value). Room service is prompt and tasty (although I have to say one of the most expensive I have come across). The lads that deliver the meals are also very friendly. I ate at Mosaic for most of my breakfasts and one dinner. Food is pretty good, only complaint is that the service could be snappier (that's why the 4/5 rating for service). Ate once at the lobby bar, also pretty good food there. There are lots of restaurants at the GPO (yes they are pricey) and the surrounding areas. But there are also a lot of cheap eats within walking distance. This is still my favourite hotel in Sydney so far and I'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “One of Sydney Best”
Reviews.Author: Manukau1960
Reviews.Content: Having been a regular visitor to Sydney for over 30yrs on Business and leisure. I have stayed at all the 4 & 5 Star Hotels on offer. Some on several occasion, offend when brand new and some after having been through re-furbishment and Upgrades. This was my first time staying at the Westin 1 Martin Place Sydney And can say that I was impressed and please with the standard of the hotel. Firstly the Staff where a delight to deal with. The lobby area has a great atmosphere. As there are only a limited number of rooms on each from it Give the feel of a much smaller and intimate Hotel. The rooms themselves Are spacious with great design with some nice features and touches. The beds and pillows are supreme. This hotel provides great value in Price and location. Top marks to the Westin. Well done. Evan

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rc33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located conveniently in Martin Place and close to shops (only a block away from Pitt Street Mall) and other amenites like good restaurants and bars. Check-in was a great. I arrived earlier than standard check-in and asked if my room was ready. The front desk staff duly noted my request for a higher floor and advised room would be ready at 1:30pm. I asked if there was another room available and she advised yes but on a lower floor which I was happy with. This is good service in advising the customer of their choices rather than making them wait when there is a room available. I stayed in a deluxe tower room. It was of above average size and the bed was extremely comfortable. There was a large LCD tv and bathroom was of generous proportions with the heavenly shower and large soaking tub. I liked the separate toilet stall as well. I tried the room service and was very happy with it. Delivered promptly, it tasted very nice. Overall, very happy with this hotel and would not hesitate to recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic spot in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SF_Traveler72
Reviews.Content: My family and I just completed a 5-day stay at the Westin, and can't say enough good things about the hotel. The staff were friendly & helpful, the rooms were comfortable & beautifully appointed, and the location is excellent. When we arrived, the staff were gracious in allowing us to check in early at 11am, which was terrific as we had taken a red-eye from California & our kids were exhausted. The connecting rooms were very spacious, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The concierges were very helpful in providing advice/assistance on places to visit in the city, and with restaurant recommendations for the kids (ages 10 & 7). The hotel is a short walk away from the Opera House, the Darling Harbour Aquarium and from Circular Quay, so the location was a big plus as well. The only shortcoming to our stay was that everything (food, cabs, ferries) was relatively expensive, but this was not restricted to the hotel & I think was more a function of the weakness of the American dollar. All in all, we had a great stay in Sydney & the Westin was a terrific first stop for us on a 2-week Australia trip. Our kids are already looking forward to returning to Sydney on our way out of the country in 10 days. I would highly recommend this hotel for families with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: Beachgrvr
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Westin Sydney just prior to flying back to Canada. From the moment we checked in, to the time we checked out, we received very personable and attentive service from everyone we came in contact with - in particular, the front desk staff and our waiter in the lounge who was kind enough to provide us with a lot of sightseeing tips and recommendations. When we checked in, I mentioned that it was my husband's birthday and we were looking for restaurant recommendations in the vicinity, and later that evening, a personal note with birthday wishes from the general manager arrived under our door. We were not VIPs, and were not even on the club floor. Our room was a standard room, although it was very spacious, with a fantastic oversized bath/shower room and separate toilet room. The hotel is in an excellent location, central to walking to the Rocks, the ferry terminal, the Royal Botanic Gardens and, of course, fantastic shopping. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to stay there again one day.

Reviews.Title: “3 weeks and didn't get tired of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay here and it remains a very polished hotel. Staff are fantastic- especially on the executive floors. Definately worth upgrading to these rooms if they give you a good rate ($50 per day is what I paid over the standard room cost of $260/ night. I only wish that the hotel would include internet connection for free. For rooms facing Martin Place, the night time noise from the Ivy nightclub can be annoying if you are a light sleeper so request a room facing the other way, or even facing inwards on the lower floors. The gym is a bit strange- it is shared with a regular gym

Reviews.Title: “We'd have got more service out of a doorknob.”
Reviews.Author: JemLouOrg
Reviews.Content: How do I sum up the worst hotel experience of my life? Easy. These words - astronomically appalling. I have never been treated with such contempt. It started the moment we walked in. The Westin Hotel in Sydney is pretty enough, but for the price we paid it should have been extravagant. Unfortunately for us, we weren't dressed as other patrons of the hotel, say in a suit and tie and were immediately frowned upon. Check in was a disaster. At 9am when we arrived to drop off our bags, we were told the room wasn't paid for and that they'd have to check with the person who's name was under the booking (unforunately he could not make it due to medical reasons) that we were supposed to be checking in. This is protocol and we were fine with this. They told us to ring back at 11:30. We rang and nothing had been sorted. We came back at 1:30 to check into our room again and it was not ready, nor could we again check in because of the missing person. We had to go through the entire 15-30 minute process of the morning's saga again. We were told that everything would be fine and we could pay the account on check out. The room was not ready until 2:15pm, that is, that we could enter it because it was finally clean. They did not offer us a porter to our room, we asked. They also didn't tell us where the gym, pool and any dining facilities were including where we would be eating breakfast in the morning. They were only concerned about money and not us as guests. The hotel bathroom is beautiful and everything is clean and neat, however, the beds require more pillows (three pillows for two people?! Why?). We ordered room service that night - they forgot part of the order and it was cold. Breakfast the next morning was delicious, but we were ignored by staff the entire time. My friend watched on as he sat patiently waiting for a refill in his coffee, as the staff went to every other table with patrons and gave them refills and never returned to us. It's the little things that count. The cleaning lady was especially good. Wished us a good day, asked if there was anything she could do. The front desk staff could learn from her. The next day we received a phone call at 4pm saying the account had not been fixed. There was no emergency in the woman's voice. We said we'd sort it and no more was asked or told to us. At 1:30 in the morning when we got back from Marti Gras we found our cards weren't working in the lifts, when we asked at reception we were told that we were not allowed into the room until they had a credit card with enough limit on it to suffice the bill. 1:30am. To get your head around this, we then had to call our sick friend (who, by the way, is sick because he is getting chemotherapy treatment for cancer) at this time in the morning to sort out the bill. He didn't pick up. When I asked why they didn't ring him in the afternoon, they stated that they didn't have any contact details. He booked online, he is a star privilege member of the chain of hotels and they'd rung him TWICE the previous day. No details huh? Asked what would happen to us if we didn't have a credit card, the night manager replied that we wouldn't be allowed back into our room where all our possessions and belongings were. Luckily for us (or perhaps unluckily?!), I happened to have a credit card available (the others do not) and was ESCORTED to our room to retrieve the card and escorted back down to the hotel front desk to place on the bill as a back up in case our sick friend did not pay account. By the time we got back to our room and asleep it was 3am and this was after we kept ringing our friend and his wife and doing the HOTELâ€™S job to get the account paid. This could have been handled so differently. The manager could have said, "I'll give you a ring at 7 and you can come down and fix it up then." They thought we weren't supposed to be there and we would run off without paying. That was what our whole experience was about. They honestly thought because we didn't look like their usual clients, that we'd abscond without paying. Way to judge Westin. The next day we missed breakfast because we'd overslept. Check out was uneventful. Our friend had rang up and abused them over the phone. We never received an apology, a thank you for staying or a warm smile. Everyone on that front desk needs to pull the stick out of their bottoms and greet people with warmth, not robotic insolence. We paid to stay at that hotel and we treated with such disrespect we might as well have been fleas on a dog. When we received the bill they charged it to my credit card, not our friendâ€™s and charged us for an upgrade that was free. They couldnâ€™t even get that part right. I haven't written everything that happened, only major (and a few minor) events that all bundled up made for a cataclysmic diaster of a weekend holiday. The only reason they can give for this? Itâ€™s protocol. Get some compassion and empathy. If everyone ran a business with the service they have, we'd be a third world country. It's so hard not to insult on here and I want to say so much. They ruined our weekend and made us feel insignificant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and location”
Reviews.Author: calilregit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney at the front end of a 30 day trip in Australia and Asia. Sydney is a wonderful city and a joy to explore. We would highly recommend a heritage room, which were almost too spacious. The hotel has access to nightlife and an adjacent courtyard where you can sit back and people watch with your morning coffee. It is an excellent base to stay inside inside and enjoy the hotels many lobbys, bars and restaraunts, walk/shop/eat nearby, or access a number of cultural hotspots. The service was excellent. Alas, the one thing it lacked was a good gym and spa but that's because it was under reconstruction. I expect it its up and running now but the pool is very small. I have stayed at better hotels but, frommy perspective, this is one of the better Westin hotels and I do a lot of traveling.

Reviews.Title: “classic elegance and luxury”
Reviews.Author: boopie39
Reviews.Content: Very classy and beautiful, european elegance, great service from the concierge, good food in the bar, just the breakfast service was lacking, otherwise a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Modern Hotel in the Heart of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Ad_Guy_Ed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the last day of a week-long trip in Sydney. Compared with the Four Seasons (where I stayed for six of the seven nights), the Westin was simply amazing. The hotel is located in the center of downtown and on a Friday at 5 p.m., the surrounding area was bustling with life. The Tower Room I stayed in was "normal" sized, with a nice sized bath area. The design is pretty consistent with other Westin's I've stayed at - simple, modern and bright, and looks to be new. The bed was absolutely fantastic - comfortable, soft, and even beats the Four Seasons. The bathroom was well designed, with a separate bath and rain forrest shower (which was great). Standard Westin toiletries were provided. My only complaint was the room service. The meal came in a reasonable time, but the food was quite bland and over-cooked. This may have just been a one-time thing though. Overall, this is my new go-to hotel while visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, service a bit slow, beware "Premier Cabs" at the Taxi Stand”
Reviews.Author: retinadoc52
Reviews.Content: Hotel location was good. Pillows smelt musty but were replace with fresh smelling ones. Service is a bit slow at the lounge, perhaps they are short handed. The "Premier Taxis" at the Taxi Stand are for the most part driven by drivers with a bad attitude who will not take you to an address which is too close or a hassle for them. Use Sliver Taxis, they an be easily hailed from the sidewalk. Two out of Three Premier Taxi drivers refused to drive to close addresses, this is too much of a coincidence.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller014
Reviews.Content: Best place in Sydney to stay, loved it!! Loved the location, the hotel, the service and just the small touches that completed my experience there... The staff were friendly and nothing was too small for them to attend to. Comfy bed, good shower pressure.... great view from my window. I would suggest not leaving the hotel altogether as it could be a lovely rest or a great romantic getaway for couples.... I look forward to returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - a good business choice for Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Snorlaxxl
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd stay that I have had at the Westin. Its location is the big plus for me as it is virtually across the street from my Sydney office. The Westin is a no fuss establishment that is in tune with the requirements of the business traveller. Rooms are comfortable without being stunning. Bathrooms are functional with good quality fittings and layout. I had no problem with accessing the gym during my last visit and was welcomed as a guest. There are many eating choices nearby which is good as I would have to say that the room service menu is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jonedwards80
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin was a good one. The hotel is beautifully designed within the old PO building, in the heart of Sydney. It could not be better located, being only a short walk from Pitt Street, Circular Quay and a train station. The rooms were lovely. Very modern, clean and well set out. The service was fine. They were friendly enough. Nothing more, nothing less. After spending time recently in Asia at some quality hotels, I feel Australians are lacking a little in that little bit of extra customer service. I felt the Asians 'go the extra mile' with their customer service and really make it feel personal and special. For the money spend at this 5 Star Hotel, the staff really should 'go the extra mile'. Us Aussies have a lot to learn about this sort of thing from our Asian neighbours!

Reviews.Title: “Special occasion...”
Reviews.Author: Flubberghusted
Reviews.Content: ... and it was awesome! We got upgraded to a SPG preferred room and it was by no means nothing short of very impressive. Large showers, bath that opens up to the bedroom and tv and beds lived up to its reputation. Received an engagement chocolate treat thanks to Martin, the front office manager and he accommodated our occasion too perfectly. Thanks Marty! Only one negative thing is that the building is next door to Macquarie Bank so entry felt very business like and didnt know a Westin was there, but thats being nitpicky. Bar downstairs at the GPO was handy and the clock tower and stone walls of the old post office it was before, gave it such a nice feel. Some of their US counterparts could learn a thing or too from this property.

Reviews.Title: “everything you need and more”
Reviews.Author: kasparorange
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay but a beautiful building and we were lucky to be upgraded to a heritage room. A huge room with 5 m ceilings and a gorgeous bathroom - the rain shower makes a joke of the Westin's claims to be environmentally friendly - but what the heck, it was great! Lovely staff and breakfast passed the test - there were Coco Pops, our mark of a good buffet breakfast! Excellent location in the heart of the city but a peaceful haven within.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kylie_Renz
Reviews.Content: My partner & i stayed just before New Years. We found a really cheap price on lastminute.com.au, it saved us hundreds of dollars. The room we stayed in was in the heritage part of the building & it was huge! The biggest room & bathroom hotel/resort we have ever stayed in. They had every thing in the room even a bike, yoga mat, weights, gym/yoga dvd's to train to-everything! The bed was out of this world-best night sleep ever.

Reviews.Title: “What Could be Better?”
Reviews.Author: ckv500
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel conveniently located in the CBD within walking distance of all the major sites The lobby opens up to an amazing seven story atrium that exposes the renovated exterior of an early twentieth century building that the hotel also used for its conference center, spa, and exercise facilities Adjacent to the spacious lobby, shops, restaurants and a cafe encircle the atrium. It is a beautiful architectural combination of old and new. Front desk, concierge, and bell staff were very helpful and courteous. Rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well appointed. Free wi-fi in the lobby, and a business center available for longer sessions on the internet. The highlight of our stay was the morning breakfast buffet that included a host of fresh fruit, healthy fruit drinks, meats and cheeses, pastries, and cooked items such as omelets and eggs. A great way to start the day before touring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for one or two night business trip”
Reviews.Author: m2010x
Reviews.Content: This is not a leisure-oriented hotel at all -- misses the balance that Westin properties usually establish (I have stayed in many). Gym was only open 1 of the 5 days I was there, and is actually just access to a private health club in the same building. Was not told of this on booking or check-in. Other than that, zero leisure facilities. Room view was of a dark alley. Had to strain to see if it was cloudy or sunny. As I was on extended stay and am SPG status, asked for a room with at least some light -- was told they could move me but at AUD40 more per day (!!). Needless to say, will not be returning to this property. Totally over-rated except for very short business trip when someone else is paying.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and under done”
Reviews.Author: Pilumitch
Reviews.Content: For $470 a night you would expect to be staying at a hotel with a pool and gymnasium. The Westin Sydney has neither at the moment because they are closed for a refurbish. Had we been told that when we made the booking we would have stayed elsewhere. We also weren't told about the lack of facilities when we checked in. Our "deluxe" room is small and dated. Most hotels we have stayed at in Sydney including the Hyatt, Four Seasons and Shangri La have spectacular views but the Westin has views of city buildings. When you have a massage at the Westin they come to your room. For the price of the room and the massage you would expect them to have a spa where you could have your massage. That's certainly how it works at every decent hotel we have stayed with around the world. Whoever hands out the stars should head back to the Westin Sydney for a visit because for this hotelnto have five stars then it makes a joke of the whole system.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding as expected”
Reviews.Author: GolfGirl427
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are gold members of the Starwood program so we usually stay in one of their hotels. We have always been very happy with Westin and Sydney was no exception. We stayed for 3 nights and were upgraded to a deluxe room as part of our gold membership and the room was gorgeous. The bed was extremely comfortable and a welcome delight from all the B&Bs we experienced during our OZ & Kiwi travels. The hotel was conveniently located within the CBD and circular quay. The hotel provides free wi-fi in their beautiful lobby with plenty of lounge chairs and table service if desired. We used cash and points to pay for the room, otherwise we would not have been able to afford this luxurious accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely met our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Marj H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Sydney to celebrate our wedding anniversary on January 28. We have stayed at other five star hotels in Sydney and also overseas and this was one of the best experiences we have had. We stayed in one of the new Tower King rooms which overlooks the interior of the hotel which is part of the heritage listed and restored old G.P.O. The room was beautifully decorated in a minimalist design with fine bed linens and a selection of pillows. We had a large wide screen TV and comfortable arm chair with footstool. The bathroom consisted of a wonderful deep bath tub, separate shower and separate toilet all encased in tinted green glass and marble. We were provided with plenty of soft towels and quality bath products. We found the staff very helpful and check-out prepaid eliminating the need to queue. Breakfast was included in our package which was amazing value and one of the best we've had in a hotel anywhere. The waitress even made me a pot of Earl Grey leaf tea without additional cost, it arrived almost immediately (in a nice teapot) and with a smile and offer to make another. The hotel is in a great location close to shopping and restaurants. The only negative comment I could make would be the cost of the valet parking which was $56 although the charge covers 24 hours and we left our luggage after check-out and did some shopping. Since our package (booked through the hotel's website) was generous we did not resent the parking cost and understand parking is at a premium in the city. Great hotel, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, superb location, real friendly staff, make you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Marfit_007
Reviews.Content: Finally a city hotel which is high quality and luxury but still down to earth. 5 - 10 minutes walk to all main things, just sitting right in the middle. Spacious, great breakfast, fantastic interior. Even the rooms have that little bit extra, ie you can look through a bg window in your room and out the window. Mixed international customers, the business folk, families, sporty looking people. All very nice and open. But the staff really make it. Always helpful and they even smile. Some stars in all areas, front of house, door, restaurant, even the room cleaners have a friendly word. Truly great, thank you Westin. Lucky I still have some more days.

Reviews.Title: “Good first stay in a Westin”
Reviews.Author: perryw
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in a Tower Superior Twin room in October 2010 for a very short break in the Sydney CBD area, having made a direct internet booking with the hotel. I parked the car nearby and caught a bus to the hotel. Initially, it was hard to find the entrance from Martin Place and then difficult to access the reception and itâ€™s much easier to get to the reception area from Pitt Street. The reception service and attitude were both ok on check-in. I was allowed to check in during the morning, before the official check-in time. The room looked to be of a good quality and reasonably large. It had a wide and spacious design with soft traditional carpeting throughout. There was a separate area for the storage and wardrobe. Unfortunately, the curtains were not of the full block-out variety and still let in some light. The TV was a large LCD and had a good channel selection available. There was also a dvd player provided as well as a Bose clock-radio-iPod player, where I had difficulty operating the iPod function. I called the helpline and a technical staff member quickly assisted with my problem. (It turned out that the volume on both the iPod and the player had to be turned right up in this case.) The couch looked very comfortable and proved to be. There was the master switch on the side of the bed which was successful in turning everything off. The switches in the room were all of the soft-touch variety, meaning that it was pleasant to use them. Despite the bed being a Westin Heavenly, I find that whether beds are heavenly depends quite a lot on personal preference and, in my case, I found the bed a little soft and perhaps not the best when combined with the firm pillows. A soft bed with softer pillows also would not work well in my case. The room looked out over the clock tower and had a good view of the Sydney CBD area. The bathroom was large and had a nice and large rainshower as well, which was pleasing to use as it had strong water pressure. Apart from the rainshower, the other shower head seemed to be quite difficult to adjust between the different types of water streams. The bath itself appeared large and of an ergonomic design, it was certainly quite comfortable to lie in and it took a short time to fill with water, relative to most other hotel baths. However, despite the generally good design and layout of the room, the furniture was not of the highest quality and was looking a bit worn. The wood used was not solid and it was hard to open a few of the cabinets and drawers. There was no hardcopy of the room directory but it was stored on the hotel system, which could be accessed via the TV. I asked the reception why there wasnâ€™t a hardcopy provided and they didnâ€™t seem to respond appropriately because they wanted to know what I needed. Instead, they could also have pointed out that it could be accessed through the TV as well (which I didnâ€™t know at the time). The public areas of the hotel were just as nice as the room itself with the lifts and hallway being quite nicely appointed. My room was set back from the hallway, which helped with reducing noise levels from the corridor and certainly there were no noise problems during the stay. There was quite a large security presence in the lobby during the first day of my stay and Iâ€™m not sure why but it could detract from the enjoyment of that area. I tried the room service once, where I had the shiitake mushroom udon noodle soup. The service attendant was very friendly. The dish tasted very authentic and was probably as good as could be expected in a high-quality Japanese dining establishment. It cost A$40 just for the small bowl so seemed overpriced and the hotel had also included a delivery charge. However, these prices would appear to be standard in the higher-range hotels in Sydney. I was also able to try the gym and swimming pool, both of which are not housed within the hotel itself or owned by the hotel but are part of a separate chain in another building which could be accessed internally through the Westin. It was quite a long walk from the Tower superior rooms, as I had to walk through the hallway housing the Heritage rooms before getting to the gym. The gym seemed to me to not quite be a complete gym with the full set of equipment as far as gyms go but still seemed more extensive in equipment than most hotel gyms. The swimming pool, on the other hand, which was also connected to the gym was quite small even by hotel standards but I think it was heated. The hotelâ€™s location is right in the financial district of Sydney so itâ€™s probably not the best area for rest and relaxation, particularly during the weekdays. However, the hotel is still close to the main tourist spots. It was a good first stay in a Westin and prompted me to try the Westin in Kuala Lumpur later, which was also a good experience which I will review later. Note: A video of the room may be found on my youtube page at: http://www.youtube.com/AllHotelrooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wow-factor room!”
Reviews.Author: LKBrown
Reviews.Content: We returned to Sydney for second visit after spending some time in Melbourne, so we already knew that this location was ideal. You could easily walk to the botanical gardens, circular quay, the opera house and the rocks, and you're close to transport links for other places like darling harbour. You can also get there from the airport by train in around half an hour. It's also great for shops, bars and places to eat (you're definitely spoilt for choice in Sydney in terms of good food and drink). The hotel is great and quite striking inside. The room was really spacious and had a fantastic bathroom with a glass divide to the rest of the room (they seem to go for this in Sydney hotels - the Hilton just down the road had a similar feature). On the lower ground floor is an area with restaurants which all looked great, with a really upbeat atmosphere. We decided to eat in the hotel for convenience before catching an evening flight, and opted for the sushi belt, but the pizzas also looked really good. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Amron18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Westin and found it "fine". It ticked all the boxes for this tyoe of hotel, and was in a good location to explore Sydney sights. We didn't expect personal service but got just what we expected which is what i think it is all about.... wee wouold be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: casamoir
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 7:30 am after a long flight from California. The hotel was very accommodating and gave me an early check-in which was great. The rooms are modern and well designed for the business traveler. The location is amazing and close to great restaurants and the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Not Five Star Service But Good Location”
Reviews.Author: kelownacruiser
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights around Christmas. The location is fantastic and the room was beautiful. We upgraded to a tower room overlooking the clock tower and the bathroom was huge. Unfortunately the service at this hotel leaves a lot to be desired. I use a handkerchief to clean my glasses with lens cleaner. One morning I used it and left it on one of the night tables to dry off. We left on a day of sightseeing and when we returned my handerkerchief was gone. It was a cloth handerkerchief..it is impossible to think it was a tissue. I notified the front desk and talked with the assistant manager who told me he would contact housekeeping and get this taken care of. Well basically he told me that the maids denied ever seeing the handerkerchief and that they didn't know what I was talking about. So no more handerkerchief. That same night I asked for fresh towels to be delivered as I had a shower before dinner and wanted the old ones to be removed and replaced with new ones. We went out to dinner and came back about an hour later. Two bath towels were sitting on the bed and the used wet towels were still sitting in the tub. I don't understand why someone would leave the towels on the bed. You pass the washroom before getting to the bed why wouldn't you drop the towels in the washroom and remove the old ones? Anyway another phone call to Service Express and it was done 30 minutes later. I was also very upset when I had to ask for ice to be delivered as this hotel does not offer ice machines and the employee bringing the ice actually expected to be tipped for bringing ice! Another night I again ordered fresh towels and went to dinner. When we got back from dinner the towels still hadn't arrived (we were gone for more than an hour). I called Service Exp and got the same person I originally ordered the towels from who confirmed that she definitely talked to housekeeping and arranged for the delivery. She told me that she would alert housekeeping and call me back to confirm that the towels were delivered. Well after 45 minutes the towels were still not delivered. I then went to the front desk and talked to the assistant manager again. All he did was apologize and after I tore a strip off him made sure my towels arrived in under 7 minutes. The lobby is huge but very poorly air conditioned. The restaurant is mediocre. Everything at this hotel is ridiculously expensive. Do yourself a favour and stay at the Four Seasons or the Hilton or the Shangri La and experience true 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “2 nights in SYD”
Reviews.Author: brookdj1
Reviews.Content: Spotless hotel. Great location. Can walk to all the major sites. While in Sydney, highly recommend the 'bridge climb'. Stunning views

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: sponky
Reviews.Content: We loved our overnight stay at the Westin. The room was beautiful, the bathroom was enormous and really lovely, and the staff were the friendliest we have encountered in a 5 star hotel. A bottle of champagne was delivered to our room, compliments of management for our anniversary and organised by the girls on the front desk. In relation to other reviews on this website we must agree that room service was ordinary but we found the bar to be clean and again the staff made the experience just perfect. We would go back tomorrow if we could!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to going back again.”
Reviews.Author: skmalliance
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay @ westin. Our room was absolutely fabulous and comfort, especially since we were tired of being rained on. The only annoying thing was that we had book two tower rooms but the other couple, my parents, got a much smaller room and had a terrible view.

Reviews.Title: “let down by awful dinner experience”
Reviews.Author: cathybrisbane
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the standard of our room...amazingly comfortable, luxurious beds, huge bathroom etc..slept very well!! Fantastic location too..central to everything. However for a five star hotel there were a few things lacking. we had drinks down in the lobby bar one night...lots of tables were uncleared for far too long...our table was sticky from the previous people's drinks..there was some rubbish left under it too..the waiter finally came along to take our drinks order and apologised for delay saying there was a run on the cocktail orders...they obviously should have had more staff on..we had had drinks at the Marriott the day before and they certainly put on the five star treatment. The Westin's lobby lacked wow factor too...the few lounge chairs were tired and scuffed and the rug was pretty hideous..neon stripes etc as was the wall covering...yuk- not in keeping with the beautiful bedrooms!! On our last night we decided to treat ourselves to dinner in the Mosaic restaurant - HUGE disappointment. The service was good but the food was awful. We ordered a bowl of olives and to enjoy with our bottle of wine as a starter...well..it took about 5mins after we had our order taken for our 2 main courses to be delivered!!! 5 mins...was it sitting under a hot plate en masse??? i was soo shocked at getting the food so soon - i barely remembered the olives and wine...when i did - the waiter laughed and said ' yes they are coming now' - erm - starters normally come before the mains...what use is a bowl of olives when my main course is sitting there ready to eat???? all could have been forgiven if the main courses had been good..but my gnocchi was revolting..it was served with plain cream over it as the sauce..and some aniseed type flavour was overpowering..with lots of shitake mushrooms...when i read the menu i thought i ordered gnocchi with a cherry tomato sauce??it was a sickening combination and i noticed a fellow diner beside me struggling to eat theirs!! my husbands trio of pork was TINY...he finished his in 3 mouthfuls...and we are not people with huge apetites...but this was ridiculous...so for $150 for 2 mains- a bottle of wine - and an unwanted bowl of olives...very dissapointing! we should have complained..but were too tired to make a scene....i wonder if the chef had done a runner and they had the waiter out back trying his hand in the kitchen!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located & Nice Aesthetic, But Not a 5-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trekkingtheglobe_10
Reviews.Content: As a brand, I generally like the Westin branch of the Starwood Hotels. The Westin, Sydney is lauded as a 5-star hotel. Based on my experience with hotels in general and in Sydney, this particular Westin falls short of that status. If it is a 5-star hotel you're expecting/seeking, I recommend you stay at the Four Seasons, Shangri-La or look into some of the great boutique hotels that are popping up (depending upon the nature of your trip and the amenities for which you are most partial). To put into perspective: I've also stayed at the Four Seasons, Intercontinental and the Sheraton, Darling Harbour. The hotel definitely gets bonus points for its location (George St. is a prime place to be & Martin Place is decorated quite nicely for the holidays). For anyone who has been to NYC, the location of this Westin is almost like being a couple blocks from the studio of NBC's "The Today Show" (Rockefeller Center) re: Sydney's equivalent, "The Sunrise Show" (Ch. 7). Shopaholics, armed with an AmEx Platinum or the like, will be in heaven (QVB & shops around George -- great deals @ Haymarket). The Royal Botanic Gardens, museums, Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Opera House, the Rocks, etc. are all easily within walking distance. That aside, and being a Starwood Gold Preferred Member, what was advertised as an appealing room (to me), was mediocre by Westin standards. My membership status, room preference and potential perks were ignored and were not applied. There were multiple tech problems that had to be fixed. The room was so bland and sterile looking that I actually sent out for a bouquet of brightly-colored flowers! On a better note, my stay, with my boyfriend at the time, was romantic in nature. The tub was adequately-sized for us to relax and comfortably unwind together with some champagne at the end of the day. And, of course, the bed was "heavenly." Aside from the hotel's great location, there isn't anything particularly outstanding about this property. I may or may not return to this hotel, but only if the room's price-point is competitively priced.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing bathroom and bed, one of my favourite hotels.”
Reviews.Author: amiski
Reviews.Content: WOW - I was surprised by how much I loved this place! From the classic hallways to the high ceilings, we found our room extremely clean, comfortable and very spacious. We really liked the layout of our room (only a Heritage room on the first floor). The bed was king size and is truly heavenly, I usually have trouble sleeping but I had the best sleep on that bed! The large bathtub was so much fun, and now I feel disappointed when other hotels don't live up to this standard. Couldn't recommend this place enough, fantastic room. (We didn't really encounter any problems so can't say anything about the service, but staff seemed polite)

Reviews.Title: “Standards slipping?”
Reviews.Author: originalmrfresh
Reviews.Content: I normally like this hotel however on this occasion did not have the best experience. We stayed in the heritage section. When staying 5 Star I expect the room to be spotless which it wasnt, I complained and it was cleaned. Also charged for items on the minibar that we didn't consume. The charge was promptly reversed when I rang the next week to complain but it seems as though standards here may be slipping. Breakfast here like all Westins is one of the best I've had, however it annoys me greatly to be charged $5 for an espresso coffe with breakfast when the room and breakfast charge is far north of $US200. Positive was they let me have a shower after I had checked out in the Fitness Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Amazing Guest Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jolotraveler
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a great location in downtown Sydney, close to shopping, the botanical gardens, museums, and the train station. My guest room as the Westin was stocked with all of the amenities I could possibly need and the bathroom had a great wash tub and shower. I would definitely go back. Fantastic hotel. There is also a nice food court right in the hotel, that has decent priced food with lots of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but lacks 5 star hotel ambience and service”
Reviews.Author: Thomson_aus
Reviews.Content: The positives: -Great location, right next to Martin Place and Pitt Street mall -Great food quality in restaurants, really nice high tea offering, and breakfast offering -Extremely comfortable bed -Great sized bathroom The negatives: -Lacks the ambience of a 5 star hotel. Feels like walking into an office block. No flowers or candles in lobby. Feels very cold like walking into a corporate office building. -Lacks 5 star service. Staff do not open doors or greet you as you enter (they've put in automatic doors). You can walk right through the lobby and not have one staff member greet you. Staff at breakfast do not provide any service besides finding a table for you, do not even thank you as you leave the restaurant -The hotel does not have its own wellness centre/swimming pool/relaxation area. After staying at the Westin Melbourne, I was looking forward to a nice swimming pool, spa, sauna area to relax in. Instead the Sydney Westin offers access to a nearby gym, but it has old facilities and a tiny pool that I wouldn't swim in. In comparison to the Westin in Melbourne, the Westin in Sydney lacks service, and lacks the ambience, and also lacks the nice swimming pool/relaxation areas you'd expect when paying this sort of money. It would be fine for a business stay, but if you're paying for 5 star service and facilities then other hotels are probably a better option in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed, but other shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: maxie88
Reviews.Content: OK this is an expensive hotel, and my expectations were proportionately high as well. Beds are superb, location is excellent for business or holiday, hotel is spotless. Some niggles: No wireless Internet in the rooms. Wired broadband available at a cost, but no good for an iPad. No slippers in the room. An expanse of marble floor in the bathroom made this a chilly experience. UHT milk provided, and zero complimentary nibbles. I paid $2.50 for 2 Anzac biscuits! The key card to the room often failed to register in the lift or the room door at first (or second) attempt. Forecourt staff - when I left at about 7.00am there was no-one there. Previous day I was 'greeted' by a large individual with the grim appearance of a Bouncer who barely managed an 'hello'. These days I think other five star hotels such as the Intercontinental offer a better service.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds and spacious rooms, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney_Zo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon. It was a great choice. We had a large room, large bathroom and great view of the clock tower. The decor is warm and inviting and we were very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful too, we were escorted to our room and the next morning found a complimentary paper under our door with 'Congratulations' written on top from the porter (as I had arrived in my wedding gown). We enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast and even had a refreshing swim in the pool. I would highly recommend the Westin wether you are staying for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - luxury, ease, spacious”
Reviews.Author: AmitabhTeena
Reviews.Content: 1) Location - cannot find a better location in Sydney from accesibility perspective. Only negative is that most rooms have no view 2) Large spacious rooms - modern and well equipped. 3) Bathrooms are a lap of luxury 4) Everything is so close - we did not take any public transport for 2 days - 300 mtrs from Sydney Tower, 500 mtrs from Circular Quay, 500 mtrs from Darling Harbour, 4 buildings away from ASX, Pitt Street mall 5) We did not use the restaurant and try food but well designed spacious coffee shop at lobby level.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLuv
Reviews.Content: I arrived early on check in day and was unable to check in. That is okay, I don't usually expect to get a room at 7am. The lady at the front desk was very helpful and put me on priority to get the next available room as she knew I was a little raggedy from the flight in. In the mean time she offered me a towel and use of the facilities of the gym toilets to freshen up. To kill time I had breakfast in the Mosaic restaurant. A little pricey for eggs ben. Because that's all you get... Eggs ben. No grilled tomato, no pan-fried spinach which is the usual accompaniment at other restaurants. Anyway I checked back sometime mid morning and my room was ready. The rooms are gorgeous, very spacious and clean. My room had no view, but I prefer it that way because it usually means that it is quieter. Of course the Heavenly beds which are at all Westins are indeed heavenly. Room service was prompt, under 30 minutes. Housekeeping was also prompt. Had dessert in the lobby bar one night and that was excellent. Location is great, less than 5 minutes to Pitt St. Also very convenient if you are going to see a show on King Street. Also not far from the Rocks. This might turn out to be my favourite Westin yet. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and service. Great great location.”
Reviews.Author: dkkam
Reviews.Content: It was for our Wedding anniversary. There were complimentary bottle of champagne and a nicely decorated plate of pastry waiting in our room when we checked in. Room is spacious, clean and contemporary. Fitness center and swimming pool were nice. Luxurious and best in its price range. No doubt for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Convenience combined”
Reviews.Author: jaejaez
Reviews.Content: You are spoiled for choices when it comes to luxury hotels in Sydney. This is a good thing for customers because when businesses compete, the products improve. The Westin Sydney (hereafter WS) is a prime example of a hotel that does not stop trying in order to retain its position as one of the finest business hotels in Sydney. Though it was not a perfect one, my last stay here was one where I could witness these efforts in all corners of the hotel. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family. One thing to note for those who have not visited Sydney is that the WS is located at the heart of Martin Place. This is the center of the CBD where you can reach Circular Quay (Opera House, The Rocks, Harbor Bridge) or the Darling Harbor (Aquarium, IMAX, King Street Wharf) by foot. In terms of location, I would rate the WS above the likes of Shangri-La or Four Seasons (which are located closer to the Rocks) or even the Sheraton on the Park or Hilton (closer to Darling Harbor and Town Hall) as it is strategically located in between. Furthermore, being in the middle of Martin Place means you get to stay on a street with impressive history â€“ the very building that the hotel is housed in is over 100 years old. It is no doubt one of the most prestigious addresses in Sydney â€“ if this is any indication, the hotel is side by side with the Macquarie Bank Global HQ. Service is exceptional in most cases but is surprisingly flawed in others. The staffs are generally trained well and it shows through the way they interact with guests. Most notable are those at the check-in desks â€“ those who represent the image of the hotel as they are first ones to meet guests. They are cheerful and helpful and do not mind doing â€˜extraordinaryâ€™ things if it makes its guests have a more comfortable experience. The service issues I had was with room-service. I had realized in the morning that there were no dental kits in the bathroom so I had asked for one to be brought up. This took the hotel forty minutes to deliver. If I was on business and had to run for an appointment, this would have been fatal. When it finally arrived, I told the deliveryman that it had taken much longer than I thought was acceptable, and that this should be taken as a complaint to the hotelâ€™s management. To this the gentleman who brought the dental kit shrugged his shoulders and said â€˜Sure, no problem. Whateverâ€™â€¦ and walked off. I was simply stunned that I stood there for a while thinking â€œwhat just happened???â€™ The other minor issue I had with WSâ€™s service was every time I called the service line. The hotel seemed to have incorporated a process to have the agent hang up on you once they think you are done talking. There were a couple occasions when I was not done when the agent still said â€˜Goodbyeâ€™ and hung up on me. I thought it was a given that these agents usually say something along the lines of â€˜is there anything else I can help you with?â€™ before bidding farewell. Still, when these matters were shared with the management, they listened and took action immediately to assure me that these issues will not repeat going forward. I may not have been 100% happy, but having been given the assurance at a personal level by the management let me know that this is a hotel that does listen and care, and that my voice is one of value to the management. I would not expect these service issues to repeat itself for anyone else now. The hotel is a beautiful one as the design evidently tries to maximize the artistic blend of the hotel building with the modern comfort of the Westin brand. Mosaic restaurant is a fun place to dine as you get to dine in between the new tower and the old heritage building of the Westin. Service is superb. The lounge was a bit smaller than the ones I am used to but still provided comfort and a service level that was on par with some of the best hotels I have stayed in. There are hot offerings for breakfast at the lounge so make sure you stop by in the morning if you are at a club level. In all, this is a beautiful hotel, centrally located with great service (minus the small incidents) and a fantastic product that one would expect from a Westin. Add to this the willingness of the management to engage guests where there are issues, this is a hotel that I would not hesitate staying in again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: StefK1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Westin, room was large and the bed was comfortable. The breakfast each morning was excellent! The hotel location is very convenient, we were able to walk to the bridge, opera house, gardens... and/or public transport easily. There is free Wi-Fi in the lobby but not in the rooms. Overall we had a great stay at the Westin and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, great location, excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: peachtarte
Reviews.Content: Was able to stay here for 5 nights with a great SPG rate! Property: The property is gorgeous. The old post office building houses the Westin, along with a host of other modern eateries and bars that look to be frequented by business people in the surrounding area. Checked out the GPO Wine Bar which had a great selection of Australian wines and cheeses. Room: Stayed in a Heritage Room, which I would highly recommend as its decor is antique, yet you still get the modern luxuries (rain shower, heavenly bed). The room was quite large as it had a sitting area and walk-in closet. Never heard a peep from any neighbors. Also found everything to be very clean. Housekeeping did an excellent job; they even called maintenance to fix some hinge in the bathroom we had not even noticed. Location: Comfortable walk to all the main tourist attractions. Only time we took any sort of transport was to take the train to Bondi and the ferry to Manly. Train and ferry stations are very close. Taxis are also readily available as they queue at the entrance of the hotel. Service: Everyone we spoke to was very pleasant and helpful. Front desk was very nice and allowed us to check into our room early at 11am. Also called for an extra hour at checkout w/ no problem. Concierge was always extremely helpful and had no trouble arranging reservations for us (they were even able to get us a nice outdoor table with a view at Cafe Sydney on short notice!). Upon my return home, actually had an extra $20 charge from the Westin. Emailed them to verify and got a near immediate response that it was for something from the minibar. When I clarified that this was mistaken, their response was that the charge would be removed immediately. I know that with the price of this hotel, such service is generally expected, but I still very much appreciated that it didn't disappoint :) Would recommend this hotel 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable/terrible customer service. The Customer is always wrong”
Reviews.Author: BangkokRyan
Reviews.Content: First off I spend about 300 nights a year in high end hotels.. This experience has left a bad taste in my mouth for Australia and Starwood. Early on a Sunday morning, I realized that a reservation at another hotel I had was not in order. So I contacted the Westin, and asked if they had rooms. I was told yes. I asked if I make a reservation if I can check in super early. I was told yes. Upon arrival the manager also confirmed this. Then when I was about to get my keys he said that the other hotel situation had me at fault. And he would not let me check in early with out paying for another night. Mind you at this time several drunk men in suits arrived at the hotel, one fell to the floor whilst his friends poured champagne on him. Hotel staff did nothing about this nor cleaned up the mess. I finally go to my room which I am paying for several hours to stay in, as my girlfriend had to be at work in several hours. We arrived to a freezer. The room was set at 15 degrees. It took about an hour to warm up as everything was cold. The hot shower didn't help. She woke up for work miserable. I called the duty manager whom didn't care about anything and told me the hotel would do nothing. I wasted money on a miserable experience at a nice hotel with no regard to it's customers or valuble guest (Starwood Platinum with 79 stays this year) DO NOT give this hotel your business! there are plenty other hotels in Sydney to spend your money at.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Eastsrufc1
Reviews.Content: The westin is a great hotel to stay out in sydney, yes it's a bit pricey but well!!!! worth it. The staff were always friendly and helpful, and the room that we stay in was great. it's has the most wonderful soft beds to sleep on and personally the couldn't put at foot wrong at this hotel. So if you want somewhere lovely to stay for a romantic night, or a good night's sleep. STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Always incredible”
Reviews.Author: beryan
Reviews.Content: The service is always great here - the staff are lovely and kind. The room was spotless and comfortable. The bathrooms are big, with a massive tub and comfy fluffy bathrobes. I've stayed once before and each time has been wonderful. The view of the city isn't big but it's lovely being so close to the clock tower and over looking Martin Place. The buffet breakfast is incredible, but the line can be really long, so get there early if you want it. The pool is tricky to get to and not worth the effort to go up and down the stairs and round the numerous corners to find it. Give the swim a miss. The highlight though has to be the best room service burger I have ever eaten!

Reviews.Title: “seeker of excellence will not be dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Hadit
Reviews.Content: Westin seems to go the extra mile in luxury appointments and service. The hotel is part of the refurbished origional Sydney post office, although the part we stayed in was the new tower. On slight downside was that the restauants and cafe's seem to be franchises not owned by the hotel and do not chare accounts to the room. If this ws made clear in the first place it would save some confusion.

Reviews.Title: “Stock standard five-star hotel with appalling customer service”
Reviews.Author: fayfox
Reviews.Content: I have travelled a lot for both work and play in Sydney and have stayed at a large number of the five-star hotels in Sydney. Relocated from the Shangri-la (my accommodation of choice) to here over the weekend because my sister was coming to stay and I was after somewhere more central, and the Westin is certainly convenient in that respect. Rooms are relatively spacey (more so than theFour Seasons/Hilton) and my current view is over a clock tower if you like that sort of thing. However - when I arrived in a cab with luggage at just after midnight on a Friday, there were NO STAFF in the lobby even though it was busy with guests/assorted Friday night crowd. No bellboys - noone at reception and one unfriendly doorman who watched as I struggled with getting two large bags and a suitcase out of the cab, across the lobby and into the lift. Did not come across one single hotel employee during this time. So all in all - great location, however even on floor sixteen I can hear the noise from the street. Room facilities are nice and spacious however servicing is an issue - my bathroon sink was still wet from previous use when I checked in. As above, service is appalling. If you are after more of a luxury experience, avoid the riff raff, suck up the extra 500 metre walk and stay at the Shangri la/Intercontinental/Wentworth/Park Hyatt. If you are after an overpriced convenient location with no customer service, stay at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Service, but more of a Buisness Travellers Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAGLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because we have stayed at the Westin Dubai so many times and had a great time there. We were sort of thinking that we would have the same experience, however this is more of a Buisness travellers hotel, rather than somewhere to stay when you're on holidays with a family. Having said that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and will definitely be reccomending this hotel to friends. The service was excellent. I was extremely suprised when I came back froma jog one evening and the concierge handed me a bottle of water and towel as I came into the hotel lobby (obviously I looked like I needed it:)). It's this type of service and help that sets the Westin chain apart from most of the others around the world. My only tip to families deciding to stay here is to get the Deluxe rooms. My wife, 7 month old baby and I stayed here initially in a Heritage Superior room and found it unbearably small with all of the luggage etc that goes along with a baby. We ended up upgrading to the Heritage Deluxe for the rest of our stay. This was 100% more livable and the staff were so helpful in heling us move. Nothing was too much of a chore for them...v.impressed!! Breakfast was great, we can definitely reccomend that you get this as a part of your room rate. It might cost more, but is worth it. Excellent buisness centre there. Internet, scanner & printer are all there and suprisingly free to use. We were going for our USA visa interview near the hotel, so needed to do some last minute (frantic) scanning & printing...was no worries here. Location was 100000000%. Just walked down to Circular Quay & the Rocks for dinner everynight. Reccomend a trip to Manly (via Freey) and also to Watsons Bay (Doyles Fish & Chips - best Takeaway). Only negative I can find is the views. I was told over the phone that all rooms had 'city views'. Now I took it that this was a good thing...I was wrong. City views means a view of the next buildings windows. When we changed to the Deluxe room the view was pretty good (looking out to Martin Place), so I can really reccomend room 322 if you want to have a decent view. Oh, one otherthing. Dont bet on getting a massage at the hotel. This we tried so much for and no spots were ever available. This was a bit annoying, but like I said, it's a buisness hotel and not a resort so we guess that the spa part isn't like the one in Dubai. Just for the record: * Stayed 5 nights (25-30.09.2010) * $410/night (incl. breakfast) * Stayed in room 322 (highly reccomend this room as it has good 'mall' views).

Reviews.Title: “awesome weekend”
Reviews.Author: sandy-lnhl
Reviews.Content: thanks to Laurie H from spg.com who made this stay happened. As my spg card expired, i should wait for 7 days to have the points back, but Laurie H helped to made a booking. Thank you Laurie. We book superior for two days, first day booked with the points from starwood and second day with credit card. 'we have been upgraded to twin room deluxe in room 335, the room superb, spacious, clean with a fire place decor. the bed are superb, the bath tub great. with overlooking view to the city. the only thing is the second day when we would like to had breakfast..at mozaic...we have to wait to be seated...nobody attend us...wait for at least 8 minutes..even restaurant attendant sees us but noone entertain us..but it doesnt matter as overal we had great time..

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat this location”
Reviews.Author: ilst
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel with comfortable beds. Breakfast at the Mosaic restaurant is smaller but much more relaxed than the one in Sheraton On the Park. Love the atmosphere here. Room 1806 had a nice view over the city. Convenient location for both business and leisure

Reviews.Title: “Grand Location, Charming Old Building.”
Reviews.Author: TravelTiger2010
Reviews.Content: History is well-preserved in this grand hotel. Immaculate room and nice little touches such as speakers in the bathroom ceiling. Modern facilities and nice breakfast buffet. Location is very central. Paid around $400-$500 for our room including breakfast and car parking.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Westin”
Reviews.Author: Glenco1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on points. This is a pretty standard Westin, the room was fairly small but nice decor. There was a lounge, pretty small but served a hot breakfast. It was a pretty brief stay, not sure of price since we were on points, but this compares well to many other Westins I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Vest hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LozWhittz
Reviews.Content: Keep meaning to get round to saying what a fantastic hotle this was. Start of our 4 week trip to Australia and it could not have been better. The location was ideal. The rooms were gorgeous. The bed was out of this world. Staff were very cortious. we arrived very early and they got us a room.

Reviews.Title: “Its all in the detail”
Reviews.Author: Meldivino74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Westin, Sydney for the first 3 nights of our Australian honeymoon. Having booked through Expedia and having requested a room with a view we were given a fantastic room with a view of the tower and city. As the hotel was aware of the nature of our trip we were also greeted in our room with an ice cold bottle of bubbly on arrival. The room itself was very large with a great bathroom.Throughout the stay all the staff we encountered were very helpful and polite and nothing was too much trouble. Another advantage of the hotel is its excellent position which means you are right in the centre of town and only 5-10 mins walk from the bridge and opera house. One final point you must try the Club sandwich from Room Service you won't be disapointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Finally found it!”
Reviews.Author: JandJAdelaide
Reviews.Content: We have been travelling to Sydney for several years now and we have been trying to find a hotel to stay in that combines a good location, good service and reasonable price. With the Westin I think we have finally cracked it! The service was friendly and welcoming. Our room was immaculate and very spacious by Sydney standards. The bed was comfortable,the linen was nice and the room was quiet. Factors that help with a good nights sleep. We particularly liked the bathroom - good separate shower and excellent towels. Breakfast was also good. We did not dine in but met friends in the bar before going out. The service and beverage selection were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best chain hotels in a great location”
Reviews.Author: JasonandSally
Reviews.Content: I'm not a fan of chain hotels, however the Westin in Sydney is suberb. This is a great location on Martins Place and the rooms are a reasonable size and are very well kitted out / styled. We had a Tower Room overlooking the clock, I liked the bathroom and the electric blind between on the window between the bathroom and bedroom. Plenty of room for the cot for our 3 month old baby as well. We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of a 3 week touring holiday and having lived in a motorhome for 3 weeks, it was great to get some comfort. The beds are so comfortable and amoung the best that I've slept in, we've even looked into buying one for the our bedroom at home.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaShus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Westin Sydney for our wedding anniversary; it was simply fantastic. Check in was smooth and we had a great tower room looking right out at the clock. Also in our room was a note from the general manager, congratulating us on our anniversary, with a complimentary bottle of champagne all chilled and waiting for us when we arrived, with a little plate of desserts. It was a great way to be greeted, that's for sure! I have knocked it down for service, because we booked a package which included a manicure/pedicure. I had to remind them that this was included and take the initiative to book it, and it also showed up on our bill at the end. They quickly took it off, but to me, this was a detail that they could have improved on and it meant that we had to line up at the check-out desk instead of just being on our way. The breakfast buffet at the Mosaic restaurant was fantastic, with lots of variety and choice, with plenty of fresh and healthy options to start your day. I was next to someone in line who was asking if there were pancakes. There weren't any, but the chef working didn't blink an eye and offered to whip them up right there and then. I could go on and on, but I think the thing that impressed us the most was when we went down and asked the service desk for a restaurant. We told them we just wanted something casual and the gentleman working directed us to a little Thai place that we probably would have walked right by. The food was amazing and cheap as well! I marked it down a bit for value because it is an expensive place and the price of their food for room service was a bit much. That was a minor niggle and it really is to be expected in the big name hotels. We absolutely loved our weekend and were so sad to leave. Thanks to the great staff who made our weekend so fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “great westin group hotel, all the usual features and service”
Reviews.Author: travelwellallthetime
Reviews.Content: no real comments other than the usual large business style hotel with all the service and high costs attached.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, one of the best I've been to”
Reviews.Author: KingTito
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights and had an incredible stay. The hotel itself is in a great location. About a 10 minute or 15 minute walk from the Opera house. The rooms are fantastic. Very clean, awesome bathroom design with a huge tub that, alas, I did not use. There are about 6-7 restaurants in the lower floor and I went to the steakhouse and the sushi place. Both were great. The steakplace fired up one of the best steaks I've had in a while and the sushi place was quick but very good. The gym is nice. Perhaps getting a bit dated but nice. It is not owned by Westin as far as I can tell but Westin guests seem to get free use. Overall, I hope I have a chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room in heart of city”
Reviews.Author: eves21
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, very comfy bed with Bose alarm clock, lovely bathroom - really big with separate shower, nice big bath and separate toliet (all within the bathroom), good TV, easy internet access, nice bars and restaurants in the building itself so no need to leave. Only downfall was that my room faced an internal walkway so no ability to open the blinds for natural-ish light, but it was only for 2 days so no great fuss.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious hotel accomodation in historical settings”
Reviews.Author: joycekwong
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel and its services thoroughly: great location, excellent service, wonderful restaurant, unique architecture - would recommend it and return!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: soloangel
Reviews.Content: I am a long time Starwood member. I was disappointed when I entered my room and I found a hair (the private kind) ironed into the sheet which was clearly obvious as I stood talking on the second telephone (by the bed) as the first telephone (on the desk) did not work. At $270.00 room p/n I certainly didn't expect this! The only compensation I received was a bowl of fruit and a different room (no upgrade). The hotel was prepared to do nothing more for me I even spoke to the manager (just by chance whilst I was waiting in the lobby) and he did not offer anything... no apology, no nothing, he was aware of the problem and said they had sorted it out! My advice go elsewhere... oh I remember the good ol' days of the Ritz Carlton in the city... those were the days!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FriscoSoccerMom
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in the center of the Central Business District of Sydney. It is close enough to walk to the Quay and to shopping. There are restaurants galore and just a beautiful vibe of the city. This is a hotel geared for those on business but our family on vacation thoroughly enjoyed our stay. A grocery is around the block for the snacks and drinks you may want to have in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Sydney's city center!”
Reviews.Author: dukie84
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a beautiful hotel located directly in the center of Sydney's business district and a close walk to all tourist attractions. The lobby of the hotel is formed out of an old post office with lots of charm. The location right on Martin Place, a pedestrian only street, which adds calm to this centrally located city hotel. We booked the hotel for leisure and were a bit concerned that the hotel would be too business oriented for our pleasure trip. Although the Westin certainly has a business feel to it, the hotel is very central and perfect for a Sydney tourist. Just a short walk to the Rocks, the Opera House, the Botanic Gardens, Darling Harbour, etc. (between 10-15 minutes to each). As Starwood Platinum members we enjoyed a host of benefits--including a delicious breakfast, happy hour, snacks (coffee/tee/hot chocolate, cookies, fruit) and free internet. The staff members are very responsive and incredibly pleasant. The rooms themselves are of the usual modern, Westin Standard--very clean, rather spacious, and very comfortable. The Sydney Westin is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: livelife990
Reviews.Content: We booked an executive suite for a reasonable $500 a night. As I had booked a few weeks in advance i requested for one of the top floors, and upon check-in was told we will be staying on the the 31st level. Room was impeccable, bathroom well appointed and the food (room service) was absolutely fabulous. The ambience was carefree and not stuffy or snooty which some 5 star hotels can tend to be. Buffet breakfast was inclusive and worked out to be much better value for money. Staff we also very helpful. I have stayed at the Park Hyatt in Sydney but this hotel far surpasses the Park Hyatt in service. Westin is well worth its 5 star rating and having stayed at dozens of 5 star hotels, i highly recommend the Westin if staying in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChloderosLaclos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney for 12 days in July. We had a conference to attend for a couple of days. Our trip was a mix of business and pleasure. Traveled with husband and daughter (pre-teen). Stayed in a Heritage Room. Lovely, lovely, lovely. And huge. Great amenities. Large bathroom. Nice teas for breakfast. I loved that the hotel is in the GPO (old post office building). Fabulous restaurants to choose from and clearly a place to be seen. And the workout facilities were incredible. We loved the Rocks.
