But this hotel is convenient to everything on foot. The weather was mild--60s and sunny, most days. Better than the heat in our hometown of Nashville. Great staff. Early check-in because of early flight. I booked a Deluxe King Heritage room. Plenty of room to spare (and I mean plenty!!) for an extra bed for my daughter.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staying, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Modena2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at the Westin room 1502, the check in was fast. The room had a beautiful view, large, clean, and quiet. Bathroom large, clean, shower and bath-tab, with many and quality courtesy products (soap, shower gel, balm, comb...). Breakfast is great. Large selection of foods and beverages. Fresh, testy and in a very unusual place: the inner terrace of the Hotel, with a view on the clock tower place. There are several restaurants downstairs, from cozy to easy-going. Different prices. The Westin reception staff are kind, professional and helpful, especially for good restaurants addresses. We purchased via the Hotel website, cheaper and large possibilities. Ten to fifteen minutes walk from the Rocks. Close to shops and restaurants. The swimming pool is in a fitness center a bit small compared to the pictures. Internet point for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Very nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: PackerBacker72
Reviews.Content: The Westin in Sydney is a very nice hotel. The location is not where there is a view of the Harbour, but it is a great location for visiting all of the main attractions in the CBD. It seemed like no more than a 10-15 minute walk to everyplace. The decor is very modern. The bathrooms were pretty wild, but you have to love a shower that is big enough for a group and includes a handheld shower head as well as an over head rain shower. Overall the rooms were very nice. The beds are advertised as the "heavenly bed" and they are. The flat screen TV's are nice but pretty limited on channels. Luckily, we were not too interested in watching TV. The complaints are the ticky tacky things that are probably no big deal to some, but just annoying to us. No ice without calling "Service Express" (aka room service) for example. We had no idea how to even figure this out without a call to the front desk. When we called we were told all the information you would normally find in print in the room could be found on the TV. That's fine, but it would have been nice if we had been told that at check-in. It seemed like everything we needed required a call to the front desk or room service....sorry, "Service Express". One personal irk: I wish the high end hotels would take a tip from the Holiday Inn Express and SpringHill Suites type places and charge like a dollar more per room and give everyone free wifi instead of the crazy $13 to $27 per day fees for the few who actually pay that we saw this trip. You would think that 10-20 people at a time using the free wifi in the lobby would give them a clue. Yeah I know, next thing you know I;ll be expecting them to include charges for checked bags on the airlines.... Overall the Westin in Sydney a beautiful hotel in a great location for seeing all of the CBD of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: CanberraTourist
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time staying at the Westin Sydney and all 4 experiences have been consistently excellent. The previous 3 times were paid for by work and this time was booked through Wotif secret hotel by ourselves. 1. Location. It is in the middle of the CBD. Everything you need is short stroll, shopping, restaurants, Circular Quay, Darling Habour, China Town, Hyde Park etc. 2. Room. We LOVED the spacious and modern bathroom with shower, spa bath with transparent window with view to the clock tower outside and the LCD TV in the room. The shower has 2 shower head and strong water stream. We could basically live in the bathroom. King size bed was really really comfortable. We also love the LCD TV and the Bose stereo system. 3. Service. Very friendly and efficient staff. 4. I have previously used the gym, which is basically a fully functional gym that people from outside can also pay to use it, unless some hotels would have a couple of equipments. 5. On business days, there is a very classy food court at basement (GPO Food Court). We loved the gourmet pizza. 6. We have stayed in various hotels in Sydney CBD and some hotels can be noisy on Saturday night because of the nightclubs nearby. Westin Sydney is a quiet place and we have not heard any night club music. We loved the Westin Sydney. It is one of our favourite hotels we have stayed around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Westin, service like a Sheraton”
Reviews.Author: EricInSF
Reviews.Content: This is my third Starwood visit in Sydney and haven't been impressed with the service in any of them. Efficient service, and quick to respond. But none of the Aussie friendliness you come to expect. Overall, insincere and cool. The room was on par with the better Westins. And the common areas are gorgeous. Unless you get a great deal, I don't know if it's worth paying more for the Westin, compared to the Sheraton in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Ho-Hum, the Westin Sydney is Average”
Reviews.Author: NoSleepTillMnhtn
Reviews.Content: Some Westins you win, some are just ho-hum, and this, in my experience as a long-time Starwood Platinum member was ho-hum. Had big expectations moving into the hotel based on the price. Location is central, building historical, but views, at no fault of the hotels, uninteresting if at all. Pros: +Great Executive Lounge. One of the best of any Starwood I've stayed! This makes me stay here again. +Great Bathrooms in the Deluxe rooms. Love the seperate toilet and shower. +Very Clean. Room/Hotel felt pristine (in tower rooms at least). Cons: -Cheap beds. Did not feel like the standard Heavenly Bed, though I could be wrong. Was surprised how light the bed frames were... bumping into the bed, I had to move it back into place! -Poor views unless top floors. -No upgrades! As a top tier elite, I expect an upgraded room. The check-in person confirmed there were corner rooms and jr. suites available that night, but she couldn't give me a room because it was up to the manager who was already gone for the day. Really? I made the reservation in advance of the day, but alas. So in all, if you need a Starwood hotel, the Westin would satisfy if you can get in the Executive Lounge. If not, I'd recommend the Sheraton or another brand.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: ElMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. Our main issue was that the room was not serviced at all during our stay. We came back from dinner at 10pm to unmade beds, no clean towels or anything. We went down to reception to complain and all we got was a "sorry, house-keeping must have missed your room". They said they would send someone up with fresh towels. 10 mins later there was a knock on the door and I was handed a pile of towels. On closer inspection - we had been given ONE bath towel, THREE bath mats and SEVEN (yes 7) face washers. What a joke. So we had to call house-keeping again and ask for more towels. This is pretty poor service and unacceptable for such a hotel. We won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: SheilaRoo
Reviews.Content: On honeymoon in Sydney, my husband and I had booked 3 nights accommodation in the Westin. We were able to check in early after arriving off a flight from Brisbane. From our first encounter with a member of staff, it was top quality all the way. The room was amazing and the breakfasts were just delicious. Such variety and breakfasts could be cooked from scratch if you didnt fancy anything from the wide array of choice from the buffet. We had porridge twice - which is difficult to get in a hotel- and it was fab. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for treat in Sydney. Brilliant location, brilliant hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: GooseNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 7 nights in mid-July and loved it! It was centrally located in the CBD, but slightly away from the generic tourist hustle and bustle. We had an awesome view of the city on the 26th Fl. and no problems with Housekeeping, etc. The hotel is near tons of trains/buses, which makes it easy to get anywhere in the city (we even walked to a ton of places from the hotel). Any cons, Iâ€™d say, were that we had to go pretty far to find everyday restaurants to eat at. We wanted to stay away from expensive hotel food (though we did have a lovely dinner one night at the wine bar in the basement), so it took a day or two for us to figure that out. Plus, a lot of nearby places were closed on the weekends. And forget about trying to get to the indoor pool. It closed really early so we never even got in to see it. The concierge wasnâ€™t super helpful, but that came as no surprise given what Iâ€™d seen from other reviews. However, even with those things, I would absolutely stay here again on another trip to Sydney. The place was pleasant and convenient, and the staff generally friendly. Bonus points go to the hotel for having our room available at 9AM when we arrived!! There's nothing better to hear after 2 days of air travel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Sydney, a place to stay down under”
Reviews.Author: larskoelle
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is one of the greatest Westin which I have visited during my numours travels around the world. After a long weekend in the plane I arrived on Sunday at 2pm local time, unfortunatelly my Upgrad - Room was not available since it still had to be cleaned. I was offered another room to refresh myself and change clothes and check in for my suit but I decided to check out the lounge as well as the gymn. The room itself was very nice, a large suite with an additional clothing room, a large bathroom, seperate living room and a corner sleeping room with a wonderfull view including Harbour Bridge.

Reviews.Title: “You can always trust a Westin Heavenly bed”
Reviews.Author: Aleximo1965
Reviews.Content: Third time staying at a Westin - other two were in Europe - and it's impossible to believe they can maintain these standards worldwide. Starting at check-in, we were very early but not a problem. Checked in straight away and shown to a delightful room with a nice quirky touch - a bathroom with a glass wall so you can watch the TV whilst having a soak. Breakfast was included and was excellent with all the usuals plus a nice line in fruit smoothies (which my wife is addicted to). The hotel is slap bang in the middle of everywhere you need to be and an easy walk to the harbour and to the awesome shopping at QVB. This hotel lived up to all my expectations - the staff are friendly and helpful but the beds just make the stay. Best nights sleep you can get when away on a trip....and we should know; both my wife and I are insomniacs and even we get a decent sleep at a Westin! Already booked another one in Dubai for January 2011.....

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat 'The Westin'”
Reviews.Author: cobba19
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Having stayed at The Westin in Kuala Lumpur before I was quiet confident this hotel would be just as good. Only this hotel was better. Room spacious with a lovely bathroom especially the bath...nice & deep. Those little extras like a magnified mirror in the bathroom, extra towels & helpful staff made a big difference to our stay. Located just a short walk to Darling Harbour. My daughter & I booked the Winter B&D from their website for only 1 night. Breakfast was excellent. We will defiantly be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury - 5 star”
Reviews.Author: JessandNat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after a weekend of partying for 2 days. Close to the nightlife and shopping. Really luxury for service, facilities, location evrything!! Go for it if you can afford it

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch...BUT”
Reviews.Author: BobbyGAus
Reviews.Content: Once again we had a relaxing stay at the Westin. Very tasty dinner in Mosaic and a first class breakfast next morning. Our room on the 18th floor was bright and airy. Everything was great BUT........this time we took our car. I understand this hotel is at the expensive end of the scale BUT $49 for overnight parking is an out and out ripoff!! Valet or not!! I thought $35 overnight at some other hotels was a bit steep but $49 is below the belt. Shame really cause we like this hotel for all the good points, but at checkout it sours the experience! (for our US friends this is about $40 USD)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Contempary with a nice mix of old-fashioned.”
Reviews.Author: willcp
Reviews.Content: We were greeted by the smart doorman to the beautiful concierge - and what would you expect when you enter an old post office? Not bars and restaurants - but the Westin is a metropolis of shops, bars and lounges. The bellboy took our luggage to our room which was incredible. One night of our stay we went to see Wicked, so it shows the hotel is in a great place. Would love to stay again, didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, excellent location!!!”
Reviews.Author: min16h
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this hotel highly enough. We had a deluxe tower king room and it was absolutely stunning. As other people have said, there is a glass window between the bathroom and the bedroom which is very cool. The shower also has a rainwater head which is great and the heavenly beds are soooo comfortable. The location is unreal. The mall is the next block up and Circulay Quay, Chinatown and Darling Harbour are all within about a 10-15 minute walk (depeding on if you have high heels on :) My only complaint, and it is relatively small, is that we had gone to have breakfast so turned the do not disturb on, when we returned housekeeping were in our room. Another time we came back at 5.30pm and housekeeping were only just cleaning our room... Still a very small glitch on an otherwise perfect stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good till you got your bill!”
Reviews.Author: y10998
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights at Westin Sydney, the location is good, room is clean and comfort. We booked through Expedia.ca, the rate in June (their winter time) is not bad, however, everything else is expensive, a buffet breakfast costs $40/pp, a local call from our room cost $4.35/min ! The biggest disappointment came after I got my credit card statement. The hotel billed me in Australian dollar as check out, but without asking, it converted and charged me (in Canadian dollar) with a much higher exchange rate( how high? my credit card charges 2% fee on the top of currency conversion, even that, the hotel's conversion made me paid 5% more than just converted it by credit card). It just ruined my experience staying with the hotel and for sure it was not a 5 star experience!

Reviews.Title: “Slick and professional”
Reviews.Author: LadyMuckQld
Reviews.Content: I stayed for five nights in a tower deluxe room and found it to be a relaxing experience. The rooms are modern, stylish; the large glass panel between the bedroom and bathroom gives the illusion of more space and provides natural light to the entire area. It was disappointing to be deprived of digital TV stations,: only the main free-to-air stations, a BBC news channel, American cable dross and endless sport was available. Any guest with an interest in Australian politics who wants the informative breakfast programme on ABC2, would be disappointed. The Westin TVs are flatscreen so there's no excuse for the lack of digital channels. This is the same at a few other upmarket Sydney hotels - why? The reception staff were particularly helpful and patient in finding a room in a quiet location and the 'heavenly' bed lived up to its reputation. Breakfast in the open Mosaic Restaurant beneath the high glass atrium was above average: a good buffet selection attended by efficient staff and regular topping-up of coffee. I was surprised to see thongs on several occasions - this is inappropriate footwear for a predominantly business hotel where the clientele tend to be more formally dressed. It's about time guests at 5 star hotels in a CBD location realise they are not staying at an island beach resort . The Westin is not alone in this, thongs regularly appear in the best Australian hotel dining rooms. Maitre d's should enforce a better dress code if they wish to be seriously regarded as 5 star. Overall a very good experience in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room and hotel- ideal for a romantic stay very impressed ***”
Reviews.Author: SineadR79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 2 nights for a romantic get away and couldn't have been more impressed- the hotel is large and spacious and our room was luxurious with a gorgeous bathroom with a wall that opening shutters connecting the bedroom to the bathroom. The room service was excellent and the staff were really friendly. We ate late one night in the room and was really impressed with the quality that was available- even delicious fresh fruit juices and curries. The room was very quiet and the bed very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Recommended to Anyone!”
Reviews.Author: OrganizedTourist
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a Starwood Member so I do have a love for Starwood hotels and I can be a bit biased but even if I wasn't a member I still would've enjoyed my stay at this hotel. It was located centrally in the Central Business District in Sydney. It's about a 5-8 minute walk to Circular Quay and a 5 minute walk to Daarling Harbor. The rooms are absolutely amazing and the heavenly beds are just heavenly. I had the best sleep of my entire trip at this hotel. Granted, it was our last stop for our tour around Australia and New Zealand but we want out with a bang. The cost wasn't as expensive compared to other Westins but you should still expect to pay over $200 a night, which is completely well worth every penny. We checked in and were escorted upstairs with a bell man. The bell man then showed us around the room and on top of that even came back after helping us with our luggage and gave us a map detailing out the restaurants recommendations we had talked to him about. The breakfast each morning at the Cafe was amazing. There was fresh fruit, smoothies, pastries, all types of food. The variety completely surprised me and the food was delicious. The lobby is large and spacious. You can also get free wi-fi for one day in the lobby which was nice. My only complaint was the concierge. I had gone downstairs to ask for help in booking a reservation at Cafe Sydney and though I may have been dressed in sneakers and jeans, I was given a snooty attitude and was glanced over as if I was questioned about being a guest at the hotel. I then asked for help in figuring out what to do on our trip there but there were no suggestions given. I had to request specifically for information and even then I was not given much help. Overall, I would still recommend the hotel minus the concierge problem. I didn't let it bother me but if you have high hopes on service then this might dampen your stay a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Alice_t024
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the Starwood hotels (to which the Westin is one of) all over the world and was excited to see what the Sydney Westin had to offer. I am disappointed to review that my stay The Westin in Sydney was one of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had. A bell boy who shut my pressed suit in the door and a very grumpy check-in host were just the start. This was followed by dirt and sand in my (presumably) un-used bed and hair sticking out of the drain, follow this with a constantly running toilet (that for some reason no one could manage to fix for three days) and this hotel felt more like a thatched bungalow in the Thailand jungle. Do yourself a favour and stay at one of the many other world class hotels Sydney has to offer, The Westin is not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every area”
Reviews.Author: sandluc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in late May and had an excellent stay. Our first three nights were in an Executive Suite which was absolutely fantastic. The room had a good sized lounge, separate toilet off the enterance and a large main bathroon with a great view over the city. This room also included access to the Club lounge on the 28th floor. We had drinks here each evening along with canapes and a cheese selection. The breakfast in the lounge each morning was the best I have had in an executive club. It included a huge range of fresh fruits, pastries, cereals, espresso coffee and four decent hot selections. Everything was super fresh and well presented. The service in the lounge was great both in the morning and evenings. On the second night in the club lounge the waitress remembered my drink preference from the previous night. We stayed in a superior room for the last two nights as we used Starwood points for these. The shift between the rooms was done smoothly for us while we were out and they just updated our keys on return. This standard room is still far better than most in Sydney and as in all of their rooms, they still feel like new. You can pick this room up for around $AU140 on special over the off season which is superb value. Another nice touch is the free use of computers/internet to all guests in the business centre (hard to believe that most hotels charge for such a basic service). The Westin is one of the most central hotels to stay at in Sydney (along with Hilton and Swissotel) and it is only 5 minutes to circular quay or 2 minutes to the main shopping area. There are main train stations which head east or west within 2 minutes walk as well. The restaurants around the Westin are superb, and there is a fantastic steak restaurant "Prime" in the basement of the GPO building attached. We had a couple of great day trips out of Sydney that I would highly recommend. The first was the Jenolan Caves (about 3 hours drive) which were truely spectacular. The other was a horse trek along the beach and sand dunes at Anna Bay (2.5 hours north of Sydney) with Sahara Trails. An absolute blast for a complete novice (myself) and my very experienced wife. We love Sydney as a city and trying all of the great hotels on offer. The Westin rates with the best them and we had absolutely no complaints with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently excellent”
Reviews.Author: alkira_roaming
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Sydney many times since the hotel opened, for both business and leisure. The hotel looks as good as it did on the day it opened and I still like it. The hotel is a modern tower that incorporates the historic Sydney GPO (post office), so the lobby and some public spaces enjoy a well executed mix of old and new. Rooms are available in the heritage section, though I have never stayed in them. I like being in the tower, with views over Martin Place and the old GPO clock. Rooms are tasteful, neutral and very comfortable. I do like the deluxe rooms, featuring a glass wall between the bedroom and bathroom, which is somehow quite conducive to a long soak in the tub. I usually book a rate that includes breakfast. The Mosaic restaurant is a light-filled, bustling spot and breakfast is a cut above the average hotel buffet. The location is great for CBD shopping and business, though if I was a first-time Sydney visitor I would probably want a harbour view (look for a hotel down at the Rocks/Circular Quay).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Fiona018
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location and walking distance for most to most of the attractions, Opera House, Darling Harbor, shopping, the tower and restaurants. Lovely hotel, large spacious and modern rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “If in Sydney stay here, top class hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flor72Zurich
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel, great bed, huge bath and separate shower, very good breakfast buffet and top class service. I stayed here 3 nights and before that I had stayed at the Intercontinental. If I had known how good was the Westin I would have stayed here for my whole stay, I really recommend this hotel if you like comfort and luxus. Great location, just some minutes walk from the Sydney Opera House.

Reviews.Title: “I want to take the shower home with me.....”
Reviews.Author: flaggster
Reviews.Content: It was a perfect 10 - an incredible bathroom with a tub and separate shower that made it hard to leave, a comfy bed, phenomenal breakfast, free wifi in the lobby and free printing in the business center. Walkable to great restaurants and a concierge that was friendly and very knowledgeable. I would definitely stay there again (especially if work is paying for it....)

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: Felix UK
Reviews.Content: I think the Westin, Sydney is simply a wonderful hotel. It's a great location. Right in the heart of Sydney - easy walk to the quay and all the shops. The staff are always friendly and helpful - whether it's the guy getting you a cab, a coffee, checking all is going well with your stay or just offering assistance because you may need it. The range of amenities is fantastic. Whether you want a business centre to print out documents, a gym to do some exercise, swim, a cafe, bar .... and then you've got the GPO in the basement. Sushi? Steak? Excellent breakfasts (didn't have b'fast in hotel). There's a cheese & wine shop to get that tasty morsel and fine burgundy before you walk out to your restaurant or the Opera. The rooms are modern and well equipped. I love the bathrooms. The rooms are big - a real sense of space that you just never seem to get in Europe. Helps having floor to ceiling glass wall that looks from the 35th floor through the tower blocks to the harbour. Maybe it's because i'm an Australian living in London and travelling extensively in Europe - but the total package of the Westin makes it my most favourite hotel in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Elegance in the heart of the CBD”
Reviews.Author: FirstTravellerLondon
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the Central Business District and integrated into the old 19-century post office this is easily one of Sydney's best 5-star hotels. The lobby sits in the middle of an impressive seven story atrium with glass ceiling; on the left hand side is the new 28-story tower building which hosts the majority of the rooms; all with floor to ceiling windows and great views of the city (although unless you are on the very top floors you are more likely to be looking into an office building across the street than enjoying views of the harbour); on the other side is the smaller heritage building with more classic style rooms. We had an Executive Suite on the 27th floor of the tower building with a living room with a two seater sofa, arm chair and flat screen TV and a corner bed room, again with a large flat screen TV and floor to ceiling windows on two sides. The bathroom was probably the best part of the suite however; with a large bath right next to the window offering panoramic views of the city and a large separate walk-in shower. The executive lounge on the 28th floor offered great service although food offerings were somewhat limited; breakfast in the lounge was good. We tried the Mosaic restaurant on the first floor for dinner one night and were impressed by the standard of cooking. Outside the hotel, restaurant options are fairly limited in the immediate area; however the rocks area is only a 15 minute walk from the hotel and the great restaurant scene of Surrey Hills is only a short cab ride away. We did come across the great Sushi-Tei though just 5 minutes walk away. The hotel has no gym of its own but as a guest you get free access to an independently run gym literally across the lobby which is sprawling over several floors with a (small) pool on the top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: janeymcp
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - probably the best we stayed in during our extended (thanks to the ash cloud) trip. We got a great room rate from their own website, with breakfast included. Room was great, fab bathroom, comfy beds, although view uninspiring. Bar was expensive as others have said - $17 for glass of Sauv blanc, but cheaper if you go down into the basement where there are several eating/drinking options including wood fired pizza and sushi. Pool was some distance from the room as we were in the new block and probably not worth the trip. Had to walk through the gym in your swimmers to get to the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable beds, great city views”
Reviews.Author: mathpoet87
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon. We got a great deal by using hotel points and cash, so I can't comment on the usual price. I can say, though, that the city-view Tower Superior room we had was luxurious and delightful. The floor-to-ceiling windows overlooked the 1800s post office that's now part of the hotel, with views of the buildings beyond it. Beds were very comfortable, which seems a bit rare Down Under. The bathroom was huge, with a large tub. It was only about a 10-minute walk to Circular Quay, and maybe an 8-minute walk in another direction to Darling Harbour. The Queen Victoria Mall and the Sydney Tower were within 5 minutes' walking as well. Note that one cannot see the Opera House or Harbour Bridge from this hotel (unless maybe from the highest floors). If you want that, you have to stay near Circular Quay. Nonetheless, we quite enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, if not a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: AdamDroitwich
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is located right in the heart of the Central Business District (CBD) of Sydney. This is great because Sydney Harbour is just 10 mins walk away and a load of shops including department stores like Myers and David Jones are just moments away also. The hotel itself has a large lobby with friendly staff waiting to greet you. We had pre booked our room as we knew our flight arrived into Sydney early (around 6.30am) Donâ€™t expect to be given a room if your flight is really early. Check in time is from 12:00 normally The room itself was lovely. We had a large double bed which was like sleeping on air! There was also a large 42in W/s TV which had HD content. The room also had a complimentary safe which came in handy and was a nice addition. Shower facilities were great too. The room was very clean and modern. Complementary gowns were also provided. Mini bar facilities were also available. However, they were quite expensive for what they were offering. BREAKFAST We paid for a room rate which included breakfast in the hotel. I was glad that we did as it cost $42 per person for the buffet if it wasnâ€™t included in the room rate. I have to say though, the breakfast was wonderful. Anything you may have wished for was there from cereals, freshly made smoothies, ready to eat fruit, made to order eggs and much much more. Tea and coffee was offered constantly and actually was very nice. The restaurant was large and airy and you also had access to free internet should you need it. Staff were always attentive and it made the experience overall pleasant. The Bar A very nice meeting place area. We had a couple of vodka and cokes one afternoon after a long day of Sydney exploring. We were greeted by a friendly barman who took and interest in us and what our order was. We were also brought a selection of nuts to enjoy. The only downside was the price of the drinks. For 2 Vodka and cokes and 2 Bombay Sapphire G and Tâ€™s it came to an eye popping $60. Just bear this in mind if and when you go. A great spot for people watching though! Facilities Loads of great business facilities as you would expect from this type of hotel. It also has complimentary access to a Good life gym which is a well equipped gym and has everything you need for a good workout. The pool was small but useable. General Sydney Prices Nothing to do with the hotel but we found this trip to Sydney really expensive. This has been exacerbated by the exchange rate of just $1.57 to the Â£ To give an idea of costs, please see below: (April 2010) 1.5 ltr bottle of water from $0.60 â€“ Aldi Manly to a whopping $7 Westin Hotel most places charging $2-3 for a 600ml bottle. 600ml bottle of coke $3.60 - Coles Supermarket. Same price everywhere generally Schooner of beer $4.50 â€“ Oxford Hotel bar to $5.80 Ship Inn Bar Spirit and mixer $8 Palms Bar to $15 Westin Hotel Sun cream lotion $15 to $24 for 200ml Ozzie Tim Tams from $2 Woolworths to $6 Sydney Domestic Airport â€“ 150grm pack Sydney Harbour Bridge Climb $200 Cost of an average meal with wine (Starter/main/1 drink) $75 pp Can vary obviously depending on where you eat. This price is based on the rocks area of Sydney Chart paperback book â€“ $25 to $33 Chart CD - $20 to $30 Cost of Taxi from Airport to CBD $35 Overall Whilst this is a higher priced hotel, the facilities and service given makes the hotel an excellent choice. If you can afford it, I feel you will have a great stay here at the Westin Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsBigApple
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin as part of our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. It is nicer than most Westin's in the US and had all the amenities that you would expect. We were upgraded for free since it was our honeymoon- and the room was spacious and pretty. The hotel was also a good location for us to walk around and explore some of Sydney's sights. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury, loved every detail”
Reviews.Author: Tripaholic83
Reviews.Content: I was blown away by the Westin, I would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat. The rooms are spectacular, service impecable and location hard to beat. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Westin Comfort in Australia”
Reviews.Author: canadian_traveller88
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the CBD (Central Business District) is the Syndey Westin. We stayed in a standard room in the new tower. The room was a very nice size and had a modern and large bathroom. Staff were friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi in the lounge area. Centrally located and an easy 10 - 15 minute walk to major tourist areas (the Rocks, Circular Quay, Darling harbour, Paddington Markets).

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shrop
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel for a major city, not many get it right but the Westin Sydney does. It's really hard to fault it, I guess if you want to be right by the harbour this is'nt the hotel for you but if you want to be close to everything is certainly is the place to be. Easy walking distance to almost anywhere in the CBD including The Rocks, Darling Harbour and Circular Quay. Rooms are good, comfortable and up to Westin standards, staff are courteous, helpful and friendly. The restaurant breakfast buffet is one of the best hotel breakfasts I have experienced, good quality food, fresh and well presented. Stay here if you want a central location with good standards of accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lov2getaway
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel and loved it....the best hotel we have stayed at in Sydney. The room was located on the 24th floor and faced the clock tower which gave us great views over the city and glimpses of the water. The rooms were so quiet...which gave us good night sleep after very busy days. Our room had 2 very comfortably double beds and we were allowed to have 2 adults and 2 children in 1 room, which is becoming hard to do in some hotels. As other reviewers have said the bathroom is big and beautiful...the kids really enjoyed watching TV from the bath...they could even hear it through the speaker in the ceiling of the bathroom. The quality of the linen was beautiful, the towels were large and so soft. Breakfast was included in our room rate and the variety and quality was great. The location was fantastic an easy walk to the shops, Darling Harbour and to Circular Quay. We found the staff to be friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great building, service somewhat cold”
Reviews.Author: kwon123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, luxurious and cool. Stayed for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon. Our room on a higher floor was not ready when we arrived at 1 p.m but we were offered a pretty decent room on the 11th floor which was large and faced the clocktower. The room was superb, the bathroom was very cool and the bed was just heavenly (we went to a few starwood hotels after this and thought we had the best sleep here!) Location was great, close to all the sights and sounds as well as shopping. Received a welcome/ congratulations dessert and bubbles on our first night, was a nice touch. Breakfast, just superb with a great range of hot and cold food, was just excellent! Anyways, staff were a tad bit cold, professional but cold. Concierge were almost bordering on rude which is quite sad for a hotel of such class. Ah well, at least the front desk was professional enough and breakfast staff actually smiled. Overall, a pleasent stay and I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: aglazer
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, nice rooms, great location. All the rooms were incredibly comfortable. Highly recommended - my favorite hotel in Sydney by far. Stayed here a total of three times during a two week trip. First room was on the 5th floor, which was fine but had an inside view. Second room was on the 27th floor and had a beautiful view of the city. Final room was on a low floor in the "Heritage Wing", which the front desk described as "unique" but other than having a bit of brick looked like a standard (but nice) room. All stays were on SPG points or points+cash so can't speak to actual room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Expecations Exceeded”
Reviews.Author: SuzandGee
Reviews.Content: As I have previously commented adversely on another Westin property, I feel obliged to commend the Westin Sydney on my recent experience on a five day business stay, having found a very favourable Expedia rate which included breakast. I couldn't find a negative!! The front desk staff and concierge were polite and efficient. The room had a great feel and was well serviced efficiently with all supplies replenished. Oh, GREAT towels!! Breakfast was excellent with great variery to service all tastes. All staff that I experienced were a credit to the hotel and management and th property is well positioned to other hotels, the CBD and the Quay. Well done, Westin!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: happygilmoregolf
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a fantastic hotel - expensive, but a really great hotel experience. The rooms are large and inviting, and the bathrooms are massive. My friends and I booked five rooms at the Westin, some standard tower and some deluxe tower rooms. Both were fairly similar, and had massive bathrooms. The rooms were large, modern and fresh, and very businesslike. Bed was very comfortable and soft, and pillow menu was extensive. We had a view of the clock tower from the large windows in our room. The hotel's location is close to all the main districts of town, shopping, restaurants, night clubs, circular quay - all close by. Room service is very expensive, as is everything at this hotel. A plate of chips was $18. Valet parking is $54 a night! Great variety in the mini bar, but expensive. We had the buffet breakfast in Mosaic restaurant the next morning. It was good, but not as good as many of the other 5 star hotel breakfasts in the city. Overall, this hotel is easily the best in town and I would highly recommend the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep in a hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: lucytartan
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Westin - booked via a Wotif secret hotel discount reservation. On the basis of this experience I'm always going to take the secret hotel whenever it's offered. This was the most comfortable hotel room I've ever stayed in - the bed was exceptional. I had the best nights' sleep in memory. The furnishings and layout of the room are comfortable and relaxing. The bathroom was very good, although not as clean as I would expect - the marble tiling had splotches and even smears upon it which were camouflaged by the veining in the marble, but not so much that you couldn't see them and feel a little bit grossed out. Still, I really did enjoy staying here and wouldn't hesitate to stay again. I can't comment upon service really since we didn't ask for any, used our own internet etc.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD TIME AT THE WESTIN”
Reviews.Author: Ellie144
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Westin for 5 nights March 2010, had the best time there, room great,slept like a log, breakfast very good, everything that you could think of. It was my husbands 50th birthday so they sent up a bottle of champayne. Next time we go to sydney that is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “great spot in central sydney”
Reviews.Author: abotel
Reviews.Content: Modern, well appointed hotel with nice sized rooms & bathrooms in great location for exploring Sydney. Easy walk to shopping. opera house & Sydney harbor. Service is excellent & concierges very helpful. View from hotel is of downtown rather than harbor,hotel food, although reasonably good , is expensive ; business center is rudimentary but free wifi available from lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNiks
Reviews.Content: The Westin never disappoints! A friend and I had been taveling around Australia mostly staying in Hostels. After roughing it in the outback, we decided to treat ourselves to a nice Hotel for our last stop in Oz, Sydney. What a treat! Beautiful hotel with a great location. The staff was very accommodating and helped us setting up our bridge climb. They have a great office with computers and FREE internet! After raking up a good $100 in internet use during our trip, it was nice to have not only computers aval. to use but for free! They have printers as well and it's a very quiet area.

Reviews.Title: “nice but amora and shangrala are nicer and cheaper”
Reviews.Author: lusloan
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the westin for 1 night and it was lovely and clean etc but when I compare it to Amora and the Shangrala it didnt live up to paying over $100 a night extra. The bed was small, my husbands feet were hanging over the edge and hes not that tall.There was no bed turn down as you would expect in a place like this and no change of towels in the evening. Nice but i would pay less and get better service at the other 5*plus hotels

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to write home about...”
Reviews.Author: GingerHongKong
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin twice over the past 3 months. Each time, for more than 1 week. I have to say that it's okay in terms when compared to other Sydney hotels... but disappointing when compared to Asian hotels. The prime issue is the service. There isn't a service mentality like in Asian hotels so it never feels 'special' or anything other than a place to sleep and eat. None of the employees ever tried to do anything other than their job or to make my stay special in any way. No one to greet you at the door and say 'hello'. No one even says 'good morning' when you walk past. When I asked for a recommendation on restaurants, the concierge didn't have too much of an opinion and just gave me the phone number for a restaurant that I suggested without offering to phone them to make the reservation. I would think that's 5 star hotel '101' - to help make reservations. The room is good - lovely big bathroom, comfy bed, etc. Good location - close to Pitt St mall and to CBD offices. As I said above though... really missing something in terms of training staff to make guests feel anything other than paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: McCann-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel in a good location. Unfortunately we were unable to check in until after 3pm due to the hotel being full; however we were allocated a nice room overlooking the famous Clock Tower. Free 24 hr Wi-Fi was available at the business centre and allowed us to check-in for our flights. The Westin is very much a business hotel but located within easy reach of all of Sydneyâ€™s main attractions and some very nice restaurants. A comfortable stay in a nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good base for short stop in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: jo1970Singapore
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights between trips North and South. The first night was on points and the staff were extremely helpful. We asked to extend our stay for another night on check in and although the staff tried, were unable to get us into a King bed room for the second night. The hotel was overbooked so although it was annoying to change rooms, the staff moved all our bags for us when we were out during the day. Both rooms we had were light, spacious and clean. I had no problems with the layout and the beds were very comfortable (Heavenly beds). Bathroom has a glass divider to main part of the room but there is a privacy shade if you like... Good pressure in shower and seperate toilet. It's just a short walk from the hotel to many shops and restaurants which was great. If you like steak, try Kingsley's steakhouse as it remains one of the best in the world although open for years. Valet parking was not cheap but it was prompt and worth it. Driving to the hotel is pretty good given it is in the heart of the city - just try and avoid peak times to save any aggro. The gym was good. Yes, it takes a little while to get there but the equipment was excellent and plenty of it. I do not mind that the gym is run independently of the hotel as it means that people in there are there to work out which I find motivating. The hotel room also clearly has a few signs to remind you to take your own towel if you go to the gym to avoid a fee for towel service. Overall a great stay and excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: helsie57
Reviews.Content: Wonderful light room, fabulous bed & bedding made it even better. Great location, staff friendly and helpful. Really could not fault anything.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell890
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my sister and her 14month old daughter and stayed one night. Service was terrific, friendly and very helpful. We were able to check-in early which was good as baby was due for a sleep. Our room was very nice, had two very comfortable double beds and a proper cot for bub. Bathroom and the bath was just bliss. A little more room in the fridge would of been nice though. The buffet breakfast was delicious. The only disappointment was that the pool closed early on Sunday evening and that was the time that I thought would be most suitable to take baby for a swim. Hoping to tire her so she would sleep well through the night and not disturb anyone. She still slept well anyway.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: countryNSWBam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night before we headed overseas. I usually stay at the sofitel wentworth or the sheraton but will now be staying at the Westin. The rooms are larger than the sofitel and sheraton and the hotel is spotless. The staff are all friendly and the hotels location is great. You can get a good deal on the the room rates if you book well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: scoke07
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at Westin Sydney to celebrate the new year. The room we stayed in was huge and well equipped. A beautiful hotel with many amenities. The hotel is well situated within walking distance to The Rocks and Circular Quay. A few downsides though, huge hotel with only 3 computers to access the internet, only 2 computers worked throughout our 5 night stay. The view from our room was the side of an office block. Despite these issues we had a great time and would recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Service”
Reviews.Author: BellTrav
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 5 day stay. Rooms very comfortable and quiet. Enjoyed the free internet in the lobby. Staff very accomodating. Good food/bafrs in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: daisybooSussex_
Reviews.Content: We had been looking for a hotel in Sydney for some time and got ourselves thoroughly confused as there was too much choice and they all seemed quite pricey! We eventually found a good deal at the Westin via Octopus travel as it included breakfast which we found was really good as eating out in Sydney is not cheap. We looked at the price of some of the breakfasts in nearby cafes and they were on average about $25 per person. We cannot fault the breakfast at the Westin...there was nothing missing from fruit and continental breakfast to full English and freshly made omlettes. The Westin seemed to be very much a business hotel but this was not a problem. It is ideally located about 8-10 mins walk of Circular Quay, the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. It is also right on the edge of the main shopping area where there are a number of cafes etc. The room (21st floor) didnt have a great view ( city view) but then we were hardly in the room so this just didnt matter. The room was exceptionally clean and spacious with one of the most comfy beds I have ever slept in. It was also very quiet. The service we had was excellent and I cannot recommned this hotel enough. I emailed the concierge just before we left the UK to ask about how to get from airport to the hotel etc and they replied very quickly and couldnt have been more helpful. We stayed 3 nights and it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Westin - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Flash123Cork
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful 3 week + Honeymoon in Austrialia - our stay in the Westin was the first hotel of our stay and wow did they set the bar high. We arrived about 9ish, we got a taxi from the airport but it was expensive and the train station is very close by to get the airport express (which we did on our way out), easy check-in & only mentioned that we were on our HM as I signed the registry with my maiden name by mistake. The room was a corner room so lots of windows and a fabulous big bed. Big tropical shower & really lovely shampoos etc. We headed straight out to see the Harbour (Opera house alone was worth the 24 hours of travelling). The area of the hotel is great, there are closer hotels to the harbour but we really like the fact that it was near the park and food courts. Sydney was more expensive than we though it would be but we did spend most of our time downtown so to be expected. The next day when we came back there was a bottle of champers in the room and some deserts with congratulations in icing - really nice touch. On Oz day we took the champers to the park and had it in the sunshine. All in all we had a really great stay in the Westin, couldn't fault a thing (apart from the ten dollar glass of beer in the lobby, yikkies!!!)

Reviews.Title: “great location in the middle of the city”
Reviews.Author: bruindan2000
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the westin sydney for the last night of our honeymoon in australia. we stayed at the shangri-la hotel, which is located in the rocks area, a week earlier. when comparing the two hotels, the main difference is the location. the westin sydney is in the heart of downtown close to darling harbour, chinatown, and the main shopping district. we found the westin sydney to have an overall better location with more dining and entertainment options. we really felt the city's vibrant energy at the westin. the hotel itself is what you would expect from the westin brand: luxurious amenities, great service, and the heavenly bed and bath products. we stayed in a tower room that is ultra-modern with a large flat screen tv with electronic controls for everything. the bathroom was also modern with glass doors for the toilet and shower room. the bath tub has a window type feature that opens out. the room itself though is rather small. the staff offered us excellent service and hospitality. the bellhop brought up our luggage and gave us a tour of our room. it was a nice gesture as the room itself is high-tech with a lot of cool gadgets. all in all, i recommend the westin sydney as a good base to explore the city. circular quay, the opera house and the harbour bridge is a 30 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury - Did not want to leave after 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: FunkyIngy
Reviews.Content: Very Fast checkin ! The grand foyer was impressive our room was even more breathtaking! Loved it loved it loved it. They had very friendly and helpful staff from the Valets to the mosaic breakfast staff. They even allow you to request fresh linens after the first night. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin, Highly recommended and we would definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in the center”
Reviews.Author: nn510
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for pleasure, and decided on the Westin since we've always had great experience. No different with this location in Sydney. While you felt the hotel was mostly used by business travelers given its location, we loved staying here. The gym is great, the breakfast in the am, amazing. And its central location was perfect for what we needed. We walked or hopped on a bus from locations close to the hotel Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly hotel”
Reviews.Author: KiwigirlNZ
Reviews.Content: This really is a gorgeous place to stay - top notch professional staff willing and able; divine bathrooms, thoughtful layout and furniture to make you feel like you are at home and in comfort. It's great when a hotel room makes you feel so relaxed and you don't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations”
Reviews.Author: ldm09
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for a night to celebrate our wedding anniversary and could not have asked for anything better. Checking in was fuss-free and very welcoming - I liked it how the lady at the desk took the effort to come over to our side of the desk to hand over the keys and point out where the lifts were. More importantly she did so with genuine warmth and smiles, something I find to be lacking in many five star hotels today (which can often be polite but cold and sterile). I had put in a request for a high floor but did not expect to get it, considering how we had an extremely good deal ($225 including breakfast) from the website, but once again we were astounded to find ourselves on the 21st floor with a fantastic view of the clocktower right in front of our window. The decor was very impressive and modern, and the Bose speakers a very nice touch. The room was quite a bit smaller than at the Sheraton on the Park, but it was done up so nicely that it didn't really matter after all. We had a massage at Endota spa which was just average (but technically not part of the Westin) - next time I will perhaps consider having one of those in-room massages advertised on their website instead. The next morning, we were also very pleasantly surprised with a congratulatory note, followed by a bottle of champers and a plate of beautiful pastries. Buffet breakkie was fantastic with a generous range of hot dishes, fresh fruits, and some very interesting juice shots. I will definitely be back again and will consider staying at other Westin hotels interstate/internationally when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegal15
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 lovely nights and days at the Westin last weekend. We booked a package that included breakfast for $260 per night. On arrival, we were upgraded to a lovely room with a view on the 24th floor of the Tower Wing. From the moment we arrived until we left, the service was impeccable. The Westin in Martin Place is in a great position, handy for walking to Circular Quay, the Rocks, Opera House, Botanical Gardens etc. The other way it is close to the shops, Hyde Park and Darling Harbour. There are restaurants on the lower ground floor which are separate to the hotel. We had a lovely meal at the Spanish restaurant - Postales - on Saturday night. On Sunday night we had an excellent meal at the hotel's Mosaic Cafe. On Monday we caught the ferry to Watson's Bay and had lunch at Doyles, something we do every time we visit Sydney. The breakfast was superb. Lovely fresh fruits and berries, juices, cereals, loads of hot dishes plus eggs cooked to order, salmon, cheeses and the crustiest of sour dough breads which you can cut to order, pastries and a coffee machine that makes quite a good cappuccino or latte as well as the normal coffee and tea. The bed was just so comfortable and the pillows were great. It was extremely hard to wake up each morning. The bath also is a good size and just the right shape. All in all it was a wonderful 3 day break which we enjoyed immensely and we will return again to this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontyB2
Reviews.Content: You really can't fault the Westin Hotel in Sydney. It is the 3rd time I have visited and the staff are exceptional, the hotel is spotless, the food is delicious and the location is superb. Parking at AUD49 a night seems a bit pricey but suppose that is the price you pay for the middle of the city. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel well located for Darling Harbour and Circular Quay”
Reviews.Author: bevandmark2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights over New Year. It was expensive (but so is everywhere at New Year in Sydney) but we got a decent deal on Expedia. The room was good, great bed and decent bathroom, overlooking the clock and the Xmas tree. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment on the food. Internet access is an additional cost in the room but free WiFi is available in the lobby. We can recommend spending New Years Eve on a boat. We were on the James Craig - we had a fabulous time and wonderful view of the fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SFLeonce
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Sydney with my partner, over New Years Eve 2009, and we enjoyed every minute of it. As a SPG Platinum guest I received an email shortly before the stay apologizing that they would not be able to upgrade me this time due to high demand over New Years Eve, but that I would receive all other amenities as usual - understandably and fair. The Tower room was nice, clean and spacious. Very nice touch to have a large glass-wall between the bathroom and the bedroom with a view. We have seen one of the suites and I am happy we did not get upgraded, the rooms are so much nicer. The executive lounge was very nice, though constantly overrun during this busy time (it was just too small to deal with the amount of people that stayed at the hotel this time of year). The staff was wonderful, very attentive and remembered what we drank after the first day. Every day they served some delicious little appetizers and offered a cheese buffet in the evening and a complete breakfast in the morning. We also had dinner at the hotel restaurant one night and very much enjoyed the food, especially the fish dishes. The service could have been a bit more attentive, but overall it was a nice experience. The gym is not your typical hotel gym as it is run by an outside company and accessible for hotel guests. It comes fully equipped with all the machines one needs and a lap pool - great! Overall, we enjoyed our five nights at the Westin and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BenDoran
Reviews.Content: Can't really fault this place. We got a good price using SPG points, excellent location, very nice rooms and fantastic service. Free use of the gym and the internet is another plus. Only really lost a mark as it's a chain and as such doesn't have much of a soul...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Family
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney at the Tower Deluxe room, and we loved it. Check-in was great, and I was greeted by name. The hotel lobby was beautiful, and adjoining it is the GPO, with several restaurants and cafe's. Our room was spacious, and the bathroom was spectacular with a glass window separating it from the room itself (with an automatic blind if you require privacy). The Heavenly bed was very comfortable. We enjoyed dining at the Mosaic restaurant, with some memorable and unique dishes. But the location is the best part - situated right on Martin Place, and it is about one minute's walk to the Pitt Street Mall. We went to the Theatre Royal for a show, and that took even less time to walk. Circular Quay is only about five minutes away on foot, and some of the world class restaurants are within a short walking distance, too. You can't have a better hotel to base yourself during your trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Legend of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akl_traveler36
Reviews.Content: The Westin is just an amazing hotel. The location in the city is superb, everything is within walking distance. The quality and professionally of the staff is excellent. The rooms might not be cheap, but you get what you pay for. We had a corner room, overlooking the innercity, great views. Room was nice and tidy and the beds are just awesome. Best hotel beds i've ever slept in. We had a big room and even bigger bathroom, separate shower and bath. We weren't happy with the quality of food in the Mosiac restaurant, probably only interesting to eat in if its included in your hotel package. Otherwise its to expensive and quality lacks. We had a swim in the pool, which was nice, but it could do with a bit of better lighting, bit of a dark place to swim. Staff was very helpful in getting us a room quickly as we arrived at 10am, and sure enough we were able to put the stuff in our room at 12. Would recommend it to anybody. Oh and free wifi internet for 24 hours, which is a big plus. And if you clear you're browsers cookies, you're able to get another 24 ;)

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, good location, connecting rooms great for kids”
Reviews.Author: CharlieNorthLondon
Reviews.Content: Right in the centre of the business district, but 5 mins walk from the Botannical gardens, 10 mins from the wharf, and staff who found us a room hours early which my exhausted family needed after a long flight from HK. Very smart - almost too smart for our children - but worked v well for us all.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: fishle
Reviews.Content: We stayed again here for New Year's Eve and it was just wonderful. The hotel is perfectly located to access all the nice firework watching spots and you can walk easily everywhere. The furniture are tasteful and modern, large TV screen very comfy bed and nice large bath towels. This time we had a room in the "tower" facing the atrium. This meant we didn't get much from the noise of the street that night at all. However I would prefer the rooms in the old part of the building as they are a little bit more charming and bigger. For me this is the best hotel in Sydney. I stayed at a few of the 5 star ones and I am always happy to return to the Westin. We booked it as a mystery New Years Eve one-nighter. The best way to start the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay- extremely clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jasmine05
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my partner for one night and we thought the Westin was great. The lady who checked us in at reception was friendly and allocated us a room on the 27th floor (which is nearly the top level & I didn't even have to ask!). This meant the room was very quiet being so high up and we were facing the clock tower (which we only heard once during the day, we didnt hear anything at night.) We stayed in a deluxe tower room (which is the Westin's most basic room, but still very nice). Everything was spotlessly clean and was in an 'as new' condition- the room amenities/furnishings are the usual ie desk, a chair, a couple of paintings etc. The highlight is the bathroom with a window separating the bathroom from the bedroom so that you can soak in the deep plunge bath whilst having a view of the bedroom. The shower is large & in a separate cubicle and has the option of a rainwater style shower head with great pressure or you can use the 2nd shower head which has a cord and massage head. The toilet is also in a separate cubicle which is rarely the case in a hotel room. The bed was comfy and sheets were very fresh & clean. Our only complaint was the pillows were uncomfortable- we were supplied with a duck feather pillow and another pillow which was very thick/puffy. Both of us had sore necks in the morning- the thick pillow puts your head at too high an angle, whereas with the feather pillow your head sinks down too low and there is no neck support. Admittedly we are very fussy with our pillows and rarely find a hotel that uses comfortable & supportive pillows! Breakfast was a buffet for $42 each, which is very pricey but we found it to be quite nice with a pretty large selection. There were a couple of issues however- the table we were allocated was uneven and rocking side to side as we ate. Also the coffee cup on the table was not clean and had lipstick stains & coffee stains as if it hadn't been washed. We complained and the cup was promptly changed. Also the coffee wasn't of very good quality- very bitter and burnt tasting. They seemed to just use one of those standard machines where you press 'cappaccino' or 'espresso', which was disappointing. We didn't use any of the hotel's facilities such as internet or pool, but we were happy enough with the check in/check out process and also our bags were stored for us while we did sightseeing before checkin at 2pm. We got a cheaper rate for our one night's stay, which we felt was reasonable for the quality of the room. I would recommend this hotel, especially for couples who want a bit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Top Tier Hotel - Bottom Tier Amenities”
Reviews.Author: GMKVancouver
Reviews.Content: Wow, beautiful lobby and all. But don't plan on going for a swim or sitting in the spa. What's called a pool is a grubby little cavern on the other side of the hotel about a mile away. No spa and towels are $5 each unless you bring one from your room (the hotel doesn't actually operate it)...and the lap pool is a dilapidated facility. Not what you expect from Westin...very disappointed for what I paid. Far better value and facilities down the road at the Marriott Sydney with close access to Circular Quay and the Opera House. We stayed there two weeks earlier with far better results.

Reviews.Title: “Five Stars for Incompetence!”
Reviews.Author: MsHotelConnoisseur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin over new years and lets just hope 2010 is better than our stay at the Westin. The Westin is overpriced ($650US for week leading up to new years), understaffed (16 hours to clear the room of dirty dishes despite TWO requests?!), and the farthest thing from a five star hotel. STRIKE ONE: Despite astronomical rates, the hotel nickels and dimes you for everything. $30 internet per day (that's the reason you see all the refugees in the lobby using the free wireless); $45 mediocre breakfast brunch and the best of all - AN AUTOMATIC $8 service charge for all room service orders. Everytime I ordered milk for my 2 year old toddler, the bill was actually $11.50 because of the $8 service charge. RIDICULOUS! STRIKE TWO: The service is atrocious from the manager down. We do not believe in airing complaints on a website like this without bringing them to management's attention so they have an opportunity to rectify them; however, in the case of the Westin, two separate managers were indifferent to our complaints and explained that we should expect poor slower service during busy times. One went so far to say that we were lucky to have a room at the Westin and if we were unhappy we should stay elsewhere next time. Unfortunately this attitude is reflected in the concierge, bellhops, waitstaff, etc. STRIKE THREE: The concierges were absolutely useless. They had never heard of a bagel place one street away from the hotel; left out KEY pieces of information (e.g. you have to have a PREPAID ticket to board the bus); and were impossible to get a hold of (shortest time we waited to have the concierge pick up the phone was 12 minutes). STRIKE FOUR: There is no benefit to being a SPG member. We are gold members and were told that there was no upgrade available despite our friends being upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite that same day. We have stayed at 5 of Conde Naste's top hotels in the world. The Westin Sydney doesn't come close to any of those hotels and in reality we have never paid so much for so little.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: jtatenyc
Reviews.Content: I've never seen a world class hotel have such terrible service, completely unknowledgeable concierge, and an utterly unhelpful front desk. While the Westin rooms and beds certainly live up to their high class reputation, the people working at the Westin fall far short. The price for room service was beyond absurd, as were the dining prices. Also, the concierge directed us to an overpriced and bland restaurant in the Rocks called The Rocks Cafe (granted, we've heard most restaurants in this area are overpriced though not inedible.). Another absurd upcharge was the internet service, which the Westin thought appropriate to charge us $30/day for. NB: if you are there for more than a few days, but a broadband card at the post office for $80, and a $15 card to pay as you go. Much better deal. We are using our Virgin Mobile card now. When we asked the concierge how to get to Kings Cross, he first suggested that we take a taxi, when the easiest way was likely the subway (aside from the fact that it was only a 15 minute walk to begin with.). Concierge had no idea what the cost of the subway was, or whether it was a good deal to get a weekly pass. Additionally, we asked a different concierge how to get to Newtown. He also recommended first, that we travel by taxi in a surly manner. After we insisted on public transit, he told us the wrong street to catch the bus, which also was two blocks away and incredibly simple to use. NB: get a weekly pass if you're there for more than a few days and plan to take public transit. it's $47 for the week, taxis are overpriced, and the pass includes trains, buses, and ferries all over the city. Great deal. We also requested that the concierge book us a reservation at a nice restaurant before we saw a show at the Opera House. He said he would do this and leave us a note confirming our table. Obviously this was too difficult of a task. Finally, our room was not properly cleaned until i called to complain after three days of terrible service. They did start cleaning the room better once I notified them. On a positive note, we have not slept better than in the Westin beds. The shower is fabulous, as is the bathtub. The room is spacious, and while we didn't have a view of the street, the clock tower was nice. Make sure to get a room on the 7th floor or higher, as you will not have a good view otherwise. Also, free fitness center was also great. Personal TVs on cardio machines. Great room, terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel awesome bed & bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Ubu76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Boxing Day with our 2 sons (5yrs & 6mths) and were not disappointed. Booked a tower deluxe room and even with our own travel cot and hotel fold-up bed had plenty of room. Nice clean room, decor nothing fancy but nice, lots of storage space, great view of clock (only heard it chime once thankfully) but the bed & bathroom were fabulous. Have never slept so comfortably in a hotel bed and I've stayed in numerous 5 star hotels around the world. The bathroom was magnificent - glass wall between bathroom and bedroom with mechanical blind for privacy, bathtub perfectly positioned so you could watch & hear TV from the bath, 2 separate glass doors within the bathroom hid away the shower and toilet and lots of beautiful toiletries. Breakfast was great, nice selection of typical continental breakfast and lots of fresh fruit! Great location for Pitt St & QVB shopping, Martin Place, Wynyard, George St cinemas and fairly close to Chinatown and Circular Quay. Only complaint would be the pool - it was located in heritage section and we had to go up and down numerous flights of stairs in different locations before arriving at the pool which was more of a lap pool than anything. Nothing bad about it but compared to Sheraton and Shangri-La pools this was a let down. Overall however our stay was magnificent and will definitely return to this hotel either with or without the kids - although not on first day of Christmas sales as the chaos in Myer and other shops even at 10:30pm was ridiculous!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: hayleyep
Reviews.Content: Went here for a romantic getaway in Sydney and couldn't really fault it. Stayed in the Heritage side of the building and everything was beautiful. Very friendly staff who were more than eager to help out in anyway. Housekeeping and room service was excellent. Bit of a walk to the pool and gym but was staff were very helpful when you got there. Gret location, close to everything in Sydney. Only complaint would be the lack of free parking, $49 a night to park, whereas some other hotels have this included.

Reviews.Title: “never disappointing”
Reviews.Author: carinasydney
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin 4 or so times, and it never disappoints. Always clean, extremely comfortable beds and I just love the glass bathrooms. The only complaint I have is that the street frontage is almost impossible to find if you're driving in. And the staff aren't always the most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jetfixersfo
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Im an SPG member and booked with points. We're given a larger room on check in and had the clock tower in front of our window. Wonderful architecture of the Grand Post Office or GPO as they call it. If you want reasonable eats.. exit the hotel on Pitt St. and cross the street directly to a small alley Howe St. into the MLC center there's a food court. 8-9 dollars per item. In a pinch late at night turn left on Pitt St. half a block there's a PizzaHut.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, food not so great and pity about the poor service”
Reviews.Author: FDanvers
Reviews.Content: Very nice room with great bathroom (rainforest shower and great bath with a view). Comfy bed with very crisp linen that smelled fresh and not dry-cleaned as often is the case. Room was large and was in a good state of maintenance and was kept very clean throughout my stay. Bathroom - something I am very particular about, in addition to the state of the bed - was totally spotless. The illusion that I was the first and only person ever to use the room - the feeling one should get in every hotel - was helped greatly through perfect maintenance and cleaning. Dinner at the Mosaic restaurant was of exceedingly poor quality added to which the restaurant had all the charm of a very cheap basement canteen. My table was lazily cleared in a nearly empty restaurant - many tables had not been cleared - and I was left with a sticky and downright dirty table. Paneling next to my table showed food smears that had not been recently made. Upon request the waiter wiped the table (using the second napkin) but left it every bit as sticky. Breakfast the next morning in the same restaurant showed in daylight in what a poor state the restaurant was. Inquired about a la carte menu at breakfast and told there was none; discovered on third morning that there indeed was an a la carte menu - I advise guests to go for this instead of the vastly overpriced buffet. Internet access was an eye-watering AU$30 a day! Free access in lobby. Generally the hotel is in a very good location. A short walk from the hotel to Circular Quay (The Rocks, Sydney Bridge, Opera House) or Darling Harbour (good choice of restaurants); 24-hour well-stocked supermarket round the corner (turn right at exit, make a right at the first street and go down escalator on next corner - vastly cheaper than minibar); David Jones food hall down the street has very good and very affordable choices for lunch and early dinner. Underground about a block and a half away from hotel which allows for very easy, very quick and very comfortable access to the airport. My main gripe apart from the very disappointing quality of the food was the poor service. Check-in was frosty and even haughty by someone who evidently did not think it necessary to make eye contact. We all have our bad days so I did not think too much of it, but I had an inquiry the following evening and talked to the same person and her demeanor was exactly the same, if not worse. Her colleague at check-out was worse and even downright snippy: when my bill had been settled, the invoice had been tucked in my bag and I was ready to leave but still had to ask for my credit card, his response was a very angry "in a minute!". I ordered tea in the lobby and waited for 20 minutes before calling the same waiter again, inquiring about my tea. He seemed to have no recollection of my order and left. Ten minutes later same thing. When I finally managed to draw his attention for a third time (lobby was quiet, no more than 3 or 4 other people at as many tables - funnily enough, all seemed to be there for the same reason I was, free internet access) he still seemed to have no memory of my order placed twice. By the way, tea never appeared. Ordered tea in my room the next evening, still waiting despite a return call and order placed again. On balance a nice hotel in a perfect location, room was pleasant and comfortable and worth the price. Food was hugely disappointing and not worth half the price, if that much. Service was the issue that made me decide I will most likely not return to the Westin Sydney soon if ever. For a vastly reduced price I would advise the Hilton right down the road. Sure, smaller rooms and tiny bathrooms, but a vastly better breakfast buffet (included in price of room) and not half the aggravation due to bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it for the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: spiderpig01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our wedding night in December. Living in Sydney I rarely ever stay in hotels but this one happened to be great! We checked in late, around 1130pm and it was fast and polite. We were upgraded to a better room (it had a desk and light) in the Tower block quite high up. I do not remember the level. When we got to our room there was a small dessert thing with Congratulations, a card from the GM and a bottle of bubbly on ice. Very very nice. But the bathroom is the true star. High ceilings, bathtub with views out of your window with an electric blind for privacy. The shower is a rainwater type with huge water flow rates - it was really special. The bed was immaculate and comfortable with lovely doona and pillows.
