Unfortunately we only stayed one night so did not dine in the hotel, but given its location, why would you bother when you can walk around Sydney? Checkout was smooth and fast, although we did note some queues earlier in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TCTroubador
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a first-class well-located hotel with amenities that all cost extra. No free wi-fi and a beer from the in-room mini-bar is $12. The rooms, at least the one we had, feature what is apparently a contemporary design for some hotels of a bathroom with glass walls - and a shade you can move down if you want. It's a very nice hotel if you are willing to pay the price or get deal. We paid for two nights and got the third free. Note: There is a grocery store outside, around the corner and down the basement where you can buy food, beer and wine at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: PikePlaceTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have absolutely no complaints about the Westin Sydney. I booked a room for a week based on an excellent promotional rate through Expedia. The Westin mostly caters to business travelers, but it's perfectly situated in the historic heart of Sydney's CBD for leisure travelers. Circular Quay is an easy walk, as is The Rocks, the Opera House, all of the key sites. It is also close to CBD train stations. My room was beautiful and very comfortable. I liked the modern design, including the glass wall between the bathroom and the main room. I detected no water temperature fluctuations, as one other reviewer commented. If I ever visit Sydney again, the Westin will be my home base.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sydney”
Reviews.Author: gate1973
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back this evening (Dec 24) after 3 weeks in Australia. We have been planning this trip for a couple of years. We flew in from Cairns last Saturday and the landing path took us right over Sydney Harbor on a crystal clear summer day. We have all seen travel photos of Sydney, but I kept saying that the actual views are more spectacular than any photo. The aerial view was breath taking. We stayed five nights at The Westin. Great location, amazing re-use of a very important Sydney landmark building, GPO. Service was indifferent, (I knew more about Sydney than the Concierge) the Heavenly Bed was polyester. Business Center was poor and not air-conditioned but the gym was first rate. I really think that staying away from Circular Quay gave us more of a feel for the City. The CQ is overrun with tourists and shops selling tourist crap. George and Pitt Street have all of the nice stores (David Jones food hall -not to be missed-wait for a seat at one of the counters for a well priced high quality meal.) Took in a play at The Opera House- $44 beats spending $135 for a tour. Do not miss the Sydney Architecture Walks (wed and sat) from the Museum of Sydney. These are a great way to learn about the history, politics, economics and of course architecture. Also took the Bonza Bike tour - was outstanding, a great way to cover lots of ground quickly- starts in The Rocks, follow the harbor around into the Observatory and then up and halfway across the Harbour Bridge -quick stop at a Rocks Pub and then over to Darling Harbor, ChinaTown and into Hyde Park-ANZAC Memorial, Hyde Park Barracks, Through the Domain, Potts Point, Botanical Gardens and Opera House. This was my highlight but I am a biker while it was the low light for my wife who was petrified all the time. The rides takes you through crowded pedestrian and vehicular areas and I would recommend this for people who are comfortable riding in traffic. We took many ferries rather than organized tours. Watsons Bay, not to be missed-walk along the sheer cliffs of the Heads-beautiful. Must walk along and above Bondi Beach and have a snack at Bondi. Ferry to Manly and walk to Shelly Beach and eat at The Kiosk. Manly Beach is a 2 mile crescent. Took Parramatta River Cat ferry just to experience the west side of the city. Another highlight-Sydney Harbor Kayaks, organized 4 hour tour of Middle Harbor from Mosman just under the Spit Bridge. Beautiful homes and unspoiled Park land all 5 KM from the Opera House. Middle Harbor was lake like for me, little boat traffic and totally protected from wind. Strongly recommend. Kayaking in Sydney Harbor would be reckless and crazy- unless you are very experienced-too much traffic. Took buses often- to U of Sydney-beautiful English like Quad worth the visit, Sydney Jewish Museum in Daringhurst -very well done and informative, and Surry Hills, away from tourists, a chance to see how real Sydneyites live. Funky but I found the street life lacking compared to SoHo in NYC. Food Recommendation: Pony in the Rocks- great meal. Ripples at Milson's Point. May be the best view in Sydney- is a cafe under the North end of the Bridge looking up at the Bridge and out at the Opera House. Food-so/so but view amazing. Shopping- My wife was not impressed. Stores all looked like NYC stores but more expensive. Same name labels. Very view things seem to be made in Oz so they are more expensive. Overall impression- I could see living in Sydney- NY commercial activity with a LA feel and weather. Beach and water activity would be a real plus and the people are the best. I can't wait to plan my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Perfect Staff, Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uesider
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin Sydney at 7 in the morning after 20 hours of flying from NY. When we checked in we were told that we have been upgraded to a suite (SPG Platinum member), however our room would not be ready until early afternoon since there was still a guest in it. They asked if we would like to go to the club on the 28th floor for breakfast and relax a bit. They also offered us towels and use of the spa if we would like to shower. As we were enjoying a wonderful breakfast the manager approached us and gave us a room key. He said our room was not ready, but had given us a standard room for the time being to shower and take a nap if we pleased. We walked into the standard room and were blown away. The room was huge, all glass, amazing bathroom. We could not imagine what the suite would be like. We took showers and headed out for the day. Upon our return our bags were moved to our suite and a bottle of champagne awaited us. More than all this, the location is perfect! We walked everywhere from the hotel. It is perfectly situated in the CBD and all major attractions are walkable. We started our trip at the Sydney Westin and will be returning to celebrate New Years Eve to end our trip at the Sydney Westin. This is a first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Room 303”
Reviews.Author: Krannyonline
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great hotel in an ... ... friendly and professional. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel - l would recommend the Westin and l will definately stay at this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “good service, good clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: NorthernHenry
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights after arriving from UK direct, room made available early, excellent standard, very modern, all mod cons that you'd need. Bathrooms particularly good. Location is ideal and central, o.k. not overlooking the harbour, but why pay more for that when its 5 min walk away. Breakfast buffet very extensive & included in our SPG rate. Extra's like bar drinks/ coffee etc very expensive. turn right out of hotel and 2nd block down an excellent coffee takeaway bar. Would stay again, as room really impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home: I didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: TravelingRam
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, updated, clean and very comfortable. They have "spa" bathrooms, which includes a large soaking tub. The bathroom is huge and they they provide large plush towels and robes. I stayed for 9 nights. The service was very friendly and fast. I felt very safe and actually enjoyed being in my room. Amenities: They have free wireless internet in the lobby only, otherwise broadband internet was $30/day. There's a public health club attached to the hotel which looked very nice, but I didn't use it. The pool is in the health club and it's very small. The restaurants are standard hotel restaurants; expensive and average food. However, there are restaurants in the lower level that are much better! Location: Central Business District. There aren't many restaurants, and those that are near close early. That was the biggest challenge - trying to find somewhere within walking distance after work. There is a lot of retail if that's what you like. It's about 20 minutes by taxi to Bondi Beach, and about a 1/2 hour walk to the Opera House. Overall, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great location and wonderful lounge”
Reviews.Author: stoulson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights on a Cash/Points basis through Starwood's Frequent Guest Program. Had a lovely 26ht floor room with floor to ceiling windows looking down on the Clock Tower of the old General Post Office building. The lobby interior of the hotel is in a portion of the old building, with lots of dramatic high ceilings. Our room was very large (even by Westin standards), with 2 Queens, a large desk area and sitting area. The bathroom is a bit different, with the tub having a glass wall looking directly into the bedroom and the floor to ceiling window views. There is a shade to lower for privacy. The shower and toilet are in 2 adjoining "stalls", with doors that open both ways. Both "stalls" are on the small side. Also the bathroom lights are on the wall outside of the bathroom, which was hard to remember. The location at One Martin Place is very convenient for the Central Business District, and to see the historic buildings on McQuarrie Street, and Hyde Park. It's several blocks walk to Circular Quay (10 minutes or so), or you can take the train from Wynard Station direct to Circular Quay. We really enjoyed the Executive Lounge, where we had a large breakfast each morning, and evening canapes and drinks before dinner. Fantastic views, great service, and a nice spread of food. Also took advantage of the free wi-fi in the Lounge. I stay at many Starwood properties on business, and this was one of the nicest Westin's in my experience. Sydney is a beautiful city with so much to do, that you usually don't spend much time in your hotel, but it is nice to come back to a comfortable bit of luxury after a long day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Dee28
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on a few previous occasions and had nothing to fault but was disappointed on this occasion. We had a tower room which was big, spacious and clean. Check-in was smooth and efficient. Our toilet would run non-stop when flushed and the internal lock had been removed from the door. I could cope with these minor details. My big whinge is about breakfast. Don't get me wrong the actual breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever experienced but the waiting time involved in getting a table was a joke. This morning I waited 25 minutes just to be seated and counted that there were 33 other people waiting for a table too. Whether this was due to the hotel being fully booked or a shortage of staff I don't know but a 25 minute wait for a breakfast table is not something that I expect when paying for a 5 star hotel. Whinge aside I'd still return to this hotel. The customer service is exceptional, location fantastic and comfort great. Please fix the breakfast problem to avoid disappointing other customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but is a bit overrated”
Reviews.Author: MissO73
Reviews.Content: Yes, the location is great but the service was not quite up to par....insanely expensive room service menu, the Internet connection and phone charges plus I had to call to get my room serviced by the house cleaning two days in a row. Not sure if I'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: penaltyshot
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a nicer hotel. The room was exceptional with a great bed and an awesome shower. The breakfast could not be beat. I wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic & luxurious hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: RocketAus
Reviews.Content: Went to Sydney for the night with my wife for a business function. Check in was easy with very nice staff. Rooms are beautiful with every luxury and AMAZING beds. Really can't ask for more. Buffet breakfast was a top international standard with plenty of options including a cook for special requests. Would happily stay there again - budget allowing!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Aussies”
Reviews.Author: mrsgoldilocks
Reviews.Content: I loved the room at the Westin. We always say it's our anniversary or our honeymoon and this time we were telling the truth! We were celebrating the first night of our honeymoon at the Westin in Sydney and the room was beautiful! They upgraded us for free and we were just a walk away from the Opera House and some of the best restaurants! Loved every fortunate minute we had there! Thank you Westin Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel in an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: ukstevens
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Sydney at the end of our 3 week trip to Singapore and Australia. The hotel is excellent, the room was large, very clean and very well appointed, we were on the 31st floor which afforded a nice view of the city skyline. We made use of the Westin Club lounge for breakfast which was great and exactly what what we needed before long days out doing 'tourist stuff'. All of the staff that we had dealings with (reception, concierge, lounge, housekeeping) were first class, highly proffesional, friendly and always very helpful. I have stayed in several Westin properties and I have to say this tops the others even though they are still good. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wishing to stay in central Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin was beautiful, luxurious and well located.”
Reviews.Author: txmanx
Reviews.Content: It is connected to the old post office building with the lovely clock tower but the Westin itself is a new highrise hotel not really visable from the street. It is the best of both worlds since you have the old world ambiance with everything a new, luxurious hotel has to offer. It is as nice as the photos depict and was within easy walking distance to Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, and China Town. The restaurant was expensive so we found food courts (in the underground malls) that offered a large selection for reasonable prices. If you have time, take the day bus tour to the Blue Mountains which includes a visit to Featherdale Wildlife Park to see and touch kangaroos and koalas.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied with Westin experience”
Reviews.Author: NettieB
Reviews.Content: Have just stayed in this hotel and was very pleased with my choice. On checking in after a long flight from the UK, I was pleasantly surprised with my room...it being very light and well furnished. The bathroom is a little different with glass walls facing into room....but there is a blind that comes down to hide your blushes! The bathroom has a large bath and seperate shower. I found the room extremely clean and well maintained. The Westin itself is right in the CBD district of Sydney. The large David Jones store is about one block up and there are plenty of cheap eateries in the Myer Mall. You are also only a 10-15min walk from Darling Harbour and all its restaurants and shops. Circular Quay and Opera House are once again only about 10-15min walk. I would definately stay here again. As a women travelling on her own, I felt completely safe staying at this hotel. As safety of area, I did'nt venture out too late and feel that like when staying in any city you just need to be aware of areas that have a bad reputation...the CBD did'nt give me any concerns. A big thumbs up to Westin!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel but lacks customer service "big time"”
Reviews.Author: vivi5
Reviews.Content: First stop in Australia on a months holiday. Very comfortable rooms, wonderful beds and excellent breakfast. There is free wi-fi in the loby and also free internett access in the business centre which is a big bonus. The Westin is in a very central location easy access to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay and all the main tourist sights. The Hotel also has access to trendy bars and restaurants (not owned by Hotel) on the lower ground floor which served good food at reasonable prices. The main criticisim we have is the frontline staff, they need to be friendlier, we found the concierge was not at all helpful and the reservation staff spent most of the time with their heads in computers and never acknowledged guests unless you went up to the desks. We just felt as if they were doing their jobs but had no interest in customer service. We would most definitely stay at this hotel if we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “LIves up to its reputation, some minor shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Kramax
Reviews.Content: I had a recent 4 night stay at the Westin. Firstly, some reviews refer to the staff being snobby. I found that all the staff I had dealings with from start to finish were excellent, professional and friendly. I could not fault them. I had a larger than normal room which was spotless when I arrived. The TV was great, easy to use. The room had a view over the GPO clock and George Street. The window coverings were great, clock radio etc all easy to use, which is sometimes rare in a hotel. Cable channels were generous, acknowledging that there are female guests who don't want to watch sport. Bathroom was large and had lovely products. Hairdryer was great, not one of those cheap, small ones mostly used by hotels. The only two complaints I have was the size of room service meals - the quail breast, sorry chicken breast - they must breed small chickens in Sydney for a cost of $50 was about 5 mouthfuls. I think the cook trimmed it to within an inch of his life. All the room service meals were too costly, but standard for Sydney. Scrambled eggs in the morning were way too runny and had barely hit the heat, very disappointing. Other than that, no issues. Room cleaning for this hotel was a little below par, soap dish was never cleaned, nor used soap replaced. Sink etc were barely wiped. In most hotels this wouldnt rate a mention by me, but at the Westin it was surprising. I highly recommend this hotel for its service, location, friendly staff and the lovely rooms. Especially if you love quail breast!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: aimlesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night our last night in Australia. Not as great a location as the Sheraton on the Park. It is a 5 minute walk from the Wynard train station which we took in from the airport. A little hard to find a way in on the George street side. The lobby wasn't much as it was part of the building which housed other offices. I think I really liked this hotel because we got upgraded to an executive level room (I'm only a gold preferred) on the 30th floor, right below the top floor. The view was probably as good as it gets on a 31 story building amongst higher buildings. The room was very nice and large with floor to ceiling windows. Of course, the Heavenly bed was nice. I only wish we could've stayed longer (but then we probably wouldn't have been upgraded to such a nice room). The front staff was very friendly. Separate bath. Shower also had option of rain shower in addition to the handheld handle (is this now standard? Also had this in the Westin in Fiji). I tried to use wifi in the lobby. When I tried to connect to a page, it brought up a message that offered one complimentary day use of the wifi. This would ordinarily be a charge. Would definitely stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pvdg
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times and had high expectations on my return, which I am glad to say were met in every way. The service is friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed and still in very good shape - looks like a refurb has just happened, but I would imagine it is just well kept. I won't really comment on the price of the rooms or the restaurants and bars as the reason you come to this hotel is not for a discount experience! i would recommend to anyone especially for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: lbh3spreadem
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Sydney and stayed at the Westin for 4 days. The customer service was top notch as soon as I walked onto the property. Check-in was fast and easy (as well as check-out). The hotel lobby, restaurant and room was immaculate! The bed was extremely comfortable, along with the pillow and comforter. Had a view of a clock tower from my room. The bathtub was large and the way the room is set up, you could watch tv from the tub! I loved this hotel so much that I returned after traveling around Australia for an extra 2 days of comfort before my flight home. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: diverej
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney was a great place to stay, the service was excellent, the rooms were awsome (clean, modern, comfortable beds). It's located such that you can walk to pretty much anywhere in downtown Sydney. I would definitely recommen and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrianTMcginty
Reviews.Content: Rooms are amazing! Westin has the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. Food is excellent! Very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, not so beautiful staff .....”
Reviews.Author: KezzaKKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights here at the beginning of October 09. I was very impressed with the room (Superior King ) in the main tower. Great view of the old Post Office clock. Wonderful bed, reasonably spacious room beautifully finished. Desk area easily doubles as a dining table for two. Flat screen TV with reasonable choice of channels and movies which weren't overly expensive. Bathroom with glass division to bedroom is wonderful. Large walk-in shower with rainfall/monsoon head and separate hand shower. Plentiful towels, separate bath, separate WC cubicle. Excellent. Breakfast ... extensive selection of food on offer vast majority of which is extremely good. Egg station will guarantee fresh omelettes, fried and poached eggs but don't rely on any other 'hot' foods actually being hot! Great location, central to most things in Sydney whether you're there for business or leisure. Approx 10 minutes to Darling Harbour, approx 10 minutes to Circular Quay. About 2 minutes to Wynyard station. There's a charge for use of internet in the room but there's a small business centre in the heritage building with 3 PCs and a laptop point - free for guests (access via card swipe). Caution: main hotel entrance is NOT in Martin Place as suggested by their address, it's in Castlereagh Street. Now the negatives! As with other reviews I did find the overall attitude by staff was somewhat unacceptable. Check-in was efficient but impersonal. My experiences at the Concierge desk however were generally good - helpful and polite, although when I wished to discuss a problem with a duty manager I was treated a little differently. The concierge on duty at the time seemed disinterested in my request and the duty manager treated me disrespectfully by keeping me waiting for more than 15 minutes whilst he checked guests in (despite having agreed to see me at a specific time). I gave in waiting and spoke to another duty manager later in the day who was apologetic but seemed unconcerned at the way I was treated. I expect to receive courteous, professional treatment wherever I stay because I'm a paying guest and not because I'm an SPG member. Equally so I will always treat staff with a similar level of respect. The staff overall were polite but you get the impression it's because it's their job to be polite and not because they want to be! The singular exception was a 'lowly' bell hop, who was genuinely warm and friendly. A previous reviewer complained about the long walk to the gym which amused me as I often wonder about people who visit my local gym and clamour to park as near to the entrance as possible to avoid walking further than necessary! It probably takes a minute longer to reach this gym than it would if it were integral to the hotel itself. The gym IS a public gym next door to the hotel but this means that there's a very comprehensive range of equipment available along with personal trainers (if required, at extra cost). I've stayed in so many hotels with 'gyms' that are hardly worthy of the description and bearing in mind that the use of this gym is free to Westin guests I would see it as a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “location location location!”
Reviews.Author: aspironz
Reviews.Content: got put in tower room 1115 special rate, very comfortable place after some serious retail therapy and night out boogie. The refurbished GPO glass lobby is stylish yet charming. cant ask for more

Reviews.Title: “Less than Expected”
Reviews.Author: camsean
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is located in the former GPO building on Martin Place in the centre of the city. I had booked this hotel a treat for my Aunt to celebrate her birthday. Our deluxe tower room was as you would expect of a 5 star hotel, with all the usual amenities. It was vry well maintained and the views of the city were nice. However, the service in the hotel was less impressive. I had told the hotel of the special event we were celebrating and they were kind enough to deliver a small cake and a note to our room. However, it was addressed to me, and not my Aunt, which seemed a little careless. This attitude seemed to be common to hotel staff. The person who checked us in wasn't friendly, and nor were any of the staff we came into with. I particularly didn't like being made to wait at check-out whilst they checked the room to se that we hadn't made off with anything from the mini-bar. As a gold spg member I have rarely been treated in such a disrepectful manner. As with a previous poster, I was glad that I had used points for this stay and not paid the full rate. Overall, Sydney offers better hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: carberrie
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice with 5-Star service! Because this is in Australia, no need to tip everyone like in the USA! If you have PLAT status, this hotel is even better but it's still nice without as the gym is an actual gym, and there is a business center with free computer access. Try to get free breakfast with rate to enjoy the yummy breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Gimper90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location as its close to everything. The tower room we stayed in had a view of the clock from the old post office. The bathrooms are set up really nicely as you can take a bath and watch tv in your bedroom through the glass window. The beds are super comfortable and staff is very helpful. We ate in Mosaics downstairs which was a little pricey for the portions you get but the food was very good. We stayed here 3 nights, our fight morning we woke up to the worst dust storm in Sydney's history which was pretty interesting. This hotel is perfect for business but is also great if just on holiday like we were as the ferries and the Rocks are only a 10 minute walk. It also has a free business center which was nice for checking email, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Classy and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: schmirem
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! We stayed on the top floor with the Executive package. It was excellent value with priority checkin on level 28 (no lining up in the lobby!), all day drinks and nibbles, newspapers and magazines on the level 28 lounge, 2 hours of cocktails (i.e. wines and spirits) with delicious canapes, a generous hot and cold buffet and a gorgeous modern room with glass wall between the bathroom and bedroom - you can watch TV and the city from the bath tub! The service was excellent. It's worth paying a bit extra for the benefits of the executive floors. The only downside was the gym. We walked forever up and down stairs and elevators and even crossed a bridge before coming to the gym, which was actually a public gym next door to the hotel that the Westin had an agreement with. We were excited about visiting the pool (Westin Melbourne was just amazing!) but were disappointed to find 2 short lanes in a stuffy small room. Both lanes were occupied - luckily we found a shortcut back to our room that only took 2 lifts and a walk accross the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Goferit
Reviews.Content: Accommodation booked through Wotif. We were allocated a heritage room. It was large & luxurious. Great Location, Great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They don't come much better than the Westin”
Reviews.Author: C0nstantlyOnTheG0
Reviews.Content: For a luxury weekend in Sydney, they don't come much better than the Westin. Valet Parking, ease of check-in, large wall mounted plasma, sensational and luxurious bathrooms, king size bed, great view over the clock tower, definitely the place to stay for a decadent weekend. There are currently some great weekend package deals including breakfast; however do expect to pay $49 a night to park the car. Room service was excellent and fast, however the only fault with the hotel was that the in-room dining menu was a little limited. However, in fairness to the hotel, the meals were accompanied with an excellent selection of freshly cooked vegetables and enormous sides of chips/wedges etc. We did enjoy it so much the first night, that we utilised it again for our second night. The hotel location is fabulous for shopping and it's only a 20 metre walk before you sight your first European designer store. DJ's and Myers, the Strand etc are another 20 metres further on. The architecture of the hotel is amazing. Sydney's former GPO married with a modern tower, is quite a feat. The public foyers and lounges are highly cosmopolitan and offer ideal opportunity for a coffee break or lunch. For a one on one decadent weekend, the hotel is perfect. However, what you save on a great weekend deal, be prepared to spend at the hotel on premium prices for other services.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your SPG points nor hard earn't cash on this place”
Reviews.Author: newmummy26
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Westin Sydney for one night I have come to realise that these 5 star hotels better start picking up their game if they want to survive in the global economic crisis we are flowing in. I wasted 4000 SPG points and $67 AU dollars on this place, I thought was going to be a belated birthday treat for myself. The check in staff were surley, non helpful and really couldn't give a rats about you even if you were an SPG client, were we are suppose to get preferrential treatment. Thank god I didn't pay full price for the room, and I recommend NO ONE pays full price for the room. Room service food at night was cold and soggy for a childs meal and the fish nuggets smelt dodgy. $18 the next morning for Eggs Benedict that looked like it had been sitting on the breakfast buffett for a couple of hours. After complaing about this at check out expecting at least some monies to be taken off the bill, all I got was "I'll take your complaint up with management". Not good enough, treat your customers right for god sakes, if the food is rotton refund the money. $8.00 delivery charge and a GST on top of that, get real!!!!!!!!!!! Air con that rattled all night with temperatures all over the place and when I advised the reception on check out all I got was "did you call when this was occuring" my response was, ummmm not it was 3.00am in the morning and I didn't want to wake my child up, me being awake was bad enough. Over pricing for room service, non appealing menu, and basically feeling like a third rate citizen when checking in and out. Thanks but no thanks. I don't recommend this hotel to anyone, don't stay there, if your an SPG member go to Four Points Sheraton, there you'll be treated how an SPG client is meant to be treated.

Reviews.Title: “'Heavenly!'”
Reviews.Author: GeeFee
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 'heavenly' four night stay at The Westin, with my husband and two adult daughters. We had separate tower superior rooms, with views of the clocktower. The hotel is beautiful architecturally- it was like entering a temple-( the hotel is incorporated into the old GPO building)-and very centrally located- shops/department stores, public transport, The Rocks, Circular Quay, all an easy stroll. (Coles was a few doors down, which saved us a fortune on mini-bar purchases!) The quiet rooms, ( I had to remind myself I was in the middle of a capital city), were decorated in a modern, classic style. The very clean, marble bathrooms included a shower with a choice of two showerheads, (I liked the rain shower), and a deep bath, large fluffy towels/robes and a good selection of toiletries. The beds were indeed, as advertised, 'Heavenly'-very comfortable/beautiful, white linen. The pool was quite a walk , up stairs, down corridors and I would not consider it to be 5 star-($5 charge for towels) Without doubt, the highlight was the buffet breakfast in Mosaic-superb food/lovely ambience. Definately worth trying to find a room rate including breakfast, as it is $42 dollars if you don't. (Try the advanced purchase rate on The Westin website) Already planning a return visit-next time-the Executive Suite!

Reviews.Title: “Certainly Earns its Conde Nast Gold List Rating”
Reviews.Author: TurtleCreekTraveller
Reviews.Content: I just finished a week long stay in a tower deluxe room at the Westin and was extremely pleased. The property is certainly a flagship within the Westin brand and the combination of the old General Post Office and high-rise tower provides for interesting architectural contrasts and updated standards of luxury. Our room was quite large, the air conditioning strong yet quiet, the Bose music system pleasant to the ear, the lighting superb, and the bed and bath worthy of their "heavenly" moniker, especially the extremely deep soaking tub and the separate shower with both rainbath and hand showerheads. The room was virtually spot-free and the housekeeping service timely and efficient each day. Breakfast (normally $42 per person) was included in our special SPG promotional rate and was bountiful and of great quality, and the restaurant really showcases the architectural interest of the building. Food in Sydney tends toward the expensive side yet the quality of the meal is often unremarkable. Given that, we ate several meals at the casual restaurants in the bottom level of the hotel, even though they aren't directly affiliated with the Westin. Quite satisfactory pizzas and fishes can be had quickly for less than $20 AUD, and we found that a good option compared to food that was no better, but twice the time and money. Because I loved so many things about the hotel, I'm giving it a top rating, but I did have a few niggles: 1. The health club available to hotel guests within the complex doesn't belong to the hotel, and while the equipment was decent and plentiful, the steam room and change areas weren't of 5-star luxury status and the pool had been closed for an emergency issue. 2. I fully agree with other reviewer comments about staff attitude. Many were great but some were not. The concierge mentioned in an earlier review had a condescending attitude that was laughable and since it has been mentioned in more than one review, the manager should polish that up a bit. 3. I always get Hilton upgrades and never need to even ask, but I often have trouble getting the comp. upgrades with SPG. The young lady who checked us in didn't even mention my Gold status, and when I asked about the upgrade she simply responded that it was not guaranteed. I then indicated that I knew upgraded rooms were available for the length of our stay and that if she was having trouble finding them in inventory that perhaps we could consult the manager. That said, she produced the upgraded room in a blink. The location is excellent and actually a bit quieter than some other tourist areas. Sydney is quite walkable, but ferry and bus service are both excellent and the Wynyard Station is 3 minutes away and gives train service direct to Circular Quay. We stayed a week and found the $46 combined transit pass a bargain, especially if you use the enjoyable ferry service and travel out to Bondi and Bronte Beaches. The Opera House tour is memorable and if you arrive without having secured performance tickets in advance, it is wise to go immediately to the box office as soon as you arrive in the city, as seats to better-known performances can be difficult to come by and do sell out. The food hall at David Jones nearby is worth a look, especially for snacks and pastries, and if you are looking for a cocktail with the hip crowd, skip down George a few blocks toward the rocks to the Establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant- will be back again”
Reviews.Author: Cacao
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (incl. 2 kids under 3) stayed here on the weekend and had a wonderful time. Everything was of the highest quality and the breakfast was absolutely world class. The rooms were tastefully decorated and very quiet and private. Would recommend it to anyone. A superb experience and so close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed at in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheSpanishCat
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. From the grand entrance through the old GPO, to the great service, gorgeous rooms, amazing bathrooms and very comfortable beds, this place is by far the best hotel we've stayed in in Sydney. Not only that, but unlike a lot of Sydney CBD hotels, it's extremely quiet. Because it's on Martin place (which is not open to traffic) and behind the old GPO building, the rooms are completely free of any traffic noise. Not only that, but the walls are thick and well insulated, and we didn't hear a peep the whole time we were there (we stayed on the 7th floor of the tower). People have mentioned over-priced room service, but it seemed pretty average for a hotel of this quality, and we ordered some huge sandwiches with fries for only $21. One thing you can't miss out on (and we were lucky in that it came complimentary with the room) is the ENORMOUS buffet breakfast in the mosaic restaurant. This restaurant is located on an indoor balcony on the 1st floor overlooking the GPO and the massive glass ceiling. The staff there are very friendly and it's all you can eat style with everything you can imagine: from hot meals to sweet breads to fruits and cheeses. All of it is delicious (I think I ate about twice as much as usual) and the setting is superb. Even if you try it just once - make sure you do! Anyway, I can't say enough about this hotel and we will certainly stay there again when we're back in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but there are better options”
Reviews.Author: flyingdutchman06
Reviews.Content: The Westin in Sydney has a great location, only a 30 minute walk to the Opera House, same distance to Darling Harbour and smack in the middle of the Business District. The hotel caters for business travelers, and I suppose these people don't mind whether or not the staff is friendly. Because they're not really. Don't get me wrong: they're not mean or arrogant, it's just that they can't be bothered to smile or go that little bit extra for the customers. Rooms are divine: very large, beautiful bathroom and of course the famously comfortable Heavenly Bed. Internet was not wireless nor free, but the speed was ok. Breakfast was included in my rate and definitely to be recommended. Fresh fruit galore, egg station, fresh bread and pastries, juices, cappuccino, you name it. In all, it's a fair hotel, and with a good rate a very safe and comfortable bet. But there are nicer, friendlier hotels out there, of which the Four Seasons beats them all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Craigeryvr
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is without a doubt the best Westin I've stayed in, far surpassing the dozen or so North Amercian Westin's I've stayed at. The rooms are well appointed, very clean, with great amenities, the staff are friendly, and the hotel building is great. If you are in town for business, this is in the heart of the Central Business District and a 5 minute walk from one of the main train stations. Definitely what I would recommend to business travellers and others wanting the experience of downtown Sydney. Great gym. The only draw back is tthat cost of the internet is high .. $120 for the week.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic all round”
Reviews.Author: ShaneQld_Australia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in early sept 2009 on a business trip. The hotel is fantastic. I stayed in a standard room and it was very luxurious with a great marble bathroom with large deep tub, a shower with a shower head the size of a dinner plate coming down from the ceiling and plenty of space. The room had everything you could want with large plasma tv, extremely comfy king size bed, working desk, internet connection etc. The hotel position was great. In Martin place, the centre of the CBD, with high class shops all around it and only a short walk to darling harbour, the rocks etc. We walked to both during the trip and it was only 10 min walk to both. Couldn't have been happier with my stay and would highly recommend. I stayed on a 2 night deal at $245 a night with $100 food and beverage credit thron in booked directly on their website. The credit doesn't go far with bfast $42 a head and the bar prices very steep but probably expected of a hotel of this class.

Reviews.Title: “Indulgent and quiet weekender in the heart of sydney”
Reviews.Author: steviemacMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Sydney is a great place for out-of-towners to spend a weekend - and the Westin on Martin Place is a fantastic way to do it. During the week the Westin is a busy business hotel full of important corporate types - but on the weekend, it empties out, the room rates drop significantly. This makes the Westin a rather peaceful and affordable base for exploring the harbour city. The rooms are luxurious to say the least, with a gorgeous bathroom including a 'plunge bath', ours had a view of the internal atrium and of course the obligatory king-size Westin "Heavenly Bed" ensuring a superb sleep. On the down side - room service is prohibitively expensive - clearly aimed at those with the luxury of corporate card and generous per diem. Martin Place itself is quiet and rather uninteresting on the weekend. For an indulgent weekend that wont break the bank - try the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and luxurious, if the heart of the CBD is your style”
Reviews.Author: Annakatrina
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for two nights at the Westin Sydney, with one additional night free, a deal that doesn't usually show up for luxury hotels. Our room, while on a high floor in the tower, still didn't have a view of much more than a cavern of other office buildings, so I'd recommend specifying a good view. I agree with other reviewers that the lights are confusing to operate, bright key lights that are impossible to modify without plunging the entire room into darkness. Room service is pricey, but that's hardly a surprise, and the food we ordered came in huge portions, and was very good. We had a fair amount of requests for the concierge; every time our questions were immediately answered or items were instantaneously delivered to our room, and the maid service was near-magical. No matter when we turned on the "make up room" light, or what time we returned, the room had been flawlessly cleaned in our absence, and we never saw a maid anywhere in the hotel hallways. The bathrooms are fun in a puzzling kind of wayâ€” all that glass doesn't offer the highest level of privacy. My only real problem with the Westin is the location. Despite some stunning Victorian architecture, Sydney's CBD is an impersonal area, filled with chain stores, hordes of bankers and lawyers rushing around in suits, and few places to eat or drink that aren't either extremely expensive or at the Starbucks or touristy pub level. If I were to visit again, I'd consider staying in either the comparatively laid back and picturesque Circular Quay, or a more residential neighborhood like Balmain.

Reviews.Title: “Ho Hum”
Reviews.Author: Petal57
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a typical 5 star Hotel- nothing special and starting to show signs of wear. The good things- great bathroom, large and stylish; comfortable bed; nice amenties and good central location. The hotel is in a beautiful heritage building, but is decorated in a bland modern style- go figure. No character at all. You could be anywhere. The bad things- hideously over priced room service; off-hand service. I guess what really turned me off this hotel was the incredibly dismissive "service" of staff, both at check-in and the congierge. I had booked with a discounted web site and feel that I was treated less because of it. I would expect much more from a 5 star hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “First Class All The Way”
Reviews.Author: Historiana
Reviews.Content: This is a first rate, well run hotel. We were in the tower and the room was great â€“ it was large with excellent work space and very modern. The bathroom was enormous and we had a view of the clock tower which was great. The hotel is in the central business district which leaves you about a 10-15 minute walk to the Quay or the Rocks. It is about a similar distance from Darling Harbor. Staff was very friendly and would definitely recommend this hotel for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: AngieManila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 5 nights with daily buffet breakfast at the Westin Sydney for our third honeymoon. Everything was perfect, until we invited some friends over for the sumptuous buffet breakfast at the Mosaic. They couldn't find parking on the street (they've been going around for about 30 minutes) so I asked the manager if they can give complimentary parking in the basement since it was VERY expensive at AUD28. They gave me a discount card that says "enjoy special rates if you dine at the Mosaic" and they said it will cost about AUD15 for 5 hours. However, when they were about to park at the basement, the rude parking attendant disregarded the card and said there is no such thing and will STILL charge them AUD28. This really pissed our friends off and decided not to have breakfast at Mosaic anymore. It was really embarrassing for me and my husband. I complained to the concierge about it and all they could say was that the basement parking was operated by another company (Secure) and that the attendants were not employed by Westin so they had no control over them. The concierge apologized and said that Westin had an agreement with Secure on the discount and maybe the attendant was not properly informed. I'm really disappointed because I was very embarrassed and stressed out over this incident. Westin should have properly informed Secure about the parking agreement so as not to put their guests in so much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very nice”
Reviews.Author: charmaine150
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends in August 2009. The hotel is so so lovely. Very clean, value for money, many facilities, glamorous, nice rooms. very convenient central location, the city is at your door step! freindly staff and concierge was good, if u want a classy and reasonable hotel to stay in, Westin hotel if your best friend, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “number one hotel in sydney- especially when booking direct”
Reviews.Author: roppongi
Reviews.Content: have stayed in most of the 5 star hotels in sydney and this was hands down the best if u like modern finishings. check the rates on wotif.com and booked direct on the westin website. had a great room on 22nd floor of the tower. gym is shared and a bit of a walk through the post office 3rd floor to get to. need to bring your own towel to wipe down the equipment. breakfast buffet at A$41 a bit pricey, but comparable with the going rate in sydney hotels. definately will stay here again when next in town.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Clean, Quiet Room - Really Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mei_C
Reviews.Content: THIS. THIS was the hotel with the BEST beds. See my other reviews on Crowne Plaza Darling Harbour (disappointing) and Four Seasons Sydney (the pillows gave me a neckache) which were all part of the same trip. The check-in was smooth. And we got a nice big quiet Tower King room on the 25th floor. The Heavenly Bed was indeed fantastic. The pillows were great and gave us such a good sleep that I had absolutely no problem with my hubbyâ€™s snoring. The toiletries were good except for the shampoo (I have a sensitive scalp) and the rainshower was terrific. You know how youâ€™d hate to bathe in winter? Well, I wanted to spend more time in the shower! And there was also a separate detachable showerhead if I didnâ€™t plan to wash my hair. The toilet bowl was in its own stall so everything was out of sight. Neat. The tub looked spacious and plenty of glass so the toilet looked bigger. The only problem was the automatic blind which screens the bathroom from the bedroom. I prefer to leave the toilet light on in unfamiliar rooms and this meant that when we slept, there was some light shining into the bedroom through the toilet glass window. The blinds do not shield out light completely. As a Starwood member, bottled mineral water is complimentary but HIDDEN in the closet. And what happened to bedroom slippers? Location: Located in the CBD area. Shops close EARLY. 5 or 6pm except for Thursdays. Which meant that the food court below Myers closes early too! The hotel is less than 5min walk from David Jones, Myers, Dymocks book store, a huge pharmacy, Coles supermarket and boutiques of Jigsaw & Country Road. 10min away is QVB. 20min walk to Cockle Bay Wharf at Darling Harbour and 25min walk to Harbourside where you can get cheap internet access. About 35min walk to Star City or Sydney Fish Market or Bus 443 took us to Prymont Road/Street where we walked 5 min to Sydney Fish Market. Remember to buy your ticket from any nearby newsstand BEFORE boarding the bus. Costs AUD1.90 one way. Breakfast was included in our prepaid rate. Mosaic opens only at 6.30am and there is a very good variety with smoked salmon with dill, lemon and red onions, sausages, bacon, eggs cooked to your liking, a variety of juices such as orange, pineapple, pink guava and energy booster drinks. Also, fruits, muffins, plenty of bread, pastries etc. The service was prompt and cheerful. Oh, and do walk one floor down from the hotel lobby for an amazing thin crust pizza. But it wasnâ€™t open on Sun night.. We had the prosciutto and arugula pizza and it was delicious. You canâ€™t charge it to your hotel room though since itâ€™s a separate entity. But itâ€™s worth the lift ride and walk. Now, all Iâ€™m thinking of is â€“ ordering that Heavenly Bed for ourselves. We really miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in CBD of Sydney! Walk to almost everything”
Reviews.Author: JeanPasadenaCA
Reviews.Content: As others have said, this hotel was lovely. I had prepaid for 6 nights and check-in went smoothly. I stayed in one of the tower rooms. Breakfast included with my room package rate was superb in the Mosaic restaurant. The one dinner I ate in the Mosaic restaurant was also quite good. Bathroom was roomy with separate shower and tub. Free-wireless internet was available in the lobby though I could only get the signal strong enough to use it in the Mosaic restaurant and closer to the business center. Bathrobe was cozy. The only problem I had was with the concierge. I tried to get a restaurant recommendation for a specific area for a night I was going to the Sydney Opera House and told there was only "fine dining" there. Since I was staying in the Westin and going to the opera house after dinner, I wondered why they thought I wouldn't consider fine dining. Two nights later when I asked for a place to get a "quick bite" in the area since I had eaten midafternoon, they sent me walking along a local street looking for something (each time, no recommendation or offer to make a reservation). Other than this poor service from the concierge, the place was great!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: JasonYSB
Reviews.Content: Very nice Westin property. Modern, well appointed rooms (with huge bathrooms!), friendly staff and good location in Sydney's CBD. Complimentary bottled-water and newspaper daily, and free wifi in lobby (internet access also available in Business center).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location / Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: experiences09
Reviews.Content: When you book a Westin you are never disappointed - Sydney is no exception. Great vaue for money. Fabulous location - five min walk to Sydney Harbour nestled in the middle of business and shopping district. Rooms are loving with both glass shower and gorgeous tub with glass wall overlooking room. Concierge service was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: HughK1
Reviews.Content: I use the hotel at least 6 times a year for business and I always stay here on my own dime with my family. I'm an expat Sydneysider so I know what I am talking about! Its a big hotel but its right in the middle of the CBD and you can get to anywhere in Sydney in 30 minutes. The staff are great, rooms clean and bright and the club floors have good amenities. The gym next door is pretty good but when you can do a run a 10k loop around beautiful Sydney harbour why would you use it?! Ask for the higher floors if you want a view. There are great bars in and around the hotel. The Rocks, Paddington and Woollahra are all 10 minutes away while Bondi, Mosman and Balmoral are 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal showers”
Reviews.Author: tucsonguadalupe
Reviews.Content: A great location, superb beds, awesome bathrooms, nice T.V., soft bathrobes, free Internet at Business Center

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic...amazing bathroom”
Reviews.Author: keznscud
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful experience. Great sized room...and amazing bathroom. Wonderful staff and restuarants...great location.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Hotel was amazing and it was in the right location.”
Reviews.Author: criticrus
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Australia and we wanted to make sure we picked the right hotel and location. We chose the Westin Sydney because it is 100% smoke free. We arrived early morning and were greeted by a very nice bellman, who made sure our luggage was stored while we waited for a room. Once we got our room, the same bellman took us up to our room and was very helpful in showing us all the amenities the hotel had. We got to use their business center (open 24 hours) and their health club during our stay. Only thing that was disapointing was the pool being closed down due to repairs. The concierge was very helpful in providing us with a city map and walking/running routes. The location of the hotel was perfect. We did not have to take taxis, instead we walked to the Sydney Opera House, the Darling Harbour, the Quay, the Botanical Gardens, shops (arcades), the Rocks, etc... Although the Westin's restaurant is outstanding, we found out the building where the Westin is located has several other restaurants in the lower level of the building (Japanese, Italian, French, Spanish and a Steak House). However, during one of our walks, we found a food court about a block away from the hotel in the MLC Center building that offered all kinds of food that were not only delicious, but quite reasonable. But for dinner, you can't beat the quality of food and price at the Westin's Mosaic restaurant. All in all, we are glad we picked to stay at the Westin during our visit to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever had the pleasure of staying at”
Reviews.Author: RBill
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin, Sydney while waiting for my Corporate Apartment to get sorted out while on a 3 month secondment from work. This hotel and the room I stayed in were immaculate - incredible beds, extremely spacious, and the bathrooms were HEAVEN. The Westin is also very close to lots of shops and a great 'outdoor' mall. A beautiful place to stay - though its probably pricey it is also probably worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: Ausman57
Reviews.Content: I write this review as a Gold Member and a member who stays at a number Starwood properties throughout the year. I had two stays at the Westin in June and really wanted to wait until I had finished my second stay before writing this review. The first stay was extended from a one night in a standard room - with points, to a paid three night stay in a suite/club lounge room. I had contacted the hotel reservations directly with my request to upgrade etc, which was handled well. Well until I get to reception. Total confusion with my booking ensued. Eventually solved or so I thought. The suite was large and comfortable with the usual Westin style. Seperate lounge and bedrooms both with flat screen TV's. Bathrom was clean large and smart. The bed/pillows need no introduction to me or my wife. They are great. On the 36th floor you would think that street sound would not be a problem? Wrong! Sound travels from the night clubs that surround the hotel in Martin Place as do the noisy cars. So if you are a very light sleeper then you will notice what is going on 36 floors below you. But to be fair it should only be a problem on Fridays or Saturday nights. On our second night we tried to get up to bedroom using the room card/key. Would not work. So after spending two trips in the lift trying to get the card to work we ended up at reception. We had to get new cards as we had as the hotel computer system said two seperate bookings. If we had have been told this at check in - then end of problem. Nothing major just darn iritating. So be aware if you have two consecutive bookings then a trip back to reception may be necessary. The club lounge is the worst lounge I have ever visited. The seating/chairs are absolutely terrible - very uncomfortable and not welcoming. The nightly food offerings are terrible. The ambience is terrible. The size is terrible. The breakfasts offerings are terrible. The view is great. The staff are terrific. On our first morning to attend breakfast the lounge was well attended, with no table for my wife and I. We were told to wait. I mentioned that we could use the buffet down stairs only to be told we can but it would cost extra. I have never, ever been told that in all my visits to any club lounge in the world. On saying this was totally inappropriate a pair of seats became available. It was the most uncomfortable breakfast meal I have had for many a year. We asked for omelets, only to be told they cost extra!!!!! For the extra you pay for the pleasure of a club facility this offering by the Westin Sydney was a disgrace and total waste of money. My advice is do not pay the extra for this lounge it is terrible waste of time and money. The downstairs lounge/bar seating is also terrible. The beers/drinks are expensive, the service is terrific. Not a comfortable area to rest or lounge in. Our second stay was for one night with points. Everything was handled well the room was excellent. A king bedded room overlooking the inner courtyard of the hotel. Superb bed etc. It was a stay that was enjoyed by us both. The buffet breakfast is superb with everything you could wish for. It is a shame that two parts of this hotel spoil a very good hotel. The club lounge is a cheap shameful offering.

Reviews.Title: “Best SPG hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: kazkid7
Reviews.Content: This review is particularly relevant for SPG platinum members. In May, I stayed at the Four Points, Sheraton, and Westin in Sydney. I was upgraded to a suite at each of the hotels. The Four Points is the worst of the three, but is cheaper generally too, so is good value. The Sheraton has the best club lounge, which they just renovated. Its huge, modern, and classy with floor to ceiling windows that have great views over the park. The Westin has the nicest rooms, especially the suites. It is modern and classy, done in neutral tones with natural materials. I love the bathroom with bath tub with a view of the city. The club lounge is adequate, but definitely not as nice or atmospheric as the one at the Sheraton. Also, the location here is a little more convenient to the Rocks, Circular Quay, and Darling Harbor than the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Consumately professional”
Reviews.Author: subpardriver
Reviews.Content: Right in the middle of everything, rooms are well-laid out, very modern, and feel large. Room service was good and prompt, in general could not have asked for staff to be more responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidTAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for just one night but this hotel proved to be everything that a fine five star hotel should be. Check-in and check-out were painless and attention to detail is excellent. Staff address you properly and are very pleasant - some can be a little drab though. The room i had was excellent with every amenity i could possibly need. The 'dream' bed truely is the best night sleep you can have in a hotel and it was very diffcult to drag myself out the next morning as i just wanted to stay in it. Bathroom is also excellent with seperated shower and toilet and a divine deep tub. Bathroom wall opens up so you can lay in the tub and watch the television or spy the view outside (although i dont recommend doing this when nearby offices are in full swing). The only issues, which are quite minor, is overnight parking charged at $50 and buffet breakfast served in the lobby restaurant. Im sure that in-room breakfast would probably be available if in the right rooms but for the rest of us, its breakfast with the masses. Highly recommend the hotel and beds !!

Reviews.Title: “Thorough Professionals”
Reviews.Author: MNLMumbai
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Sydney and I was staying at the Westin. Never felt more at ease in a new city. The room was great and the service impeccable. They had an answer for all your queries and with a smile too. The concierge deserves a special mention as they guided me to the various destinations and i never got lost. The breakfast spread was magnificent. The staff very polite and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome relief after disaster of Italy”
Reviews.Author: shanalyze
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Westin. The room with 2 double beds was enormous and the beds were soft and comfy. My children loved the big bath. There is a fantastic fully equipped gym which can be used by hotel guests next door. There is a pool which is alright for a dip with the kids but probably much busier during the week. The hotel is centrally located with excellent shopping all outside your door. The Ivy is around the corner for party lovers. Breakfast was delicious with fresh eggs and crispy bacon. Big jugs of boost juices and energy shots were a welcome addition to the wide choice. Children under 7 are free for breakfast and older children pay half price. Sydney and the Westin far exceeds my recent 5 star disasters in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Family getaway for our 14th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: travelwizSydney
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful "naughty" weekend.....with 3 kids!! With adjoining rooms, we had the privacy, the kids loved the independence, and the way the adjoining worked was very clever and convenient. The hotel arranged a great bottle of champagne, dessert, and delicate chocolate decoratons to say happy anniversary which was a great touch. The rooms were very spacious, fresh, and with a fantastic bathroom which had a huge bath (I am 6ft 2in and could hardly touch the end!!) with a glass wall so I could watch tv from the tub. Breakfast at Mosaics was very good. All you could want, plus some more! In fact there was so many nice things that I just could'nt fit in everything I would have liked to have! Positioning is unbeatable, being in the heart of the city and perfectly positioned for leisure, shopping, business or conferencing. Service was good but not excelent. It took until after 3pm to get the key to the second room, no kids packs were presented at check in as promised in the hotel promotional material and the fine 5 star attentiveness was not quite there. Don't get me wrong. It was efficient, but not exceptional. Other than these little glitches though, it was a fine, relaxing and indulgent weekend. I would certainly recommend this hotel to any discerning traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: susanPerthAustralia
Reviews.Content: Have been staying at this hotel at least 3 times a year for the last 5 years and have to say it feels a bit like coming home. We always stay in the executive club and as such are totally pampered and always welcomed back by the team. The staff in the club have watched our kids grow up and have always spoilt us. We have had Christmas with Family here, celebrated birthdays and anniversaries and the staff have always gone out of their way to make these times both memorable and enjoyable. Since joining tripadvisor I seem to only feel compelled to write a review if the service is to rave about or we have had a bad experience. This rave review is long overdue! The club in the last year or so have changed the rules on kids in the club for evening drink time. This is understandable as I guess they want to ensure all guests have a quiet and relaxing time. The staff went out of it's way to ensure we could still enjoy drinks/canapes in our suite and the butler delivered a trolley each night. This is the type of service that keeps us returning. The club also serves Breakfast and coffee/tea and softdrinks all day long. Good after a shopping spree in the Pitt Street Mall. The rooms are lovely and spacious. The hotel is smoke free. The kids are welcomed. We usually have a two bedroom suite which means we can entertain friends and family and the kids have their own space to play or watch television. The beds are heavenly as they advertise the bath is large for those bubble baths and the whole place feels luxurious and comfortable. Looking for the best Sydney hotel The Westin is it...

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: T-A-UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for one night in April. The location of the hotel can't be beaten, but it is a bit hard to find the entrance to the hotel as the web site says the entrance is on another street. The rooms were large and well equiped and the bathroom is one of the largest we have seen for a while. We didn't eat in the hotel, as we chose to eat from one of the many cafes that are in the surrounding streets. There are only two downsides - 1. parking if you park your car yourself be ready for a long windy walk but up to the hotel lobby. 2. Make sure you allow plenty of time when you return to the hotel if you have left your luggage with them. The majority of the luggage is stored in the foyer next to the concierge desk and it is not only not secure but looks ugly when you enter the hotel. We left our bag and headed out for the day when we returned it took them 30mins to find our bag as someone had taken it up the the room that we just checked out of! Next time I'll stay at the raddisson. Its the same price but a much better hotel

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to fault”
Reviews.Author: pungpui
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a Saturday night, so our fellow guests tended to be of a more leisurely nature, rather than the norm (this hotel is primarily a business hotel). It oozes business everywhere, from the relatively moderate sized rooms (built for 1 in comfort), high prices to charge to the corporate card ($AUD42 for breakfast), smack-bang in the middle of the CBD location and the incredibly large selection of alcohol (hotel sized of course) awaiting in each room ala mini bar (again with prices reserved for the corporate card â€“ if corporates still allow it these days). Not to say the room is small, but for the price you would expect something a little bigger. It is just enough room for 1 standard king sized bed, desk, single arm chair, ample storage space and bathroom â€“ without bumping into someone if itâ€™s a room for 2. Of course the LCD/Plasma screen on the wall helps reduce clutter as well, donâ€™t even think about a rollaway bed or 2 queen sized beds. The room features Westin Heavenly Bed, a cabinet just filled with mini-bar stocks, a great Bose alarm clock where you can connect your iPod, floor to ceiling windows, and enough lights to create whatever mood you need. Bathroom size is much better though. It is larger than standard, and glass (or laminated coloured glass) seems to be the theme. Shower includes both rainfall and hand-held shower outlets, a bathtub which is barely big enough for 2, full length mirror and magnifying mirror with light. A neat feature is the wall between the bedroom and bathroom is a glass wall (the bathroom has an electric blind to block the view if need be). But I was impressed that I could watch the TV (and the remote worked!) while in the bathtub, while there is plenty of shelving space within reach above your head to store tissues, iPod, and even a cup of tea so you donâ€™t even have to get up! TV has cable channels, as well as pay movies (standard hotel stuff) and DVD player but no connectivity to a laptop (like some of the newer hotels these days) which is a shame since all of the features and furnishings of this hotel seem to be first class. Noise seemed to travel quite a bit (our room being first near the lifts), however we didnâ€™t really notice it that much as there are only a hand full of rooms on 1 floor, so traffic is minimal. Service was great â€“ at 10pm we called housekeeping to come and make the bed (turndown the room), they were there within 2 minutes of the call on our way out. Very efficient and friendly! Wish I could say the same about service in the restaurant. Only had breakfast here as it was included in our rate. Normally it would cost a crazy $AUD42! Iâ€™ve had cheaper breakfasts with much more choice in other Starwood hotels in Asia and theyâ€™ve never been anywhere near $AUD42. The design is long and quite narrow, so it doesnâ€™t give a very spacious feel. It seemed ever-crowded, even though you couldnâ€™t see most of the other guests. I have to say though, most hotels do not have a clue how to cook hash browns. These were the best Iâ€™ve had! Just the right amount of salt and the lack of excessive oil meant I could actually taste the potato, at the right temperature. They also have some interesting energy shots (I tried something with beetroot and it was surprisingly not terrible). They also had smoothies like mango flavoured, in addition to just the normal juice. Other items included lots of breads, pastries, 4 variations of cooked egg, cereals, miso soup, smoked salmon and waffles. The Westin is at 1 Martin Place â€“ a historical building dating back to the 1800â€™s. Martin Place is almost the focal point of Sydneyâ€™s CBD. At one end is the State Parliament, library and Macquarie Street (all of the courts seem to be here), all along Martin Place are corporate offices with some higher-end fashion stores. Toward one end is Pitt Street Mall, THE shopping mall in Sydney for anything you could want. There is a Coles Supermarket on the same block. Martin Place train station is 50 metres away. 5 to 10 minutes walk away is practically any CBD office building in Sydney, as well as Circular Quay in the northern direction; home to the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge, and China town and the George Street cinemas in the Southern direction. George street itself has plenty of buses toward the South of the city. It is literally one of the best located hotels in this city. With location and 5 star luxury, it is no wonder this hotel is constantly at the upper end in terms of rates, particularly week days due to high demand of business clients. Although given the current economic conditions, Starwood is releasing continuously lower rates either by payment or through SPG. Only issue really is that it is not a Harbour view hotel â€“ and given its central location, what else could one expect apart from a view of other buildings? But overall, definitely one of the better hotels in Sydney â€“ give it a go next time!

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: SOGA
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 40 day cruise who took us from Sydney to Vancouver. Before the cruise, we spent 5 nights at the Westin Sydney. We had booked a room at the club level. Were we ever satisfied ! We arrived around 9.30 am exausted from our 15 hour flight and our room was ready. It was in one of the towers on the 33 th foor with a partial view of the water. The room was spacious and large with the most fabulous bathroom (it had actually 3 sections ) Service was impeccable We had the most delicious appetizers , different every nite ,at the club with champagne. The staff was most helpful and one of them ,Joey ,even wrote us a note to give us the recipe of one of the appetizers we had enjoyed so much ( she had asked the chef ) We had meals there and it was delicious. We also liked the location very much , walking distance to everything We highly recommend this beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: Risky_Rat
Reviews.Content: I've struggled to find a good hotel in Sydney, but I think I may have found it. The Westin seems relatively new, but it doesn't have the unsettled feel that many new hotels have. A lovely room, overlooking the GPO clock, was the start of a great stay. Nice bathroom - the see-through window seems to be a bit of a trend. Great to have a Bose clock radio in the room. One improvement could be a Nespresso (or similar) coffee maker, as well as the electric jug. The bar in the hotel was fun, and there are plenty of places to eat in the main foyer area, that aren't connected the hotel (ergo, not ridiculous hotel prices). Just stay away from the cafe near the foyer - nothing to do with the hotel, but the service was appalling. All things considered, though, this is worth a stay - for business or pleasure. Book through the Westin site - their low prices are guaranteed, and it was not an empty promise.

Reviews.Title: “Beatifully Located”
Reviews.Author: cateeliza
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after about a month of searching and reading reviews online and was not disappointed. I had to drop my bag off early in the morning and the porters were helpful and welcoming. The room I stayed in didn't have a great view although the clock tower is certainly pleasant in it's own way. The rooms were tastefully decorated in white and neutral tones and true to the pictures on the website. The service at the hotel was variable, the check-in staff were abrupt but the concierge was helpful throughout my stay. Each night housekeeping staff delivered complimentary water to my room. The bed was large and comfortable and the bathroom was very well organised and large, I was able to watch tv from the bathtub through the feature glass wall which was a nice touch, although the glass wan't cleaned throughout my stay of several days. The room service menu was very expensive but there were other options within the local area for meals and a supermarket within a block. I would definetely go back as the hotel is in a superb location, centrally located to the CBD of Sydney and only a 5 minute walk from Darling Harbour and a 7-8 minute walk from Circular Quay

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: kat_carson
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Sydney on business last week, and I chose to stay at the Westin. It was my first time staying at a Starwood property. I cannot say enough good things about my experience at the Westin Sydney. From the moment I arrived through until I checked out, everything: the service, my room, the staff - everything was top notch. My room was clean (and I am incredibly fussy about that). The bed was unbelievably comfortable. The hotel is in such a wonderful, central location. Unfortunately my room had a very ordinary view - but since I was only staying one night and was on a business trip and not vacation I didn't care about that. I was thoroughly impressed with my experience there, and will not hesitate to recommend the Westin to friends and family. The only thing I didn't like was that my stay at the Westin was so short - just overnight. Next up is a stay at the Westin Melbourne, and I hope that they are on par (if not better) than their Sydney counterpart.

Reviews.Title: “Maintaining The Standard”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCarlito
Reviews.Content: This is how you would expect a Westin hotel would be: large, modern, clean and luxurious. You experience this from the moment you walk into the hotel, right through to when you walk into your room. The hotel is set inside a heritage building, so the facade looks very impressive. The rooms are well furnished and they are very spacious. You will easily feel at home. There is adequate wardrobe space in case you don't travel light. Comfortable chairs and sofas add to the homely feel. When you walk into the bathroom, you immediately get the feeling of space. A separate shower, bathtub and toilet gives you an indication of how large it is inside. If you please, you can also watch the TV whilst in the bathtub through the glass wall. Bathrobe and slippers are also provided in the room to make you feel even more comfortable. The hotel's location is also worth noting. Being right there at Martin Place, a couple of minutes from Pitt St Mall and easy walking distance to Circular Quay and Queen Victoria Building. This place is ideal for tourists and even business travellers looking for a central location. If you got the extra cash, I would thoroughly recommend spending it here.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dangerfunk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for two nights over the Easter Weekend '09 and had a brilliant stay. The decor and service are second to none and the location on Martin Place has to be one of the best in Sydney: close enough to Circular Quay, the QVB and Darling Harbour for all tastes. The staff were very attentive and took great care of us from check-in until the moment we left. We would happily return to the Westin if we visit Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “location and comfort”
Reviews.Author: sarpl
Reviews.Content: very good hotel and location. we stayed 4 nights. you can walk anywhere. safe area. beautiful room, special design. near by alot of locations for dining - all kinds. you can walk anywhere. we walked alot. we used public transportation only twice, when we wanted to try the mono-train and when we came back after crossing the harbor bridge. the hotel located at a very luxury place (alot of 5th avenue shopping-style).
