Reviews.Title: “Stay every time I'm in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SimonBath
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a good location. Great building. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Moss11
Reviews.Content: Magnificent hotel with very comfortable rooms with modern design. Can't find a better location in the Business District, a few minutes walk to Circular Quay. Breakfast is amazing with a wide range of choices and high quality ingredients. Also plenty of good restaurants in hotel lobby (sushi place is great). The only issue I had was that the absence of wi-fi internet in rooms, only cable. And the cost is $AUS 25 per day which is a ripp-off. Free wi-fi is what a customer should expect from a hotel as this one. Staff was also not always welcoming and helpful. Could be a bit rude sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel To seek refuge in”
Reviews.Author: JJW63
Reviews.Content: We actually only live four blocks from the Westin Sydney but the water in our building had been cut off for maintenance purposes so off we went looking for a hotel. We got a great rate and a great room so were very happy. The rooms are well decorated and appointed if not interestingly arranged. The bathrooms and the wardrobes are not typically arranged like normal hotels but are beautiful nonetheless. We mainly just stayed in the room for the weekend as we were tired and enjoyed room service and I have to say its amongst the best I have had. The in room breakfast is amazing! Service in this hotel is great but not as warm as say the Westin in Melbourne but then they know me better there as I stay there a lot. If we had a problem with our building again or were getting the carpets cleaned at home we'd definetly stay at the Westin Sydney again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Mcdeen
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Sydney a few times before but found the central location of the Westin one of the best. Its a few minutes walk to major depatment stores and shopping and about a 15 minute walk to the Rocks or Darling Harbour. We stayed in the old part that has been restored. The rooms were lovely, well decorated and the "heavenly beds" so comfortable. Staff was very helpful. Wireless internet was available free in the hallways and foyer. Breakfast was included in our room price and was good. We ate only one dinner in the dining room. The food was good, but in my opinion quite overpriced when compared to a similar meal we had at "The Rocks". I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel !”
Reviews.Author: FrmNJ
Reviews.Content: This was one of the better Starwood properties I have stayed in last few years. Am definitely returning back. A few highlights: - Terrific location in the central business district. A quick walk to most business head quarters. And a pleasant 15 minute walk to the Rocks, harbor bridge and the opera house. - Lovely architecture, beautifully integrated with the colonial era post office. Itâ€™s a pleasure to wander around the lobby area and admire the colonial architecture. - If you upgrade to the club floors for about A$100 more, you get free internet access, buffet breakfast and evening cocktails in the club room. - Also on the club floors, spacious rooms with big flat screen TVs, ample closet space, and nice bath rooms. I had a terrific view of the Sydney skyline through the big glass window/wall. - I got free ironing of suits/shirts and free polishing of shoes for being on a club floor. Lobby staff loaned out umbrellas on rainy days, concierge was genuinely helpful. I was getting tired of the SPG program after some disappointing experiences with Westins and Le Meridiens around the world, but this hotel renewed my trust in Starwood.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding overall hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: rnorth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the duration of a 7 night business trip to Sydney and found it to be one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The highlights were the friendly, attentive service from all staff, incredibly classy, modern lobby with entrances from 3 main streets in central Sydney; great value, amenities, and high end furniture in the room for the price, excellent gym, workout, and business facilities and a variety of choices for restaurants and drinks in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a Five, although I could see a strong 4”
Reviews.Author: wineguysf
Reviews.Content: First off - I stay in a lot of hotels. I just poo poo'd a Westin in Fiji. However, this hotel is almost there with a St. Regis or Four Seasons... not quite to that level of service, but close. I give it a 5 because they don't have 4.5 on here. Honestly, everything was in order at this hotel. The lobby was beautiful, the rooms were very well done. The clean lines and wood made for a nice appeal. The location was very central to both shopping and the waterfront. Good restaurants abounded and the train was super close. The service seemed very solid too. I did not really test it out, but they treated me just fine. There was some slowness up in the executive club, but then I was not in a hurry so nothing bothered me. Also, I was upgraded to an Executive suite. It was quite nice. I must say though, take off the living room part, and the standard king bedroom was plenty big. The menu prices did seem a bit steep, but alas, this is all I can find wrong with this hotel. I very much recommend it and would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dazman69
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Westin Sydney. This hotel is smack bang in the middle of the CBD and within easy walking distance to most of Sydneyâ€™s main tourist attractions. The rooms are modern and well designed; there is a shelf, nook or crevice for all your items. The bathrooms are very cool, lots of glass and mirrors and contain a separate bath, toilet and multiple head shower. The glass wall separating the bathroom to main room is a quirky touch, with the motor driven blind offering privacy if needed. The buffet breakfast is one of the nicest I have had at any hotel, with plenty of options, all fresh and of high quality. While the breakfast was included in my package, some may find the AU$42 steep. The hotels decor is modern and not too fussy and the staff were friendly, professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Really pretty good”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneK
Reviews.Content: I had a basic tower room - and it was really very good - huge room, floor to ceiling windows, luxurious bath & shower, lots of storage space, well designed layout etc. Service was fine, if not outstanding (but then I didn't really notice the service - which probably means it was actually pretty good). Room service is pretty extortionate, I paid a small fortune for a ceasar salad - almost twice what I'd pay in a local restaurant; which left me still hungry afterwards. And then they charged another $8 to bring it to the room. Mind you they do include some extras which other 5 star hotels charge for - like razors for example. Most importantly - the bed was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: greenfingers44
Reviews.Content: Very posh and clean modern .Right in CBD

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: zerogeewhiz
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin a few times over the years and it has never disappointed. From what I can tell it's had a minor refresh sometime in the last few years and the hotel remains as it was the day it opened - understated, cool, sophisticated. We chose a one-night package with late check-out and it included a welcome bottle of wine and strawberries. The room was on 30th floor with a good view of the city and harbour glimpses. The room was great, the bathroom with its deep bath for two and window to allow you to admire the view was first rate and the included in-room breakfast was epic. There's a little Bose CD player with a port for plugging in iPods (iPhones stop and start because it's the wrong pin) so you can bring your own music. It isn't cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Westin”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravellerSSV
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great hotel in an excellent location. Its step away from pitt street and in the main shopping area. All the other main attractions are also close by . It is a busy hotel. We stayed in a deluxe oversized room and it was extremely comfortable. Unfortunately, we had to request for our bed sheets to be changed a few times before we found a pair without stains! They were very apologetic and offerred a free buffet breakfast for the inconvenience. Overall, the room was clean and nicely furnished. The staff are friendly and professional. We enjoyed our stay at the hotel - l would recommend the Westin and l will definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: stephentaynton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for five nights recently and I was very impressed. The room itself was huge with a great bed and pillows. The bathroom was big and there was a lot of storage for your things. A few things let the overall experience down a little. The room was not really cleaned that well during the day with only the minimal work done. In addition the shower recess would flood the floor as there was a little space between the door and the fixed panel of the shower which allowed water to pour out. This could potentially be dangerous. Although one would except prices to be high as this is a 5star hotel but the Westin introduces new heights to the cost of room service and other restrauants. But besides these things it was a great and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lovingagoodholiday
Reviews.Content: The beds at the Westin are very, very comfortable and the bathrooms quite luxurious with rainforest shower, deep bath and fluffy white towels. Our room was medium sized with a flat screen TV, bar fridge, nice reading chair and separate desk/chair for laptop use etc. There were plenty of coat hangers, lots of wardrobe/drawer space and plenty of room for suit cases. We had an online reduced rate that didn't include breakfast so instead of paying $80 for the buffet we strolled to a local cafe for a yummy omlette and coffee at $15 each. Valet parking was a tad expensive at $49; something that perhaps would put people off. Downstairs we found "Prime" restaurant which has a lovely ambience and great steaks. If you don't mind paying that little extra, you'll definitely enjoy the food and service. All-in-all a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best 5* Hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Mixologist80
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I planned a four night luxury stay to recover from Christmas. Check-in was fast and efficient. We requested a room on any floor ending in "03" as we believe that these are the largest size of standard room at the Westin. Generally the room sizes at the Westin are larger than the norm. We have stayed at this property many times since it opened and were pleased when we entered our room to find new carpet on the floor. We also noticed that the white sheets had a caramel edge which to us indicated that the sheets where new. In the past year or so, the Westin has also replaced its old TV's with large Flat screen TV's and upgraded the in house movie system. Breakfast in Mosaic was very good and room service meals while expensive, where hot and well presented. Overall the service was excellent and it is great to see that the Westin is updating its accomodation. While the veiw from this hotel is nothing to write home about (nor the toiletries), this is by far one of the best hotels in Sydney, for its accomodation, large bathroom including large shower head above a walk-in shower and large bath tub, location and very good service.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly thrilled...”
Reviews.Author: Trevor C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney in early Feb 2008 for 4 nights, which admittedly was awhile ago. However after reading some of the current reviews, I thought it time that I say something about this overrated hotel. My wife and I generally enjoy staying at the Westin chains around the world, but the Sydney Westin was a let down. On arrival, we weren't greeted with a smile or any pleasantries by front desk. Although check-in was prompt and efficient, it was all too cold and clinical. Some warmth and a smile would've been nice! Westin prides itself on personal service - I didn't see any sign of that. The room was nice and tidy, which was welcomed. We had the Deluxe room. The room fittings were of relatively high standards, the bathroom was clean and modern, and the general living area was spacious enough for a family of three. The bed was comfortable enough. Room service was prompt in their delivery of the cot for our then 16 month old son. The concierge was always very helpful and courteous. He gave us great tips and advice on how to get around the city, and of some general sights and attractions. Although we knew quite a bit about Sydney (having been there several times before), he still managed to give us a great rundown on Sydney. Our room didn't come with breakfast, so I'm afraid we can't comment on the quality of their food. Our main gripe was at check out time. We discovered that approximately AUD110 worth of local phone calls was mysteriously charged to our room phone. I disputed this with front desk but they were adamant that we made them! Why would I have kicked up a fuss about local calls if I didn't make them!? I found them to be extremely unhelpful, cold and very clinical in handling the issue. There was no sign of any empathy or concern whatsoever. I wasn't even offered a refund. Another hotel we stayed at in Jun 06 (Sheraton Mirage Port Douglas) and had a similar issue with offered us a refund on the spot - no questions asked. I was very dissapointed with the Westin Sydney to say the least. When it comes to hotels, you can have the nicest and modern looking rooms. But being the service industry, if your staff can't empathise or 'connect' with your customers (us), you'll never retain their business, and quite possibly lose them forever. The Westin Sydney has lost us as customers, and it will take a lot of convincing for me to give them a second chance. If you (like us) place emphasis on personalised and empathetic service above all else, the Westin Sydney isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: MarioTravel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfectly situated in the business area, but rather close to the keys as well as well as to darling harbour. Excellent service, clean rooms and perfect amenities for the business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but staff not very nice”
Reviews.Author: TMaiden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our vacation. Good location, clean hotel, and nice executive club. However, the staff and concierge was awful! The concierge was not nice and we had to do all our own research and we have quite a few Emails that were never responded to. My husband is a platinum member and they treated us like we just walked off the streets. We had to complain to get a nicer room, you would think for someone who spends 60% of their time in Starwood hotels as a paying customer we would have been treated a little better. Again, nice hotel but the staff could use some customer service training. We also asked someone at the hotel who was holding a walkie what time something was open until in the hotel, he just looked at us and said you can go see that person over there and ask yourself! Like could he not have said let me find out or let me raido and ask??? Crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Location”
Reviews.Author: odie015
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney lives up to what it bills itself as, a luxury business hotel. The rooms are clean and modern and offer all the nice little touches that you would expect from a high-end hotel. The rain shower-head was really great, however a bit out of place in drought-prone Australia. It's located right in downtown Sydney, a short walk from the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, so it's not hard to see the most popular sights in the city. I highly recommend the buffet breakfast in the upstairs restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Style for Christmas”
Reviews.Author: mavistwinkle
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of spending Christmas at The Westin (it was my Christmas present - lucky me!) We stayed in one of their Executive Suites and found the service and entire experience an absolute dream with a beautiful room. It was clean, well appointed and had the most luxurious bed - it was truly as marketed 'Heavenly'. Large Plasma TV's and BOSE Sound systems in both the sitting room and bedroom were fabulous, as was the quality of the decor. The room had floor to ceiling windows with fabulous views out onto the cityscape. The bedroom and sitting room were great but the bathroom was where I actually found myself spending most of my time.... The Executive Suites have deep, deep double ended baths which, once filled with hot bubbly water (this takes a while as the baths are so big!) you can sit in and press a button to lift the blind to the floor to ceiling window which looks out over the city. The best bath views I've ever taken in! The entrance to the building is to one side of the old Post Office building and has a great juxtaposition of old and new architecture which sit extremely well together. The Lobby in the courtyard is where, as a change from the usual Christmas Dinner, we decided to have Champagne High Tea. We were met by a friendly, charming girl who was obviously a natural at providing great customer service. As we sat admiring this architecture we were approached by a gentleman, who we assume was a porter, who proceeded to regail us with some history of the building and the local area giving us an insight into some extra things to do and places to go. The service from start to finish was second to none and I would love to go back (hint hint, nudge nudge!). This hotel most definitely lived up to expectation and I would happily stay again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely luxurious”
Reviews.Author: ghanno
Reviews.Content: LOCATION: The Westin is extremely centrally located at No 1 Martin Place, right near the Pitt St mall shopping district. The closest train station would be Martin Place and the second closest would be Wynyard. THE ROOM: We stayed in a standard room with a king size bed (which was extremely comfortable) in the modern wing (rather than the historic wing which is somewhat more expensive) and it was highly impressive. The dÃ©cor was very modern and the design of the room is quite unique: there is a glass pane separating the bedroom and the bathroom which means that you can see between the two rooms (although there is a shade that you can raise and lower if you so wish and the shower and toilet are in separate rooms protected by frosted glass). It also means that if you were in the bath, you could still watch TV (which happens to be a very large flat screen). Broadband internet is available in-room and wireless in the lobby at a rather high price. The toiletries in the bathroom were generous and smelt great. The room also provides bathrobes and there is an in-room safe and complete mini bar with free tea, hot chocolate and coffee-making facilities. SERVICE: We arrived at 11.30am and our room was already ready which was a nice touch, despite the fact that check-in usually isnâ€™t until the early afternoon. Every single staff member that we encountered was so very helpful and friendly and the hotel adds nice touches like a free newspaper outside your room in the morning if requested and some iced mineral water in the late afternoon (which we found when we returned from the gym). AMENITIES: Hotel guests can use the gym and pool free of charge at a section of the building which is part of The Westin property but the fitness centre is not owned or operated by the hotel. The gym is, however, quite large with a multitude of treadmills, stair walkers, bikes and rowing machines as well as a range of weighted equipment and free weights. Personal training and services at the spa can also be arranged at a fee. The pool is more like a lap pool and is much smaller in a section above the gym. There are many conference rooms in the hotel for business use but we never used any of these or the business centre. IN-ROOM DINING: We ordered room service which came promptly â€“ we were given an ETA of 30 minutes but it did arrive slightly before that at 27 minutes.. I highly recommend a wood fired pizza â€“ itâ€™s healthy and absolutely delicious! The food was quite pricey but it was in line with what I would expect from a hotel of this calibre. We never ate at Mosaic but the in-room menu boasts several dishes from the restaurant which contain â€˜superfoodsâ€™ and there is an explanation in the in-room brochure about such foods which promote healthy living, etc. MISC: One of the brochures in the room states that there are special running sessions with a Running Concierge but when I phoned the front desk, they informed me that this property doesnâ€™t have a Running Concierge. They do, however, have running maps (6kms or 8kms) available from the front desk. The Westin is a strictly smoke-free hotel and there is a $300 cleaning fee charged to your card if evidence of smoking is found in your room. In general, the hotel has a great feel â€“ they seem very â€˜with itâ€™ in terms of sustainability, charitable giving with the UNICEF â€˜check out for childrenâ€™ campaign that they run and healthy in terms of the menu.

Reviews.Title: “THE worst staff”
Reviews.Author: FrqntTrvlrMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Westin Sydney for 3 nights with family (2 rooms, total cost over $2000) - basically we won't be back - here are some pointers - - Zero recognition as Starwood Platinum othet than the points and breakfast - Front Desk Agent had no idea whether the hotel's rooms were connecting (!!) - had to get manager... - Asked for upgrade as Platinum Guest and was told hotel was full. I had to get a Starwood reservation for a Junior Suite to prove to the Service Express hotel operator that an upgrade was indeed available... She argued with me - literally argued with me - to the point I just asked for the Manager... He explained that of course an upgrade was available - just that it was on a low floor... (So why make me go to the extent of making a dummy reservation rather than be honest and up-front with me?!?...) - I advised I'll stay in a regular/non-upgraded room, but requested a higher floor - was advised only 1 of our 2 rooms could move to a higher floor... (Please keep in mind that I have been a Starwood Platinum member since the program was created... Most hotels recognize Platinum members with a fruit bowl or at the very least a note - at the Westin Sydney there is ZERO recognition) - After the first night I had my PA 'negotiate' to get the 2 rooms on a higher floor - I honestly can't tell you why the hotel staff make you jump through hoops to be decent/hospitable - at no cost to the hotel... - Asked for 2 bottled of complimentary water (which we got on the first day) and advised we can only get these at turn-down service... I thanked the operator and asked that these be delivered now instead of later - of course the bottles never came... :) - No Concierge at night... Asked Front Desk Manager how long it would take to get to Sydney Bridge Climb in the morning - his reply was "Oh, you could allow half an hour". I told him there was now way that The Rocks (area) was a half hour away from the hotel - he replied that he didn't know where the Bridge Climb was (this is one of Sydney's TOP tourist attractions!!) and of it's at The Rocks, then half an hour was about right - or maybe 15 minutes... Aaaahhhhh... Nothing like an ignorant local to give you misdirections... - Turned-up at Coffee Shop at 10.31pm - literally 10.31pm - and was told we could not be seated for desert as they close at 10.30pm... Spoke to 2 staff members who advised we should go to the lobby (we've already been there and they had nothing) or order room service (!!). After trying to 'negotiate' for a few minutes I asked for the manager, who apologised, but frankly, by then we were over it... Bottom line - hotel is well located, rooms are not large and have no views, but are nice/comfoartable and have decent bathrooms. Staff is a whole other story - long waits at front desk, and VERY MUCH in need of training in customer service - in several departments, from the phone, to front desk and f&b. Staff clearly unaware customers pay their wages and leave the impression we are distrubing them... We won't be back... :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: advocate_of_truth
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for my birthday. We arrived at 12 noon and Paul the very polite customer service employee said we could check in already and offered us the choice of 2 rooms and we ended up chosing the room on the 25th floor room 2502. This was the Starwood Guest floor. Paul even offered to deliver me a complimentary gift to my room for my birthday which ended up being cake, a letter and complimentary bottles of water (water was an amusing touch). The hotel staff were always ready to help in any way possible. The room itself was nice, clean and comfortable. You could see the bathroom through the glass window in the bathroom, or you could press a button to close the blinds on the bathroom window. The bathroom had a separate section for the bathroom and shower. The room itself had a nice view of Martin Place. The room had a flat screen and DVD player so it would've been good to bring own DVDs to watch. The gym was pretty average. It was a task to get to, and a confusing task to find the pool. The pool area is pretty average, nothing special. We ordered in room dining which was so expensive! $21 for a sandwich w fries and what they call a salad which consisted of just lettuce. They stuffed my order but was prompt to fix it. The restaurants in the hotel are very overpriced, you would better eating out. The hotel is located right next to Pitt Street Mall which is the shopping precinct of the city. Overall good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYCGlobal
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean, modern and very grand. Rooms are quite small for A$300/night. While the rooms are very modern with glass and beech wood, there were small things that were annoying for a 5 star. For example, the cabinet door to the mini fridge did not close properly and so the sharp stainless steel door handle was always jutting out waiting for you to gash yourself on it. This is exacerbated by the small size of the room which increased the likely hood of hurting yourself. The onsite Westin restaurant and bar was WAY overpriced. Since when did the Westin start competing with Michelin star restaurants in pricing? A$30 for a hotel cheeseburger??? Lets get serious. Oh ya, they tried to charge me an additional A$20 for a late checkout. My total bill was A$1,500 over 3 days and they tried to ding me with A$20 on the way out. Incredible. The hotel gym is actually a private members gym. It was old with old equipment. This would have been acceptable for a standard hotel but not a 5 star that charged $300 / night. Not a big deal but just another thing that adds up agains this hotel. Location was excellent and centrally located in the CBD - if thats what you need. To sum it up, the hotel is clean and slick but scratch past the veneer and its actually a fairly significant rip off. You can probably do better in a boutique hotel and get more bang for the buck.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Jadeandzoe
Reviews.Content: stayed in the Westin for 5 nights in October, what a brilliant hotel!! we were met upon arrival and bags were taken from us. we were whisked to reception to check in. as it was 7am the room would not be available to a few hours. the receptionist took my mobile phone number and said she would call when the room was available and sure enough at 10am i got the phonecall. when i arrived in the room the bags were already there. the room was gorgeous! very big with a huge bed which was so comfy that everytime i sat on it i nearly fell asleep!! the bathroom was just as good with a huge shower and a rainforest showerhead too! (i struggled to get the rainforest showerhead to work but reception staff were very helpful) the bath was big enough for tow people and had a huge glass window looking out into the room. great if you were with a partner and were happy to be seen in the bath but if not there was an electronic blind that came down. the room was cleaned every day and the shampoos etc replaced every day. there was even free bottled water and ice every evening! staff were very helpful and polite. i did not eat in the hotel but the prices were quite high. a little tip, if you go down the stairs in reception there are a vast array of restaurants and bars that serve lunch. (i did not spot them until the final day and it looked very busy but i cannot comment on prices or quality of food). great location 10 min walk from harbour, 5 minutes to the right of the hotel was a huge food court with great choices of food at great prices!! also brilliant shops within 10 mins walking distance! i would def recommend this hotel to people and would def go back! worth the money i paid to stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: montegrappa
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat my wife to a mini break by staying at the Westin Hotel in Sydney, Australia. We have previously eaten to this Hotel on many occassions and have been well treated by the team and have really enjoyed the experience. When we arrived at the Hotel for our stay, the receptionist was engaged with a customer, but within a split second, we were approached by another staff member (badge said supervisor) and were booked in quickly and efficiently wit a full explanation of all services at our disposal. He even booked a table at their Mosaic restaurant for us. The room was very well appointed and in modern taste, which we were very comfortable with. The service and quality of the food was exceptional. The wine list a little underdone, but adequate. In the morning, the breakfast was fantastic. The checkout process was fast and efficient. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MIKAAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 2 nights in July. We had an Executive Superior Room which overlooked the clock tower. Having booked on the internet, we got a very good price for our room. This included breakfast in the Westin Club room, not a huge selection but adequate for my husband and I. We found the room to be spotlessly clean with beautiful clean white linen (I'm very particular about clean linen and duvet covers). The bathroom was lovely and having a seperate WC. The two shower head option was nice and I did not have a problem with water pressure. The location is very good, only 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Hyde Park, one minute walk from Pitt St Mall. Concierge is very helpful. Great food available in the lower level food court. The internet is available in their business centre and it was fast and also had printers available for guests use, which I found to be excellent. We will be staying here again upon our return to Sydney and we will be recommending this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful bed, great location”
Reviews.Author: nymph2106
Reviews.Content: I couldn't find anything to dislike about the Westin Sydney, but then again, I'm usually not a 5-star hotel traveller, so maybe it was easy to be impressed! The check-in process was prompt, and the staff were reasonably friendly. The view from the room wasn't great, and we didn't get a room with a bathtub separated from the bedroom by a sheet of glass (what you will see in some of the travellers' pictures here). But we didn't have any major complaints, because the bed was very comfortable and the room was always clean and well made-up when we got back every evening. It was also very spacious, with the toilet and shower partitioned off from each other. The concierge in the lobby was friendly and knowledgeable and readily gave us directions to the factory outlets when we asked. Even though we weren't business travellers and certainly weren't dressed as such, I didn't notice any difference in treatment as some reviewers have noted here.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy showers”
Reviews.Author: miltonmao
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed here and I didnâ€™t like it 2 years ago and I still donâ€™t Oh yes, youâ€™ll be impressed by the dÃ©cor and the general finish of the place. But just wait till you have a shower. Now you know how annoying it is when you have a shower and someone in the house washes their hands or flushes the toilet. Well, imagine that in a hotel. The fluctuations were so severe I tried to shower very late at night but even then I kept getting frozen or burnt. Unbelievable, in 2 years they never bothered to fix it. Also, I donâ€™t know why but the Heavenly bed just didnâ€™t feel so heavenly.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, deluxe, very central in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: TheDutchFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for 5 nights mid-August. We had one room with two double beds, so we could sleep with 2 young kids in one room. Location is good, very central. 5 minutes walk from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and Hyde Park, one minute walk from Pitt St Mall and David Jones. In the heart of the CBD. Room is spacious, modern and spotless. Bathroom is beautiful, nice design, great rain shower and separate bathtub. Breakfast is good but overpriced, especially if you have very good alternatives in the lobby and around the corner. Staff was always very kind and professional. Concierge is very helpful (he helped us to get a table in Restaurant Tetsuyaâ€™s, although they were fully booked for months!). Lobby is big and always crowded. Great pizza and sushi in the lower level food court. Swimming pool is situated in the former GPO, quite a walk form the main building. Although not rather cheap, we can highly recommend this Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: traveltimeCanberra
Reviews.Content: We had high expectation of the Westin Sydney, having had a very enjoyable stay in the Westin Melbourne a couple of months ago. Our experience wasn't up to standard. Firstly, the initial room we were allocated (Rm 303) was very noisy, as it overlooked the restaurants and central atrium. We were so close you could tell what the guest sitting below ordered for dinner. As we had work committments the following day, we went to reception to request a room change. The reception staff member didn't handle the request well - he informed us that the hotel would be quiet after 10.00pm (?), that no other rooms were available and that there was no way he could be expected to remember us checking in as he was a busy man (we'd checked in with him less than 10 minutes previously). Anyway, after a 15 minute wait and consultation with the manager, we were eventually moved to the 18th floor. A much better room, lot quieter but it hadn't been cleaned properly. There was a sticky mess, perhaps juice, on one of the bedside tables and the other had a foul smelling liquid under the radio. We used a flannel from the bathroom to clean this up. In fairness the rest of the room and the bathroom were very clean, so I'm not sure how this grottiness was overlooked. I'd also say that the room decor isn't up to 5 star standard. The carpet looks like it escaped from a basic hotel chain, ditto the upolstery fabric. A long way from luxe. Breakfast was very good. Friendly staff, excellent choice of food and consistently good quality. Worth getting there early to avoid the queque on a Sunday. All in all, if I were in Sydney and looking for a business hotel this is fine but if I wanted somewhere special to stay I'd look further.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: alexandre123456
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a very nice hotel in downtown Sydney, staff is helpful and courteous - I disagree with the previous reviews. The hotel is nicely located, among pedestrian streets, shopping malls, and within walking distance of many touristic sites. I recommend it more for business than leisure. we were driving around NSW and had to park the car under the hotel: this parking is expensive and procedure for hotel guests to park and pay is not easy. Other than that, the stay, the clean room, the food, the staff, all was perfect. we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst night ever”
Reviews.Author: HONkiev
Reviews.Content: Normally I like Westin due to their heavenly beds. I don't know why but at the Westin Sydney the mattress has been sooo soft that I couldn't sleep at all. I called the reception and the told me that they can help me - the next day (which didn't help since I stayed only one night)! So finally I moved to the floor and tried to sleep there. It has been one of the most horrible nights I every had.

Reviews.Title: “Schzophrenic hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: W0zza
Reviews.Content: I heartily agree with Classylad's review of the Westin Sydney - it must have been something about last week because we seem to have had pretty much the same experience. On arrival last Tuesday (3June) for my 10th stay this year(at the Westin Sydney) the reception I got at check-in can only be described as a fiasco and certainly well short of what I expect from the Westin Sydney. It's odd because on my last stay here in April, my colleague and I were bowled over by the helpful, friendly staff who went out of their way to make us feel welcome. The first room I was given was certainly not an upgrade - one of the benefits expected as a Gold SPG member within 2 stays of Platinum membership and on my 10th visit!!!! When I opened the curtains in the first room I was allocated, it faced on to the bridge across to the heritage building. Anyone walking across the bridge would look straight into my room....certainly not what I expect of a 5 star hotel nor as a very frequent, repeat guest. When working in the business centre, my colleague and I tried to order 2 cups of coffee. We called room service and were told that we could not do that. Neither of us could understand why it is possible to order a cappuccino in your room and charge it to your room but NOT possible to order a coffee to the business centre and charge it to your room??!! I honestly feel that some of the staff need to be reminded of some basic facts of the service industry. 1. Guests (never mind FREQUENT REPEAT guests) are the only reason the staff at the Westin have jobs. 2. the really frequent, repeat guests are the ones they should go the extra mile for. 3. NOTE to reception desk staff : If you're going to lie to the customer, make damned sure it's a whopper ... not some half wit excuse you came up with on the spur of the moment. We are not dumb and it annoys us to think we are PAYING you for a service that you are NOT delivering. Failing that, we (the paying guests), have a choice and I for one, will exercise that choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel. Inconsistent service. Impressive housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: ClassyLad
Reviews.Content: We're big fans of Westin hotels, particularly in Melbourne. Our recent experience in Sydney fell short of our expectations of a five star hotel. For starters, when the taxi arrived there was no one to greet us or collect our luggage. Bad first impression. After I hauled our suitcases out of the cab boot we walked past three staff members as we wheeled our way to the reception counter. Not one offered to help - they just stood there and watched. During our stay, I also noticed other guests wheel their luggage through the reception area. I thought this was really odd for a five star hotel. Despite this, there was evidence of exceptional service worthy of a 5-star hotel. The housekeeping staff were fantastic including the excellent turn down service - thank you. Some reception and management staff were also exceptional with their friendly and thoughtful service; however, management needs to ensure other staff perform to a five star standard e.g the porters, or rather lack of them, on arrival and departure. The rooms' are contemporary, comfortable and spacious. The bathroom is huge and luxurious - one reason why we like Westin hotels. The room service menu is standard hotel fare - personally I think it all seems so 1990s. It offers your usual club sandwich, burger and pasta fare. This was a room service menu at its boring best. I think there was a 'restaurant menu' option but it was too late when we ordered so I didn't even bother reading it. Low-fat menu options available 24/7 would be welcomed by us e.g healthy salads, fish, anti pasto, low-fat chicken dishes. Unfortunately I didn't get a chance to test run the gym - I decided to go for a jog over the Sydney Harbour Bridge instead.. well worth it.... stunning views! We've stayed here a few times and we're not sure if there are rooms with harbour views - it's a good distance from the harbour...it's closer to the mall and business district. If you want Sydney harbour views stay in a hotel closer to the harbour. This hotel is perfect for the business traveller - tourists may prefer hotels with harbour views and closer to The Rocks. Normally we are very impressed bit this time it was slightly below par.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is just okay”
Reviews.Author: jetsette
Reviews.Content: Westin is in a good location, almost center of city. There are 2 train stops located within walking distance. The rooms are very contemporary, the bathroom design was especially pleasing. I paid extra to be in the higher floors for better views and was given access to the executive lounge for breakfast, afternoon tea, and o'deurves. The breakfast is okay, and the o'deurves is nothing to write home about. The complimentary wireless in the lounge was very handy. The Westin is walking distance to most points of interest, the opera house, darling harbour, etc. Room service takes very long, over an hour, to get to your room. The gym and pool are nice, but a long walk from the tower my room was in; they are located in the older part of the building. The main area that needs improvement at this Westin is the customer service. The personnell in the executive lounge was very slow in serving cordials and teas. The food is served buffet style, but if you are thirsty, it's a good wait. Front desk was not as friendly as some other Westins I have stayed at. Paying extra for the high rooms, was not worth it in the end, as my view was blocked by taller buildings or construction. I was only able to get a glimpse of the harbour in between obstructions. Post office located onsite, this came pretty handy also.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent corporate hotel with modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: jlb3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the Sydney portion of our honeymoon. We are Starwood Preferred Guest members and thus were able to pay for part of our stay in points. Our main concern was having a quality hotel with a central, convenient location. This hotel is adjacent to Macquarie Bank and as such does a lot of corporate business; it is obviously more of a business-style hotel. That was fine with us - we had other portions of our trip for the more romantic/quaint type of thing. The rooms are ultamodern with electronic light and fixture controls, glassed-in bathrooms with extra large tubs and a separate shower, and a flat screen TV with sound that is pumped throughout the room. Everything in the room looked brand new and worked well. We did not order room service or use the restaurant other than for the breakfast buffet, which offered a wide variety of options including powerfood-type juice blends. The health club, as other posters have noted, is a bit far away from the modern, new tower (about a 5min walk across a catwalk on the third floor) but is excellently appointed. As it is a private gym and not merely the hotel's health club facility, it has all the features of a modern European-style health club, including a lap pool. We found the staff of the hotel to be extremely helpful and efficient, as one would expect of a Westin. The skylit, multi-story lobby is also very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoneymooners
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin in Sydney several times and never been disappointed. The hotel is impeccable clean and well maintained, the rooms are modern, equipped with all the amenities, have comfortable beds and great bathrooms. The room service is nice but quite pricey. The hotels heritage rooms are also lovely but I prefer the tower rooms as I like to stay on a high floor. The hotel's restaurant is delicious and the restaurants and bars at GPO (located within the hotel) are fantastic. The only downside is the hotel lobby, restaurants and GPO (the parts that are open) are very quite and dead on the weekend. The hotel is in a great location, close to public transport, main CBD shopping areas and walking distance to many tourist attractions. I'd never consider staying at another hotel when I visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: aimantakkisah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nites on 14th April 2008. The rooms are clean and spacious. Stayed at Level 25 but not much view, many tall buildings around. Only able to see other buildings. Good location, only 8 minutes walk to Circular Quay which is near to the Opear house. The hotel is also near to 2 train stations ie Martin Place and Wynnard. Many high end shops nearby. Be reminded that the hotel is 100% smoke free so you would see people smoking at the entrance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: GinaLBoston
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. We spent one night here and when they found out it was our anniversary sent a bottle of champagne to our room. The service was excellent, the room was beautiful, the bed comfortable, and the bathroom large and modern and well laid out. This hotel does not have a great view, and is downtown, but we loved it. We did use the gym and did not think the walk was bad-- you get to see the old part of the hotel, and if you are working out it's not clear why a long walk is a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: JessieWindermere
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 10 days at the Westin Sydney as part of our extended holiday January and Febuary. When we booked we were aware we would be in the CBD as opposed to the more central tourist area of the Harbour or Rocks, this was fine as we were only a 10 minute walk away.When we arrived we were promptly checked in but unfortunately to a room that smelt heavily of smoke.We found this very strange as we had been informed prior to our arrival that smoking was banned (this was a strong factor in choosing this hotel) and also that there were heavy penalties for doing so.We immediatley complained and were transfered to another room.The staff throughout our stay were pleasant enough but I would agree with a previous reviewer that they treated 'suits' differently, my husband and I are 'suits' but not on holiday and we found the attitude amusing.We had excellent service from the service express dept and the housekeeping was to a good standard.We ate in the restaurant on one occasion and this was to a good standard but even by Sydney standards expensive.we found the location excellent a great atmosphere in the bars etc in the week and more peaceful at weekends.The main dissapointment for us was the poor weather but that is not the hotels fault.

Reviews.Title: “Great CBD Location”
Reviews.Author: TrvlOftn
Reviews.Content: Great business location. Neighborhood is slow on weekends, busy during the week. Not sure about the negative reviews, but service was great for us. Checked us in early and room was great. Value proposition isn't the best, but still one of the best hotels in Sydney. Walkable to the Quay and neighborhood pubs that have busy happy hours.

Reviews.Title: “Superb room - Arrogant hotel”
Reviews.Author: pirate-allie
Reviews.Content: Personally I prefer the Radisson Plaza! I cannot fault the room. the very comfortable bed and the great facilities at the Westin. However, all were soured by the rudeness of the person checking me in. First they had messed up my booking but didn't apologies, secondly they told me twice about how I would be fined if I smoked - I felt that they were making assumptions based on the slightly hippy casual clothes I was wearing when I checked in that i was a smoker. I am not. Thirdly, I was disappointed when I came down later in a business suit (I was there for work) that their attitude was completely different. this alone put me off this hotel. The final downside was the extortionate price of room service compared to similar hotels in Sydney. I was left with the overall impression that this hotel thinks it is better than it is. If it's possible for a hotel to be arrogant then the Westin has it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice except for Pool area!”
Reviews.Author: Harvsman
Reviews.Content: Needed some R & R so headed up to Sydney for 3 nights over Australia Day Weekend to catch up with some friends and enjoy a leisurely few days away. Booked a room at the Westin and checked in late on the Fri night. The guy who served me (I think he was irish) was very friendly and issued me a room on the 19th floor in the tower. The porters were also very on the ball and immediately offered to take my bags up. Got up to the room and it was beautiful! Very nice room with a view of 2 office towers and if you craned your neck you could just see a podium from the Sydney harbour bridge. Room had a plasma tv (Mine wasn't working when i arrived but when i let them know early the next morning it was fixed immediately) with about 30 channels and about 5 radio stations. bathroom had a huge shower with massage showerhead and your standard westin tolietries. It also had a seperate bath but the only thing i found weird was it had a glass wall so you could see the hotel room as you went to the toliet. They did have an electronic blind you could pull down at the touch of a button but it was a bit of a strange experience. One day i went to the pool area which as someone had mentioned is a LONG walk through many corridors and a lift! When i finally got there whilst i appreciate the heritage building is an older building the pool was missing tiles and to be quite frank looked shabby. It looked in bad need of an overhaul. There was no spa attached and the deep end was just over a metre in depth and it was quite small. I didn't actually get to use the actual gym so i can't comment on that but the staff seemed friendly enough when i went to use the pool. All in all a good choice with just some minor issues. A great location and i would definitely be happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Sydney falls short and hits average”
Reviews.Author: xxxkits722
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Westin Sydney for 5 days during Christmas week 2007. Our experience teetered between average and above average during our entire stay. Unfortunately, the high cost of the (higher than usual, due to holiday season) nightly rate was not properly supplemented by the usual Westin experience. We have stayed at many Westins over the years, and this one fell short of expectations. After all, if you are paying for some pampering, you should at least get a little. The positives: Our room was located on the SPG Executive floor, just a couple doors down from the Westin Executive Club. Breakfast is served daily in the Club. Pleasant, though the selections were average and do not change. Free wifi is also available in the Club. The room and bath were spotless and spacious, very contemporary, with a few notable touches. The giant heavenly bed is a favorite of ours. Two train stations are nearby, 5 minutes or less by foot, with a line to the airport. Good location: walking distance to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, and plenty of CBD shopping. The negatives: Service in the Club was surprisingly below par. And all they had to do was bring our drinks. Only two people provided adequate service. The others, too busy chatting with each other. Views to the harbour are obstructed by tall buildings. We didn't chose the Westin for the view; but if one was interested in unobstructed harbour view, ask for the very top floors or choose another hotel. The concierge staff didn't know much about the area. We spoke to 3 different concierges about restaurants and sites nearby and they gave us wrong information, wrong directions, wrong times, etc... This was highly disappointing because we were not up for wild goose chases in a strange city. They were also not personable and acted as if they were being disturbed, even though each was just standing at their desk on the 3 occasions we came by to ask questions. God forbid we ask them to book us reservations and do their job. If your room is in the newer tower, it is a LONG trek to the pool and gym which is located in the older, historical tower. The restaurant onsite is expensive and forgettable. I can't even remember it's name. The food was served in very small portions and barely average in taste. Better to walk to Darling Harbour. Front desk service was average, not quite welcoming but not quite cold. There was one friendly and helpful fellow though. We're hoping that this experience is an isolated incident. If we had to fly to Sydney again, we would probably give this place a second chance. Hopefully, their service will have improved by then.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: melb0864
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this beautiful property on January 4 - January 8. The service on all levels was beyond our expectations from the fantastic restaurant recommendations by the friendly concierge staff to the smiling housekeeping ladies who did the room. Can't praise this hotel enough - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Good - but a bit less than expected”
Reviews.Author: WLDGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin, Sydney at the end of a month's holiday in Australia. We were quite impressed with the room, it was very spacious with lots of nice touches. The bathroom was quirky (with a window into the bedroom) if a little pointless. I felt the hotel location was ok but very quiet at the weekend as in the business district. We weren't at all impressed with the pool which we had to walk miles to get to. Not really worth it. Also, I didn't find the hotel reception staff very friendly or helpful. We had been to Sydney at the beginning of our trip also and stayed at the Old Sydney Holiday Inn and felt that we actually enjoyed our stay there far better although it was no where near as fancy or expensive. We preferred it also in terms of location as it is in the Rock's district which is far nicer than the CBD for tourists

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Sharphan
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Westin. Room was excellent. Service from reception, concierge and housekeeping excellent. Breakfast excellent value. However other meals not so good value

Reviews.Title: “Worst service in the city”
Reviews.Author: kady179
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, nice location, but terrible concierge service! Not just unhelpful but flat out rude--bring a laptop, because if you need any recommendations, you will have to find them yourself online. Also, rooms are awkward to stay in for more than a day since they don't have a dresser or drawers of any kind. I have stayed at the Westin Sydney at least twice a year since it opened, and the service has gone downhill significantly over the last few years. This time, I arrived with extended family who has never been to Sydney before, and asked for a assistance with a dinner booking and movie times at a nearby. Concierge made a face (!) handed me a newspaper, and told me to find the local cinemas in there. Asked if he could he look it up for us and print out the times, like the concierge usually does? No. The next day I saw another concierge was there, and thought I would try again. I asked Gary if there were any restaurants in Chinatown he could recommend. He said sure, listed a few, said there is nothing nice in Chinatown in Sydney, and we should just show up and choose one in the area. I asked if he could make us a booking. No. Are any of the ones he listed better than the others? Quiter? Better service? He stated they were all the same to him. When I got back to the hotel a few hours later I went back up tot the room, paid $30 for an internet connection, looked up the restaurants, called, and found they were completely booked, except for one available time at 5.30. I then tried calling the concierge again, got another person and asked if he could recommend something else. He was unable (or unwilling) to do so. For a hotel of this standard, I would expect a concierge to be able to make these bookings and provide recommendations as required. I have tipped very well every time a concierge has made a booking for me here over the last 8 years, and was very suprised by the serious dowturn in the service. I will not be staying here again. If you are looking for decent service in Sydney, try the Park Hyatt instead.

Reviews.Title: “A true "aussie" hotel under an American brand”
Reviews.Author: DPK-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently spent six nights at the Westin Hotel in Sydney. After reading through mixed reviews on this website, I went ahead with my booking because , well, there does not seem to be any better choices in Sydney. Each luxury hotel in the city has its own issues, be it a small-sized standard room, or poor management, or both. Oh, did I forget to mention the famous heavenly bed at the Westin? The heavenly bed was indeed from the other world. The choices of pillows were fantastic as well. We booked an superior room on the executive floor, which is a bit on the smaller side (probably smaller than my ideal size of 45 sqm). View was standard city view into other office towers. Our Bathroom has a rainshower stall and a deep soaking tub. The executive lounge is located on the 28th floor of the hotel. The size of the lounge is again small and it can get crowded during breakfast time. The lounge serves a small buffet breakfast with a few hot items and evening drinks and hors d'oeuvres. Unlike a few other club-level lounges we patroned, it is up to the individual waiter/waitress whether they would give you a bottle of water outside the lounge for your sight-seeing during the day. As one waiter put it "we only allow you to consume our food and beverages within the lounge." On a number of occasions, we saw people "sneaking" food and drinks out under the cover of their newspaper. Services were spotty and in accordance with the "relaxed" attitude of Australian culture, as advised by one popular travel book. The front desk staff denied my membership entitlement to upgrade to a preferred room and stated the room I reserved for was a preferred room already. Housekeeping was forgetful about replacing toothbrushes and other vanity items. One conciege staff did not know how to go to the Fish Market via public transport. The list can go on, but you get the point. Overall, Westin Sydney has the hardware and brand name of a five star hotel and service of a 3 star. Next time, maybe I will try the Marriott in Circular Quay or get a service apartment instead.

Reviews.Title: “Style and Substance in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: australian73
Reviews.Content: Ahhh the Westin. Possibly Australia's most comfortable and stylish hotel. Pure quality and luxury. The rooms are very similar to The Westin in Melbourne. Huge heavenly beds with a plethora of pillows to choose from, plasma TV, good work space and a bathroom to die for. Huge shower head, deep bath and luxury fittings. The hotel bar has table service and attracts the deal makers of Sydney. Located in the heart of the city close to everything. The best part is you have FREE access to a fully equipped professional gym for a good work out. The breakfast restaurant was excellent, with high quality food and plenty of choice. Yes its slightly more expensive than other locations in Sydney but it is worth every cent

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: vanmarie72
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, first class hotel in a super convenient location. Loved it. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “5*+. Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Having read good reviews I stayed here just the1 night using points and was not disappointed. I was allocated a junior suite which was not particularly spacious but was absolutely perfect in every sense, very modern, lots of glass, dream bathroom, walk in shower room, big bath plus the standard issue Westin beds and linen. Everything in the hotel and my room looked new. Why can't my house look like this! The reception and bar staff were efficient and friendly, the ambience of the hotel felt pleasant due to the large open spaces of the lobby and old inner quadrangle that now serves as the restaurant. Some of the features in this grand old building have been preserved, one of which is the steel circular stairway to the business centre which I was able to use free of charge including internet station and printer. Despite being billed as a business district location it is still a good tourist location being maybe a 10 minute walk to Circular key and 5 minutes to Wynyard train station which is a direct line to the airport. I know a few folk gripe about the cost of meals, drinks and laundry which of course were exepnsive but you know that when you visit a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel but watch the extras”
Reviews.Author: suttonLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip in August. Got a corporate rate of AU$290 which was great - I have previously stayed at the Amora Jamison and the Westin is really in a different class. I won't be visiting the Amora again. The room was very spacious, a 37" flat TV with a reasonable range of channels, wonderful bathroom with monsoon shower and of course the heavenly bed. The staff are very polite and helpful - they don't hang around expecting tips. On the downside (if I had been spending my own money) is the price of the extras - AU$20 a day to use the gym, a fairly basic breakfast can get up into the AU$50 region if taken in your room and AU$100 for a week of internet access. I use my mobile phone but a 5 min call is AU$40 to the UK or US they helpfully inform us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Tawny-Frogmouth
Reviews.Content: This is a first class hotel with excellent service, great location and wonderful views. We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and had a wonderful time, in fact we came in and out of here 2 or 3 times. They looked after our luggage when we travelled up north, changed our room when the air-con went on the blink without a hitch. This is how a hotel should be run - I can't recommend this place highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comfortable Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LAWoman100
Reviews.Content: This is a modern hotel built above the old post office in Sydney. Located on Martin Place in the downtown, it is a short walk to the harbor and most main attractions. The rooms are modern and clean. Service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for business or leisure”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer74
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Westin Sydney on a business trip, however, the location is also excellent for leisure travelers due to its proximity to attractions such as the Opera House. The rooms were of good size, offered the wonderful Heavenly Beds, but the real clincher for me was the beautiful bathroom and huge tub. The staff was also very effective and one member of their staff was extraordinarily helpful when their printers in their business center wouldn't work. She allowed me to e-mail my documents to her, printed them, made copies, and brought them to my room immediately and turned around what could have been a very frustrating situation. I would absolutely recommend this property and stay again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: flyingroo
Reviews.Content: I've recently reviewed the Shangri La and Four Seasons and given this is usually one of the 3 hotels I stay in whilst in Sydney I'd thought I would give my views on this hotel. One of Sydney's newer hotels and in a very central location, the Westin mixes modern chic with old age charm, but it does come at a cost. Whereby other hotels do charge for general additional services, the Westin charges to excess. Room service, restaurants food is average and don't warrant the prices they charge. A charge for the use of the privately run gym is also somewhat exhorbitant (and the gym's not that great either)and the charge for using the internet is also above those of other 5 star hotels. What the Westin does offer however are modern, clean and very comfortable rooms. Decor blends in well and calming. The bathrooms are large and modern and try and book one of the tower rooms where you can sit in the bath and look out into the city skylne. Beds are the classic Westin 'heavenly', very comfortable. Service requests are attended to promptly but lacks the warmth factor. Overall the Westin is a lovely hotel but for me apart from the modern rooms, I prefer the Shangri La or Four Seasons. But if its a central location you're after then go the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: RexVictoriaAustralia
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when in sydney. Probably the best 5 star hotel in sydney with good staff. The hotel also charges 5 star prices for everything but that aside you will have a great time at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly great experience”
Reviews.Author: grsurfer
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. Period. I was visiting Sydney for a week, and I was thoroughly impressed with this hotel. The facility, the rooms, the service, the atmosphere - everything was excellent without a doubt. The service at the Westin Sydney was extremely professional and attentive. The location is excellent for exploring the downtown area - walking distance from a lot of great restaurants and also the harbor. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: makawaobadgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very elegant. Centrally located in the City Center, it was easy to get around while vacationing in Sydney. It's also a great hotel for business travelers, because of being in the center of the city. The rooms were not that large, but had all the wonderful amenities of the Westin that I am used to. I loved the location being a 10 minute walk to Circular Quay, Darling Harbor, Botanical Gardens, Sydney Tower, etc. I had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “West-out!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentFrier
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin for a day and a half for a weekend convention. The side rooms (on floor 12 at least) face a narrow gap between office buildings, without much privacy. The rooms are quiet and modern, and the bathrooms are beautifully decorated. However ... the turn-down service turned-up after 9pm, our breakfast had a dirty coffee cup included, our newspaper was missing one section, and they didn't put in our Starwood number from the booking form. Each were minor issues - although I don't think I've ever turned over a newly arrived room service coffee cup to find it needed a wash before - but they added up to a less than OK experience.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great, Service Great even with cranky toddler!”
Reviews.Author: Bellbird
Reviews.Content: Our second stay recently and still great. We had three rooms of family and found them most accomodating of us all. We got joined and recently refreshed rooms, with new TVS etc and DVD which our toddler enjoyed immensely. We notified them at v short notice of our need for a cot and arrived to find it made up with a small packet of essential baby items (nice gesture and unexpected). My current favourite Sydney hotel. If you're in Sydney for a little retail therapy as well, the location can not get better!

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel that delivers!”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The decor is modern, new, and just what I like. The glass bathroom in the tower buildings are awesome! The service is great too. The concierge remembered my last name and greeted me every time I passed by. It rained 2 of the 4 days I was there and the hotel was quick to hand out umbrellas as I left the building each time. The front desk clerk sent up a bottle of wine with a nice note saying this should make a day in the rain more enjoyable. This hotel is in a great location for the for business or leisure traveler. The maid service is great, with a turn-down service that was more like a second full service room cleaning. I highly suggest this hotel. They really get it. I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “First Class Service”
Reviews.Author: snippyPerth
Reviews.Content: Excellent service was simply the perfect accompaniment to such a lovely hotel in a grand location. Surroundings were always clean, staff were always friendly and eager to go out of their way to help. One would be mad to go past the Westin as their choice of accommodation. My only complaint would be the shifty in house driver who took me to the airport, overcharging me for the ride thinking I wouldn't notice. But I still wouldn't let that stop me from staying there again...I'd just take a cab next time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: anagiocla
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 nights in 2 rooms as golden Starwood Members and not only they have not given us any promised free room upgrade, but the housekeeping was absolutely awful and unsufficient for such a pretentious hotel. Room cupboards are very small and we have been obliged to keep everything in the suitcases. Bathrooms are gorgeous and large but...what for if the rest is so...poor. Breakfast with long lines every morning and...poor as well. Too high air conditioned in all the hotel. We have frozen. Better chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast in Bed”
Reviews.Author: Pepper-Repper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, lovely room, fab bathroom, but you may want to order breakfast in bed. We had to queue for breakfast, because there were to many people. But they do have a great breakfast. Service is great, and the location is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! (Again)”
Reviews.Author: SamW_DC
Reviews.Content: Second time to stay at this hotel and was not disappointed again. Check-in process was friendly and although no suites were available, the agent put me in a great Tower room on the 22nd floor with a Martin Place view (see photo). The room was superb. I just love how the bathroom looks into the bedroom and vice versa (a blind can be used if you wish). The bed seemed much more comfortable than other heavenly beds; it was wonderful. The bathroom was clean, large, and had decent amenities. A Turn-down service replaced the towels in the evening and gave the bathroom a fresh clean. DVD players and flat screen TV's are provided, and an excellent BOSE sound system was beside the bed which was great for CD's. The mini-bar is huge and well-stocked. I won't go on about the location, but trust other reviewers - this is a PRIME spot for tourists to Sydney. I walked down to Circular Quay / Opera House in about 15 minutes, and immediately around the hotel there are quality shops and services.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattrLondon
Reviews.Content: The Westin Sydney is a great hotel and I would recommend it to anyone. It is in a superb location, right in the centre of the city which makes it great for business and/or tourist visits. The staff have always been helpful and responsive. The rooms are stylish and very well appointed - the bathrooms are a particular highlight. The only downer about the rooms (as is the case in many hotels) is that they have old TVs, which look terrible in such great rooms. The building itself is beautiful. The breakfast (only food I have ever eaten at the hotel) is really good, although the restaurant gets extremely busy on the weekend which can mean you need to wait for a while for a table to become free. I've stayed here a few times now and have had consistently good experiences. While it is not cheap, it still provides good value for money. It would be my first choice hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the world - no complaints for us”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: We ended our two week Australian vacation at the Westin in Sydney and the easiest way to describe it is as icing on a cake. Everything about our stay was perfect. When we checked in at 12, we were escorted right up to our room. While we didn't have a view, we were so grateful to be able to get our room at that early time that we didn't care. The room is nothing short of luxury, with the bathtub being the best and most comfortable tub for one or two to enjoy. The rain showerhead was so good that I want the exact one in my home. The bed was like a cloud. One morning we ordered room service breakfast (by the way, one person full breakfast is enough for 3 people - it was enormous and an amazing value for $38 for room service), and just lounged in their cozy bathrobes. It couldn't have been more peaceful and wonderful. The gym is also fabulous. It is not just a hotel gym, but one that people in Sydney actually sign up for. It has classes, an entire room of cardio equipment and very well stocked weight room. We were incredibly impressed with this gym and can definitely recommend it, even for the biggest fitness buffs. Now, you really don't want to leave your room it's so wonderful, but when you do, you find that you are seconds away from the best shopping in Sydney. It is a 10 minute walk down to the quay, and the ferries where you can explore the beaches and the harbour life. We found the staff to be exceptional, as we had some faxes and important calls. They helped us through all of the business we had to do, as well as our tourist desires. We were sending things to Canada and they even helped us figure out the codes to dial. We don't give 5/5 ratings very often but this one deserved it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Wesin! Rooms, Location the best”
Reviews.Author: MKSKI
Reviews.Content: Just spend a GREAT week at the Westin and could not have been treated better - from being able to check in when we arrived at 9:00 in the morning, to the large room with a view of the clock to the waterfall shower and huge tub - to the not charging for the extra bed for my daughter. We also enjoyed the breakfasts with all the fresh food and the useage of the Health Club and pool. The location was great - right across from Starbucks (cannot seem to do without my Mocha) and the ease with getting to Darling Harbor or Circular Quay as well as Hyde Park and the shopping areas. Easy access to the monorail as well.

Reviews.Title: “A high quality hotel, ruined by terrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: jimthetraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 4 days to kick off a long holiday in Australia. Despite the hotel being informed directly with our arrival date and time, it would have been nice of them to inform us that the Sydney marathon was running when we expected to arrive and effectively cut-off the hotel from the rest of the city. We were forced, after being abandoned by the taxi driver, to run through/across the runners in the marathon dragging our luggage behind us then walk 8 or so blocks to the hotel. Not fun after a 24hr flight. The bell boy at the hotel seemed to find this very funny. A top class hotel would have informed us of the problem beforehand and arranged some help - at least a bell-hop or taxi/shuttle on the 'inside' of the marathon to help with luggage. This terrible start was a real shame as the physical building itself is fantastic, the lobby great, the room was excellent and the bathroom very well appointed. If it wasn't for the marathon debacle and the laughing bell-boy this hotel would have got 4 stars. A short walk from the hotel to circular key (rocks, bridge, opera house) or Darling Harbour (loads of resturants and bars). Of course you are in the CBD which is quiet on weekends but buzzy during the week with lots of shops etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hardware, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Critical_eye1111
Reviews.Content: I have spent more than 100 room nights in various Sydney hotels over the past 3 years, with the bulk of them at the Westin. I have also stayed at the Four Seasons, Shangri-La and Hilton. WESTIN: Pros - large rooms, bathrooms with character and space, comfortable beds, central location for business and shopping, rarely crowded lobby, SPG points (my main motivation!) Cons - lax service (1 out of 2 room service orders are bungled up despite specific reminders), no recognition even if you stay 30 nights a year, room service menu limited and unchanged in 3 years, food in room and in the Mosaic restaurant is very poor quality for what you pay, in-room toiletry is standard issue Westin (poor), management is not very interested in feedback FOUR SEASONS: Pros - excellent service, food is generally high standard and very accomodating, great location, great toiletry, fantastic views (if you get the right room), overall friction-free experience, and a hint of romance Cons - rooms are small and standard-issue except for the views(definitely not FS standards) HILTON: Pros - HHonors points, location is good for shopping Cons - incredibly small bathrooms (even after a room upgrade as a Diamond member), views into other office buildings from room window, crowded lobby SHANG: Pros - views (opera house facing rooms only - "harbour view" rooms face the bridge expressway!), rooms are decent size, good bar (Altitude) Cons - location is a bit out of the way, food is not very good (room service advised me that some of their room service food was made in bulk elsewhere and trucked in, so cannot be altered!), service generally laid back and lax, a very ordinary hotel and a world away from the usual Shangri-La standards In sum, I think the Westin is acceptable for a short business visit, but you pay too much for merely a competent room and good location. For frequent stayers, service levels at the Westin become an annoyance. The Four Seasons has the edge over all others due to location and service. It is now my pick. If only they had better furnished rooms and a frequent stayer program! Overall, the quality of Sydney hotels is a couple of notches below major Asian or US city hotels. It is really a sea of mediocrity at European big city prices.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and character”
Reviews.Author: BeachBagger
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in January 2006. Expensive but wonderful facilities, service and location. With so many modern hotels in Sydney CBD it was also wonderful to stay in an old building with real character.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: Melb_is_home
