Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night, so didn't get to experience a whole lot of the Westin and can't say a whole lot about it. We actually chose to stay in the heritage (rather than tower) section of the hotel, which is older, and the hallways almost had a dormitory feel to them, so would probably go for a tower room if we happened to stay again (unlikely though! mainly due to lack of an intimate feel to the hotel, which we prefer, so would probably choose a hyatt or sheraton next time). The heritage superior king room was quite spacious, HUGE ceilings which were a lovely unique feature, a lot of closet space, modern bathrooms and all the comforts you need. On the down side, our room was on a low level so being a Saturday night it was extremely noisy on the street until all hours. Breakfast was amazing, it was part of our package (where we also got champage and chocolates - a great deal off wotif!). Overall, very efficient, very clean and modern, but in our opinion probably more suited to business travellers or couples who don't mind large scale hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin”
Reviews.Author: jrld
Reviews.Content: Westin Sydney is a wonderful hotel in a perfect location. Upon our early arrival the front desk staff was very kind and understanding of our 15 hour flight from the US. We were given a room immediatley. The room was spacious and modern. There was a floor to ceiling window with an amazing view. We were lucky enough to have a room on the 27th floor. The bathroom was also perfect. The rain shower was my personal favorite. The concierge was also very helpful. We had many great dinners in Sydney thanks to his knowledge and expertise. We only ate breakfast at the hotel. A bit pricy but good. The Westin will always be our hotel of choice when traveling to Sydney. Thank you for enhancing an already amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Location, & Price”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the first 4 nights of our Sydney Trip. We are platinum SPG members and were treated like loyalty. Got an upgrade to a corner suite. We also stayed using corporate rate, so we had a great deal. Here are the pros and cons. PROS: a. Very clean and modern hotel. Supervisor checks the room after maid/cleaning service has done its job and make sure its up to Westin's standards. b. Plenty of closet space to hang clothes and lots drawers, if you are here for extended stay. c. Close to popular shopping areas d. Staffs are young, but very friendly. e. Parking is expensive but very easy. Valet service is flawless and always on top of their service. f. Hotel is secure & safe. Elevator access by key card only. g. Recognizes SPG Gold and Platinum members. h. Club lounge has plenty of seats, space, and great service. i. Taxi service is always available. j. Bed was always made, bathroom cleaned well, extra towels always provided. k. Great floor to window view! CONS: a. Far away from popular restaurants and dining options (such as the wharf and the harbour). Walkiing distance about 1.5 to 2 miles. b. Very business like hotel, does not feel cozy or resort like. This is definitely a business hotel. c. The staff are very young (mostly under 30), may not be able to recommend or fulfill requests or questions more geared towards older clients. d. Internet acess very expensive... I think about 20USD per day. e. Club lounge has good breakfast, but lacks hot food (eggs, pancakes, bacon, etc). f. Dining options are expensive and very limited within the hotel. g. Most stores and restaurants around the neighborhood close down around 7pm, very little night life. Overrall: I think this is a great BUSINESS hotel, it is not very romantic or family oriented. If you are travelling to SYD for pleasure, stay somewhere else. But the service was great, staff friendly, and prices are good.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best place to stay in Sydney overall”
Reviews.Author: jpmay
Reviews.Content: There's no point staying at the shangir-la or four seasons in Sydney -- those institutions simply don't reach the profund levels of service they do at their flagship locations in Asia, Europe, etc. It's a waste of your money. The location of the Westin is perfect - it's where locals (not tourists) would think is the coolest location in town (as opposed to being "near the opera house" a couple blocks away -- which is corny.) You're steps from the good shopping, eg. famous local jewellers J. Farren Price, as well as the usual Chanel, etc etc. You'll enjoy the hustle and bustle of "city" Sydney. and the parks, etc. The Westin is in possibly the most beautiful old colonial bldg in Sydney - the old post office. Be SURE to get a suite in the "old" section of the building - ask them clearly. There are no particular views - if you want Harbour Views, go for one of the hotels on the harbour (i.e., a few blocks away). Run over to woollahra to Bistro Moncur for dinner, or what about inner-city cool Longrain (ask the concierge) or go to Iceberg's (overlooking Bondi beach) and time your dinner with the sunset. For "village" strolling/shopping, go to Double Bay or woollahra, in both cases a few minutes ($A10) in a taxi. The staff are all perfectly friendly and OK, like any hotel in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend The Westin”
Reviews.Author: Bridey2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last week for four nights. Very comfortable stylish hotel with superb beds and fabulous staff. Breakfasts were great in the Club Lounge. We had Executive King roms in the tower block and thought they were good. Wouldn't have wanted a much smaller room. Hotel is in a great location. Can't commend the staff highly enough - all helpful, relaxed and professional.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: dc_chuck
Reviews.Content: As a tourist location, it is good. If you are looking for something closer to the opera house and ferries, try the sydney harbour marriott. Westin had good service, helpful staff with tourist question (very knowledge) and nice rooms. will not go wrong. Seems to be more business clients. Fun times.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, comfortable and stylish rooms, impressive buidling.”
Reviews.Author: Gemakan
Reviews.Content: An impressive, modern hotel, carved out of (or in to) the Victorian General Post Office building. Check-in was efficient and no-nonsense. Room on 25th floor of the new tower was modern, clean, spacious, with a particularly bright and modern bathroom, one wall of which is entirely glass, allowing you to sit in the tub, look into the bedroom area and TV, or straight through to the buildings outside (yes, there are blinds that separate off the bathroom if you wish!). Separate, and large, walk-in shower. Small irritation â€“ found in so many similar hotels â€“ of tea and coffee tray stored away at almost floor-level, no nearby socket for kettle, and having set everything up on the first day, the room attendants then go and pack it all away each time, so you have to start again! Very comfortable â€œHeavenlyâ€� bed (the Starwood trade-mark offering) and good central lighting control (for once, the master switch really does seem to turn off all, not just most, of the lights). At the end of my stay I had my computer bag stolen in a bar on The Rocks, containing lap-top, wallet, mobile phone, etc (luckily passport, keys, etc, were in the room safe). The two young-ish duty managers handled the situation reasonably well, although one seemed more concerned about how I was going to settle my bill there and then (my Amex card had been taken) than actually helping with my own problems (eg took a lot of negotiation to get them to agree to make any cash advance at all and add it to my bill)! In the end they got an Amex authorisation by phone and provided me with a free taxi-voucher back to the airport, free calls to my company head office in New York, and had also offered to provide lunch â€“ overall good service, after just a tiny bit of encouragement.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: GDP747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for Christmas and would thoroughly recommend the hotel to others. The service level was excellent - in fact the front desk staff could not do enough to help us. Our flight arrived at 0630 so we did not expect to be able to check-in until at least midday. However, we were allocated rooms immediately and in fact were upgraded so that this could happen. The room was a good size, not huge but there was plenty of room and tons of storage. The decor was unusual for a international hotel in that it was fresh, modern and bright. The 'Heavenly Bed' was very comfortable and the floor to ceiling windows provided a fantastic view of Martin Place. The bathroom was another novelty, with glass shelves and modern cermaic basins and best of all, a glass wall between it and the bedroom. You could sit in the bath and watch TV through the glass - perfect! The shower was another big plus point. It was a separate cubicle with a rain shower head so you really did get a good soaking. When deciding on hotel rooms in Sydney you invariably have to decide between harbour view rooms or rooms that provide good value. I have stayed at the Four Seasons in a Grand Harbour View room and it was spectacular. The room however was very small in comaparison to the Westin - and at least Â£80 per night more expensive! I would recommend the Westin for value and style and spend the savings you make on a nice meal down by the harbour!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless property - but SPG members should keep some things in mind.”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: It would be difficult to rate this property as 5 stars ONLY because of problems encountered as an SPG Gold member. Please read on: I had booked a "deluxe" room - which, as it turns out is in their older, Heritage wing (i.e. no view, low floor). I disagreed with their assessment that the room is "deluxe", and asked to be upgraded. Starwood Gold means nothing to this hotel, and complimentary upgrades are out of the question. Thus, I agreed to pay for the upgrade for the first night, as long as the night on points would not incur an additional charge - I was assured that it wouldn't. I paid the AUD60, and pressed on. I was surprised to find an additional AUD116 on my bill at check-out. In fairness, they took care of it after some complaining, but it should NOT have happened. They are fairly flexible with the late check-out (4:00 PM), and they are a congenial group - but I couldn't get the bad taste out of my mouth, with the condescending comment about Gold members. They only upgrade (and cater to) Platinum members.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While planning our first vacation to Sydney we initially wanted to stay at the W Sydney as that is our preferred "brand" of hotel. Friends who have been to Sydney several times recommended the Westin as being more centrally located and still part of the Starwood group(we were using points for a free night). After seeing the actual location of the W we were glad we chose the Westin as the location was very central and close to everything and the W is in an out of the way location. We had a tower room that was beautiful and yes, the bathrooms are pretty spectacular! True there is no "harbour view" but I'm sure you pay a lot of money to get that view. Most days we were in or near the harbour and Circular Quay so that didn't matter too much to us. We upgraded to the "Executive Club" level which allowed us to access the club lounge and have breakfast every morning, which had a very nice selection of food and drink. I must commend the concierge staff of this hotel, particularly Gary Lee, who could not have been more helpful or friendly and made all of our dinner reservations as well as reserving tickets for us for a performance at the Opera House! A true professional who knows the meaning of customer service. Thanks Gary! Even though we are loyal W customers, we were very happy with the Westin Sydney for a great central location, a beautiful room and excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “Great if work are paying!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay at the Westin (business trip). Location is second to none - right in the centre of Sydney and close to the harbour. Rooms were great - the bathroom a real plus and the staff friendly and attentive. There were a couple of bad points - $20 charge for the gym for the majority of guests and the fairly high price of room service. I've stayed at numerous hotels in Sydney and although this is one of the best, I would stay elsewhere if paying out of my own pocket as the Radisson, Sofitel and Medina are better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Tokyo_resident
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Sydney for 3 nights on a vacation. It was our first time to Sydney, and sightseeing was our sole purpose. I admit Starwood points was the initial draw to this hotel. First the negatives about the hotel. The hotel basically has no view except the standard city view. If you are really looking for a harbor view, this hotel is not for you. We did not have one, so we are not sure what we missed, but given that pretty much every day of our stay involved leaving from Circular Quay and moving through the harbor, we feel that we did not miss much. The hotel is also in a central business district. Great for business. Not so great for sightseeing. Although we did not miss the harbor views, we did miss being right on the harbor for the sake of convenience. We could walk to Circular Quay easily. However, it is a 15 minute walk and those extra 15 minutes when you are coming back from a long day of sightseeing. Also, everything in the immediate area pretty much shuts down on weekend evenings (as far as we can tell). The Rocks area or Darling Harbor had a lot more happening on weekend evenings. Now the positives (which there were many). Our room was great, and our bathroom even better. We were upgraded to a Heritage room in the old section of the hotel. My wife and I like sleek, modern hotel rooms rather than classical type rooms. So, we initially wanted to stay in the Towers. However, the front desk clerk recommended the upgraded and we trusted her. We were not disappointed. Once you enter the room, you get the feel of "tradition," but appropriately balanced with a "modern" feel. We loved the room, and especially the walk to the room. You exit the lifts and walk across the bridge to cross the beautiful atrium between the Tower and the old building. You get to fully appreicate the architecture as you cross over, and for tourists like us it is a great feeling. The bathroom in the Heritage room did not have the "window" into the room that the Tower rooms have but it was large and very modern. The bathroom amenities included everything that we needed including detergent. The basement area has a very modern, upscale food court that caters to the business people working in the area. A great place to pick up quick food at a reasonable price. Unfortunately, we did not have the opportunity to try out the hotel's restaurants. The concierge was very helpful in making recommendations for us. All in all, it was a great hotel. I would rank it as one of the top of the line Westins. If sightseeing is your main goal, the lack of being on the harbor is a slight downer. If you are in town for business, I think it is the perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulesBermuda
Reviews.Content: I always do a lot of research before staying in any hotel and for this trip I was due to spend 4 nights in Sydney for the first time. I asked 5 people for their opinions and 3 recommended the Westin. Even Conde Nast had it down in their top 500 list. I asked one person "what makes this Westin so different from any other?" and was greeted with a "trust me" response. So I did. And my husband lived to regret it (as he bore the brunt of my complaints!!) Don't believe the pictures on the web site that show great pictures of Sydney views - I tried 3 different rooms and none had a "view". The swimming pool is off limits at the times we tried to go there - 6pm on a Sunday evening for example when there's not much else going on anywhere else in Sydney. The rooms were no different to any other Westin - decidedly average. The fact that you have a bath next to a window is nothing to shout about. It just becomes a pain when someone needs to get up in the middle of the night and goes into the bathroom - the light is turned on and bathes the entire bedroom in light. You also need to be careful as anyone from the office blocks across the way could happily see you in the bathroom if they so wished. Housekeeping - obviously don't get the concept of "do no disturb!" We went out one morning and came back later in the afternoon to find our room had still not been made up. My husband went for a jet lagged nap and so I put the do not disturn sign on the door. Next thing I know, housekeeping are phoning me (and waking up my husband) asking when we want our room made up as we have do not disturb on the door. I advised them that I had meant it. No apology, just annoyance. The concierge service was also nothing to shout about. they gave us a great suggestion about the behind the scenes tour of the zoo, but ddidn't mention that this needed to be booked in advance of going to the zoo, so we were disappointed upon our arrival there. They didn't get our brideg climb sorted out as we'd asked so we nearly missed out on it, instead we ended up on the 7.30am climb (not ideal when on holiday!) I can't think of anything to recommend about this hotel, which disappoints me as chances are that was my one and only time in Sydney and i find that the hotel is as much a part of an experience in a City as the city itself.
